rz058SCwl2mIg_rHoK40tg.text: One of my favorite places! The lemon grilled shrimp tacos with the spicy avocado salad is my go to. Shrimp fajitas are also really good. Salads not so much. Mimosas are $5 Queso is delicious but small portion is offered and it's way too expensive for how small it is.  Super super super busy on the weekends.

eF6mxGLt62Ss093nYawuRQ.text: Lemon grilled shrimp tacos were amazing! Wasn't too impressed with the side of rice and beans. Nice ambiance, great service. Will be back for sure.

u8NlaxyfHhAMRjq6UGObTw.text: Best place in noda! Fish tacos are on point and the margaritas are made to perfection. Over been there a few times- ok maybe like 50- and the staff seems nice and the food if awesome.

_Bb_CceYU2J4UKYVW5yWmA.text: Moving from Phoenix I can be a bit of a taco snob.  Although its not "real" Mexican food its really tasty. I like the lemon shrimp tacos the best. The corn salsa is refreshing and I'll add this place on my list of regulars for sure.   The only thing that puzzles me is why there is California Reggae Dub music playing in the background.  Its more like Mexico meets Texas on a tourist Jamaican vacation.  I'm a huge fan of tacos and Reggae/Dancehall but I've never seen them meet this way.  It's interesting.  I'll keep coming as long as the shrimp tacos stay on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

kWsm4_tpI5UPfBSF8C17sw.text: Food is always good, but this time we had an issue with the order. I called ahead so we could pick up the food and take it home. When we got home, we were totally missing one meal--the tofu tacos. I called back and the order taker said I hadn't ordered the tacos, however both D and myself knew we had. There was supposed to be an itemized order list--not there. I'll admit that I should have checked the bag before I left, but so should they have. Now D is speaking to a manager. It boils down to I ordered it and she didn't hear it. We're out of an entire meal after paying $30. Walter, the manager, is giving D her tacos for free when she goes back. It's better than nothing, but...

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jerk chicken, jumbo shrimp, bow tie pasta, red &amp; green peppers, all topped with pineapple cream sauce
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nom!

K7741K3k3ZHxOVUBPGH1ZQ.text: Had the BBQ Mahi Mahi fish tacos.  Told my friend it was like the tacos were having sex in my mouth it was so good.  Great spin on ready a solid staple fish taco!  *definitely on the low end of $11-$20.  My whole bill for one was $12.  Definitely worth the $12!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Corn salsa is &#39;different&#39;, and really good!  Has some crazy vinegar-sweet cinnamon taste to it!

KiAKk01_eK7ZckwmdMC1QA.text: Stumbled upon this place from a review from a local who highly recommended it. We were glad to listen to their recommendation!! The food was incredible, and the atmosphere was fun and laid back. I would highly advise trying the BBQ mahi tacos!

WX89Oxt9_GTy2y_1HDMsAQ.text: Lets get right to it; if you name your place after one particular dish, that item needs to really deliver the goods. Yeah, the fish taco is flat out spectacular! Here's why I like this so much ...   When you order any of the tacos, you get 2 tacos and a side. The restaurant has  a very nice policy that allows you to mix and/or match your tacos. So have a fish taco and have a chicken taco or whatever taco on the same plate. I like that. Each taco comes to the table like a nice big overstuffed hoagie that you eat kind of openfaced. Cabo Fish Taco has figured out how to prevent this from turning into a giant sloppy mess as you munch your way through the meal. The tortilla is wonderfully crispy, a little flakey, and pliable at the same time while not being at all greezy. No idea how they do that?? It holds up perfectly during numerous pick-ups. And it tastes great ... delivering a fresh homemade flavor that will make you feel like you are sampling a family-secret-recipe.  We've eaten there for several lunches, so I have had the chance to sample some of the other non-taco dishes. All very good but I'm happily stuck in taco mode. One quick word about the sides ... the server recommended their spicy pasta side dish. It was perfectly very spicy hot and the pasta was perfectly al dente. Really nice execution.  One last thought about why Cabo Fish Taco gets 5 stars is due to the atmosphere of the place. Very nice and friendly, casual relaxed vibe. Terrific service. Very nice bar thing going on, which I haven't sampled but it's front and center stage. You can't miss it and it lends the place a nice relaxing backdrop.  Give this place a shot, I bet you will really like it!

QSjvFl57MqnSjKNxbg3Y5w.text: Went last night based on reviews. Crowded and loud. Didn't like the corn salsa at all. Chips tasted stale or overcooked. Got the queso. It was decent. The tuna taco was awesome. The advocado pasta was ok. I like spicy, but jalapeno was almost all I could taste. The Noda Jam Session was good. My daughters Mahi Burrito was no bueno. She only took a few bites. We are from Florida and used to eating fresh fish. She said it didn't taste fresh or it was not a good flavor combo.  Our waiter left us sitting for a while with the bill waiting to pay. He was sitting on his phone st the bar. I finally walked the check up to him. Probably won't be back. Wish we had picked somewhere else to eat on our one night in Charlotte.

M38YnwqjkeM9ZIm-GEd_zw.text: We gave this place a try last night and were not disappointed. Although the wait was a bit long the service was wonderful once we were seated. We were lucky enough to be seated outside and we got to enjoy the music and fresh air. The inside was a bit old but didn't seem too bad. The food also turned out to be wonderful! We started with the queso which was delicious! My husband had the tuna burrito which he loved and I tried the honey soy glazed salmon tacos which were outstanding! Their wasabi sauce is a bit hot but still tasty. We would absolutely recommend this place and would love to go back the next time we're in town.

lh2MNnFtN_YUkKtvS8Z9qA.text: I had a great time here for lunch ... my waiter was very friendly and the food was delicious!  I really enjoyed the corn salsa and chips that came as soon as we sat down - it was a nice change from the standard tomato salsa.  I went created a taco lunch of two different specialty tacos. I had the lemon grilled shrimp taco which had a nice light flavor while the tuna with the honey wasabi dressing was awesome! The tacos had generous portions of shrimp and tuna respectively. You can choose your side and I went with the refried beans - it was a lot spicier than I was anticipating, but it was a pleasant surprise. The only thing about the beans that I didn't like was that it was served a bit cold. Other than that I really enjoyed this place and will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tuna taco is the closer taco and the shrimp one is behind it ... chose refried beans as my side.

QI6VIQveK-3TmLkjBMH9sg.text: We grabbed dinner here with little time to spare before heading for a show at Ovens Auditorium.  We've been wanting to try it for a while and they didn't disappoint.  We were greeted by a couple friendly faces at the door and seated in the seasonally enclosed patio area on a cold winter day.  It was toasty in there so no problems there.  We informed our server we were in a bit of a rush and he was super helpful and took our drink and food order right away.  Before we knew it we had our delicious tacos in front of us.  We each got one of the traditional fish tacos they are known for and then got another variety to try.  I had one that had a jalapeno Creme sauce.  It was really delicious but still didn't top the original fish tacos.  I also had the avocado pasta salad as a side.  Yummy but I left about half of it because the tacos were so filling I couldn't eat any more.  I love the atmosphere here and it seems like a great spot for hanging out at the bar and eating some tasty food!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Daily special of fried flounder taco w/jalapeño cilantro cream sauce and an original fish taco in the back
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yummy homemade corn pico!

7V2uLcYfp3IR8nYMshlodQ.text: I have been here now 5 times because it is where other people suggest meeting. I think they think it's a hip place to go because it's in Noda or something. It cannot be the food, the service or the ambiance.  And, someone please tell me WHERE THE F*** ARE YOU SUPPOSED TO PARK?

EwuwsswN7Gcj_kVYFmjRzQ.text: The food was very good. They have a great selection when it comes to interesting types of tacos. I enjoyed both the mahi-mahi & carne asada tacos I ordered. The Churros are awesome too! The spicy avocado pasta salad was def worth a try.

O5AAwBxFBLpiuA2QBJs4gw.text: Lunch at Cabo Fish Taco- ordered the chicken & shrimp burrito, which was good. With peppers, rice and beans, it's very filling but had an interesting, almost sweet, seasoning on it. I tried the avocado pasta salad, which was creamy and spicy.

kg1FDkcvz5831njvWBE8ug.text: Decent place to grab seafood tacos.  I was in Charlotte for business and a coworker suggested I come here.   This restaurant is located in the the NoDa part of Charlotte, a very cute neighborhood that is worth exploring more if I were to ever come back.  Street parking only for this location. Got here 6pm on a Monday and we were seated immediately.  Seems like a cool and chill atmosphere.  They have a full bar as well.   Once seated, they brought us complimentary chips and corn salsa. From their taco portion of the menu, you can order any two tacos which come with your choice of side dish.  I went with the BBQ Mahi and the beer battered shrimp, with a side of baja rice.  Both were delicious but not too memorable.   Service was nice, food was OK, but not sure I'd make a beeline to come back to this place if I were back in Charlotte for business.

xOTIb5p2GNeP2jLKSTKagw.text: This is my favorite place ever. I'm originally from Blacksburg which is where the only other Cabo is located, and I'm not going to say that Cabo was the sole reason we picked the NoDa neighborhood to relocate to, but it was definitely a factor.  This place holds a special place in my heart, and my tummy. My go to order (I literally do not stray from this, ever): Lemon Grilled Shrimp Tacos with the Guacamole Pasta Salad.

gkyVr6xnD4x_t56FVOOm5Q.text: Had the pleasure of dining at the great Cabo Fish Taco.  Ordered the Rasta Pasta, it was simply fantastic.  This has to be one of the best pasta's in the Charlotte area! IT has generous helpings of chicken, shrimp, pineapples, bell peppers, etc.  SEX for my TASTE buds, that's all I can say about the Rasta Pasta.   -The crab dip was awesome, as always.  The pita bread it was served with, was warm and soft.    Service was great.  Tunes were great.  Ambiance was great.  The Sex my taste buds had was great.  Everything was Great!!  GREAT! GREAT! GREAT!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rasta Pasta
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab Dip

2loocOPLta3huTp6Buz4ag.text: Cabo Fish Taco never dissappoints!  Several of my coworkers are in LOVE with Cabo Fish Taco, so I go there every 6-8 weeks for work-related lunches. The service is usually very prompt and there is typically no problem getting a table during the lunch rush.   I love the salsa, and have tried virtually everything on the menu and have never had a bad meal!  I've also been to Cabo for brunch and dinner. Our brunch experiences have been delightful and, if memory serves me correctly, I had a stellar bloody mary the last time I went there for lunch.  My only beef with Cabo Fish Taco is that they don't take reservations for dinner (or at least they didn't the few times I've called), I sincerely hope they'll reconsider because I would love to add the restaurant to our repertoire of locations to go for birthday celebrations and/or to bring out of town guests but I don't like to wait in line for 45+ minutes for a table.   Cabo Fish Taco serves top notch food, and provides excellent service. I'll continue to eat there regularly and, if I find out they've started accepting reservations, I'll up my rating to five stars!!!

wa78p-3DkMn3htHTOqUHBQ.text: Best eats in NODA! Service is 10 stars. Consistency and great food puts this restaurant above the competition.

3mo2E_lFNwnq_Y2Pmsx4jw.text: The corn salsa was good. The lemon grilled wahoo fish tacos were real dry, the fish). The shrimp and crab dip, way too creamy. Not for us.  Also, from several mths ago. :(

jcaB-Wi-SVYpZbcIwM9cCQ.text: Somehow I walked in on a busy Friday night without having to wait.  What I ordered:  Caborita margarita - delicious.  Queso fresco - too much queso  White fish tacos - just meh, the fish just had a fried taste  I had remembered having awesome fish tacos - apparently it wasn't here.

yvyL3mf2d_l-BuNojWe9bA.text: Do you like bob Marley ? Fried food and cod in particular ? Then this place will not disappoint. This place really does not make you feel bad about those calories.

VQUsYg7EoP6m_5fEKaizOg.text: Let me start off by saying I've been here several times and reason being? Food Network of course...so I got the BBQ Mahi Tacos as always and they were delicious! I love the crunchy slaw with the tender Mahi Mahi and the white cilantro sauce.   Service was ok (that's why I took off a star). Our waitress was flustered even though it wasn't that busy. She forgot to bring more chips & salsa after being asked an excessive three (3) times. Not to mention the station to get the chips & salsa was right beside our table; So we repeatedly saw her walk past it but we still didn't get it until asking the 4th time. She also took a while to bring our beers and we could see the bar from where we were sitting.  Also, the hostess @ the door had a mild "stank-a**" demeanor that I didn't appreciate. O_o

s0nsz84rcRxE_jnkZOWX9Q.text: Love this place.  The atmosphere is eclectic and funky and I love their outdoor patio.  The food is spot on every time we come here and the wait staff is always on their game and friendly.  We would probably visit more as we live in NoDa, but since it's such a long wait to get in most days, we try to visit during off hours - like 3pm on a Sunday.  I would highly recommend if you want some good Mexican food in a cool area of town.

mzNj_V-v6Vqpd7amx2ok7A.text: We visited on a bustling Friday night and have our name to the hostess for a table. We were seated in about the quoted time and were greeted promptly with chips & the house corn salsa with a preliminary drink order taken. We wound up ordering the shrimp & chicken burrito (without shrimp haha) and a taco plate with the white fish and carne asada. Both were fabulous and filling. Many creative menu items and plenty of options for a non-fish lover like myself! Ingredients were fresh, presentation was good and service was good as well. Waited a bit for the bill, but hey it was a Friday night and we ate rather quickly. Fun & quirky ambiance. Reggae tunes on and servers wearing plaid ;) funky, mon!

xQjm5ejY78AjEuOBdXLhCQ.text: Was wrestling between a 3 or 4 for Cabo Fish Taco, but I give it a 4 because of the fun factor and that I'll definitely be a returning customer.  The restaurant is on a lively street in the NoDa area, surrounded by other restaurants and bars.  It reminds me of some of the neighborhoods back home in Chicago.  We stopped in around 7 on a Saturday night and there was already a line formed to talk to the hostess.  They informed us that it would be an hour, which wasn't a problem.  We expect waits like that on a Saturday night, plus there are a bunch of bars to go grab a drink or two while you wait.  Also, the wait only ended up being about 30 minutes.      Ambience/Space:  4  A very loud, energetic space with island type music playing.  This is a great place for groups that want to go out, slam some drinks and have a good time.  They also have a small outdoor seating area which is great for nice nights.    Service:  3.5  Hostess was very nice and texted us when our table was ready.  Our waiter was pretty standard, more interested in just taking our order and moving on.  Again, it was packed and he was very busy, so no big deal.    Chips/Salsa:  3  The salsa was a pico that tasted very fresh, but I would've preferred a little more spice.  The chips were pretty run of the mill, nothing special.  Entree:  4  I had the two tacos and a side dish.  I tried the white fish taco and the carne asada tacos.  I really liked both.  They had a lot of flavor, but the thing that sealed it for me were the shells.  I chose the rice & beans side, and unfortunately that fell a little flat for me.  It didn't have much flavor or spice to it.  Next time I'll probably try a different side.     Margarita:  3  To be fair, I only tried their house margarita that comes with Cuervo.  It was pretty good, but next time I'll probably go for a different version.  I think they have something like 16 different margaritas, ranging from cheap ($5), to skinny, to flavored, to premium.  It really is a pretty cool margarita list.

dQenhbDtNCsMtAVMyNXtJw.text: Just had lunch today at Cabo FIsh Taco.  I had the wasabi tuna wrap.  There is only one word to describe the dish:  WOW!  It had to have been one of the of the best fish dishes I have ever eaten.  The portion was huge- I had to take half of it home along with most of the rice and beans. The service and ambience were awesome.  So why only four stars and not five stars?  I had a microbrew.  A pint cost $6.50- or over half the cost of the main dish.  While it was good, I will stick with Diet Coke next time.  But rest assured, I will return!

EW90KdDBhd4hfOFhlOy0Rg.text: This place is way over rated for the price, there's always a wait. I can't understand why because the food isn't great and the service is subpar.

gqQ694UWQ5kQvwCGWpkSfw.text: The mahi tacos are delicious, the sides are fresh, and the atmosphere is awesome! Highly recommended!

fhP6SiCahVoH3W2aeosaQg.text: The 35 minute wait ended up being over an hour. Thankfully the areas surrounding the restaurant were entertaining enough to keep me occupied. The corn salsa was so bland that I felt the need to add a pinch of salt to each bite to experience some flavor before I gave up on it completely.   My family ordered three different dishes  1. Beer battered fish tacos had way to much batter. We could barley tell there was even fish in it 2. Chicken quesadillas were nothing more than mediocre. Chicken was very dry   3. BBQ Mahi Tacos were decent. The slaw on top was a bit overpowering but overall, it was the best out of the three dishes.   Maybe my expectations of tacos is different being from Texas, but I had heard such good things about this place that I set the bar high in my head. If I were to come back here, it would be for the environment, not so much the food.

th6m5xUHZ6wA3-FXlm5ugA.text: This place only having 3 and 1/2 stars is a joke!!!!  These tacos are awesome, quite possibly one of the best meals I've ever had!!  Quality and quantity of food was top notch!!! Service was incredibly good!!!!  We had the chips, salsa, queso, jalapeno beer, margaritas, fish and chicken tacos and everything was perfect!  We will be back.

b6Kpb91P2B2FyY9xF72aeg.text: We went after hearing great things about this place, but was disappointed by the blandness of the food. The shrimp & crab dip appetizer was very good, but the taco's and burritos were bland. Save the trip.

QHIP4keTsXlrP4736Bzy5w.text: Poor customer service. We put our name down on the wait list, they gave us a call at 2:44pm to let us know our table was ready, we call them at 2:50pm to tell them we are on our way, we show up at 2:56pm and the rude hostess tells us they gave our table away because it had been more than 18 minutes. We showed her the time stamped call on our iPhone and she still refused to seat us. As a new resident of Charlotte, I will not be going here ever again.

C98oi8UaDa8n9-GnpG_LpA.text: Worst customer service ever. I first heard about this place from a friend of mine and decided to check it out. So I went there with another friend, but when we arrived it was a 15 minute wait. I didn't have a problem waiting, but the hostess suggested that we wait at the bar and she will come get us when our table is ready. So my friend and I went up to the bar and was greeted by a rude bartender. My friend and I didn't want to drink, so when we were asked what we wanted, we just said water. The bartender was upset and told us that we would have to order a drink in order to stay at the bar, because "drinks make me money. that's why I'm here." It was at that point that I started to feel unwelcomed, so I felt compelled to order a drink. So once our table was ready and we were seated, yet again we were greeted by a rude waitress. This was our first time there and we were stuck on what to order because the prices were a little too much for ordinary platters. Apparently we took too long to decide what we want because the waitress asked if we could decide what we wanted at the bar so that other people can have the table. I was completely appalled and disgusted. I didn't even get a chance to eat the food because the poor customer service ruined my appetite.

id_R2MeGEXIgNyJtveb1OQ.text: Cabo Fish Taco is super tasty... I've been there twice but this is my first review and both times was great! The downside.... if you're super hungry, go early or be prepared to wait. I've been to NoDa several times and this place is always crowded.... I'm talking 45 min wait or so.... But it's no big deal because they tell you your table is ready via text so we just went across the street to get a drink and an appetizer and problem solved. I wish they did take a few reservations for big parties.  Their food is very very good. The fish tacos are the signature dish and the best part is that you can mix and match the fillings. There's a ton of sides I've had the nopalito salad, the beans, the avocado salad and they are all very good. The beer battered shrimp/fish were my favorite.  I also had a burrito on my other visit and it was also very good. We had queso and some sort of crab dip as an appetizer and they were both good. Their salsa has corn and its super yummy.   The service was good too.... prices are very reasonable and you get giant servings of food so can't complain.

vBZ9MsOSXuknWSm4Zt0vew.text: Just a forewarning the lines at the Cabo can be a bit long Friday and Saturday night. That being said its worth the wait and the buzzer they give you reaches across the street to the shops if your looking to blow some time.  Once your seated the chips and dip are amazing and the service is great. I will however warn you that you may have to seek professional help after taking that first bite. If your anything like me you may become a Fishoholic. Night flashes, shakes, panic attacks. I guess it all depends on how well you can handle a taste of heaven on earth.

PRDIq_s_EldMKb0fNsJKdw.text: Well I finally made it out to Cabo Fish Taco and I must say I left with a sense of maybe this place is overrated.  I mean I don't want to be too harsh because all aspects were great but great in conjunction with any other mexican restaurant.  I know I may need to try some other dishes and I will eventually but for now I'm not jumping for joy for this place.  The interiors aren't anything to get crazy about, very NoDa, shabby chic like most business in the area.  Not a bad thing, just is what it is.  Our waitress was gracious and pleasant and kept up with our needs very well.

Enm5gbCdo1JMdsfNs8Qd-Q.text: Great food, friendly service. I really enjoyed my quesadilla and the queso is amazing!

Pi4pOfKJjJuESKBnvRwoqw.text: I was in town for a conference and decided to stop by after seeing it featured on DDD and boy was the food delicious.  I went during lunch hr and the place was pretty busy but the service was great. Parking is a b**ch but the neighborhood is cool and eclectic. I tried the salmon tacos which was topped with with pimento cheese...i know it sounds weird but it was good. The spicy avocado pasta salad was amazing. If I'm ever in the area again I'll go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon taco with pasta salad

4vIOdgMRR1TxMxBVK2fU8Q.text: Probably the best burrito I have ever had. Cool little place in NoDa really good food and drinks.

_KjmOO_hbfCPGVi9Ib4wrw.text: LOVEEEE this place, food is amazing and so is the atmosphere. Everyone was so nice and welcoming and the service was great!

oLMD3ktpjjgOgJqFH-20Mg.text: Best Latino restaurant in Charlotte. Very cultural and a good time for family or friends. Try the salmon Tacos with red beans and rice or pasta salad. Decent beer selection. Highly suggest you get a beer with this food. Compliments it well. DEON  was a great server and was nice. Complimentary chips and salsa is better than you average. It more of a pico de gallo. Everything tastes house made. Only concern is parking. I will return and suggest everyone to try.

Jhd9g6-MqjSanNcFrMq75A.text: I had really high hopes for this place, came here for my 21st Birthday dinner with family and we all agreed that none of us would come back. We didn't even finish all of the food we got. The Queso tasted like the cheese that would be on Mac and cheese it was very cheddar flavored and no one warned us of this before purchasing. Staff was friendly but pretty slow.

v_RvxjPHFkum-ZzgTQQOAA.text: My family and I went to your establishment (Cabo Fish Taco) and ordered a to-go order that took over 40 minutes to prepare. I asked the waiter to have a manager visit my table to discuss our frustration for the excessively long wait.   The manager finally came, and she said I'm sorry we've been behind and your waitress shouldn't have handled it that way. Then she simply walked off! I still can't believe how dismissive she was.  It's disheartening when no one cares about customer service for longstanding, consistent, regular customers.  #NoCustomerServiceatall #TooRude

ht0aJR6bS05hJF0lUDOKIQ.text: If you haven't tried the blackened mahi-mahi tacos you are seriously missing out!

9AgJqVHuOXqlq67YWbRa8A.text: Stopped in to check out this very popular place in NoDa.  And of course for my first visit, had to have the fish tacos!  Which were very good. Accompanied by Asian Slaw, and a nice cold beverage, it was a great experience. I really liked the decor, this place really has a comfy feel to it!  My server was very helpful and nice. I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fish tacos and Asian slaw

XhxbQ7W17Pu9gitalmTk_w.text: I know that two stars is pretty steep but I have to be honest. I cannot live this Cabo Fish lie anymore. My friends rave about the jalapeno mash potato side...the tacos...and the drinks. Besides the drinks, I'm not a fan. The salsa is more corn than anything else. I want salsa. I want options. I can't get any options here. The guacamole is one scoop for almost 10 dollars. That hurts my soul.  Why the hell can't I get a regular taco option? Why does it have to be over the top?  I understand my opinion is not the most promising for Cabo Fish Taco. My friends love it. I have tried more than several occasions to find common ground with these tacos but my heart isn't interested nor my taste buds and my stomach isn't delighted over them either. I'm sorry. If you're searching for anything other than your wonderful authentic taco, this place is what your dreams are made of. That said, if you crave tacos from the streets of Morelia...keep searching, fellow taco lover.  But the environment can be fun with friends and I haven't found a need to complain about the drinks.  Truth be told, I will probably return to Cabo Fish taco because my friends don't know the lie I am living.   So I'll see you around and order a drink with an extra shot of tequila.

iJXQaVNwKTkMiP6PRa1yEg.text: I was expecting a great meal after reading the reviews for Cabo Fish Taco, but left feeling underwhelmed. We stopped in for dinner on a Thursday night to be immediately seated. The restaurant was packed and the waitress very attentive throughout our meal. I had the lemon tuna and beer battered fish with a side of the spicy pasta salad. The fish taco has a lot of breading and not as crunchy as I would like. The tuna included seemed quality and big chucks. The waitress recommended the spicy avocado pasta salad, which I found not to be spicy and too much mayo for my liking. Both tacos were stuffed with fish making them difficult to eat without making a mess. The tortilla really shined here as they are homemade and served warm. The chips were a huge bummer as they tasted stale and over cooked. I did enjoy the corn and tomato salsa and chipotle cheese dip, but the chips kept me from really digging in.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

lyIUVcg4bHpk8yqHe8wRMA.text: This place is really great. The nachos & corn salsa are excellent. Ordered Mahi-Mahi Taco, Chicken Taco & Spicy Avocado Pasta. The staff & the service is excellent. The location is close to the Charlotte downtown. Highly recommend eating here!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

-VYRJ9zXccV3Nn0iBzggNg.text: This was my first time and let me just say that the experience was really great. The server was really helpful when it came to figuring out what to order. He was very knowledgeable about the menu and it helped that he had tried out some of the food. I'm definitely going to come back with some friends for this wrap. The sauce in the wrap, I forgot what it was called but it was so good.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Thai Shrimp Wrap

7tk2QM4kjxHESjkkunc3ww.text: Great taco place. The meal started with a corn based salsa and chips. I then had the lemon grilled shrimp tacos that had avocado, mixed greens, tomatoes, onions, and a white sauce. This is a really great place to go if you want to have lunch with friends.

V-6HLsBIoqbeLR3NBoT1Gg.text: Some of, if not THE BEST tacos in Charlotte. Perfect sized tacos for the price and you'll always have a little spillage left over to eat with the chips and corn salsa they give you.  Tuna taco and fried shrimp are a must have!

r8nRosL40qMUsqHYsXeneA.text: Cabo is a dope fish spot in one of the eclectic sides of town NODA. Hands down one of the best taco places around. The margaritas are sooo good. Today i had their mule and it was just what i needed on a hot spring evening. The nachos and the chunky salsa is so flavor filled.  I ordered beer battered shrimp tacos and a BBQ mahi fish taco. With in a few minutes of ordering our food came out and was everything I expected and more. We sat in their new add on and it was so nice and exciting to see they have more space to sit. I enjoy this place every time I come.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

3iQEnODADfimaovS1Xt_wg.text: Great place for tacos! They start you off with some free chips and fresh salsa which was nice to munch on before our meal. I had the honey soy glazed salmon and the lemon grilled shrimp tacos; both were great but my favorite was the shrimp!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

oiUPGjkmsUF0_LRY-tOW6g.text: I was so excited to try this place! But I was a little underwhelmed. The wait was longer than we were quoted so that wasn't a great start. Our waitress was nice and pretty attentive. Unfortunately the chips were rather stale but the salsa was tasty. The food came out quickly but wasn't very warm which was a big bummer. In general the side dishes all needed salt except for the avocado pasta salad which was good. Overall it just didn't live up to the expectations I had been given.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ mahi mahi tacos with refried beans

k94i3B6uVrV633OYsYlBXQ.text: I love Cabo Fish Taco, the atmosphere is great and the decoration is cool but most important the food is awesome. I don't eat meat and they offer a great variety of fresh fish tacos, I love the Honey Soy Glazed Salmon Tacos and the Sweet Thai Chili Tofu tacos as well.  I have been several times and always the service has been good, attentive and really fast!

kCrjmQOCjlDWnweT2-Pzug.text: It was 'ok' def not as good as it used to be. Chips were bland or old - or both. Corn salsa was pretty good but they could provide a bigger bowl for it and a spoon maybe?? I had tuna tacos but the flavor was generic.  The chicken tacos were good.  All in all I would go back for a margarita but that's about it. I did not advise the waiter of my displeasure because I took a leap ordering the tuna tacos. They shouldn't have to recook my food because I ordered something out of my norm.

LynBSGLTrCADwR3UuH-p-w.text: Everything about this place is excellent! Quick wait staff who are friendly and the food is to die for. My husband and I ordered the queso as an appetizer and the tacos for entrees. The queso is out of this world! Smoky, creamy, and they serve it in an overflowing bowl - my kind of place!   I had the carne asada tacos with rice and beans. So flavorful and definitely not your average taco. What surprised me most was how good the tortillas were! They were double wrapped with a bit of cheese and freshly made. So yummy.   I also tried the Slim and Jalaritas - so good! The right balance between sweet and sour. I highly recommend this place - it's great for a light lunch or even before a night out - may be my new favorite Charlotte spot!

CAZndD4khmbzAmdlpCr3iQ.text: I feel like I entered a place of cultural appropriation. Everything I tasted lacked flavor. The salsa tasted like mixed cooked veggies with a tiny bit of cilantro, no SALT, whatsoever. Then I had the steak quesadilla. Mountains of cheese with steak medium cooked, huge chunks of onion, oily with sliced peppers. AGAIN, where's the flavors? They incorporate little to no seasonings in their dishes. Idk if other dishes pack good enough flavors but I wasn't impressed enough to come back. OH! And then they had the audacity to say the avocado salad was a customer favorite. I tasted it from my sister. It was trash.

OcNFKsHZ4CuwUhD1n5nG2g.text: oh my gawd, this place is amazeballs!!! Service is fantastic, food is phenomenal, great drink selections!!! Visited on a Friday night with a large party and we were well taken care of.  We mingled for a bit on the bar area before being seated where I had the fried shrimp app ans an overflowing shrimp taco with pasta salad.  I wish I had more room for everything else on the menu!   The decor was fun with sugar skull chicks, paintings, signs, wood floors, etc.  Music was  loud-ish but not so bar-like that you're going deaf yelling in someone's ears.  Plenty of bathrooms, although I was a bit thrown off looking for them as they're up against the wall in the bar area, but there's more at the back on the dining room as well.  There's also patio dining.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp taco w side pasta salad n a whole lotta Yum!

vocaSEkR_Nx9ag6XDbgAqg.text: I am from northern virginia and I cant find good fish taco anywhere. My boss and my boyfriends parents (who are from charlotte) says this place is the place to go for fish tacos. I have to say O.M.G so delicious.   I ordered the blackened mahi mahi tacos with black beans and rice and it was so good. They give you so much fish and you can tell it is fresh. They give you two tacos and they are huge!!   My boyfriend ordered the special of the day which was dredged seabass taco and it was amazing too! It was lightly fried and seasoned so well!  Our server was such a sweetheart and was super attentive. She refilled our drinks without even asking! Also the manager/owner came around too and asked how our food was! (Which is a huge plus for me)  P.S this place isnt a mexican style tacos everything has a california style to it. If i am ever back in town this place will be on top of my list.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened mahi mahi tacos with black beans and rice

U1XP9rKuxyRj3u1It9FzlQ.text: Very good tacos and burritos!  Went for my sister's 21st birthday! The waiter was very helpful and patient with us! She even brought out our cake for us from the freezer with a candle! The plates were very reasonably priced, $12 for my carne asada tacos. They were a little bit spicy but I'm a baby when it comes to spicy. The drinks were reasonably priced too for a cocktail-cosmo $8 with their mid grade liquor. We had an overall great experience! Would definitely go back.

pW3-Yfpi7UkXR-qjPAZoig.text: I ate here a few times and always enjoyed my food and the atmosphere. It can be a very busy place, mostly on weekends. The service had always been good.  I would go back, just not my favorite type of food.  Overall a good experience though.

UnudKud7AtoBwhrE8E4QBQ.text: Like everyone else's post, this place is great. Try as I might, I could not find a thing to complain about. Food was great, service was great, drinks were great.  If I had to pick one thing to complain about, it would be parking, that NoDo area has limited parking. And with all the construction going on, it made it even harder. This was my first time to the NoDo area,  That said, I am definitely coming back. Thank you Cabo Fish taco.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. This is one of their bowls. Big enough for two if ask me. Totally worth it.

iI7gP2keMa3iiEJEsfv6Kw.text: I can't wait to go back again. The food was amazing and I had a blast with colleagues. Definitely love their drinks

BBqrr_6QQ6w22-9_8mtjEQ.text: First let me say that I just moved here from New Orleans. I live to eat and know good food when I taste it.  With all due respect, I have no idea how this restaurant got so many 4-5 star reviews. The service is great and fast, but that's all I can say on a positive note.  The fish tacos were on the fishy side - even with all of the heavy seasoning and salt, you can't be fooled. Nothing that we got here was fresh. The "queso" was straight up Velveeta with some peppers (probably Rotel, if I had to guess). The "Mexican slaw" was the blandest of cole slaw with some pumpkin seeds sprinkled on top. Neither the salsa nor the pico de gallo was fresh - you know this Bc it was cold - straight out of the fridge. Any salsa you get at a legit Mexican restaurant, or just any restaurant in general, are served room temp. In either case, it was bland as hell.  Save your time and money and head next door to Sabor. Everything is fresh and authentic and delicious.

ykj4_MoJrs3GdVGTtOnEaw.text: Food was just average, way over hyped. Cool area of town, but it ends there. Service was good and beer was cold.

-tWf0X76jNpcK4uT7HCIDA.text: I am rating the food and restaurant 4/5 stars. The reason I am rating them 3 stars is my overall experience. I LOVED the tacos but I felt sick after 30 min of eating there. Don't get me wrong I would still come here and enjoy the cool, hip vibe.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Entree-Carne asada tacos with a side-spicy guacamole salad (the salad is a must try). It is a lot of food! Price is ~$11.50

7HzXoe0sZdvTv7rqBvG3iA.text: Eclectic cafe with fresh well prepared California Mexican style food.  There was a wait but the tables move quickly.  We got drinks at the bar and they send a text when the table is ready.  We had the fried shrimp tacos. The portions were generous.

7mZF_-FhALuq4TLq877N-A.text: In the words of George Takai... Ohhhhh Myyyyyy!!!  This place is freaking amazing!! I came here two nights ago before seeing Here Come The Mummies at the NEIGHBORHOOD THEATER.  I had the Tavaru Tuna tacos and thought I'd woken up on the shores of the actual Cabo!!  Tender seared marinated tuna - had to be 8 oz between the two tacos - that melted in my mouth.  I had to eat half the tuna with a freakin fork to get the them into hand food.  (I'm 6'2 230 and can palm a kickball).   Once I got my full on taco bite on - holy s$#t - the shell was like a French pastry shell flattened just to handle the all the protein deliciousness.  So in case we are not clear yet.    Stop what you are doing and sprint - not run, not walk - to this place.  And we haven't even started on the drinks. The Jalarita is their house margarita with fresh rended jalapenos and is very good.  They go from good to ARIBA ARIBA ANDELE when you get the Silver Surfer Margarita (mid shelf tequila Cointreau and fresh made house sour mix) and add the japs.  I could say more but i'm getting another drink now. So....  Adios my beloved pendejos!!  Tip: Sit at the back bar and ask for Rafaella. You'll thank me later.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

WImtpTlmVdengpvpcbBiEQ.text: Top notch taco joint.  It has a cool vibe to the place, and the food is darn tasty and the portions are large. The service is both friendly and efficient.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mahi Mahi Taco
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp &amp; Chicken Burrito

vAKMHoGx4Vhe8d6URuuczw.text: Best Fish Tacos! Great location and friendly staff! When I lived in Ohio I could wait to visit family so I could eat here.  Now that I am a resident I eat here all the time.

yQzCg4GHW53Hda8vPwTGpw.text: I had barbecue mahi and beer battered fish tacos with black beans and rice. No avacado tho because I can't eat it. At any rate they were totally overstuffed totally delish, fresh and fabulous. We had a hour wait which is ok because that gave us an opportunity to walk around and get a drink. Using the phone to alert you when your table is ready lets you wander and check out and support other local businesses. Kudos to Cabo for doing this.  Great meal and good fun and friendly atmosphere.

TteqsdVhBdTwtP8kSbRz2w.text: Great tacos!!!!!   The shrimp and steak tacos are the best.  The best side is the spicy avocado pasta salad.  Their tomatillo sauce is delicious as well.  Truly one of our favorite places in NODA.  The drinks are great too.  Get there early because the wait is long...but well worth is.  Also, this place is awesome to get together with family or friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

S5biKKZRnCK3ZdIOTF7v6w.text: Always great good here. Definitely worth the wait. I would recommend the Tavarua Tuna Taco's! Absolute favorite of theirs...fast friendly service any time of the day. When it's nice outside, you can enjoy your meal on the front patio and do some people watching. Cool neighborhood too. I'm sure you'll find plenty of things in the area, but you'll keep coming back for more. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tavarua Tuna Taco...delicious!
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ Mahi Tacos

2V8KAfv99qqxUOXQ4-BdoQ.text: I've been here on several occasions, most recently for Cinco de Mayo. The service is always right on target and the food is consistently flavorful. It gets busy here often, so be prepared to wait in the evenings. My only complaint is that the tap water was awful today. That might be a ploy to get you to buy a drink. It worked on me. You can't go wrong with any meal here.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lemon grilled tacos with beans and rice

66CDu6rfIXnpvu1LHGDZGw.text: I had the opportunity to visit this place while visiting from South FL. Great little spot. Lots of hustle and bustle on Saturday at 2pm, but service was great and the lemon tuna tacos were even better.

C6UljGmuCnyHAspRXMoTxw.text: The wait was 10 minutes but they sent us a text when our table was ready. So we went shopping in the boutiques across the street. Unless you sit outside, its impossible to have a conversation with out yelling. They have a good selection of local beer and about a dozen margaritas.  We ordered the beer batter fish tacos- they were big and filled with yummy but very greasy fish.  ( next time Im going to try something grilled) ). It came with 2 sides- i had black beans and rice- both perfectly seasoned.  Our server was super nice and well be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. The starter salsa

JmrEfHorm8I-aHz05ZKkVA.text: I recieved my drink, appetizer and meal within 10min! Very good and fast service. Food was amazing, hot and fresh. The lemonade is fantastic

DJC9MPcaK2kherpTvUWm8g.text: Super yummy fish and shrimp tacos! We where in town from southern california and where pleasantly surprised by this gem!

5qpCIm-5Mpyj8K1zh_E7Mg.text: i am a mexican food maniac, so this restaurant with a catchy name and just 5 minutes from home, immediately moves up my favorite places to stop list and who doesn't LOVE the skull and crossbones artwork on the patio right now?!  i stopped in with a friend for lunch yesterday around 1pm, we indulged in the corn salsa and chips & an order of the guacamole (all of average quality, but i am a sucker for a starch dipped in avocado mush, yum!) i proceeded with one of my favorites the carne asada tacos sans cheese with a side of mexi-slaw and it did not disappoint.    everything on the menu is fairly priced, the specials are always an option worth exploring and the mexican beers available make me happy :)   only issue i had yesterday were some hiccups in the service, while seated immediately we waited awhile for our waters, waited even longer for our tacos and then again for refills and the check..but it was A-OK and i will definitely be back!

-XE-2bb0bSPKMUfXZPgOqQ.text: Nope, this isn't the real deal. You want a real fish taco? Head to the Baja or the California coast. BUT, locals rave about this place. If you don't have any point of reference, then apparently it's highly recommended. It redeems itself in cold brew.

xBAgD2oxGWG523Vz3DVz9g.text: Though it's a little bit off the beaten path, this was one of the first restaurants I was taken to upon moving to Charlotte, which says a lot about it, I think. Smack dab in the middle of NoDa, CFT is worth checking out if only so that you have an excuse to check out the funky neighborhood its nestled in.   But the food and drink are worth it, too. As the name implies, try the fish tacos. My girlfriend's obsessed, and they're prepared the same way they are in Mexico--lightly battered, served with cilantro and all the fixins. Very fresh and very tasty, and not too expensive at all. The other food is standard mexican--nothing too transcendent, but it's all very good, too. I love the drinks here, and they sometimes have margarita specials which are worth checking out.   As for its environment, we love this place. It's small and intimate, so we love a date night here (clearly we're not alone). Definitely a good plan: go check out a gallery opening and eat here before or after. Or grab a romantic cocktail on your way home from some art-buying. Tres classy.

3WopLT8o7fL0waYif9t7zg.text: The Mahi tacos are wonderful and I would return for the food but not the service. The tacos were fresh, delicious, and came quickly but only when the waitress decided to finally take our order. I attended at a time when there were only a few people at the bar and one other table and the waitress was too busy talking to co-workers rather than helping customers. They were well staffed at the time especially considering the small crowd that was there. I'm going to try to go there again during a busier time and hopefully the service will be as good as the food.

IZ9pIs8io4_uV_zJ3ehHDw.text: Worth the wait. Get there early and put your name down then walk across the street to Growler's for a beer.

489xlpTXpV7U0QV2_izqvA.text: Ugh, stale chips mixed in w/ fresh chips. That's weak. My wife whose gluten intolerant, asked for corn tortillas since it's a taco place and the waitress said all they had was flour tortillas. I ordered the special which had green peppers in the tacos. Since I'm not a fan of green peppers I requested the special w/ out the peppers.  Five mins. later the waitress came back and said the "chef" couldn't take the peppers off my tacos as the special was a "pre-mix". Pre-mix?! It's a damn taco, not French bouillabaisse! Once I heard that I knew I'd never eat here again. The food was decent but I'm not going back again.

_STXkj-O7XdMPtiRdiKPvA.text: Fantastic atmosphere in a funky area.  Start at Cabo for a yummy fish taco dinner.  Whatever flavor you like, they have it!  The service is top notch!  They have a faine assortments of local brews.  I personally eat low-carb so they brought me everything without the rice.  I skip the tortillas which were homemade but looked/felt they might have been a bit tough and chewy.  Terrific dinner, head over to Growlers across the stree for a home brew and down the way to Amelies for a dessert (to go, because I am a pumpkin in the evening), and you have yourself a fine evening planned indeed!

rSKcICNcRnn2pNPssvOt1w.text: I had the shrimp tacos and was really surprised. The tortillas were made fresh which is a huge plus. The tacos were also a nice size, plenty of nice sized shrimp. A little disappointed in the jalapeno mashers, they were literally mash potatoes with jalapenos and cheese on top, I don't know I guess I was expecting something a little more unique, but it was still good. $2 beers and good service, can't beat it!

iKppf8hSo5eYSOl3phB5zQ.text: This place is awesome, and a must when you're in Charlotte. The food is fresh and the staff is very friendly.  If you want the best bloody Mary you've ever had, ask for Charles to make it.

ZbBCuc6xB6UgA3i1YxjT7Q.text: Cabo has been receiving a lot of mixed review lately. Some say that the food has been over hyped and that the food didn't live up to it. Today I dined At Cabo Fish taco and I must say that most (not all things) were actually really delicious.  I'Ve been to Cabo many many times and for the most part I loved it. Today was no different. We walked in around 5 and was sat quickly. We ordered The Cabo Roll and Blackened Mahi Tacos. We got the signature corn salsa and chips which would have been been nice if they were a little warm. The salsa needed a little salt. Overall I like the jazzed up idea of the corn salsa. There has been dispute about how they don't get the whole non-tomato based salsa idea. Well let me tell you this: most restaurants that offer a salsa that is slightly blended usually arrives via sysco trucks in a jug labeled Pace Picante. Im all for FRESH foods, not a product that is heated and cooled and shipped thousands of miles!  The Cabo roll was filled with cheese and rather large chunks of both crab and shrimp. It was tasty but the guac needed onions, lime juice and instead of rolling the ball in cilantro it should have been mixed in. maybe a little salt too. As always the tacos are always a favorite. My personal fav is the Diablo shrimp, today however we ordered, and loved the blackened mahi mahi. The fish was perfectly cooked not dry or over cooked at all!!!  I absolutely love their sour cream and lime sauce they use on almost everything... nom nom nom.  I know service is kinda wonky but today they were on par.  love Cabo will be back.!

1FuQw8CJMg3CaF3JE9L1IA.text: I went wtih two local friends and an out of towner last night to Cabo Fish Taco. We had an amazing time. They have a great beer list that we checked out during a brief wait at the bar for a table. Our server Brittany was fun and incredibly efficient. She was patient while we laughed and talked and ignored the menu as well. We split their queso which was a hit all the way around. I had one of their specials which was a snapper taco and picked the refried beans and rice as my side and it was fantastic. All of us loved our meals and will definitely be back. It's a great, fun spot while you are out and about in NoDa.

F4cuoq3vCLB7Jr6dJC_BDA.text: Best fish taco I've had outside of San Diego.  Service is fast and courteous, cheap drinks and the corn salsa is fantastic.

lfUDW3AFKicfSZivkYVKBA.text: You cannot go wrong with any of their burritos or tacos. Corn salsa is delish. Margaritas are refreshing. Jalapeno mashers are my favorite side item! Only complaint, sometimes the tuna could be prepared more med rare.

8GfO_nijyIkLthVdHEI13A.text: Great location, good service. Just an okay food experience. Chips were cold and salsa had more corn in it then a sauce dip for chips and salsa. I ordered the shrimp tacos they were pretty good.

Pwei6a4Vmm9RXQ_fO-r5gw.text: Not impressed the food was over seasoned and even the patio was loud.Should cactus salad have cactus? Mine didn't.  I have to lean towards Bill M's response. I think the name and location makes this a so called "hip"place to go. I just prefer to taste my food not have it covered up with "a hint of lime"which must have been a whole lime. Not real anxious to go back but who knows.

F1Q36JlLWouBPoIHSjWHyw.text: Best tacos in town! Bartender Cobra rocks! She is attentive and fun. Had a great meal and a great experience! Highly recommended.

tKSUBMvrn183eqFDqqd1sg.text: SMH....Keep in mind I lived on the west coast in the mexican food capital of the United States (AZ). There was one bartender on a Saturday night, who was not only serving people at his bar, but he was making drinks for the enitre restuaraunt (which was full), answering phones and taking to go orders. Because of this, it was not the best service.  However, food was worst.  The salsa (whatever you call that) was not authentic, not good and very bland. The queso was OK! and my fist taco was just bland and not good.  The ingrediants that make Mexican food special are a combination of  citurs (lemon, lime), garlic, cilantro and salt. None of  which was present in any of the food!

EBe2vaCf_4tUz55lGmBaWA.text: First off, this place was on tripple d. Amazing food! Great service! Get the tav-a-roo tuna tacos!

VIcm1bWmDBO_OdjR1YLG8w.text: NOT a good experience..... I'll leave it at that. Something has changed since the triple D visit or Spike would have  walked away shaking his head ?

BL6_uqBRAyTjtMjQLsjbvA.text: My favorite taco place in Charlotte. Love the margaritas and the appetizer roll with the crab meat (can't remember the name). BBQ mahi, ahi tuna, and the serrano chicken are some of my go-to tacos. If it's in season get the jalapeno mashed potatos (can they please start having this year-round!?!?). Usually a bit of a wait but it is well worth it!

EUQCeDM3DiMOAnFef--kMQ.text: Hands down best Mexican restaurant I've ever been to. The guac was top notch and the shrimp pasta with a pineapple sauce was amaze-balls. Order it!

42t9ny_0htEnsL_c9TQpdg.text: Chips and salsa please!!!!!!  I love it.  What a great place for my wife and I to walk to whenever we want.  Drink specials and two bars to sit at if you don't want to wait since there is more often times than not a small wait time.  No problem though.  I have a spot in my heart for some fried shrimp and their beer battered shrimp tacos are out of this world!  Very delicious and the shrimp are always huge and tasty.  The jalepeno mashed potatoes are my go to side when they have it since it is not year round.  If you want to test and see how much you can eat, order the shrimp fajitas.  I'm a big feller and it is all I can do to eat that whole thing.  More chips and salsa!!!!!!!  When the weather is nice, the patio seating is pretty cool since you get a chance to see all the characters we have in NoDa.  I am so glad we live very close to this place!

gm593vYXfc1opC0CbwPSDg.text: Get the Tarvaroo tuna tacos and the Baja shrimp n crab dip. Best tacos I've ever eatin!

W2gp8VT-xzPvk_VYgNAJrw.text: Great experience last night at Cabo Fish Taco. The spicy avocado pasta salad was very good and complimented my tuna tacos well. The bartender did a great job explaining the menu and her service was excellent. I'd recommend this spot for anyone looking for great food and a relaxed atmosphere.

z_Skl0GPF1oQjPLfFnIvNA.text: The food tastes amazing!  Never had a thing on the menu that I didn't enjoy.  Lemon grilled shrimp tacos are a favorite!

-vj5R7vEnkPl-VrGrTAP3Q.text: Mediocre food.  Absurd wait times.  Cilantro in every pore of the meal.  REALLY REALLY LOUD. Cabo, I'm just not that into you.

GH3QFCFXz2gQU0eF9zNzYQ.text: We enjoy making the drive to Cabo. Roughly about 45 min. Cabo is consistently excellent!

mpv6gsLkqiZALcX976H2cg.text: Hands down the best fish tacos I have ever opened my mouth to. I had the lemon grilled tuna tacos (not the ones with wasabi) with Mexican slaw and it was filling, delicious and unlike anything I've ever bit into before.

gLi9frqyEjR9Q5oAqJ4_Ig.text: If you're looking for a casual mexican dinner this is a must-visit restaurant.  It is quite loud and can be tightly packed at peak dinner hours, but worth the experience.  Upon being seated, a bowl of chips and side of tomato-corn salsa will be brought to the table.  The salsa is good and different from the more traditional pureed type, but the chips are nothing special - cold, thick, and relatively tasteless.  I've only ever ordered the tacos here.  It's not stated on the menu, but you can combine any two tacos for the taco plates.  I chose the BBQ mango and Tavaru Wahoo tacos.  The BBQ mango is super saucy and flavorful, and the Tavaru has a stellar honey-wasabi sauce.  All of the entrees are served with a side and I chose the Nopalio salad, which was a cold mix of black beans/cactus/spices.  I've also had the mexi-slaw in previous visits and was pleased with its very light dressing and topping with sunflower seeds.  In addition to great tasting fresh food and generous portions, the prices can't be beat.  $10 will buy you two very large tacos (seriously the most stuffed tacos I've ever had) and a side.  This is definitely not the restaurant where you leave hungry.  Several "double decker" cake slices were listed as daily specials, but I was too full to partake.

xZqCN04uRLURf9WTZy5ZMQ.text: It's all about the location and funky vibe (tattoos, piercing & a few dreadlocks-no patwa). There isn't anything special on the menu (fish tacos???). Oh, that's right.. it's all in the name. The food is okay at best (over priced...must be NoDa) but the service is good. The staff is customer friendly...which really creates a comfortable environment.  Looks like a Socal beach dive has landed in NoDa. Surf's up!

7XK0dZIu6s5NUFHCkR4-2g.text: This is my first checking however it will not be my last. The food here was scrumptious I had the beer battered fish and carne Asada tacos they were quite scrummy - the family have an arrangement of tacos and everyone was equally as impressed I agree that the avocado pasta salad is fantastic and I shall look forward to returning

WRYiDtBCkZYDORdzbpUJ4g.text: I don't live in town and we really struggle to find good restaurants. We were on our way back to suburbia and the wife and I decided to head into Noda to see if we could get a decent meal.   It was so nice to go to a relaxed place with good food. I live in a town where Beef Obrady's and McAlester's deli is cherished. I hate these places so if you are a fan of those restaurants, ignore my review. Every kids menu is filled with crap I wouldn't feed my dog much less my kids.   Our kids ordered their grilled shrimp and fruit. They ate every bit of it. I had the signature bbq fish taco and thought it was wonderful. The chocolate cake is a yes.

_x-mJw11YYRKl0m5EsFvYw.text: I love Cabo Fish Taco! It is one of the most popular places to eat in Charlotte and rightly so. Their mahi-mahi tacos are delicious, and their guacamole is incredibly fresh. The atmosphere is great too, it's right in the heart of NoDa near other amazing places to go around too.

xglV9q_Mvr85WOcufsgrOA.text: Wow what an great experience! Fish and shrimp tacos are spot on, queso dip was superb. My only complaint, and the reason for 4 stars instead of 5, is the salsa sucks! Skip the salsa, grab the queso dip instead and you will be fine. Highly recommend this place, worth the drive and won't disappoint!

EMii2-z0MGlNqVyd7YYMlg.text: When I saw this restaurant featured on diners, drive ins, and dives, it looked like the most amazing fish taco I could ever eat...it was good but just ok, I was def let down

599nzcR0cYXeGzMABbOBqw.text: Cool spot and the food is really good.  Often it can get crowed and they do not have space to wait, so often you're outside until a table opens, if the bar is crowded.  But as long as the weather is okay, it's worth the wait.

EmZbmELgZ_pcux03P5utZg.text: This place has awesome fish tacos.  I tried the blackened mahi mahi taco and the beer battered shrimp taco both tasted great.  I also chose the avocado pasta salad as my side and it was great.  It had the right blend of spice and avocado.  I didn't care for the corn salsa that was complimentary with chips when your first seated but that was the only thing I didn't like.  It did not take long to be seated and the customer service was great!  I would definitely recommend it you are in the area.  I look forward to going back the next time I'm in town.

mkw3ImfVl67qzqYCk2G59Q.text: A lot of hype. Tacos are ok. Drinks are great! Service depends, sometimes its great and sometimes its slow.

dcntgRfdaO_KiYq4A_61NQ.text: I am a professional cook myself so i tend to be critical about quality, service and presentation. With that being said my dining experience last night was a treat. As soon as my eyes were presented with my dish(BBQ Mahi Tacos w/ Spicy Avacado pasta), i couldn't wait to indulge. My dish was fresh and full of flavor, plated simple but nice. The atmosphere was relaxed and pleasant. My girlfriend's Beer Battered Salmon dish left much to be desired. Personally salmon is not a fish that muddle up with deep frying. The flavor was truly lacking. Rachel was our server and definitely contributed to our pleasant dining experience. I would highly recommend this very reasonably priced restaurant to a friend.

nx-G4a4SltHppFlz7qEGXg.text: So cute and tucked away on a street corner. I loved the vibe this place gave me. We went right when they first opened up (time wise, not grand opening) so we practically had this place all to ourselves. The decor was cute.   We order a few different tacos my lunch date had a few spicy ones that he really enjoyed. I'm pretty much a wimp and stuck with all the safe options. You get a lot of food for the money and the price point was decent. Nothing too crazy.   If you're in the area stop by it's definitely worth a try. No complaints here!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

cJNKsHBEDkMONB1QcTzD7Q.text: Obsessed!  Anytime I want to feel like I'm back at the beach (weekly?!) me and my boyfriend stop by for some fish tacos. Love the corn salsa and chips...the tuna tacos are fire, the mahi tacos are fire, the fried flounder tacos (special) are fire. Everything is amazing. The only thing I could complain about was this spicy pineapple margarita that was super weird--I'm a bartender and I know what a spicy pineapple margarita should taste like and this was just awful. The traditional margaritas, however, are perfect.

cfZvnCE9m424sxI5vJxcgA.text: If you like Tacos or Latin food in general, then Cabo Fish Taco is the place to go.  The food is simply delicious.  This was not my first time going but it is my first review of the restaurant and it is something you need to see.  Location: It is located in the North Davidson aka NODA part of town on a busy street with both street parking and a small public gravel parking lot ($3 for all day parking).    Restaurant: The interior has very eclectic art everywhere (which I love) and the place has a very fun, funky, chill vibe.  We had a party of 5 this time and we were still seated right away.  The booth was comfortable and spacious.  I used the ladies room and found it to be clean, well lit and well stocked.  They should upgrade the soap from what they are currently using (cheap pink stuff) but they at least had soap in the dispensers.  Service: We had some folks who "like things just so" and our server was very patient in getting everything just right.  He was great.  Food: Let's start with the beverages this time as they happened to have Margarita's on special this day so we all tried different variations of them.  All were good but they were kind of light on the alcohol.  For me that was the only negative was having to pay $8 for a drink but wondering why I felt nothing after drinking it.  On a much more positive note we munched on the chips and salsa while we waited for our food and the taste was very good.  Not too spicy but had enough spice to add a bit of a kick.   We ordered tacos with sides and a variety of other things.  The food was succulent and very well seasoned.  The chefs here have spent a good deal of time working this menu because the food is always consistent.  I had the salmon Taco's and they are always finger-licking-good.  Be sure to get one just to try it.  Ballantyne is actually closer to me so I will go and try that location on my next visit and I hope it is as good as the original location.  This one has set the bar high.

pCQMRGjghDZopStrtUcV3Q.text: Dined while traveling to Charlotte area. Atmosphere met expectations.  Food was good.  I might visit again, if in the area.

hbb205l00RwmPbe4RFc_Fg.text: Visiting for the weekend and a friend suggested we try this place out. GREAT find!!!  Crab and shrimp dip with FRESH pita bread the blackened MAHI MAHI tacos with jalapeno and cheddar mashed potatoes and avocado pasta. Exceptional!!!!

n0MSAMHILEnkN3EARSFfjA.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE OMG. I usually get the thai chili tofu tacos and the avocado pasta and it is to die for  my love always gets any of the meat ones and loves them all! We call ahead and walk there for take out, it's usually pretty busy depending on the time of day you go! One of my favorite places to eat in NoDa!

uxonX7f5DiWKyew1j2MWQQ.text: Absolutely looooooved the food here! This place could have gotten 5 stars if their salsa was salsa but it's a corn salsa. Wasn't my favorite but the TACO BOWL!!! Bay-Bay!! Soo good! I got it with the blacken chicken. Nice and spicy!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blacken Chicken Taco Bowl

kJVNLgjbt0t7GrOXUar1rw.text: Excellent service and food. The calamari tacos are perfect with fresh ingredients and the blend of flavors.

OmtjK6UgEdptv_QX0g2plw.text: We have ate here 2 times so far and the meal has been fantastic  Seating is a bit tight but a very good experience  Parking can be a bit of a pain too depending on the day

Y6S2ZZ3H-NmF1-c6eIylzw.text: A NoDa institution, Cabo Fish Taco serves up tasty Mexican dishes and outstanding margaritas in a cool, laid-back setting that could easily pass for a beachside bar in Cancun. Stopping by on a recent evening, my wife and I started with a pair of delicious (and potent) Silver Surfer Margaritas, along with a complimentary bowl of crisp tortilla chips and fresh salsa.   For my entree, I ordered the restaurant's signature dish: the wonderfully flavorful BBQ Mahi Tacos. Guy Fieri raved about them on his show, and this recommendation was spot-on. My wife enjoyed the Carne Asada Tacos, which weren't quite as delicious, but still an excellent choice.   Cabo has a fun, family-friendly vibe, and the friendly and prompt service was as good as the cocktails and food. While the restaurant doesn't take reservations, you can put your name down using the NoWait app, or just kill time like we did at one of the many neighborhood watering holes within a short walk. NoDa is one of Charlotte's coolest neighborhoods, and no visit is complete without a stop at Cabo Fish Taco. Definitely worth the trip.

1c9E_-QrwgrNfK5ACiA8Xw.text: The food was so good! We loved it! It was very flavorful! We had the beer battered white fish with the avocado pasta and it was a delish!!! We shared it with my husband and it was plenty for us! All of that food for $14 dollars tips including you can't beat it! Would definitely go back here and recommend it to everyone in the area!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beer Battered White Fish Tacos + spicy avocado pasta!!! Delicious
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

04gnMjdJzP5bJijHGTY53Q.text: If you're in NoDa and want some good Mexican food, you MUST go to Cabo. I am so obsessed with their Tavarua Tuna Tacos. They use this amazing sauce I have never had before, wasabi sauce and it gives the taco a huge punch in flavor.   They also have this amazing spicy avocado pasta salad that is to die for

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

eKv2u1iQ8oVaD6Rdse9nOg.text: Nice casual dining place in the heart of NoDa. This place was a fun down to earth feel. As soon as we walked in on a busy Friday night they found seats for us. Staff were pleasant and the drinks were good. The food was great. I had the taco option. It's not listed on the menu but you can pick two different flavors. I got the chicken and the beer battered cod. The cod was my favorite. As a side option I got the brand and rice. The black beans come over the rice with a bit of cheese as a topper. I felt the portions were pretty good and filling. If in the area I may come back.

rjhJNvsqvLa5dPxq4fRY7A.text: My fiance and I love it here! We've tried most of their taco options and have never been disappointed. The atmosphere here is fun! The chips and salsa are good. I recommend getting a margarita. Every time we've been it always looks crowded, but don't let that deter you we've never had to wait for more than a couple of minutes before being seated. It's great for a date night, dinner before going out in NoDa, or for a group. We'll definitely be back!

GHL-rglmra56spoLDor3Cw.text: Amazing place!! I came here on a weekend trip to Charlotte and it was completely unplanned. My friends had been to a different Cabo Fish Taco and I've always wanted to try it and let me say, it did not disappoint.   I had the Soy Ginger Shrimp Tacos with the Jalapeno Cheddar Mashers and it was absolutely delicious. You get 2 tacos with your order but it's a decent handful and you get a good amount of shrimp. I don't know what they do with their tortillas, seems like they lightly fry them, but it just takes the taste to another level.   My friends who have been to another location even said the food here was exponentially better than what they've had. I definitely recommend this place!

z-f8urQ6_3BRvD1LTqB7Zg.text: Best EVER!!! Secret: Tuesdays are slow! Atmosphere is really awesome. Pretty good beer list with a few staples and some good rotating brews. Oh...the food....the food is outta this world. The Tavarua is my go to and so awesome. Friendly service and has been very accommodating to kids or adults who just aren't feeling hungry. See ya there

hEHVwE2GQXbQTmGDofLagg.text: I have heard so many great things about this restaurant, so I wanted to see what the hype was about! Well, I was so underwhelmed... The complimentary chips and salsa was just ok, there is a lot corn, I mean A LOT!!! I ordered the guacamole for an appetizer, and this was the most disappointing guacamole I've ever had! It was not fresh avocado, it tasted like the wholly guacamole brand, and they put the tomatoes, red onion, and jalapenos on the side, so you have to mix it yourself! It is not seasoned at all, we asked the waiter why isn't it fresh, and he said they are working on making it better! I ordered the salmon tacos for my entree, and it was just ok. My guest ordered the tofu tacos, and it was under seasoned. The atmosphere was nice, and the waiter was super nice, but the star of the show "the food" was not impressive! I will probably never revisit!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tortilla chips...
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Corn salsa...

hQM-yJ039WpNextu1R6i_w.text: Looking for dirty Mexican? Won't find it here, but don't worry - Cabo is packin the taco game!!   The Salmon teriyaki tacos are hands down the way to go! Packed with some much favor! And don't forget to ask about thief daily taco special. They usually have some unique options like alligator or shark. Plus, you can mix n match your tacos so come with a group of friends and try them all! Also, something unique, is that Cabo lightly frys their tacos shells, giving them a light, soft, yet crispy texture. Probably one of my favorite taco shells (is that a thing?) in Charlotte.   Now to the sides- you gotta get the avocado pasta salad. It sounds strange, but so delicious. Warning - It's  packed with a little heat, but oh so good!!!!   The margaritas are also pretty solid and they have plenty of options and flavors, including a full bar and a variety of different beers. They usually don't post their specials so be sure to ask your server if there are any!!! I've gotten lucky here before with Dos being the beer of the month.   Now writing this review got me excited to go to Cabo again, as I'm going there tonight!!!! Aye aye!

B2NMFR8St4FxxNayKz7kbA.text: This place is very popular and everyone seems to know about it. I was really excited to go and try their famous tacos. We went today for lunch and sat outside in the patio. At first I was a bit worried bc it's kinda hot today but their patio has a fan and it's just so nice and pleasant. They brought us chips and corn salsa which was good but honestly not my favorite. I prefer regular salsa, just too much corn for me but people seem to love it, so it might just be me haha I ordered the blackened shrimp taco and the calamari taco with a side of fresh fruit. The shrimp taco was amazing, it had a nice kick to it. I would eat it all the time if I could. The calamari taco was also good but it was a tad greasy bc they fry their taco shells. I feel like since the calamari was fried, having the shell also fried was too much.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

5MBc6EAIxRhXZdntIPMBeQ.text: Mexican fare in noda. This place actually came highly recommended, so we made a special trip up to see what it was all about. Everything was really just ok. Food quality was average for Mexican themed fare. The tacos we had were really nothing special. Facilities are cool, the place has a funky crunchy vibe. The place was packed when we went and service was quite slow. Since the food and service were just average it's my opinion that the food is over priced for the experience you receive. If your looking for Mexican in Charlotte, check out my review of cantina 1511. If you're close by it might be worth a look but it's definitely not worth a special trip.

7U8coo8yqEvoPskUwmRpTQ.text: The salsa that came with dinner was cold corn kernels with tomatos and cilantro-it could have been good but it was basic. When I asked for salsa what I got what tasted like it came out of a jar from the supermarket, so I ordered tomatillo salsa for $5 which tasted like old salsa freshened up with lime juice, which just made it runny.  My white fish tacos had slightly deep fried flour tortillas which just made them greasy, and as bland as everything else so far.  My boyfriend's ginger wasabi burrito didn't taste like ginger or wasabi, he got a hint of wasabi in one bite. Overall everthing was incredibly unremarkable.

3pyFG6eeUnfd34RgRqu37Q.text: Very good tacos. I had the Blackened Mahi Mahi with the Black Beans and Rice. The corn salsa and chips were a good starter. I really enjoyed it and I ll definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carne Asada Burrito with sauté vegetables. Aioli on the side.
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened Mahi-Mahi Taco (close up)

pF7GRcy216fONwuN-sQXog.text: We've been back to Cabo Fish Taco several times since my initial review.  We went again this past Sunday afternoon for a late lunch/early dinner.  It was still pretty busy, despite the off time, but thankfully not like a Friday or Saturday night.    The complimentary chips and corn salsa are excellent, but there's hardly enough time to eat them because the entrees come out SO quick.  And that's not a bad thing.  Almost always, I order Honey Wasabi Tuna Burrito (minus the mushrooms) with the tuna cooked rare.  It's always so freakin' delicious with that sweet spicy flavor that I can't stop ordering it.  This time around, though, I decided to be daring.  I ordered the Tavarua (tav-a-roo) Tuna Tacos.  I know -- so off the wall, right?  It's pretty much the tuna burrito minus the rice.  Upon delivery, the tuna was literally spilling out of the taco shells.  That's how much tuna there was.  I picked one chunk up with my fork and ate it.  OMG.  It was incredibly flavorful, juicy, and cooked to perfection.  Since I had never had their tacos before, I was amazed at how delicious they were, too.  The shells were super fresh (I'm assuming handmade/cooked), and they were a little puffy and soft, but with some crunch.  Wow!    A side comes with the entrees, and I usually order the Nopalito Salad.  It's light and refreshing.  Oddly, this time around, there were hardly any nopalitos (prickly pear cactus pads) in it, but the chickpeas and black beans were good.    The service was fantastic, too, and I think I've found my new favorite "usual" at Cabo Fish Taco.

OxWFjP_P9Va5Yvor9IpIqA.text: Very tasty!  I had blackened Mahi Mahi tacos and, of course, a margarita.  Good and very filling!  They did bring my brother a shrimp taco instead of a fish one but they were very accommodating about it and let us keep it (my niece devoured it) while they made him a fish one.  I loved the corn salsa they brought out, preferred it to regular salsa!  Nice atmosphere and very friendly staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened Mahi Mahi tacos!
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Margarita!

HLaU58dQUANV7pYo17KAIw.text: The waiter was very kind however the salmon tacos were disgusting . I did not enjoy my meal.

kxX2cyGTUGh80xm7HkeN6g.text: This could just be the best restaurant in Charlotte.  Most delicious beer battered shrimp taco that I've found anywhere.  Lunch and weekends can be busy.  Charles and Delphine at the bar are friendly and super-efficient.   I'm hooked on their shrimp tacos and fish tacos, but recently discoovered their incredible spicy avacado pasta salad.  Keep coming back cuz I can't believe how yummy the food is.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Scallop taco special today!
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp tacos with spicy avacado pasta salad are the best!
