1HRw8urieYV7Z5tayr9nnw.text: Tacos are good! I got the blackened mahi mahi tacos and they have the most flavor of anything on the menu. But I feel like the freshness flavor has gone down over the past few years. Especially the tomatoes. Rice and beans are the pretty average. Kind of under seasoned in my opinion. Chips and corn-tomato salsa are kind of bland as well. Jalapeno mashed potatoes are good but I don't feel like they pair great with tacos. Cute atmosphere and good wait staff but I don't thing the food is anything amazing

wbY6VKMdLPnIs20vAC5a1g.text: The wait is incredibly long Saturday night but worth it! Don't get the guac (nothing special and portion size is small and not a size to share despite its $7charge). I got the BBQ mahi mahi taco which was great! I definitely recommend it! The taco has a crunchy but soft shell.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

E2sh80sEpAIzDe9YbMN-BA.text: I eat here on a WEEKLY basis. That soy wasabi salmon taco is LIFE! Love the atmosphere, staff, prices and food. The wait can be a beast on the weekends, but it's worth it.

ZV1236CxFChUvymYFbPD5g.text: Cabo was my first Love in NoDa. I have been many, many times but always get the same thing. The Tavaroo tacos with the pasta salad. It's the best thing on the menu and never misses!

pWWVG1JDpUnfmXFrxY8mIg.text: The best taco spot in town! You must go. Even if you do not like taco's they have bowls, pasta, and salads.  I love the chill atmosphere and I am a customer for life.

ZnOJf6QxhifYHbXKNXSjRg.text: Great food and experience. Always busy. But worth the wait. When you put your name down on the waiting list they will take your phone number and text you when your table is ready.  This allows you to walk around Noda and grab a drink at another bar while you wait. Check this place out.

mpmep47EwXkgArErNk_oOg.text: I got the beer battered fish tacos but I don't know if there was actually any fish in there or if it was just beer batter. I was very disappointed after all the great things I've heard about this place. I'll probably give it one more shot- maybe it was just what I ordered.

TVExd69UTQr6xEW7_lmh1g.text: Cabo has lots of great reviews, but let me add mine to the fold. This place has become a staple for me after Carolina Panthers football games in the fall. I am from Greensboro, so traveling north on I-85 right after games is a nightmare. Instead, I opt to pass some time and have a good meal at this establishment in NoDa.  They have an interesting and wide variety of tacos here. Obviously a lot of fish offerings from Mahi Mahi to Tuna and even Swordfish. But beyond that, the carne asada is some of the best you'll eat, and they have an incredible pasta salad that is made with avocado. Be sure not to pass up the queso dip, which is infused with chipotle pepper, and thicker than your average mexican queso dip.

vQa9Nt63kHkFfTh8FGOZ3Q.text: It's good! I feel like it's kind of hyped up. They have a good menu for seafood lovers, but i wish there were more chicken options lol. I know it's Cabo "Fish" Taco, but they usually have to have at least some options with chicken. And they have a lot of spicy stuff. So if you are picky like me, don't go here if you don't like spicy or fish!

c78uhu0CeTmEhlTmbxVPAA.text: I just moved into the neighborhood and had to try this place out. I'd heard it was the best fish taco joint in town and an all around great restaurant.   My wife and I went for lunch and each got two tacos and a side as per their taco menu. I chose the beer battered white fish tacos with rice and beans and she got the tuna tacos with the avocado pasta salad. You get unlimited chips and salsa when you sit down. The salsa is really good - extra chunky and a little spicy. I was a little surprised at first that the cost was $10-11 for that amount of food, but when the plates came out I understood why. The tacos are HUGE. As in pieces of fish falling out all sides. We munched on several bits with forks before attempting to pick the shell in and go at it like a regular taco. It was manageable from there.   The battered fish tacos were very good. The fish was really soft and tender with a light batter that was very crispy. The sauce was delicious. The tuna tacos were nicely seasoned with a great texture as well. They had a horseradishy flavor from the sauce. The beans and rice were good for what they are and the avocado pasta salad was very good. It was nice and creamy with a delightful avocado flavor.   I will definitely return, but next time I think my with wife and I will split one order as we each took some of our meal home with us and were still full when we left. My one criticism would be that I'd prefer the tacos to be half the size and half the price. It would be an adequate amount of food and only cost a reasonable $5-$6.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. One tuna taco and one classic beer battered white fish taco with a side of beans and rice.

9skfS9Dg8bgzOlOvVZJmOw.text: My friends and I truly enjoyed our visit to Cabo Fish Taco ... all 8 of us was ticked away in a cute booth ... we laugh, cried, took pics, acted silly and ate some really fresh and authentic food ... we will continue to visit this location as it is a hidden gem, currently being discovered

ezl2YjEtZiMzqZ2QKIQyeA.text: Went here for the first time because it was featured on Guy Fieri's Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives television show. It is now my favorite restaurant in Charlotte and the best fish taco I've eaten. Every time I have guests visit Charlotte, this is a place that I take them to. Every time. Each time I've gone here (4 or 5 times) has been a great experience.   The vibe and the ambience is upbeat and laid back. The lighting is fine, and it gives off a casual dining atmosphere. The service is extremely quick, and the waiters have been attentive and friendly every time. They start you off with free chips and corn/tomato salsa which is very tasty. Not to mention it's free!   I've only ever eaten the fish tacos here and I can't imagine myself ordering anything else. They let you mix and match two tacos with each other, so you can try two different ones. The portions are pretty big and they don't hold back when it comes to the fish. Not a big fish taco eater prior to coming here, I always assumed I would be hungry after eating fish tacos. Not here - I am stuffed every time. The two fish tacos come with a side dish ranging from rice and beans to jalapeno mashed potatoes. One sneaky good side I would recommend is the avocado pasta salad though! Would recommend the BBQ mahi mahi tacos (the ones Guy Fieri had on his show) and the Tavarua tuna tacos (if you're not a big wasabi fan, get the sauce on the side, cause it's strong).  They don't do reservations so expect a wait at peak hours, but it will be worth it.  Bottom line: Amazing food, great atmosphere, efficient and attentive service. What gives this 5 stars and not 4 is the affordability - Prices are extremely fair and you get a lot of good food for what you pay. If you're in Charlotte you must eat here.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ Mahi Mahi and Tavarua Tuna taco with jalapeño mashed potatoes
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ Mahi Mahi and Lemon Grilled Shrimp Tacos with avocado pasta salad

bVFF0OTy93IXWxbJvbj_Qw.text: Definitely one of my many favorite restaurants in Charlotte. You cant go wrong with any of their fish tacos. The fried shrimp taco is one of my favorites. The BBQ tuna taco is a fan favorite and is extremely flavorful if you looking for a twist on a fish taco.  I love most of theirs sides but am still disappointed that the jalapeno mashed potatoes are no longer on their menu.   The wait can be long but if you remember the days prior to their expansion, it's gotten a lot better. Parking in Noda is always difficult so be prepared to walk.

jDOX7n7j1QEUe06H4p64BQ.text: Every time I pass by this place, there was always a long line and people would rave about it from co workers to management staff at my apt building to uber drivers!   But I have mixed reviews about this place after I tried their fish tacos and BBQ mahi. Really overpriced for the lack of quality. The tacos were mediocre- fish tacos tasted bland and the batter overpowered the fish inside. The BBQ sauce on the Mahi tasted like it came from a bottle that you can buy from the store and fish was overcooked.  Will prob go back here again only because our server was so pleasant and accommodating. She noticed I didn't like the beer she suggested so she offered me what i originally wanted on the house. They clean the tables right away and try to seat ppl as fast as they can.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fish tacos with coleslaw.

TaF-6vuWQ87HebGn85A1qg.text: I saw Cabo Fish Taco on DDD about a week ago, and just had to check it out. Very busy, short wait. They said 10-15 min., but it was more like 5 min. I had the lemon shrimp tacos, they were wonderful. Oh, we also had the shrimp and crab dip & that is a must have! Prices are ok for the amount of food.

y34NNn_QAbad0ZpS1P-s3g.text: My first couple of times at Cabo we're not impressive - in Blacksburg or in Charlotte; my husband and I were both impressed with our service and quality of food at our last visit. Waitress made sure that our drinks never went dry and that we had everything we needed throughout our meal. The food was perfect - my husband especially loved the wasabi tuna taco!

pKjA1Hj7n9vSSqAu4cyZ5w.text: I don't get all the hype. It's a good restaurant with good food but it's in no way earth-shattering. I was happy with service and the availability of cheap margaritas (el cheapo for $5), but it was loud and the wait was an hour.  So it's a nice place to go if you want casual atmosphere and if the line isn't too long.

9b812Vlcef6NDcBy2Qt-HA.text: Excellent! The bbq Mahi Mahi tacos were delicious! They were probably the BEST fish tacos I've ever had. The service was good and our food came out in a timely manner. I would definitely come back if I'm in the Charlotte area.

pVYsQYSr9hO8CSZDuE0uIA.text: Great service!  Beer selection good.  Lemon Grass Shrimp are tasty, not overpowering.  Chips and salsa were not awesome so that's why I only gave 4 stars.

pkmqB7wvztff-OVx611omQ.text: Most creative taco place! The first time I went I ordered the BBQ mahi tacos and they were AMAZING! Super flavorful, fresh tortilla was perfectly crispy and they had a good texture from the slaw. Definitely a hipster vibe/setting, portion size was good for the price. I've been back a few times since and I've tried the tempura salmon tacos (daily special) and the crab dip. The crab dip is probably the best thing on the menu, next time I might order that as my meal! Only downside...I wish the chips were a little hotter and I wasn't a huge fan of their corn salsa it was more of a pico but overall great place!

eiuvl8qrMIVW7VKY1IOS0g.text: Lunch today, first time dining there. Waiter was quite helpful. When I ordered the tuna tacos, he offered the recommendation for their house specialty then went on to tell me I could order one of each since there are two on the plate. I did and it was a great way to try different flavors. Both tacos had abundant large pieces of tuna cooked to the medium rare I requested. Waiter kept the ice tea coming.  Really nice lunch!

3jXNAdOGd998oCTKxR3vVw.text: This was probably the most boring meal I have ever had. The $7 guacamole tastes like it came from a a package, the chips were stale and someone went a little crazy with the cinnamon in the salsa and sauces on chicken & shrimp. Margarita tasted like it was a pre-made mix as well. Overall disappointing.

yo2O6vjA_JMKvswwJQo6Dw.text: The food and selection is good. Having been to Cabo and raised in LA, my standards for the lowly fish taco are actually pretty high. This one was good. The seating in the restaurant was cramped so we opted for the covered patio which is nice, but right on the street.  Parking is a little bit of a challenge.

ZNoYKrKb1-HRmsjmkEkDYw.text: Absolutely excellent!!! The service was friendly and very informative. The food was delicious and very large portions!!! Great prices. I will be back the next time we are back in the area.

BkPdWMbblgPB_tTfVZ1H9g.text: One of our favorite places to go in CLT. Always fresh and tasty. Epic tuna burrito is my pick.

dhlY4Zxk3U2QGoQY-DmkSw.text: My husband goes down to Charlotte often for business and on one trip the group he was went Cabo for lunch, it was the middle of the week and it was also 1:30.  They all raved.   So one night three of that large group and spouses decided to get together and go.  It was a saturday night in Aug.  The place was packed, there was no place for us to wait, they told us atleast an house wait but to check in 30 mins.  We went across the street to a bar and had a drink while waiting, one person from our party went and checked in after 30 mins, they told us 45 more mins.  We then went to finish our drink they walk around and browse in some stores.  We had to stand across the street and wait, there was no place to sit because there were sooooo many people waiting.  We finally got a table, it was right near the bar, which was packed, and had people's butts sticking in our face during our whole dinner.  The place was so loud we could barely hear the waitress.  For as busy as the place was we had ok service.  They had NO chips, ran out of them.    We ordered the Cabo roll to start, my husband that doesn't usually like crab enjoyed them, as did the whole party.  We all enjoyed out dinners, they were very tastey.  We all said we would go back but never again on a Saturday night and I am sure Friday night is the same way.

zBWNcGrQH3YlnngxM5397Q.text: Beans or rice or both way too salty and when meal went virtually uneaten, it was not even questioned.  Also ridiculous  price for a bean and cheese burrito -- $10 bucks -- are you kidding me??   And the chips were completely stale.

tEGtPMK9RHHGQIkm58rijw.text: I used to love Cabo, but I think they've gotten too big for their britches.  Our most recent visit paired rude, lackluster service with mediocre food.  It started when they forgot about us for 45 minutes.  We were wondering why our food was taking so long, when our waitress popped over to tell us that "the printer hadn't printed" our order, so we had fallen behind.  I am not sure whether that was the truth or not, but when one of our party (half-jokingly) asked if they were going to adjust our bill, she made some snide little joke about all she could do was keep our water glasses filled.  And guess what--she didn't even do that!  When the food finally came, it was pretty bland, and the portions were very small for the price they charge.  I didn't want to pig out, but I left hungry.   Other small annoyances:  -the hostess who sat us was quite rude, at one point informing us that we needed to move because we were "in the way."  Ok, that's reasonable, but that's not how you talk to a customer.  You ask nicely or at least say excuse me.   -The board listing their specials was a night old, so we tried to order things that weren't available.  The waitress looked at us like we were stupid before we pointed out their mistake. -It's loud.  Almost too loud for a bar, and definitely too loud for a restaurant where, you know, you might want to be able to talk with your companions.  I was very disappointed with Cabo this time around... I don't think I'll be back.

jEZl3V6bv4ZZHoLuF1G9RQ.text: Love, love, love CFT.  It's often crowded but I think it adds to the atmosphere.  The waitstaff are relaxed and funny but efficient, and the food is awesome!  I'm not a fish or seafood eater but can always find something on the menu that makes me lick my chops.

SSXACngyD-figJxq6vwEaQ.text: 4 stars instead of 5 because I found their complimentary chips especially stale.  Everything else - amazing.  I brought my boyfriend here from out of town, and this was his absolute favorite restaurant out of all the other places we ate at.  A big reason was because they serve complimentary house corn salsa with their chips - he LOVES corn salsa.  (Though I think their corn salsa bowl can be much more generous.)    They're tacos are delicious and unique - love their soft taco shells!!! They're fried but still soft and decadent.  Amazing.  I ordered both types of fish taco on the menu, and they were great.  Will definitely order again.  Ambiance/decoration - lively, colorful & fun.  I absolutely love the Day of the Dead paintings - which I could take them down and have them in my own apartment.  A great place to eat casually with friends, with drinks, and to also take your family.  Most unique/fun restaurant I've found so far since I've moved to Charlotte actually.

ntT7jbPIg5xDlHbSd085ag.text: You know, you'd think that after giving a restaurant 2 stars, I would stop going.  Me and Cabo are like You and That Lover; you just can't let go even though you know it's not good for either of you.    It's a mystery to me.  I think maybe I fantasize about the prices lowering themselves by half. Or the food improving itself by half (either way suits me).  I think I just really need a Baja Mex restaurant to fill a void and I keep going back to Cabo.  There are a couple of things that are ok.  Like that one server with a cute....oh I'll stop.  Not even a cute butt is consistent there.   Oh well.  I keep trying.  Trying to fill that void.  Trying to understand.   Does anyone else have that restaurant they don't understand why they patron? Could this go in a self help article?  Maybe I would sign my name, "searching for tacos in all the wrong places".  But that's it! Sometimes I think I like the atmosphere............?????

x8H3JrrDE3DnZnoC2QvIfQ.text: Fish tacos in Charlotte? Pretty good ones too. They were big, really big. Flavorful and fresh. Price was right. They encourage mixing and matching which is key.   Lively atmosphere, nice art. Friendly service. Glad to have a local introduce me. Never would've wandered in by myself.

t0XG1gICB9GAl5yBDdnFKQ.text: Had a really good time here. The food was good, but the music was too loud. I'm no prude, but I do like to hear myself think and the company I'm with talk. Other then that, excellent.

3AXvIcS1W4Fu_tlpu3cGdQ.text: Amazing!!!! I don't usually give five stars but this place was a fresh breath of air.  From the hostess to the waitstaff and manager, we were taken care of for our entire lunch. Best tacos I have ever eaten.... BBQ Mahi Mahi!!!!

INBz36eUgvMUMPltfX_iDA.text: This little shop has all the makings of a great restaurant, except good service and quality food.  I've been there twice, the food on the first trip was good, if a little simple (I believe anyone can wrap a piece of fish in bacon and cook the hell out of it).  On the second trip both my girlfriend and I  ended up with bland food, my side dish of rice was undercooked and her meal had zero flavor.  Our waiter was too busy falling all over some yuppy girls at the next table to bother with us.  We're generally not picky, but after we brought the problems with the meal to the attention of our waiter, he literally shrugged, apologized and went back to flirting with the next table.  No offer to correct anything.  We won't be back anytime soon.  Overall the place is great for people to see and be seen, it's a yuppy hangout, it's loud and the food is hit or miss.  Pretty much sums up NODA these days.

V3ev9caBp6VypJtnhzGrmQ.text: I've been here 2 times. First time the food was bland, cold, and my tortillas were soggy. The service was ok. The second time was just terrible. Service was horrid. Our server didn't check on us at all, our drinks were never refilled, she dropped our check off and picked it up without saying anything. The food was unforgivable. Greasy, overcooked, and tasted like water this place has never heard of salt. I had to season my food and add citrus to my fish tacos. My side of rice and beans were cold, undercooked, and had no seasoning. The corn salsa was served with cold ships and once again no seasoning. I usually never leave bad reviews being that I work as a server in a restaurant in uptown and also as a cook/kitchen manager in another restaurant in uptown. But this was just shameful to everyone in the restaurant industry....

oL9kBi-u9QPf0Mw57XwRAg.text: I expected a lot more from a dish that is the namesake of a restaurant. That's some greasy, flavorless fish, CFT. For shame. While I commend you for giving me a lot of food, it simply was not good.  I also have an issue with the corn salsa that come with the chips at the table. I love corn salsa IN a dish. But, it makes for some seriously awkward dipping with just chips.   The kernels...they were...everywhere.

BGdtSrLD-nHr_tlB-AKKOA.text: Oh Cabo, I've always meant to visit you! Why didn't I do it sooner? Oh it's probably because you suck. I want to give it the benefit of the doubt, I mean everyone has bad days right? But it's just so bad that I don't want to go back.  So after agreeing to go to Cabo Fish Taco after a pretty bad Eclecfest event at Red at 28th, I was kinda excited. Because Tacos! So after my date and I found some parking, we discovered that we were the first to arrive in our party. I walk in and I'm told by the hostess that there is an hour wait for a 5 person table and a 10 minute wait if we want to squeeze into a 4 person table. I ask to see the 4 person table and it's not really too bad so after some feedback from the others we agree to a 4 person table. Well I went to the restroom, and apparently my friends got told to move it cause they're blocking the hostess's path. Maybe they put up a fight getting out the door who knows, because all I know is after I got out and joined them again to wait outside she yelled my name like she wanted to kill me. My line of work deals with very upset people all the time  so I didn't think too much of it, but my friends and date were quite shocked and upset over it. As we get seated I'm wondering why right next to us there's a perfectly good table for 5 but we're still seated at the table for 4, oh well. Our orders get put in pretty fast I thought after a confusing mix up with them not updating their daily specials board. Chilling with our drinks that don't get refilled, so my date Allen generously refills my cup with his water. About 45 minutes of no water later, when I'm hungry and not happy enough our waitress comes over and says the printer had problems and hadn't printed our orders out (sounds to me like they totally forgot the order). She said sorry I'll keep your water filled at least! Well she didn't even do that. Maybe you could have sent over an appetizer or something after making us wait so long for food and not even checking up on us, because we're hungry!  Finally the food the food arrives at our table, and it's pretty skimpy portions but I'm a positive thinker so I say maybe it'll taste great! Well was I wrong about that. There are way too many onions in the quesadilla, maybe if they had actually stated that there were going to be onions galore in there I would've been able to ask them to omit them. I just wanted a cheese quesadilla guys! We would have been able to share the disappointment in our dishes if the waitress had been around or if we could have heard each other over the loud noise of the place.  So people left hungry, prices are not good for what you get, and there is rude inattentive service there. This place managed to get everything wrong and leave such a bad impression on their customers so why is it so popular? I for one don't have any inclination to return anytime soon, or ever.

G5TC00QNewmQLF9XqhCVsQ.text: Wow, I was impressed. I ordered the blackened mahi mahi fish tacos. They were delicious.  I was really impressed. The salsa that is brought to the table was also excellent. I will definitely go back and I highly recommend this restaurant.

SuY9woJiqfr1ah825I-3Pw.text: Cabo Fish Taco is amazing.  I could inject the queso dip into my arm via IV and be content forever.  I'm so spoiled after the steak tacos that I won't order tacos anywhere else!  Best restaurant in Charlotte.  Great vibe.

SF6Oc_gRDdAxiU_qAV2Klg.text: Good food, good location.  For the people that are complaining about the free chips being stale, its kinda hard to find a place where the free chips aren't stale.  Service has something to be desired.

w48SAlbYHki605LuuoRZkQ.text: Planned ahead and arrived in plenty of time before the band we were going to see later that night. This restaurant is within walking distance of some great small music venues and galleries in NoDa. I was prepared as I watched the Triple D excerpt on their web-page and checked out the menu on-line. We had quick service and plenty of chips and corn/pico type salsa to prevent over ordering. 3 of our party had the Tuna with Wasabi burrito and not a one of them offered me a bite so they must have enjoyed it very much. I went with what they are know for- a blackened Mahi fish taco and a beer battered shrimp taco. both were good, the Mahi was better. I also had the Silver Surfer Margarita, fresh and tasty, no syrupy mixer. I would eat there again if for no other reason than the convenient location and to try something new.

uH3Aq2vCJKwN22ATfAVVpA.text: I love fish tacos, and after reading all the blah yelp reviews, I was worried about this place. Turns out--nothing to worry about. This place is great! One thing I did take from the reviews was to stay away from CFT's standard fried fish taco. Instead, I went for the grilled mahi mahi taco, which was very good.  Also tasty was the Mexican slaw with pumpkin seeds that our friendly waitress recommended.   A big thumbs up for the decor, too. CFT is located in an old renovated building with brick walls and old wooden floors that is festively lit and full of warm bright colors. I really thought the design elements of the space added to the experience.   Sure, it is not exactly Ocean Beach San Diego, but it is pretty darn close and a really fun atmosphere with great service. It is definitely worth a visit.

W7OmKRkXFA6TzDhY4dvccw.text: First round of chips came by and they were stale asked the waitress for fresh chips she came back with two other baskets and they were worse. She said they fry them up every shift and in my mind it might have been last weeks shift. As an appetizer I ordered the queso and I should have gone to food lion for that one. It was a busy place and I wish everyone complained but my guess is people like stale chips or they just don't care.

NfiKDtdzzvw7XS_MWPsP5w.text: I'm ashamed that it's taken me so long to write a review about one of my favorite places in Charlotte. Anyone who has not tried Cabo, is definitely missing out. The service here is by far the best i've experienced and i've dined in many places, in different parts of the world. Very attentive, very professional staff but not stuffy or uptight and quite fun, I always leave happy and full. Many of my friends are now addicted to this place and I must say I am the cause for this addiction. Anyone who has yet to try this place, I have to recomend the Cabo Roll and/or the Honey Wasabi Wahoo Burrito. Both are heavenly!

5_hDlD3ACGeowZ52RH20XQ.text: I didn't realize tacos could taste this good....   Nice location in the trendy Noda district... Indoor and outdoor seating...  Friendly staff.... Highly recommend this place....

Yaxt_vnjXRZE6fsCagBNrA.text: Finally made it and have to say I wasn't truly impressed.  I got one of the tuna tacos with refried beans.  The beans were lukewarm.  Took awhile to get our drinks.  I wasn't impressed with their chips either, needed some salt and some seemed stale. The music was alittle too loud as to where we couldn't hear the waitress and she couldn't hear us.  Dont get me wrong, I"d give it another try but only if I'm in the area, I wouldn't make a special trip.

UOQWp2ZvuSGRj5rJaZmzoA.text: I don't love the corn salsa, but one can get past that with a little guacamole to accompany the thick, yummy tortilla chips. Get the classic Mahi Mahi tacos or the BBQ Mahi Mahi and you'll be in fish taco heaven.

8YqAZEbqPGOtnKq7g_JtZQ.text: Cabo I really wanted to like you... I have given you a few tries before writing this review.  You do have a few things going for you. 1. Great location 2. Interesting Tex-Mex decor  3. A really nice outdoor seating area  Let's start with the staff, the bartender gave me the wrong change ( not just keeping a buck or two for a tip- maybe it was a mistake) and fought with me for about 5 minutes before I had to show him the price of my drink in the menu. I think my waitress hated me or just hated life.  The salsa is corn based- okay, I can get that you want to be different, but the salsa is bland and simply tastes like canned corn. Our chips were stale. The queso would have been okay, but it was cold, which made it form into solid cheese- not very good on stale chips.  I decided to get fish tacos- I figured with a place called ' fish taco' I couldn't go wrong. My shrimp tacos were really boring. It seemed like the kitchen ran out of ingredients  I think they were beer battered, to be honest I couldn't really tell. My whole tables meals came out at different times and our sides to our meals were incorrect.  I would have told my waitress that our food was incorrect, but I couldn't find her for the rest of the night, until our checks came.... $12.00 for two bland and skimpy tacos. No thank you!  I really don't like to give bad reviews, but I can't find a reason to return to Cabo Fish Taco.

OVyPd0z9zD7HUMO0TH7R3A.text: I suppose it depends on what you come here for. I enjoy coming here for an alternative to mexican for something a bit more healthy. i like the grilled mahi mahi with a side of fresh fruit. If I'm going to really eat mexican out I would not come here as the fish tacos are a bit on the bland side. Nothing is really spicy.

Nwt9nKAyZIZxt2ABiKL0NA.text: Wow... My mahi taco was Stuffed and delicious !!! The refried beans too ... If you're in Charlotte... Highly recommend !!!

xsVnB5ebz3E2z6hXCO1ZMw.text: I have always wanted to go to Cabo Fish Taco.  I am a Foodie and good food is what i love.  That being said the food was nothing to write home about.  I had the "world famous" fried whitefish taco.  There was NO flavor- not in the batter not on the fish and to top it off there was sliminess that was just gross.  The crab and shrimp dip was good- but you can barely taste the crab or the shrimp.  The margaritas were Very good.  I also sampled quesedillas and they were tasty-but nothing mind blowing.  Hanging this up as-- been there done that.

yp81RDXsVv2aBrc5YsKHZA.text: Everything we ordered was delicious! Waitstaff was attentive and really cared that we liked our meals. Highly recommend the lemon grilled shrimp tacos! Yum!

5FdDCFugjI5dcz6ezNaTcw.text: Wow, what happened Cabo? The food was so beyond inedible this evening. Not one person in my group left satisfied nor with any more than a few bites of their food eaten. Fish wasn't cooked all the way through. The carne asada meat was tough to chew, like chewing on leather, and lifeless in flavors. Tortillas were hard. Spicy avocado pasta tasted like it was made a week ago and refrigerated. I used to love the chips and salsa here but the chips were stale and the salsa was lacking its usual spice. Our bill was close to $80 for four people... That price does not justify the quality of the food we received. Server hardly returned to see how we were doing. On top of that, she kept change from the cash we handed her for the bill.. Possibly assuming it was her tip?? When should you ever assume though? Had to hunt her down to ask for the change after waiting for her to return for about 10 minutes then she acted like we were being rude or an inconvenience... I've never encountered these types of problems here or had a meal that was this subpar here... Really disappointed. Hopefully next time I decide to return I'll be able to add more stars but it'll definitely be awhile before I come back.

pHDP71QJapSHF_JsKZ6tpg.text: Went here with a Friend before a concert. He saw then reviewed on diners-drive-ins-and-dives. I loved the TAVARUA (TAV-A-ROO) TUNA TACOS. One of the best fish tacos I have had. Tasted like sushi if you can believe that. I also tried the BBQ MAHI TACOS. No that impressed. It was good but I was not blown away. As for the tortilla chips they were stale? This is why I am not giving Cabo 4 stars. Along with that, they give you Corn Salsa and personally not my favorite, I would rather have a tomato based salsa. But that is me. Furthermore, you have to buy your GUACAMOLE and GREEN TOMATILLO SALSA for $6.50 and $3.95. The Guac was not great and only a ice cream scoop worth for $6.50. Need to offer free salsa. The good is this is not your average Mexican taco join. They do have burritos as well but did not try any.

EH4xEnioYQeNpScGjfhgNA.text: For my first fish taco experience, I have to say I'm impressed. I had the pleasure of devouring the bbq mahi taco with the creamy cilantro sauce. My husband had the chicken quesadillas(which was also awesome) Music was great. The setting was nice. Music was Parking not so nice. We were lucky to snag a spot nearby but if it was any busier, we would have been SOL. But we enjoyed the experience and we will be back :)

1sc-WHGfOJciscQUSOQelw.text: Saw it on Triple D & couldn't wait to try it. Had lunch & the free chips & salsa very good, corn based salsa with a kick. Guacamole was extremely good @ fresh. Has the taco's, one of each, BBQ Mahi Mahi & Tavarua (wahoo) with a drizzled wasabi sauce, unbelievable. The service was right on, got us in @ out while still being very personable.

C0gwa2kFu2WwuNxcBrh3lQ.text: This place used to be a go-to place in Noda. I'm not sure if they've changed management or ownership or if they've stopped caring. Their chips are always stale, and their corn salsa is less of a salsa and more of side of corn.  Their tacos used to be really good and now you'll be unimpressed. I hope they read this review bc I used to enjoy the vibe and food at this place and their standards have dropped.

YzoEI3UbuXxyLNqm4Ue8EA.text: I really like Cabo for the atmosphere, menu, beers.  The food is just A-OK it's pretty consistent and you can get some very good tacos but as far as food network worthy mmm not so much.  I will continue to come back to this little joint though waiting for it to wow me.  This is a great place to take some friends for lunch and try out some unique fish tacos.  It's always bumping so be prepared for a wait.

LXq0UWJxU3-SA4p7lvnZvw.text: I am a big fish taco fan, and to my disappointment this place did not live up to the hype. Food was just average. Margaritas are just alright. The ingredients seemed cheap. Perhaps their fame comes from being the only Mexican restaurant in NoDa, I wouldn't dare to say it is because of their food. I had the blackened mahi mahi signature tacos and  "meh" is all I have to say. Best fish tacos? Seriously?? Only if you have low fish tacos standards.

FJJUAslx8iTsWKWPVT4Jrw.text: I have only been here once; however, my experience was great enough that I am already planning a trip back. I had the best chicken and shrimp burrito ever. The corn salsa is wonderful and our server was the sweetest. If you go on a weekend in the evenings be ready to wait awhile for a table but it is SO worth it.

Xya9V7AFaJn3XiUzYtnYeQ.text: I'm from Southern Cal. Born and raised in East Los Lived in Sun Diego for 11 years. Cabo Fish Taco are authentic and AWESOME!

Jgvh2p-R_lsMsLgUjV6Dqw.text: They should highly consider accepting reservations and/or utilize open table..their process of seating patrons is flawed and needs to be assess and improved.  The fact that if you miss your name being called and are automatically seated ahead of those who are still waiting outside the door,  is absurd!  The (gentleman) hostess needs to understand that arguing with patrons is not appropriate or appreciated, remember you are in the service industry.  The reason the hostess felt it was ok to holler at me is because his General Manager thought his actions were appropriate. What kind of leadership and people development environment is that?  If you prefer places where you are treated with respect than go to Cantina or Loco Lime. Oh and the skinny margarita sucks.

FP90xL2Aor1vJRO0m4Qj4A.text: I love this place - it was one of my early finds upon moving to Charlotte a few years ago, and I go back about once a month.   I almost always get either the Mahi Mahi tacos or the Chicken serrano tacos -- in the tortilla on a bed of cabbage, with CBT's signature yogurt-based sauce, and some queso fresco...yum. My husband always gets the Cabo Fish Tacos, but I prefer my fish unfried. I got a burrito once - nothing to rave about - and the scallops once - tasty - but I'm kind of blown away by the reviews on here who give CBT a one or two-star rating and then confess "well, I don't like seafood/fish/the central concept" etc. Why would you go to a place with the word "fish" in the name? But anyway....  The corn salsa DOES always end up on the table. Just wipe it up. The real disappointment for me, taste-wise, is the sides. I've had the cucumber salad, the napolitos salad, and th baja rice...all not good at all. My husband always gets the Mexican coleslaw, but I stick to beans/rice (with corn)...definitely the tastiest, in my opinion.  And spending $8 for dinner - excellent. Add in a margarita (starting at $4 for the "El Cheapo") and you're all set.

c6AZAExxI0w3eE2282fHgg.text: Really like Cabo fish taco. I first found out about it because they were featured on some tv show. After that, I had to have the bbq mahi tacos, omg delicious. I will definitely go back. Good service and good prices.

vHQIe-N11qbYT0a_dMnFyg.text: Most def the best tasting food I've had in Charlotte so far. The rasta pasta off the hook!!

oJogenA2ud58WK7wiQGAzg.text: The complementary chips were a good surprise. The taco, however, was only average. I got the mahi mahi taco and it tasted bland. If I had some BBQ sauce I'd put it on. Service was very good though.

8RMEaANBR48cI3IqyDDAGQ.text: I heard a lot of good things before I tried this place. After trying, my feeling is just three star. Nothing impressive.

wJ07u4D3oWw1Iipsefya6w.text: This was the first place I checked out in NoDa, and I left so disappointed. Ok, so their claim to fame is fish tacos so that's what I ordered -- the beer battered white fish tacos. The white cilantro sauce was gross; the beer batter overwhelmed the taste of the fish. The corn salsa and chips were stale. The waitress offered to replace the meal, but since the tacos were bad and I was famished, I decide to order something safe . . . like a salad. Ok NoDa, don't let me down again. I am off to find my NoDa dining gem . . .  assuming one exists.

6GzmkxVG9vxjkBYIawsxAw.text: Fish tacos are the thing to get here - they are delicious! Everything else is kind of so-so. Restaurant was very crowded and noisy when we went, but salsa and guac were yummy, and the tacos were beautiful and tasty. Margarita left something to be desired, but fun place to go with a group of friends if you're in the NoDa area. Definitely worth trying once.

igB1RAWQgOLgILCMr2ukUw.text: We have had mixed reviews about Cabo but it has just gone downhill recently. Took a special friend there last night and liteally had to wave our hostess down every time we needed something. The cabo roll was good but my whitefish tacos were COLD! I mean like cold tortilla, cold slaw, cold fish that had been sitting out. Did not complain because they did not seem to give a rats ass!

PyZNV9LicM1CBq6i3kWsAQ.text: Meh is about all I can say about Cabo. I feel like it is super over-hyped... We went in for dinner on a Tuesday night around 7pm. It was pretty crowded but there was no wait. They brought over chips & salsa. The chips were warm but I didn't get the feeling that they were made fresh. They were on the thicker side. The salsa was a mix of corn and tomatoes/peppers (pico de gallo). Not spicy and not really salsa, but ok. We each ordered our own combo taco plate ($10.50) which came with two tacos and a side. I got one BBQ Mahi taco and one Tavaruva Wahoo taco with fruit as my side (seasonal). I was incredibly underwhelmed with my food. The fish in both were way overcooked and dry. The wahoo taco was way salty and the mahi was under seasoned... Another thing that annoyed me, they only have flour tortillas... Really? A fish taco place with only flour tortillas... Even worse, they weren't homemade/fresh. They had that store bought flour tortilla smell. Come on guys... Step it up.

1RccLsrdl9K6ZP21peZcRQ.text: I tried Cabo Fish Taco again, and I really wasn't impressed. I got the veggie burrito, and it was just bland and unexciting. My boyfriend got the cabo fish tacos and was pretty disappointed, especially since this dish is the restaurant's namesake. I wish I liked the corn salsa and chips they give you as an appetizer, but the spices of the salsa are just really off and it tastes gross.

_9pp68V4S6_Tuc5ZvA_YqQ.text: Love this place. Shrimp tacos and pomegranate margaritas are the best. Go early when there's less of a wait and it's less noisy

f_HaHUM74xAill7hewJijQ.text: So good. If you are in Charlotte you should come here- although getting a table may be difficult. It's loud and crowded, but the food is so worth it

PFbB3c4x49Ftoqxn4pMHaA.text: Cabo is a solid place for a meal or takeout. Good food, good vibe, good service, but beware - the tortilla chips are almost always stale. I have been there before and noticed servers scooping chips into baskets and letting them sit next to the bar to grab as needed. I understand the urge to save time while serving, but this guarantees that the chips will be stale when they reach the table. Also, because they're sitting out in the open, it increases the chance of contamination from all kinds of things...so no thanks. If you get stale chips - complain. It's the only way to make them change the way they do it. The avocado pasta salad and queso dip are not to be missed!

ZY7H7R2rW4xeVwp9Z9tmwA.text: I will never step foot in this establishment again. This is my 3rd time here and the service has yet to improve. Waiter/Waitresses are continuously very cold not personable. Moving on the food was below average ( chicken fajita  - blackened tuna salad) tuna was over cooked and the fajita  was thrown together! The waiter could obviously notice the tuna was not prepared as we requested however failed to ever ask if we enjoyed our dish. We feared speaking up about the matter due to the poor service and chances of food contamination.

uPR_i4fjIqlWCmIYRnq1iw.text: BEST fish tacos in Charlotte.  I've tried many fish tacos in the area, and I'm always led back to Cabo.  I've tried all varieties, Mahi-Mahi, Salmon, Beer battered etc....all are excellent with exception of the beer battered whitefish tacos.  They are bland, but are supposed to be the "signature tacos."  Sides:  Stick with black beans and rice.  They are a safe choice.  Only complaints:  Lack of "specials."  Occasionally they have $1 off margaritas, but their sandwich board of daily deals only ever include "featured items" and offer no real price break or discount.   Love the outside seating in the summer, but the inside seating is rather loud, and it is hard to hold a conversation.

CQBzi_snOQ8aUYMIQpVoKQ.text: Love this place. The beers are usually pretty well priced (2$ specials) and the food itself is a great value. I never leave there hungry or being disappointed with the meal. The free corn salsa they give you with chips is delicious and has a little zing to it because of the red onion they mix in imo. I've also had plenty of the cheese dip appetizer over the years and it has a kind of "smokey" taste to it that sets it apart from a regular white cheese you would get at a lot of mexican restaurants.   The tacos are all well prepared and my personal favorite is the BBQ Mahi tacos. I probably get that at least 2 out of every 4 trips there. A lot of the other times I will try out whatever the special is they are having. I tried the scallop wrap yesterday and while the scallops themselves tasted a little overdone (I'm guessing its extremely difficult to cook a perfect scallop) it was still a great meal.   The only thing I think they could work on, and this is something I have noticed over the years, is that it seems like a lot of the time they run out of the specials. May just be a testament to the restaurants popularity but if the special is no longer available please take the eraser to the chalkboard so my taste buds don't get all worked up for nothing,

qhvd9g_Y-upSYslfWER48g.text: Whoa, how have I not reviewed CFT yet?  Okay first, the wait: To address all these reviews that talk about waiting to be seated - yes, you usually have to wait for a table. Yes, there isn't really a good area to sit and wait. But yes, it is worth it. When you're coming to a restaurant this delicious, you'll probably have to wait.  The food: I'm not a huge fan of the chips and salsa, but most people I go with love them. I've had the BBQ Mahi Tacos (about 6 times). They are amazing. The tortillas are fried and the slaw is incredible. I usually get full after the first one, which says a lot because I can usually house my meals, but always make room for the second taco. The sides? Nothing great. Some of my friends love the jalapeno-cheddar mashers. I usually pay the up-charge to get a side salad, which is delicious, but the tacos are good enough that the lack of yummy sides doesn't really matter. The Guacamole Salmon Salad is also incredible.  Great beer selection. Decent margaritas. The prices can't be beaten. I love NoDa and I love Cabo Fish Taco.

rML5QRaLrA_vUP1RYPEQdw.text: The tables were turning over pretty quickly but a LOT of people were waiting for a spot on a busy Saturday night, so we waited an hour and 15 minutes (as quoted by the hostess) for our table.  It was well worth the wait!   Btw - the staff was busting their bums getting everyone accommodated for.  They were polite and efficient given the amount of folks waiting for tables!  I liked the happening vibe at CFT.     We were headed to Neighborhood Theater for a later show, so we had time to hang out and have a few drinks, chips, and salsa while we waited.  The chips & salsa were so-so, but I was so hungry we devoured a whole basket!  I personally like a spicier, more  tomato-ey salsa, but that's just me.  My battered shrimp taco was OUTSTANDING!  I loved the flavor of the shrimp and the tortilla was delicious.  My chicken taco was good too, but I could have devoured more than one of those shrimp puppies.  The barbecue mahi was pretty darn delicious too.  NoDa is a cool neighborhood...we'd definitely come back for more tacos and another show!

fOEfRfCYoJ2XPId7t0vGoA.text: In the multiple times I have been here, I have yet to have a less than stellar meal. Everything on the menu is delicious and perfectly crafted. Great ingredients - I especially love the shells they use for their tacos.

Q7mosN2zFyTRU1_-3zgjIQ.text: I've been twice, and driven by and not stopped a couple as well. Apparently this place gets busy on the weekend evenings. Not sure I'd wait an hour to eat here, but it is perfect when it's not busy. We were seated quickly, they have tap beer, and the bartender was super chill.   The portions are pretty big. My gf and I both got an entree, and we left will plenty of leftovers. The new standby is splitting the shrimp tacos (especially by the time you eat the corn salsa, chips, beer, etc!).  People do bring their kids here sometimes, so you may want to poke your head in and see if you're gonna wait 45 minutes to sit next to a screaming toddler...

ujd0B6c90l6FHuODQUq7Yg.text: Cabo fish taco has pretty good food, with a fairly unique and satisfying menu. A decent selection of drinks that aren't going to blow you out of the water (price wise) and are clearly segmented into tequila qualities etc.  But really, truly, and honestly, the noise level at this place is OUT OF CONTROL. There's no other way to put it. You can be at a 2 person table and not hear a single word your date it saying. I can't even imagine what  a 6 person table is like.  Service was fast and very friendly. I have no idea how our server even heard me over the roaring but our orders came out fresh and correct.  The food's a 4, maybe a 4.25, but the experience is a 2 at best. I don't go to a restaurant to sit in silence because conversation is totally futile. The place seems popular enough but how people get past the maximum volume jimmy buffet + atrocious acoustics I will never understand.

ZdRMcRszlpy0FqZmNt_UOQ.text: My wife and I stopped here today after hearing good things about the place.   We were disappointed.  Although the service was fast and our waitress was very nice, the food was mediocre.  Firstly, the guacamole was obviously out of a container.  We suspected that they use the exact same pre-made brand that you find in the grocery store.    They tossed some fresh chopped onions and some other stuff on top, but they weren't fooling anyone.  (By the way, the charged more than 6 bucks for the stuff.)  Secondly, the chips they served were stale and under-salted.  Thirdly, the refried beans were also out of a can.   They had the EXACT taste and texture of the Old El Paso brand refried beans that you can pick up in any grocery store for $0.99 a can.   Of course, Cabo will charge you considerably more.  Finally, we have to talk about the fish tacos.   We tried 4 varieties of their tacos, and they were all bland and uninspired.   The fish was overcooked, the sauces were just gross.  They used fried flour shells and cheddar instead of traditional corn tortillas and cojita or queso fresco (which would be the more authentic way to go with this sort of fair).  Personally I didn't mind the flour shells, but my wife thought it was blasphemy.  Lastly, a word to the chef:   Wasabi and Mustard are not the same thing.  -- The honey-wasabi sauce tasted exactly like the spicy mustard you get from a chinese restaurant (which is generally just ground mustard mixed with water).  I could be wrong- maybe the other flavors screwed up my taste buds- but that tasted just like any generic honey mustard sauce.  I don't mean to bash these guys too much.   The meal wasn't awful- it was just awful for the price.  Also, I need to knock down their rating a little bit, because they just don't deserve their current 3.5 stars on Yelp.  My wife wants you to know that you can get better food at Chipotle.

E1gymBkRzbQ5rkh8dcYi7A.text: Goodness Gracious!!!! let me tell you what! This place is de frickin licious! I had the bbq mahi mahi and the tuna the Tavarue one with the honey wasabi sauce that I'm pretty sure could make a shit sandwich taste good! I can't wait to go back! The service was excellent as well! Sunday at 11 with no wait and food within 10 minutes! Make a bulldog break his chain bo!

PfTD7w8IeFDwrU7oo3AKyw.text: Even though it was very busy the service was great and the food was fantastic. I can't wait to go back.

Dlw8Hi8_WjzqGS5LeeRWMg.text: Man what a let down! I was so amped to get to this place after I saw it on Diners Drive-ins and Dives. Flavorless beer battered fish taco, chips and salsa with no pizzazz, even the beans and rice were blah. And my server had some kind of narly rash on his elbows, yuck. It's not an experience that I ever care to have again.

-9R9KaARBYx8aOcz5HXSNA.text: Great food! One of my favorite places in charlotte. Price is acceptable. It's in the Hippie part of town, but it's a nice "Friday after work chill spot". Love it!

3WoQk3HPw2mXM_HYF-yg0Q.text: This place is AMAZING!! The atmosphere is great, the staff is super nice, and the food is absolutely out of this world! We went on a Sunday, our wait was 20mins until we were seated. We ordered the Queso dip which was served with chips, the spicy mixed with the cheesy was a great taste combination. We also had the BBQ Mahi Mahi tacos. They were cooked to perfection and the combination of tangy and the homemade slaw was perfect! Definitely going to come back again. In the summer they have an open patio which we will be visiting!

ywT-QoiPUOX2MfKlkdw37g.text: Am I missing something here??  I've been anxiously waiting to visit this place because I've heard so many positive things about it.  Heck, it's been featured on the food network!  So I finally went today.  Got there around 6:30 pm on a Friday evening and the tables were filling up quickly.  Cute decor, island music and nice youthful ambience.  I was feeling good...but not for long.   Chips and pico were served. Took a quick glance at the menu and knew what I wanted.  Fish tacos!  What else?  The place bears the name so it must be their specialty, right?  Wrong!!  I ordered the blackened mahi fish tacos.  ($10.50 for 2 tacos +1 side).  They were wrong in all senses of the word.  Where do I even begin...  Ok, so the plate looked nice but the fish was dry and warm (I like my food hot unless its supposed to be cold).  It had absolutely no flavor.  Blackened is supposed to be very flavorful people!  The fish chunks tasted like stale, warm, low-sodium canned tuna with a hint of, I don't know, garlic powder maybe??  It had a smear of avocado, a few shreds of white cabbage, a few shreds of cheese and a drizzle of "white cilantro sauce" which was so scant that I couldn't even taste it.  It was decoration, I guess. For my 1 side I chose the refried beans.  Yuk!  Tastes like cheap canned beans.  I ordered a dos XX special lager on tap and it was flat and watered down.  Even the beer was a hot mess.  And here I am in shock!  I'm not quite sure what all the hype is about. This place was not very good at all.  And I don't plan on going again.  Ever!  If I want good fish tacos, I'll go to the pros... Authentic Mexican.  I'm done!  What a disappointment!

bd1ki5qdjQCOan8NFE8ZcA.text: Overall? Mostly awesome. We came about 6pm on a Tuesday night. We went to the bar as we were still waiting for another to join our group. We had heard good things about the house margaritas so we decided to try them. Hey, only $6, so not really a risk. Then...OMG....who uses Cuervo in their house margaritas?! They were perfect with the house made sour mix. It was also Mexican Beer night with 1/2 off all said draft beers. We each tried a few that the very friendly and personable bartender recommended. All good. Our bar tab for 5 beers and 2 margaritas ended up being about $20. Not bad at all.  Finally our 3rd guest arrived and we were seated right away. (Quite a rarity, I've heard, even on a weekday night.) The other 2 had the BBQ Mahi tacos and I had the Wahoo. All excellent. The only other place I have had such good fish tacos was in San Diego. Now, it was obvious that the rice and beans that the tacos come with were pre-plated for some time. This is just fine because they tasted great and it's probably the reason our meals arrived less than ten minutes after ordering. Overall a great atmosphere, average service and well above average fish tacos.  -Side Note: The "Corn Salsa". Interesting and Unique. I'm not a fan. It's not bad, just not my thing. I prefer a spicier, more tomato based version. I wish they gave a few options.

eoUbIVi4YTnFVNJY7vg1DA.text: Meh.  This place is all the rage is NoDa, but it's never done anything for me. I guess it's just not my bag, baby. There are several other places in the area where I'd rather eat and hang out. You should definitely check it out for yourself, as again, most people LOVE it. I've just never had a meal I was crazy about, and the service doesn't stand out either.

Qt58kExg7xp5IZzXjQMI2g.text: Fresh corn salsa with tortilla chips.  The tacos and burritos are all excellent, as are the desserts.  The red velvet cake is a delicious multi-tiered confection with thick frosting.  I was disappointed to find that they have stopped serving the mashed potatoes as a side but the pasta salad was a nice substitute.

QsiuaxEOvVBkBpIWn4JCrw.text: What a happenin' hipster spot. The restaurant doors are wide open for half in/half out seating.  We sat at the bar for faster serving. We ordered their unique fish tacos and some margaritas.  I cannot tell you how TASTY and YUMMY this food was!!  It's kind of messy, so it's not for eating on your first date! Parking sucks, though.  You gotta park a ways away, as the NODA district is usually pretty crowded at night. The staff were very nice and accommodating.  The seating arrangement is tight and not the best design for large groups. They do have two bars, so go to one of those and eat if they're on a wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

MkhCNV_MZFZZ622CZu-eSg.text: I don't know how this place is so popular. The chips and "salsa" that was provided when we sat down was bagged chips from the grocery store and corn salsa. Which, by the way, is NOT salsa! Perhaps there is a time and place for corn salsa, but not at a taco place to eat with chips as the forerunner to a meal.  The food that we ordered was edible, but not much to say beyond that. I didn't finish the burrito that I ordered which usually doesn't happen. My partner's tacos were... like I said before, edible.  Also, the place just felt dirty, like there was a film of grease over every surface.  We won't return.

b5ujheU5Vay0nj7vEQuUEg.text: Went to Cabo last night for a celebratory meal with my boo... it did not disappoint. I knew the evening would be great would we pulled up and the parking spot closest to the door was open. I was able to do a quick, illegal U-turn and whip my RAV 4 right into the parallel spot LIKE A BOSS.  Anyway, we were greeted by the hostesses and sat in a quaint, two person table along the left wall. Our server was fantastic - she gave us the right amount of time to decide on our margar selections (an important choice, for sure) and had our drinks out to us in a jiffy. We both ordered burritos - I got the carne asada burrito with a side of fruit. They accidentally brought me the wrong side, but quickly corrected it and let me have both sides! My burrito was delicious - steak was tender and perfectly spicy for me. My side of fruit was excellent.   It got more crowded as the night went on, but the atmosphere was still good for a chat with my main squeeze.  I highly recommend Cabo Fish Taco.

kUrQtdSMFAt1hYabbuJVug.text: This is a great spot in the heart of NODA. The atmosphere is fun, friendly & super relaxed. Cannot say enough about the quality & taste of this food. We loved the corn salsa & chips to start. The corn salsa was sweet to start with a nice kick of heat at the end. We had the steak tacos, the lemon grilled shrimp tacos, the tavaroo tuna tacos, the carne asada & the honey salmon tacos. Everyone had a distinct flavor & were delicious. My favorite were the shrimp because I loved the pickled red onions that were on top. Their sides are great. Definitely recommend the mexi slaw & the napolito salad. My son had the churros with the chocolate dipping sauce, which were made to perfection. They were fried but not greasy.  If you go on a Friday or Saturday expect to wait but I can tell you it was worth it.  You will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Relaxed &amp; casual atmosphere with cool art work.
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lemon grilled shrimp tacos, with the best pickled red onions &amp; side of napolito salad
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carne asada taco, lemon grilled shrimp &amp; honey glazed salmon tacos with a side of black beans &amp; rice

93QwD7jiL0jQnI4IyzNW_w.text: The food is so delicious! I've never had a bad experience here. The decor and service were pretty decent. I would like to draw your attention to the chicken and shrimp burrito. Prices are reasonable.

P21qqlOhaEethGBOai1PyQ.text: The only complaint is that Our chips were stale. I told the server they were stale and she brought us another basket of the same stale chips. On top of that she didnt remove the first basket.  My wife asked me not to make an issue out of it because they were only chips.  The other Items we had were good.  I just feel the server didn't care to inquire about the chips they were serving from the kitchen.

59jTVWfVjcAx5uTZ68C_CA.text: Went for lunch today at the suggestion of Guy Fieri DDD....  I had the waiter suggested salmon honey wasabi taco and the Fieri recommendation, bbq mahi taco with the slaw.   I would come back for the salmon wasabi tacos any day!  I was not as impressed with the bbq mahi taco. They had a strange flavor combination going on.  My husband got the carne asada tacos ... He loved them but I just thought they were ok. Not impressed...but I am from Southern California and no one can beat SoCal carne asada street tacos!!!    But let's get back to the salmon honey wasabi tacos!.....yummo!!!  Jeremy our server was great!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon honey wasabi and bbq mahi tacos with slaw
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tuna wasabi burrito
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and carne asada taco

NlEu-vfikqjbEqrVBCE03g.text: My wife and I were excited to eat at Cabo fish taco, but were left with a poor taste in our mouths. As hyped as this place is the food is average at best. I can cook better mahi tacos at home. My wife ordered the beer battered white fish tacos and I the blackened mahi tacos and both came out cold. Not room temp I mean refrigerator cold. And my wife got sick half an hour later into the next morning. Wish I could say it was good but it was a waste of our money!

YmWR7czE2E145fNIVM2Abg.text: My boyfriend took me out to dinner here for my birthday and we had a wonderful time! The salsa and chips they brought out was delightful and our drinks came quickly. We ordered tacos, he got the mahi mahi and I got the carnita. I want to eat what I had every day for the rest of my life! I got the spicy avocado pasta salad for my side and it was soooo good! Our waitress was kind and attentive. If I lived in the NoDa area I would definitely empty my paycheck here more often. I highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

Bpd0VDol3a51XbU5maBYkw.text: I had a really great experience here JEREMY is a really good asset to this place he knows he stuff he recommended a great choice "Shrimp and Chicken Burrito and the spicy avocado pasta salad SOOOOOO GOOD I am really happy that I came here! My Bestfriend and I had a really good time! DEFINITELY COME AND request Jeremy's section!

w3LccFczUNrQHqBNvqukcw.text: Overrated. Food is very sub par and staff are hit or miss. There are a number of places in the city to get much better tacos and drinks.

zY4Ood_KOa0KnDUnCmV-CQ.text: Pretty tasty! They have a ride range of food on their menu for a taco place, a lot to choose from. Loved it.

YNrkt9pXGG0k9pfwewEfIg.text: The tai chili tofu tacos are AMAZING! I should've tried a different side. But overall great food and margaritas!

LpxGmDa7hqbE2Qf8TWoo7A.text: We've been three times and ordered something different each time and every one was wonderful!!! We've split because the dishes are so large. Plus, we order a queso and mix it with the corn salsa for a delicious combo. The first time we got buffalo chicken tacos (the daily special), second we ordered a Baja bowl (I think the name of it) filled with shrimp and the third the Rasta pasta. They even split the Rasta pasta into two separate bowls for us which was a nice touch. But if you're looking for a quiet dinner this is not the place to go and parking is also a pain. Nonetheless, this restaurant is like no other, the best food in QC.

BSlZbBUrDVgcdXALIfYbQg.text: Cabo "was" one of my favorite places in Charlotte. It was my favorite to-go tacos. Clean, good service, and great food. HOWEVER, since they changed their menu few months ago and increased the prices, the quality been going down hill. Chips are ALWAYS cold, food comes cold, and the quality of the dishes are way way way off. Indeed, the food doesn't even taste the same.  I honestly not sure what happened to them, but I hope they get it together again. Those 3 stars for what they used to be, now? I wouldn't even give them 1 star.

dpxJlxYZBFKn8IobyH5msA.text: Dont really get the hype about this place. I had fish tacos, rice with mango chutney, and a beer. Was reasonably priced and tasted fine, but it wasnt anything to write home about. It's aight.

YpskrKA9fFMu_16y8wFKQA.text: Went here after many recommendations and it was great. The restaurant itself is bigger than I expected and they were able to seat my party of 8 pretty much immediately despite being busy. We were greeted immediately and the waitress made good recommendations. I grabbed a margarita beer, which had a slightly sour after-tone as expected.    For food I ordered the bbq Maui Maui and the honey soy salmon fish tacos with the baja rice as a side. The baja rice was ok, nothing memorable but both of the tacos were super flavorful and delicious. I can see why this place was on food network. This place adds to the many great places to eat in the NODA area in Charlotte.

GXqgUbJH_0g8cXPK87TU4g.text: Absolutely one of my favorite places to eat in Charlotte. Great drinks, great specials, and always good service

DqBl0z9nYV9HJPKuFpLPKg.text: BEST TACOS MAYBE EVER??? Arrived on a Saturday night around 6 and told there would be a 30-45 minute wait (ended up being 20) and wandered around the cute neighborhood. The wait is 100% worth it. We ordered the guacamole salmon salad to share and it was very yummy. But the highlight of the night was by far the tacos. We ordered the Tavarua tuna tacos and the honey glazed salmon tacos. The tortillas were perfectly soft and every bite was full of flavor. Highly highly highly recommend coming here for the tacos!!! Definitely the best tacos I've ever had. We devoured the tacos and would have come back if we weren't leaving the next morning. If you are in the area definitely come here!!! The waitstaff is super friendly and helpful and the ambiance is so fun.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tavarua tuna tacos

OMcij4kn1YkT14F_lB-PVQ.text: My fiance and I live in Florida, but she is a former Charlotte resident and this was one of the places she was most excited about taking me. It did not disappoint. Located in a cool part of NoDa, Cabo Fish Taco has good service, a good atmosphere, and most importantly, good food!  You get free chips and salsa prior to your meal. And they have a solid beer selection, including a good number or local craft brews. I ordered the tavarua (tuna) tacos and was pleased with that decision as the overall flavor of the tacos was great. If I'm ever in the Charlotte area again, this is definitely a place I'd go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

2YuS8ZS4MbhN3L3LQszt1A.text: Do yourself a favor and skip this place. Qdoba has better food, seriously. The food here is just not good. The chips were bad, the guacamole was the worst I've ever had, not fresh and pretty disgusting. My carne asada taco was so over cooked and bland. My side of black beans and rice were so dry, I couldn't even eat them. How do you mess up beans and rice?! I am still so confused about this place and really hate that I wasted a meal here. I love reading the other negative reviews so I feel justified. Will not return.

gVrAxdyRAL-BOUPF_n_RBA.text: So. Good. We absolutely loved this restaurant! There was about a 30 minute wait when we got there but we were given the option to receive a text when out table was ready. This gave us the opportunity to walk around and check out some of the local shops instead of standing around and waiting. Once we were seated out waitress was very friendly and offered recommendations on food and drinks. They had a great selection of local beers and cocktails. We ordered cheese dip, bbq mahi tacos, and soy ginger shrimp tacos. The food was delicious and we had such a great time here! It has a good casual vibe and we will definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Queen City margarita

a8sEir0ze55Nfgj_hK24KQ.text: I really liked this place! I know it's been around for a while and my best friend has been recommending it to me for years. We went for lunch on a hot day, but still chose to sit outside on the patio- it was lovely! Shaded and there was a ceiling fan, so we weren't uncomfortable at all. I felt like I was on vacation in a tropical place!  The chips and salsa weren't anything special. The chips tasted a little stale tbh, and the salsa was mostly corn and not very flavorful. But I got the Tavarua Tuna Tacos and LOVED them. Extra star on this review just for these tacos- so flavorful and fresh. I would definitely order them again! My husband also enjoyed his lemony shrimp tacos.   The service was also lovely. The food came out quickly. A good meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chips and salsa
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tavarua tuna tacos!

PkPWIeFiJLtUm8qiF5LU6g.text: Wow. This, man. I can't even. I seriously want to move to Charlotte so I can eat here more! We decided to come here due to the Yelp reviews, personal recommendations and the fact that it was on Diner, drive-Ins and Dives. So many good things so I couldn't imagine having a bad experience here, and we certainly didn't! We started off with Guacamole. Holy Moly. It was easily the best Guac I've ever had. It was so smooth! And the taste was great. My boyfriend was convinced it "came from a can". Not sure if guacamole has ever come from a can....hahaa. But he was meaning that it wasn't made fresh. Not sure how he was able to tell this, or if it was True. But it didn't stop me from devouring it. yum.  We both got the same Margarita, The Perfect Wave. We got ours on the rocks. Our Margs were delicious! Very happy about that. Really wish we got "Mas" for $3 more. Ugh! Next time!  For my meal I got 1 BBQ Mahi-Mahi taco and 1 Tavarua Tuna Taco. I got the Mahi-Mahi taco because it was recommended and that was the one on the show. And I chose the Tuna taco because our waitress said that the Honey Wasabi Sauce was THE BEST. Oh my gosh, yes. And this place does not skimp on the fish! We had huge chunks that were basically bursting out of the tacos. So both were equally amazing. I seriously kept going back and forth to pick a "best" and I couldn't. So, just know that you CAN mix and match your tacos! For my side I chose the cheddar jalapeno mashed potatoes and they were delicious! Nothing was bad here. Not even our service! We had an AMAZING time here. Food and atmosphere are on point!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. The pinkness in my fish! You never get fish cooked like this! Delicious! So juicy!
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ Bbq Mahi Tacos and Tavarua Tuna Tacos. Both equally delicious!! Best tacos! Huge chunks of fish! Cooked perfectly!!
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Food menu

XGyuD9ENv365MAlnsoyFVA.text: Very trendy place to get tacos. It does get pretty loud in the restaurant at peak hours. I was initially a bit skeptical about the price ($12 for 2 tacos and a side) but was very pleased with the amount of fish/meat in my meal. You are allowed to mix and match any taco on the menu, so I went with two of their specialty tacos - lemon grilled shrimp and honey soy glazed salmon. Out of the two, both were extremely flavorful and juicy, but the salmon was just cooked extremely well and the sauce was divine. I also enjoyed the semi crispy taco shells, that was a first. I think the sides could be improved, however. I got sauteed veggies as a side and they could do with a bit more flavor. But overall, a very satisfying meal.   Service was slow-ish and our server didn't seem very interested at all but it was fine.   It was hard to find free street parking on a busy night but there is a paid lot nearby.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. lemon grilled shrimp and honey soy glazed salmon tacos + sauteed veggies

PVDqgAcEWcMjMmQc0_4iQw.text: Always a good time with great food! The flavors are spot on and the environment very chill. Tacos on the patio on a hot summer day was exactly what I needed...I love noda and happy to have called it home for 10 years and love that Cabo has been there through it all!!!

h0D7joUpSzo3WaB8wz0aUQ.text: Lemon shrimp grilled tacos, avocado pasta salad for my side, chips and corn salsa as a complimentary starter (which was so d*mn good!!), and my Caborita slim margarita.. "slim" but GOOD. I am definitely not dieting but I wanted to try it lol. A GREAT place in NoDa to try.. the atmosphere is bomb, and the view was relaxing..I came alone and it was just what I needed!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lemon Grilled Shrimp Tacos

mh6PYW0QPmpA_npHxbbFNQ.text: Awesome place! Love the fun casual vibe. Great tacos. The ginger soy beer battered shrimp taco was lit! Also loved the shrimp and crab dip with the fried bread!' We will be back.

yKjBEnvxdOaVdCnI4BqFHw.text: We were really excited to come here because it's that place that everyone seems to mention when you talk about Charlotte. Overall, it wasn't bad but just underwhelming.   The corn salsa that comes for free with the chips was really tasty and nice because it was something different from regular old salsa. Chips were fine but not salted at all. We also had the queso which was more reminiscent of macaroni-and-cheese sauce than Mexican queso. It was pretty good just not what we expected.   You can mix and match any two tacos which was nice, and the tacos are huge. I had carne asada and blackened mahi. The carne was good but had a lot going on between the red pepper sauce, veggies, shredded lettuce, avocado, and cheese. Unfortunately my mahi was extremely over cooked and quite fishy tasting. The blackened seasoning gave little flavor and absolutely no spice. We asked for house hot sauce but they don't have any which is a bummer for a taco place. My husband had the carne taco and fried whitefish tacos. He really liked the whitefish and I thought it was well cooked but again lacked salt or any distinct flavor. I also tried my friend's tavarua tuna taco which is honestly what bumped this review from 2 stars to 3. It was well-seasoned and perfectly cooked.  I had the "spicy avocado pasta salad" as my side which I enjoyed but was not spicy at all. Like not even a little bit. My husband had the rice and beans which were overwhelmingly saturated with parsley. Again everything needed salt.   Service was excellent! It's a bummer the food wasn't better.

jltOqgedSCrtBQG7CRWFIg.text: WOOOOOOOOOOOW.  Great tacos. Great service. A tad bit pricey but all in all it was well worth it. Carne asada tacos filled me up beyond belief..... and it was only 2 tacos lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

6J7ZTh9fQ3NDguHVZxmgPA.text: This restaurant was amazing, im from Virginia, so this was the first time trying out this place and I could say this was worth it. Me and my girlfriend were looking for somewhere to eat while visiting Charlotte, and were not disappointed with this place, would highly recommend there calamari and honey grazed ship tacos

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Calamari and honey grazed taco

JQETUGMQBQeG5bp2xUgZ5g.text: I came here for dinner one night with the fellas during my bachelor party and I am so glad we decided to come here and eat.   First off this placing is popping on a Friday night. We were able to secure a table for 7 and we only waited around 5 mins. I ordered a plate of some of their signature fish tacos but the only one I can remember is their honey soy glazed salmon tacos. Let me tell you that those honey salmon tacos are the TRUTH. It was so delicious that I wanted to get three more of them but sadly I only had one.   The portions here are plentiful and everyone else in my party enjoyed their food as well. This is a great spot to hangout on the weekends but be warned that it can get loud in here! The service was good and our waitress checked up on us a few times and the food came out in a reasonable amount of time.  SN: for some reason they only had one mens restroom and a unisex bathroom. Just a little odd that they didn't have a womens only one either

M0f5pf81hjcmbyyCB3-Aag.text: The tacos are awesome!!!  Full of rich flavors.  Highly recommend the place.  Best cal tacos in town.  They also have outstanding service.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon and BBQ Mahi Mahi tacos.
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. I&#39;m suppose to be on a diet!!!

ZbWC-Es3Kn2dPNNc704CMw.text: Tacos are pretty much a staple in my diet! While visiting Charlotte for a weekend, we stopped here for lunch. I ordered the blackened salmon taco and the lemon shrimp taco (love that you can mix and match entrees). My friend lives in Charlotte and had nothing but great things to say about the salmon tacos, so I went for it! They were great, seasoning was perfect. I was better off getting two of these instead of the shrimp taco but it was good. The special sauce and pickled veggies on top of the tacos are also worth mentioning! Nothing was too spicy or overwhelming either.   Other things to mention is that their salsa is jam packed with corn, so don't expect the regular salsa here. It's good, just different! The decor of this place is really cool too.   5 stars for the customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

t3aDFcmOu7-j1iXdbm0h5g.text: Went here with a big group and we were served promptly. I ordered the special which was pork belly tacos and chose baja rice as the side. The tacos were sooo good! The pork belly was crisp on the outside and so soft and chewy on the inside. Flavor was spot on! The tortilla was also really nice, soft, and buttery. The baja rice had some chutney on top, and though it looked unappetizing, it sure was tasty! Prices are reasonable and the service was good!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork belly tacos with Baja rice

51pYVDNf6vKI0nyY38NAzg.text: Popular restaurant in NoDa Charlotte. Went there on a Sunday lunch, and they were doing decent business. Mid-size restaurant with a fun vibe. They serve a range of the Mexican fare, but True to their name, their signature dishes are their fish tacos. I got the lemon grilled tuna tacos, and the plate came with two tacos with good-sized chunks of tuna. The tacos tasted pretty good. Got the fancy rice as the side, and that was alright. They serve complimentary chips and salsa which is one of those really chunky ones without much liquid, and they were pretty decent. The taco plate was 12.50 before taxes and tip. Not the cheapest, but not expensive either.
