photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. queso, salsa and chips, and the lemon grilled tuna tacos with a side of rice

QGwbykgzoOdAapDxragsFg.text: TACO TACO! Who doesn't love tacos? I've been to this restaurant a few times. Fun fact Cabo Fish Taco, they were featured on DDD.   Personally, I love the Beer Battered Shrimp Tacos. Comes with two flour tortillas stuffed with cabbage, tomato, avocado, cheese, & finished with our white cilantro sauce.   I have never had a bad experience at Cabo. It has a really good ambiance with an interesting layout you would never find at a chain restaurant. Weekends get a little busy so come early.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beer Battered fish Tacos

vtcKI2TWfUapqfbSL7TDeA.text: My favorite restaurant in NoDa. Comfortable interior, friendly staff, and a variety of delicious food options.  I like to sit at the bar and talk to the bartenders. They always make you feel welcome and are cheerful. My favorite selection are the tav-a-roo tuna tacos and the lemon grilled shrimp.  Their hours are convenient and their takeout is fast.

my0CQaIvrBHfhFDFzQ4h3A.text: Great vibe. Cold beer. Delicious crab dip (appetizer).   The rest can go. I wasn't really a fan. There are 900+ other reviews so I will keep mine short.   I came here with two other girlfriends and loved the vibe. We ordered not 1, but 2 crab dip appetizers- sooooo good. I ordered the lemon garlic shrimp tacos... I should've just ordered a 3rd crab dip. I also ordered the avocado salad for my side- not good at all. You know when people hype up a place and you go and it's not good... yeah that was exactly my emotions as I drove home irritated.  Service was so-so. I was not impressed at all after hearing rave reviews over the past few years.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

HoOMJFgj4i9NQGn7Wm8dkg.text: Fresh. Vibrant. Nodaish. Trustworthy.   You can't ask for a better taco menu. You can't go wrong with any item on the menu actually! My food came displayed how I imagine the OG Thanksgiving dinner looked, in a cornucopia - almost too pretty to eat. Don't worry, I ate it and it was scrumptious.   Cabo is unique, not only are the wall art installations funky, but the menus have something for everyone. Trust me when I say everyone! You can feel comfortable taking anyone here and knowing they will find something they love.   Be sure you get your tofu grilled not blacked. Blackened ia good, but grilled has the taste of summer and it sits well with the fresh veggies and cilantro rice.   Get crazy here Nd try something outside of your norm. It won't let you down!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

X9VdmnRlCdWOBmpwPOMLzw.text: Cabo Fish Taco is one of those places that people who don't frequent the NoDa area tend to flock to.   Being right in the middle of NoDa, Cabo Fish Taco tries to embrace the NoDa vibes with some quirky artwork, but just misses the mark a bit.  My stomach has never agreed with Cabo based on the three times I've eaten tacos there (not a great sign). I also just can't get over the fact that every time I've gone, THE CHIPS HAVE BEEN STALE. This is mind-boggling to me, since they serve so many chips every day. I will admit, the spicy avocado salad is a REALLY solid pasta salad, so definitely snag that as a side if you're dining there!

3DjAMJ_j3RrKkTQVd_uPhg.text: In general, I like this restaurant.  Although I was extremely unhappy with the service today.  We got a LONG hair in our cheese dip appetizer and the manager just took it away like nothing happened.  They didn't give us another one or explain that they couldn't give us another one (if this was the case).  They just never mentioned it again...

aKp1voXFnFCQSmHHGtk9SA.text: Fun atmosphere, unique vibe, cool people, tacos were on point not to hard but not to soft, the guacamole salmon casa salad was a big hit for me. Would highly recommend this place.

oAbRyh-KJNg6k3QrXkHSFw.text: A little loud but what great food. Try the bbq mahi!! We had a group of 7 and I tried just about everything.  All awesome. Nice beer selection too

xIadle-5okC37Lhs-3Q4Sg.text: Delicious shrimp tacos. A great, swinging spot if you are in the mood for California-style texmex. Margaritas are delicious and STRONG. Enjoy with a DD.

J28GyzcbE3ev8kxE3DFt1Q.text: It was ok. Nothing special maybe a little overhyped. It's really not that hard to make fish tacos at home.

Kg3AVCAJJUKNq5T06Nwa1g.text: Wait, did I just step into a beach island club, or a restaurant in NoDa. I can't tell. There's some crazy loud music that's not *all* bad, and there's a nice breeze on the veranda, and food that resembles baja mexican, but, ehhh not quite. So, I don't know, I'm confused. I want to like it, it's so close.   Atmosphere:  This is the only real reason to come here. As far as places go in NoDa, it's got some sense of style and some decent music that jams out onto the patio. It's a noisy place, so if you're a big whiny-baby that can't take some loud conversations over top of some fairly loud music, perhaps you'll be better off somewhere else, because the food won't make it worth it for you.   Food Leaves a lot to be desired. The teriaki sauce dishes are pretty terrible. I keep forgetting that and ordering them, then throw a little fit inside myself for not remembering. The salsa they bring out at the beginning is fresh corn salsa that is ok, but they give you a heap of it on a tiny tiny children's toy of a plate, so you focus like Frodo trying not to dump it all over the table each scoop.   Service:  Nothing special. Some nice folks here, they do their job and nothing more.   Celebrity most likely to enjoy eating here:  Perhaps someone from the Jersey shore. They seem to like noisy clubs and their spray tan makes me think they are mexican.   Half hour to live and I have to get my last meal here:  I'd just eat the free salsa and get drunk on some mojitos.

9pffazmlhg8rTByV2hZLJw.text: I had the blackened mahi mahi taco which was delicious. It was spicy but still flavorful. The salsa for the chips is fresh and similar to a pico de gallo. Charles was our server. He was attentive throughout our dining experience and very pleasant.

nIoSXk0N9yumda_-wL7EVg.text: Whoa! I've never gotten food this fast before EVER! And it was really good too! I'll definitely be back. The menu has a variety of Mexican options many of which are not just your standard options. It was great :-)

rJe0RpxnxGW1ou4drTQ0Rw.text: Horrendous service and attitude from both waitress and management. I was expecting a Williamsburg feel (as I live in nyc) but unfortunately that's not the case. Extremely poor service. Do not recommend to anyone. Stay away. Also should add this may have been due to me being a minority as I was the only none white person in the entire place except the waitress. Disappointing

HtzIwPKH6oh3IsQoI7t_hA.text: Great atmosphere for a night out with friends. Parking pretty difficult but there is a cash lot nearby if you can't score free street parking. Tacos are large and filling (2 were plenty). Jalapeno mashed potatoes (which they don't have year around) were delicious but honestly all their other sides are just mediocre at best.

dEw8cAvvXg1j2lfb-CjmPQ.text: Quite a foodie and boy did we love this place!  Great food and service! The salsa and queso were fantastic and we followed the recommendation of our server for the BBQ Tacos and Blacked Mahi Mahi - amazing!!

jXhN3s9TGY-tZVY4dW9zxQ.text: Had Tuna Taco and pasta salad.  Fantastic and even though only 2 tacos the portions were good size.  Great service and atmosphere.

WkJx5zspKgLoTUI4_lmGPQ.text: Sooo good! Had the grilled lemon shrimp tacos and beer battered shrimp tacos and omg the flavor was amazing! The cilantro lime.sauce they put on my tacos is amazing.the rice with mago chutney is so good. Friend had the bbq Mahi tacos and they were fanominol better than cali fish tacos! Want to come here everyday! do it! Margaritas are fantastic!

U4tT5ej56fHwU9BEDaLzOw.text: Considering, I just came back from Mexico, I was not really excited to have tacos.  However, my hosts insisted.  Really glad they did, I ordered the lemon grilled taco with refried beans.  My wife ordered the beer battered white fish taco.  My Grandmothers ordered the salmon tacos.  We decided to mix and match to try all three and I must say all three were amazing.  The grilled shrimp taco had wonderful flavor, loved the basil and sauce that it was served with.  Also, I love how each flour tortillas is fried to a perfect crispness.  The white fish taco had a nice crunch to it, the salmon taco tasted great as well.  The salmon had a really nice grilled flavor.  Their retried beans were great and the avocado pasta salad had a nice bite to it.  The only item, I did not have was the complementary chips and salsa.  The chips were good, but the salsa was terrible.  It had a lot of corn and red onions, to this tasted more like a coke slaw than your typical salsa.   In summary if, I lived here, I would definitely frequent this place.

KmXBacHlCvao2MHLmDqDwg.text: Great food, great queso, and the atmosphere is cool. A must do in the NODA area.

4L1hWcdiS0NsXFq-nNf4Mw.text: Food was great. Service was craptastic.  Knew it was going to be bad when our waitress first asks if we are ready to order, we give a cheery 'yes', and  she responds by walking to another table, returning 10 minutes later.   It didn't get better.

h5m2W8rKjFklZqmRhugkGA.text: I'm not a big fan of Mexican food, but I've heard so many great things about Cabo Fish Taco and I had to check it out. Parking was hard to find, but it was worth it. The restaurant was great, food came quickly and was absolutely delicious. I ordered some sort of steak taco with various veggie toppings, and I was full for hours. Couldn't even finish my meal I was so stuffed. Waiter was very friendly. Lighting was a little dim, but it added to the atmosphere and gave the restaurant a nice feel. Great experience.

oDjoU-IMFx4Y63dVy-oslg.text: This has quickly become a go-to restaurant for us and especially to bring out of town guests.  Service is great, food is great, beer selection is good.  It seems to ALWAYS be crowded, and with good reason, so plan ahead especially on Weekends.

Qyb50p_lKoLKSv7pMyRtag.text: Corn salsa is OK, some people love it though.   I got the special, teriyaki salmon tacos, and they were awesome. Best fish tacos I ever had.  They came with a wasabi sauce that was rather mild in flavor but satisfying.  The other fish tacos are pretty good.  Great atmosphere!  I will be back.  They always have decent drink specials too.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

kz7x7eYF1iKVD54ZzLHGTQ.text: When I was 18 years old, they served me alcohol without carding me and the bartender was very friendly. I suppose this wasn't very responsible of them, but I did have a nice time there regardless.

eMymjuGrLYJ_rqOl1rniog.text: I've been there once and loved it!  The fish tacos are delish and who doesn't like a nice little trip to NoDa?

AajVVzGVnSsWGxiKUfA6kw.text: We put in our name and waited 25 minutes, while groups of various sizes, who came in after us--were seated ahead of us. When I checked back with the hostess and pointed to an empty table near her she said, "I'm sorry. I can't seat you there. It's a fire hazaard." Then proceeded to seat another party there. We finally left. Won't be back.

oVQ-w9Do-9LvQvJe1U3xJg.text: Cabo is more like a 3.5 for me, but I'm going to give it the benefit of a doubt and round up.  I went for the first time for lunch the other day after hearing about it's awesomeness from pretty much everyone.  I enjoy the concept - fish tacos are great!  The corn salsa was mild, but different and good.  I got the tuna tacos and thought they were good but not phenomenal.  There were a lot of flavors going on and I don't think they really complemented each other.  Also, the tortilla was a little dry/crunchy.  I'd prefer a little softer, otherwise it equates in my mind as stale.  The service was good, but we did go at a less busy time.  I enjoyed the strange green people art on the walls.  I will try to avoid this place during peak hours but will go back if I'm looking for something different during lunch.

detkfo8rFJ_3sbLS99lSkA.text: Love this place! Great venue and great experience. Try the Wasabi Tuna!!

z46hpFi2MmQ3F0RYBCbtjg.text: Tried the fish tacos and they weren't really exciting. The place seems like a nice place to hang out and grab some drinks with friends but it's not worth a special trip.

isrxw_6V3EtzFNzNGJXECw.text: I wish my home town of Columbia, SC had a fish taco place just like this, I love fish tacos. Cabo had a ton of energy when I went, the mood and the atmosphere was hip and quaint like the neighborhood it was nesseled in, on a small corner of Charlotte. The service was fast and friendly. Cabo puts a good foot forward with it's corn salsa and chips that come out before meal, I could have just ate this. When I received my beer battered fish taco my first thought was wow is that food or art. My second thought when I bit into it was grease is the word is the word, can I get a towel over here. Over all Cabo was good I might come back sometime, but I think I'll ask them to towel off my taco next time.

TrRvhcoAdQJUyzJGuq6esQ.text: This is my favorite taco place in Charlotte. The shrimp and fish tacos are awesome. Additionally, the pasta was well done for a restaurant specializing in tacos. Whenever we have visitors from out of town, we take them here.

47-dMwp62kePa2Q3ZjLqyA.text: glad to see more people are coming around on this......for the food choices there are about 2 dozen places in charlotte to get better; in NODA its at the bottom of the list of the fooderies in that area...so why is it still there???....I know I know the answer is found every week in those Observer LAZY DAYS party pix of all the 'cool" people going to the "cool" bars; they support crap like this

1fwxPdAVwpfPyTRA0_tpYw.text: Love it!  I visited Cabo Fish Taco a few years ago on my very first trip to Charlotte.  Since I enjoyed it so much then, I requested a repeat visit when I headed back to Charlotte last month.   I was not disappointed. I went all out with soup and an entree.  My soup was of the curry shrimp and chicken variety.  It was on the Specials board and sounded too interesting to pass up.  On a rare (I'm told) snowy night in Charlotte, this soup was the perfect way to start my meal.  Oh, accompanied of course with a delicious margarita, of course! For my main course I chose the mahi tacos with rice and beans.  It did not disppoint.  I was so full from the soup that I really didn't need to eat it all but I certainly did.   My co-diners were less than thrilled with their main entrees however one of them also thoroughly enjoyed the soup so it wasn't a total loss for them.  Overall the experiece was good for all and when they go back (sadly without me!) I am sure they will go back to their old favorites.   SInce I have been back, the restaurant has expanded and so combined with the snow, that meant that we did not have to wait for a table although that might not be the case on a normal Charlotte night.    Out of towners, I suggest you ask your hosts to take you there on your next visit!

fpxyfPG8leaucOVC7qSx2g.text: I only go here on NON gallery crawl nights...the fish tacos are perfection with mexi-slaw and a margarita   The staff is hip and attentive.  The only thing I wish I could change about this place is the corn salsa that comes with the chips.  Prices are excellent and I love the new addition!

6CA5QbE5Ascd7ZfxU-yKWw.text: Goto place for tacos in Charlotte!  My favorite is the Epic Tuna Burrito! Yum!!! Also love the neighborhood for wandering.  A great choice all around!

k66A_7yNq70aEYPB9MpaRQ.text: Heard of Cabo Fish Taco on  Triple D.   Since I had never been to the NoDa neighborhood, we went exploring.  The area is great and the food here was as promised...Delicious.  We had fried oysters with an amazing dip for an appetizer.  We will definitely be back.

N9WmUiJtWB7Ln4MUnjdE0Q.text: ok. fish burrito was decent, but definitey get the crab and shrimp dip

JWCa5-02XA3YIgrIAX9m3Q.text: This place really went down hill. The atmosphere is cool but that's about it. The food just doesn't seem fresh and it lacks flavor. It's surprising because the food used to be very good but the past 4 or 5 times has been just bad. Service has never been good but we never expected it in this place.

3kUecipWU_vaqWbrJS_e-A.text: Yes, I'm a fan. Ate lunch with a client there. The place was busy and that was enough to get his attention off the fact that I didn't take him to a "fine dining" (expensive) establishment.

Fqu4LYu9gcbM9Q2SllR2Qw.text: cabo fish taco was good.  i ordered the cabo fish taco, but wish i had been a little more adventurous.  the salsa that they bring out was very watery and hard to get on the chips.  as other people have commented, there was corn all over our table.  the CFT was good but needed more spice.  adding hot sauce helped quite a bit.  the prices at cabo fish taco were extremely reasonable and the atmosphere was fun.  the local art hanging on the walls was interesting to check out - as CFT is located in NODA.

jMqy7CPJ8hvgkRbD1RDnMQ.text: Great place to visit while in Charlotte. I saw it on "Diners, Drive-ins and Dives" so figured we'd give it a try, great choice!

T7w5ni7KjR07kLjnC_cOHA.text: I heard about Cabo Fish Taco from a friend who lives in the NoDa area. I was so excited because I absolutely love fish tacos. The first time I visited, I ordered the queso dip as an appetizer and the Cabo Fish Taco. The ingredients were fresh and the tortilla was delicious but there was nothing spectacular about the flavor profiles. I visited a second time and ordered the same dish to give it another shot and I was again left wanting more. The side dishes also leave something to be desired. I would be willing to visit again and try something new but definitely no time soon. It is also incredibly loud which is somewhat of a downer if you want to actually talk to your dinner companions.

1I8J7DkNjjs1gAcA_daZjw.text: Not only the best mexican in Charlotte, but the most fun place to eat it.  Chicken Quesadilla is awesome (I have ordered it as both an appetizer and entree in the same meal before, it is that good), colorful waitstaff, good margaritas and large selection of mexican beer at a good price.  A few months ago they had a waiter that looked and acted like captain Jack Sparrow and somehow pulled it off (although he kept calling me darling).  No reservations, be prepared to wait (only downside).  Skip the queso.  Fish taco is also solid.  Make sure you don't go on a gallery crawl night or it will be a 2+ hour wait.  Also, the hostess here is typically rude and the times they give are meaningless (we were told over two hours and called within 15 minutes) - I wish they would just take reservations or get a decent hostess)

9Opn-fE_vXBl0AMaQk-8jg.text: Great spot in the Noda area! The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. I definitely recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

FS65tXLfY8wfnkz0Ry5gWA.text: The food is very delicious. A little pricey for what you get. They need a bigger place because you wait a long time to get in

mPkYv-_HyFC_JEgvVjQYiA.text: I think Cabo is a great place to eat. If you are in the Noda area for a music venue, then please stop in at Cabo beforehand. They have great food and great Margerita's. They have a wide selection of Mexican food. The atmosphere is pretty hip, the food good. Its a bit crowded, but generally they move people through pretty fast. I usually get the Guacamole too!

qUf6RgZQp1rFTUh2GvQJOA.text: This place is highly overrated! Maybe I came on a bad night. My server was M.I.A most of the night.  The young lady who was seating people did more of his job. She kept bringing us refills and ended up bringing us our food because she noticed how slack he was. Also, the food was just OK.

6_aoQXJ9S0TSWMObN45cqw.text: The best thing we had here were buffalo calamari tacos that were actually a special. They are not on the normal menu, but omg they should be. SO GOOD. AHH. The jalapeno cheddar mashed potatoes are a seasonal side and they were great and tasted homemade. I also had a blackened mahi mahi fish taco that was underwhelming. The fish was pretty bland, I didn't taste any blackening seasoning. The mahi mahi is the only reason this isn't a 5 stars review. I will be back soon! Everything tasted homemade and fresh.

5g-RElPtnrsX1j3MK-LKKw.text: As a Charlotte resident for a little over six years, this place has pretty much been a go-to throughout this time. I'm surprised that I haven't gotten around to write a review about Cabo until now.  The place is pretty loud especially during peak times (Friday and Saturday nights) but it has a fun and funky vibe. If you plan to go during peak times, be prepared to wait. However, the plus sides are that they text you when your table is ready and there are a number shops and bars to stop in while you wait.  In my recent visits, the waitstaff has been SUPER friendly and accommodating. You automatically start off with a small-ish bowl of corn salsa and chips. Personally, I recommend getting one of their signature margaritas. I usually stick with the skinny margarita. As for the tacos, I'm a fan of the BBQ mahi mahi tacos with rice and beans. The rice and beans aren't the greatest but a sufficient enough side choice for myself.  If you are a fan of fish tacos and a laid back time, Cabo is a good choice!

XCTBtZXE69wZTwMpfmq9fQ.text: Went here after walking around NoDa a bit and it was recommended to me by a friend. I sat at the bar and the waitress was very nice. I ordered the chicken quesadilla and a corona. The quesadilla was amazing. Chicken was nice and juicy. Good price for the amount of food they give you. I've suggested this place to friends and family when they visit and they always have good things to say.

3E8MA2RqpnaGPNENMkxS0A.text: Have been by a few times since my last review, most recent being yesterday with improved experiences both times. The service has improved, the food is still great.  The host who favors Michael B. Jordan, and the server with a Bob Ross "Happy accidents" shirt were great. I don't feel compelled to give a higher rating yet. However, I'm not out of the game!

aYoGO6rtnOQd0Cmei4TyUA.text: I live in the neighborhood and dread when anyone wants to go here. I'm open to all sorts of establishments but Cabo has taken a dive over the years. I went last night as some friends from other areas that wanted to go.  Our service was terrible, the lady was nice but we sat there for 30 minutes trying to flag her down to order the food and our drink were all mixed up.  We order their cheese dip, that was cold and chunky with the blocks of unmelted gelatinous cheese.  The confusion continued when the food arrive and we all again did the shuffle at our table to obtain our correct orders. No one finished their food, as it all was cool or tepid at best.  The flavor was bland with the sharpe overwhelming taste of raw onions.  It took another 10 minutes to get the checks, while during this time we had even more time to enjoy the atmosphere and restaurant wild life.  As a mouse had decided to use this time to make its appearance. Which quickly turn an unsatisfactory visit in to a gut rolling thought of, "if there is a mouse in the dinning room, what does the kitchen look like".  We tried our best to leave post haste but we're still waiting on the bills. As to continue with the theme of the evening no one had the correct bill, once we had corrected this we all pay and left as soon as was possible.  To clarify further, we were sat at 7:10ish on Monday (2/11), there were five of us, most of whom have been in the restaurant industry for a number of years. The restaurant was on the low side of moderately filled for a Monday dinner service.

qqXDsLmd0pxHzdfGlKvA9A.text: Stopped here at lunch time and the food was great along with our service. The waiter was helpful when it came to describing items from the menu and we received our food in a decent time frame.

YS40-yYH5cKOj41k2CvHSg.text: A staple in NODA forever. Biz partner in town from Chicago- had to bring her here.  Margs are delicious.  Specials tonight are buffalo flounder and lemon pepper cod tacos. #phenomz

X84L0-hFzbNwYdcKhGVwEw.text: Whenever my wife and I go to a new city we like to try a couple of Guy Fieri's Diners Drive Ins and Dives.    We came here yesterday after arriving in Charlotte.  After taking our drink order we were given chips and salsa. It was a different salsa,  sweet corn,tomato and jalapeno which we enjoyed.  For the entrees the Mrs. had the Carne Asada tacos and I had the Tavarua Wahoo tacos (tuna was substituted for the wahoo). As our normal procedure we always share our order.  The wahoo had a bit of a kick from the honey wasabi sauce.  The Carne Asada was tender and milder with a roasted tomato sauce.   This is a definitely a divey place,  with eclectic artwork from local artists on the walls. They also serve local craft beers which I didn't have an opportunity to try. Maybe next time when I am in town. :)

1HyV_zm08EKvv-Cx63gk8Q.text: Delicious food! I find it refreshing that they add a fair amount of Spice to their standard dishes. I had the BBQ Mahi taco and it was a home run!!! Great work!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Next level BBQ Mahi taco and Guacamole pasta salad.

zTyzQpLSRs75UNdHp9NlFg.text: A bunch of us were visiting a friend of ours in Charlotte this past weekend and we came here twice, since it's my friends go-to spot!  Being vegetarian, I was a bit skeptical due to the name of the restaurant and I didn't want their random veggie option that they throw on the menu to accommodate the non-meat eaters and typically would just be a crappy taco with some veggies.  However, I glanced at their menu and other Yelp reviews on our drive over, and I was thoroughly impressed with the amount of vegetarian options they had - burrito, fajitas, and a couple of tacos.  They also weren't 'cookie-cutter' and seemed innovative and tasty.  This place is HUGE.  It's (I believe) in an up-&-coming neighborhood of NoDa, and there is new construction being built left and right.  There's tables all over the place in the massive space, with a small bar in the back center.  Off to the side, there's another room with tables/booths, and a small, covered patio for outdoor seating.  Both times we went, we sat on the outdoor patio as the ceiling helps with the heat.  The only knock is that they may not have all their beers on tap - when a few of us came on Friday for lunch, my friend ordered three different beers, and each time, the bartender told us that they were out.  Being from Philly/New York, I have to say the service was impeccable.  Everyone is super nice and friendly, but I also guess that's the norm down here.  Our waitress, both experiences, came to our table to check up on us often.  Onto the food...they start you off with some chips and fresh, homemade salsa with diced tomatoes, cut onions, and corn.  It was simple, and refreshing...they even threw in some black pepper to give it a little kick.  They also keep refilling them for you, which is a blessing and a curse.  For my meal, I got the beer-battered tofu tacos on Friday and the sweet thai chili tofu tacos on Sunday.  Both were delicious and packed with crispy, fried tofu chunks.  If I had to pick, I'd lean towards the sweet thai chili as they packed a more flavorful punch.  The beer-battered ones were a bit dry, as I head to drench cholula into it to make the flavor profile stand out because the white ranchero sauce wasn't doing a whole lot.  They come in a crispy, chalupa-like shell, which is great because most veggie tacos are runny and break apart easily as the liquids from the veggies get all over the place.  However, these stayed in tact and gave it a nice crunch to it.  I must warn you - they put A LOT of tofu in it.  I don't know if they're trying to make up for the fact that it's vegetarian, but I easily took out at least 3-4 pieces of tofu in each taco so I could eat it easily.  Overall, a solid place, and can definitely see why they're always packed for lunch and dinner.  My friends who eat meat loved their dishes - whether it was the mahi mahi tacos, the carne asada, or the shrimp.

NU7ay1Yc5OuOI1fB--Edrw.text: I have been to Cabo many times but this time I went with something different. I got the diablo shrimp with pineapple. It was really good less spicy than expected but it had a great bbq sauce on it. The shrimp were over a delicious salad that was fresh with a balsamic dressing. The dressing was good but not really needed with the sauce of the shrimp. I would have never thought of this place to have light options but it was a great choice for a variety of options.

xh_4ein9eLLeXMYSo37KgQ.text: I've been here a couple of times and it does not disappoint. i've had the mahi, salmon, carne asada and fried shrimp tacos in separate visits. All were great and so fresh! The one side i cannot get enough of and venture to try other sides is the avocado pasta salad. It's so delicious and has the right kick! Nothing beats it, and it's probably one of my favorite side dishes, ever!!!

9-cFRGNA7MbWncipi0LmyQ.text: Decided to eat at this restaurant since it was featured on Guy's Diners, Drive- ins, and Dives. We went on a Friday night thinking we'd have to wait but were surprised to find no wait and a simply smooth, and enjoyable experience. Our waiter was very nice and helpful. I got the Sweet Thai chili tofu tacos with the tofu grilled instead of fried in beer batter. For my side I chose the avocado pasta. My husband had the grilled salmon tacos with refried beans as his side. All of their sides are vegetarian. I LOVED his tacos. Definitely felt it tasted better than mine although mine was decent.  You can park on the street. We were roaming through Noda where everything is walking distance so this was the perfect spot to eat.  I'm so glad we came here and recommend it to anyone visiting!

Kb2l9_0Ngn6CHTQnKDNn4w.text: What can I say?  The tacos are really good.  The mahi tacos I had were spot on.  Very well cooked, decently but not over seasoned.  I started with the crab dip which was great.  Loved the texture and the little bread it comes with. Decor wise, it's a very NoDa artsy and welcoming vibe.  Will definitely go back again!!

Gc9IMJJSuRR3meCIAZYwYQ.text: Been hearing about this place since I moved to Charlotte but anytime I go it's a long wait...so I leave. But finally I have arrived and there's no wait. It's a Saturday at 12:45. Who knew??? Brunch time seated immediately. I think we made the last three available tables. Thank goodness because the food was exceptional, the drinks were toxic, the staff was helpful and the ambiance was a typical Saturday, busy morning. Loved every bit of it. My Baja Bowl was so pretty and I had two people order the same thing based on my choice. A great one I might add. Also this restaurant is in a great location. Who doesn't love NODA!!!!!!(that was a statement)

zX_fycH8yR_PE-5sW8Xkow.text: My husband and I have been working our way through the Diners, Drives-Ins, and Dives featured restaurants, albeit slowly.  Today we dropped off our girl at Pit Road Bar & Grill (another interesting DDD featured choice... an indoor go-cart place) for a birthday party and hightailed it to Cabo Fish Taco in NoDa.    I scanned the Yelp reviews on the way and noticed a trend.  Get the BBQ tilapa taco, get the tuna tilapia, get the crab dip appetizer, get Michelle as your server.  Since her birthday party was early in the day we stopped in around 11:45 am on a Saturday.  Parking was light and we found a great street spot with no problem.  Walked in to rather snippy hostess who walked us to a miniature table for two (I mention this because every single other couple was seated at a table for four).    Everything changed then because we got...Michelle...as our server.  I got stitches in my hand recently and what was a crappy doctor visit became good because the the PA who stitched me up was awesome.  Same thing here... if you go to CFT, you want Michelle, she's awesome.  I listened to the other servers making their presentations, but they just weren't the same.  She knows her stuff and has personality, to boot.  I like to tell servers when it's my first visit.  Yes, I've done my homework online first.  Yes, I generally know my order.  But I care about their opinion.  Michelle's face brightened up when I said it was our first visit and she walked us through the menu.  Interestingly, it generally mimicked what I found on here from the reviewers.  Get the tacos, she said, for your first time.  Get the BBQ mahi mahi, get the wasabi tuna.  Get the crab dip starter.  Ok, then, sounds perfect.  My husband, who loves to challenge me to see if he can order the best meal when we go out orders the wasabi tuna (avarua (Tav-A-Roo) Tuna Tacos $11.50 Blackened lemon rubbed tuna in a kiwi-pineapple fajita sauce, stuffed with lettuce, tomato, mixed cheeses & topped with our honey wasabi sauce.) OMG.  He wins. He so freakin wins.  For $12.95 you can mix and match two tacos.  So I, following Yelp reviewers, order 1 Tilapia taco (Grilled mango BBQ mahi-mahi tacos stuffed with cabo slaw, tomato, avocado, mixed cheeses & finished with our cilantro white sauce.) and 1 Carne Asada taco (Grilled steak sauteed in a roasted red tomato sauce with peppers & onions, stuffed with lettuce, tomato & mixed cheeses.)  They were both good, very good.  But Todd still wins.    The tuna tacos are AMAZING.  He got medium which was a smidgey pink in the middle.  The tilapia, which reviewers seemed to love the most, was fine. I won't get it again.  I preferred the carne asada but wasn't fond of he peppers and onions.  All tacos are fork and knife.  No need to pick up.  They are overfilled and waaaaaay more than needed for lunch.  Since I love restaurant leftovers, this was a plus for me and a plus for my wallet.  The crab dip turned out to be crab and shrimp dip with outrageous deep-fried pita corners that had just come out of the fryer.  I commented on how bad they were for me and then ate about 1000 of them. It came out just minutes after ordering, piping hot, with a very, very generous serving amount, we took this home, too.    We were given a fresh salsa and chips upon being seated, a combination of roasted corn, tomatoes and scant seasoning.  I'd recommend ordering an appetizer because the chips were the bagged chip variety, cold, and the salsa extremely bland.  For sides, we got the refried beans (yummy) and the seasonal side which was jalapeno mashed potatoes.  They had some real kick to them so be prepared.  They were cold though so I wasn't really a fan.  Have you ever gone to bed thinking about your meal and your leftovers waiting in the fridge?  I went up to do ironing and then eventually gave in to come back down to snack because I wanted the crab dip and Todd's wasabi tuna tacos.  Obsessively so. This is a big rave.  I'm going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tavarua Tuna Tacos $11.50Blackened lemon rubbed tuna in a kiwi-pineapple fajita sauce, lettuce, tomato, cheese, honey wasabi sauce.  A+!
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jalapeno mashed potatoes.  Eh.  It came out cold.
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ Mahi Tacos $11.25 Grilled mango BBQ mahi-mahi tacos stuffed with cabo slaw, tomato, avocado, mixed cheeses, cilantro white sauce.

URcixLKWmEFxHaaT0GNexA.text: My friends in Charlotte raved about Cabo Fish Tacos and finally got a chance to try and boy was I surprised how good it was! It's really large and loud inside, and parking was hard to find so we had to pay for a spot nearby.   Although I had been on a taco kick the past few days before, I knew I had to try their staple. Our server was super sweet, wish I caught her name, and helped me choose my tacos. Originally I was leaning towards the fried tacos because fried food is always better, but she told me her favorites were the lemon grilled shrimp tacos and the honey soy glazed salmon tacos. I was hesitant about the sauces, so she said they would be on the side. You also get a choice of a side and I went with the spicy avocado pasta salad. I was hungry.  We munched on the chips and really yummy corn salsa and my glass of wine was delicious as well. When our food came out, the tacos were larger than I had imagined. Unfortunately they forgot to put the sauce on the side, but I liked them both!  The salmon was my absolute favorite, fish was cooked perfectly and the sauce was superb. The lemon shrimp were tasty as well, and all the trimmings inside the taco were a perfect combo. The avocado pasta salad reminded me of a pesto pasta but it was really good. I demolished my entire meal to the last bite!  Will be back if I'm ever back in the area! Very reasonably priced for the amount of food you get!

pM_HYYQ6_e1KH9Ahg1cV6Q.text: Cabo! You blessed my belly yet again! Tonight I enjoyed two delightful vegan options. She said they could create me a grilled veggie taco with no cheese. So I told her I would do the choose two with the tofu taco, and black beans and rice. Cool location in the heart of NODA. Food is consistently spectacular.

ZmuTqnZQDxeKFsTRcmMN8Q.text: Solid line up of fish tacos and burritos. I like the specials a lot too...  But the shrimp and chicken burrito is one of my favs... I'll snap pics soon.

MOZQHSiKrPtcJPFjkEc5og.text: Too loud, too crazy to get into from parking and walking in the dark road- had an issue with a gift card.  The amount purchased wasn't on it when my parents went to use it (I'd failed to keep the receipt...).  Fish tacos are good here tho... I just don't trust the process of getting in & out with kids.

kX1NXqKNIeWEzBD-yfzTCA.text: Thought I should update my review since it's been over a year. Came here with a party of 6 and was told it was gonna be an hour and a half. To our surprise we only waited about 45 mins! I was excited! We sat in the covered patio area. It was warm but very loud.   Our server was super sweet and attentive. Everyone got tacos and they were all satisfied with it. I got the grilled salmon taco and carne asada taco. Both delicious and fresh!! Filled with toppings!! I got the avocado spicy pasta salad which I highly recommend. Bursting with flavor and just perfect. I could of honestly just eaten that and be happy.   We didn't have any issues with parking. The only thing I don't like about this place is that there is two bathrooms total for men and women to share. I had to wait in line with 4 people in front of me.

Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon taco and carne Asada taco with avocado spicy pasta salad-highly recommend for all

kWTV25BFAdsL7eplbYmaPQ.text: I am not exaggerating when I said this was the best tacos I have ever had. The only reason I did not give it five stars is because its a really casual restaurant so the atmosphere isn't five star. But more importantly- the food! The salsa was great but the tacos!!! The drinks were big/strong & tasty. Literally everything you need in a Mexican restaurant in the coolest neighborhood- definitely have to check this place out! App: $5 Entree: $12 Large cocktail: $10 Total w/ tip $35

SSqQ9eN8d8F2txtCYH5CJQ.text: I love love love Cabo!!! Always fresh and always fast. My favorite is the grab dip and lemon shrimp tacos. I tried salmon my last visit and loved it.

zkrqLXNSVf2XaAE49Tlxwg.text: One of my favorite taco spots in North Carolina! The restaurant I nestled in a nice neighborhood on N Davidson Street. The service was excellent with our waitress being very attentive, especially for lunch hour during a work day. We ordered the crab dip as an appetizer and it was really good and came with so many toasted pitas we couldn't even finish it. We ordered a honey soy glazed salmon taco and a bbq mahi mahi taco. Some of the best tacos I have had! The sauce was nicely drizzled and the portion was perfect. The tacos also came with sides of avocado salad and chickpeas which complimented the main dishes well. Would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone in the Charlotte area!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab Dip
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ Mahi Mahi Fish Taco
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Honey Glazed Soy Salmon Fish Taco

rDQwgS-MV9Tp74y5E34FJQ.text: YUM! Located in NoDa, parking can be a drag but if you're patient, you'll get a good spot. There are quite a few eating places in the area and it's just a great area of Charlotte to hang out.  The table salsa had just the right amount of heat. I love spicy so it didn't bother me one bit. But why did we order the crab dip? BEING GREEDY! It was so amazing...I mean, you want to fill up your bathtub and lather it all over your body AMAZING! And those pitas they serve with it...just order it and thank me later. I'd drive from the University City area just to have that dip.  I had one of the TAVARUA tacos and the Sweet Thai chili tofu taco. Loved them both, especially the tofu because it was crisp and yummy, I just wish there was more heat in the sauce, but that's just me. The tavarua taco was really good as well. I'm thinking they may have left the wasabi off of mine because I didn't taste it at all. Next time I'll be sure to ask for it on the side.  Our server was really very nice. We shall return.

K4m01i8H5z6egLWNF_RllA.text: Great place in Noda! I loved how they texted you when your table was ready so you could walk around into the shops. The waitstaff was great and the tacos were to die for! Our waitress thanked us for being awesome, not something you hear at most places.

2dmxlbI8KciPY1q6dWn1Gg.text: This was my first time at Cabo Fish Taco. I loved the food! I ordered the shrimp and chicken burrito which was good. (The rice in the burrito was too soft and became mushy.) This is a fun spot to eat and enjoy drinks. I wouldn't recommend this place for anyone looking for a peaceful, family style restaurant. It was very loud. I will be coming back soon!

QcddcsodfyitzTO491sB1Q.text: Very interesting concept. Good fish tacos for this Cal-Mex place. While it wasn't in the menu, they were able to serve me a Michelada w my tacos.

DBOiQhkx7UEl7H43vuzLSA.text: Diners, Drive in and Dives! A must try place! So we trekked out after work yesterday. I love the location, Love the style, people and atmosphere. The place was packed! Everyone seemed to be having a great time and the vibe was hip and cool!  Service was a little slow! Chips were average and not fresh, Salsa was nothing much to speak of a bit of a disappointment.  I had three taco's Mahi, Shrimp Tara something..... all were good Tara was #1 Shrimp was #2 and Mahi was #3. Mashed Potatoes were forgettable

2261-bBcYed0YBhuTHC7gg.text: Love this place! Their mojitos and tacos are to die for. The ambience of the restaurant is great as well. This is one of our favorite restaurants in Charlotte.

6VV3Q6PZLsEpFK15TQJeWQ.text: You will probably have the best taco of your life right here at Cabo fish taco. And holy cow, the corn salsa?! I cried when we left our take-home order of salsa on the table once. Everything I've tried here was superb. Go for the upcharge and order the queso. It's worth it. Trust me.

jQudugAdaQtLDNHnN71WwA.text: This was the second time in a row that I was sadly disappointed in Cabo Fish Taco. First, I had the Mahi  taco and it is was so fishy to the point I couldn't eat it. I wanted to try Cabo again, as I thought it could have been a one time event type situation. Last night I got tuna tacos and again it was so fishy I couldn't even eat it. This tells me the fish Cabo gets is old...  I will never return and will not recommend to anyone.

Q2R57rpUOSnPmQBroRXqcQ.text: Cabo Fish Taco fails us again.  Been here many times now and the service never impresses. It was so loud in the restaurant we could hardly have a conversation at the table  I ordered the chicken and shrimp burrito. It was great tasting and accurate. BUT! We also ordered fish tacos and not to my surprise it came out with shrimp on it. I don't know where the gap in communication is with this restaurant, something is always askew. The many times I have gone they have given me the wrong food. It's a shame the service is so poor because the food is delicious. I can't say that I'll return again soon to find out if this is a fluke or your norm.

7EysY3MKz9CcED00MEZhUQ.text: The atmosphere is relaxed, the food is great, the service is family friendly... grab your drink and eat outside, you've made your day go from "I wish it were Friday to tis feels like a Friday" when you reach the bottom of your margarita glass.

U8zn1nLUg0VImKi2qUYmJA.text: Had a lunch date at cabo fish and enjoyed out good I been here back to back in the last two week. Waiters are always super nice and hippy which I love. The cranes asada taco were great meat was a little tough but still well flavored, this place is awesome in the summer when the nods area have live bands ...

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

lUbq1GoISjHYG_JT1Xq4FA.text: I try to make an effort to come to this place once a year. All though I live three hours away!! Tacos are on point.

aGKIX3GV_DoaBHfDyXKd7Q.text: This used to be my favorite restaurant in town but something changed last summer and it's just not as good.  Tacos were greasy and gauc was not fresh.  When I complained the waitress told me it's not made in house which is a shame.  Margaritas just OK, nothing special.

bujTFdgkHzLa-Ad7g6Y_ew.text: Well the tacos at Cabo are delicious! I got the special terriyaki seabass tacos and the steak tacos and both were awesome. There were tons of taco options and the prices were very reasonable.   My only complaint was the sound level- it was so loud inside that when we left, my throat hurt from yelling at my friends during dinner. The music was up so loud that, as patrons, we had no option but to talk louder to hear eachother. Even the waitress had trouble hearing us to take our order.

4u9txuIITyHbsZWPHylQqg.text: I've tried beer battered fish, steak, chili tofu... They're OK.  I don't care for their salsa and the guacamole seems like it may be from a tub. The margaritas are good but not strong. So it's the sweet and tangy BBQ mahi mahi tacos that keep me coming back. I really love those tacos and the mexi slaw. It's really all I ever order. Those two items alone are five stars in my book. Everything else is a so-so 3. I just split the difference and gave them a 4.

MeZKzr7_EDC8biAGgCZfHA.text: Great Food and Atmosphere!! Located in a very eclected neighborhood with lots of interest.  We only had a 20 minute wait on a mid day Saturday afternoon for a table for four in what appeared to a crowded fan favored restaurant. My nephew who lives in Charlotte had been there once before. He thought it was a good place to try as one of my Food Network featured Charlotte restaurant locations.  Cabo Fish Taco didn't disappoint! The server was very pleasant and steered us in the right food direction with our food choices. We had the Crab & Shrimp Dip, BBQ Mahi Mahi Fish Tacos, Lemon Grilled Shrimp Tacos, Chicken Quesadillas and Southside Chicken Wrap Burrito. We ordered the "Bannas Foster Cheescake (just okay) and Peanut Butter Chocolate Mousse Cake" (a better choice) desserts to go, but ended up eating them there!  We all were pleased with our selections, especially the warm "Crab & Shrimp Dip" appeitizer (featured on the FN episode) freshly made pita toast points. The "BBQ Mahi Mahi" Fish Tacos (also featured on the FN episode) was our favorite entree of them all. The free salas (Chopped Tomato, Corn and Cilantro) was a refreshing change compare to other table side Mexican salas.  If ever in Charlotte, NC again, I would make a track over to this place no doubt!!

XtEcqmD6aYh-Weci--XfHg.text: Love the tacos and customer service! Chips are stale :/ for some reason every time I've gone, someone has over cooked the chips or they taste like they've been sitting out for a day.

dj6tbe_4uCiA_3pkBoG_6g.text: My husband and I came here around 4 on a Saturday afternoon after spending a couple of hours at the Dog Bar. We were pretty hungry although it was not quite yet dinner time, so we just wanted something to nosh on.   We decided to go here after all the rave reviews we had from friends. We were immediately seated and our drink orders taken. We decided to split the queso and a chicken quesadilla. Our waitress (as listed per the receipt) was JWOO. She was spunky with piercings and was perfect. She was quick and even asked the kitchen to split the quesadilla between 2 plates since we were splitting (that goes a long way).   The food was excellent, although I think the queso is meant to be taken down in 5 minutes, because once it starts cooling off it can get a bit hard.   Overall we had a great time and will be back, especially if going to Dog Bar.

0-RlZCCTeIsxDHedBXmI5A.text: Excellent experience. Food out in a timely manner, our server checked on us several times and then other wait staff checked on us several times.

5K7FuS2tCaKL8hPsDT78Iw.text: Frozen guacamole. It may have been fresh at one point, but not when we got it, had ice crystals. Unappetizing. Odd presentation too, was it scooped with a disher like lunch lady mashed potatoes.   Tacos were fine. Not remarkable.   This place would not survive on the west coast.

YyuaxlKjByWKBu7D_KzU2A.text: Disappointing. First visit was a little under a year ago. Received fresh, cooked to order, good tacos.  A week ago, I went in for a to-go order, and received it too quickly, less than 5 minutes. I knew that it wasn't fresh. Tortillas were rubbery as if they'd been microwaved. Fish batter was soggy, again, microwaved. Sad that a restaurant would start off with a bang, then skate by on reputation. It won't last at this rate, and it shouldn't.

vOKgMvjIHc0g0jXbmRr1Bg.text: We saw that "Cabo Fish Taco" in Charlotte, NC was on the Food Network so we decided to check it out.  I ordered the Mahi BBQ Taco and it was very good.  Filling delicious flavor.  I really liked the taco shell.  Everything about it was delicious.  My side was the vegetable medley and it looked and tasted old.  It was not steamed recently or if it was it sat for a while.     I also got a the Tavarua Tuna Tacos which I was not happy with.  Dont get me wrong I love me some Tuna.. I love fresh sushi, grilled tuna (salt & pepper), and even tuna fish holds a special place in my heart.  The Tuna from Cabo Fish Taco really tasted off.  I was really disappointed since I though this was going to be the highlight of my dinner.  It was very fishy tasting so much so that I did not finish the Tuna.    My friend John got the Lemon Grilled Shrimp Tacos and was not happy.  I tried the shrimp and it did not taste fresh.  Very Bland...   The salsa that is brought to the table was refreshing and had a good amount of corn in it.  We really enjoyed it.    Overall a decent restaurant but the management may want to taste the seafood without all the sauces on it.  If it doesn't taste fresh all on its own its not going to taste fresh mixed in a taco.

nZA4p_A_XgHrAglReRcaqA.text: Fish tacos were mediocre and had BBQ sauce!? Most disappointing taco place I've ever been to, especially since everybody had nothing but wonderful things to say. I don't know what the reviews are like for Bakersfield but the tacos are 10x better, along with the atmosphere and crowd.

zj0VHwakzHqSQhGIFpwXyQ.text: I CANNOT believe this place was featured on diners, drive-ins, and dives. HOLY SHIT. That may have been like a decade ago cause this place sucks now. First, the nachos were soggy. I have never ever had soggy nachos at any restaurant before, so that really disgusted me, especially since both our baskets of nachos had soggy nachos! Second, the water tasted disgusting. Third, the rice had a horrible aftertaste. Fourth, I got beer battered shrimp and fish, to be safe, and it was nasty. I was so hungry and literally I just stopped eating because of how disgusted I was. Finally, the guacamole was disgusting and unnatural. It look like it was scooped out of a jar and place on a plate. Furthermore, a child with my party found a hard substance in her food and just gave up eating, a child was disgusted. Also, I don't have to ask for lemon/limes when I get seafood, that should come with the seafood. Like salt with pepper, common sense. I tried to eat the fish and shrimp without lemon and it was nasty. The only good thing about this place is that the woman's bathroom was super clean. The cleanliness of the bathroom is what warned this place one star. The tables were dirty, so that sucks that the bathroom was wayyyy cleaner than the tables lol.

IdHY35Ibyo1mWJupH6vjZg.text: This place has good service and have came here over the years . Came here today for my 30th. NOT THE SAME PLACE !! The food just wasn't good . All tacos my husband and I got were cold, very cold and the chips were stale. Get it together Cabo... word is starting to get out !!

y_gF63MGSZAnQmVczmzYYg.text: Most amazingly delicious place to eat! Friendly service. One of our favorite go to places when we visit the Charlotte area. I got their chicken quesadea and it was perfect! Servings are generous and prices reasonable! You may have a wait at this place but we'll worth it! Love to eat here!  This is a gotta try for anyone who visits or lives in Charlotte, NC.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

VYS5zKeo3y_O-B6UVmQ-rQ.text: Went to Cabo for the first time and really enjoyed it. As soon as we were seated we received a bowl of corn and tomato salsa with tortilla chips.  Next we ordered a side of queso, which was delicious.  More flavor than your typical white queso, very good, especially when we mixed a bit of the corn salsa with it.  Next was the task of figuring out what to order for dinner and because it was our first time we didn't know quite what to order.  Tacos and quesadillas are cool, but we came here to try something new.  So we relied on a recommendation from the waiter.. the Baja Bowl with soy glazed salmon and honey wasabi sauce on the side... YUM!! That was a great choice.  The manager was really cool, she came and checked on us twice just to make sure we were enjoying everything, and we did!  Next time i'll have to try the Rasta Pasta.

_FQOnq1Jn7epRvYrot1rRQ.text: This place has THE BEST tuna tacos! My boyfriend and I stopped in last week for tacos and cocktails, and both of us were completely blown away with their tuna tacos! Everything we have ever tried here has been amazing! The service is really hit or miss though...half of the times the service has been fantastic, the other half of the times we have gotten stuck with a server that slowly mopes around and looks like they would rather be anywhere but there.  I give it four stars because the food is just so darn good, but the inconsistency in service is really frustrating.

Sflr253SQC02FiHLbmVJFQ.text: Delicious! Fantastic, fresh flavors and friendly, fast service. We tried 5 different types of tacos and they were all to die for! We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beer Battered Fish Tacos made patriotic for the 4th of July with spicy avocado pasta salad
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blakened fish tacos with spicy avocado pasta salad made patriotic for the 4th of July!

aU3Ihm3cz4WgoM_lp_xsHQ.text: All i can say wow!!  Best taco ever had. Beautifull Ambience, nice music. Servers are very attentive. Loved it

-7sisxim4JmwBTWsAKnzzA.text: The Baja shrimp and crab dip is delicious!! The tacos were amazing as well! I will def be back here soon! The atmosphere is really cool!

eU2f6mBYo4M0ycPXTGjoAg.text: The service (to a point) and the food is great. It was VERY disappointing when the server cashed out to tell us that the bartender would take care of our order. Then two server/employees walked past to remind us that "the time is correct" in shouting voices as they passed our table. The last I checked, our "NJ" server and our table was respectable of a $200+ tab.  Go past 8:30 on a weeknight and service goes to a 1+. Food is phenomenal. Service before cash out - great! After that...double negative.

TKxraeKdwiSMMCZk9-7Dww.text: Service and food excellence is rare and Cabo nailed it. Had the Chef special that was a twist on an excellent tasting swordfish with complementing tastes of a mango salsa and avocado amongst other toppings. Service was quick with all questions answered. All in all, one of the best places I have eaten at.

qnPOHbPdiOJeumKQ8V-COg.text: I will start with the "good". We had an amazing server and our cocktails were good. I took some family here that are visiting and the food was not good. Our chips were stale, the corn salsa wasn't good. We ordered a side of guacamole and we got something out of a package with some chopped onion thrown on top and no flavor. The food was overpriced and horrible

2yERWQD2eA-6NwF4MtsSYA.text: Saw this place was on diners, drive-ins, and dives and did not disappoint.  Had shrimp tacos and BBQ mahi tacos both excelllent.

b3BPs6k8HuJ3-rVBKUMxuQ.text: I would have taken away a star because there is absolutely no parking but the food made up for it. I got the bbq Mahi tacos. The portion size was huge! The tacos were overflowing with yummy. The avacado side  pasta was creamy and spicy. My taste buds were very satisfied. I couldn't believe how fast my food came out too. I'm talking 5mins! I wish this place wasn't surrounded by gravel lots that are pay to park.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bbq Mahi tacos!

5wpefmLL2k4hgjYPTsf66Q.text: All I can say is wow. Blackened mahi tacos made me come back a second day in a row. Now that the blue line extension runs through Noda I'll be going a lot more.

pHYNVvT-oF-rMw9BEiYWQg.text: No trip to Charlotte would be complete without a stop at CFT. We love the Tuna Tavaroo tacos. We mixed it up and tried the Jerk Swordfish with blackberry and pineapple salsa. Wow! Another new favorite!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

fBpNnOLurzhcWyKcXKeFzA.text: i did not like the rice. my friend liked neither the rice nor the beans. refried, to be specific. other than that it was a good time. a restaurant should be judged by its rice, and this just did not meet my standards. i probably won't be returning unless this issue is addressed.

xIkWNq3bEFrOzdL3NYAprw.text: Good margaritas, tacos were decent. But most of the other things we ordered were under seasoned

StjRMKX02Gaf5rYyi8Sn_A.text: A friend and I decided to check this place out, though I had been once before, it was new for him. The service was great, and recommendations were made for us. I was disappointed with the guacamole considering it was $9, so I expected it to be fresher. The tacos were good, but that's all they were, "good." The only reason I leave 4 stars is because our server really did improve our experience. So, great service, mediocre food.

O5vZVnsxbjhKgYbTCFcK7w.text: I genuinely love coming here every time I can make it to Charlotte.  The restaurant is nestled squarely in an eclectic and laid-back arts district on the outskirts of Charlotte proper.  Their beer selection is always one of the best in the area and they always feature local and NC breweries. No-Da and Birdsong brewing are just a few blocks away from Cabo.   Their menu selections area always packed with a wide variety of fish tacos, burritos and their new tortilla cornucopia bowl. Some excellent flavor combinations that will appease your fish taco cravings. The staff is always pleasant to talk with and the bartenders very knowledgeable about the beer selections on tap. Don't skip this place if you're on the East side of Charlotte.

UfraEvA8ccw5JcVWfVmURA.text: Cabo fish taco is the best restaurant in NODA. We go here probably once a month and the food has never disappointed. They bring out a basket of corn/tomato salsa and chips for everyone. It is a bit difficult to eat but I love the corn in this. My favorite restaurant salsa! The grilled Serrano chicken tacos are my go-to. Last time I went they were so big I couldn't even finish them. The white sauce is the best, I always order an extra side of it. The mashers (mashed potatoes) are great. They are obviously made from scratch and are some of the best I've ever had. The El Cheapo is a great basic margarita. Highly recommend Cabo, great value and great food!

yBbLB9Eg0Q5W-8_6K7B4dA.text: We met a fee friends here for lunch,  it was the first time we ventured into what's called "NODA", glad I brought my concealed weapon,  just kidding,  it is a very artsy area with some cool places to go.  Cabo Fish Taco was a very nice little food joint with some really interesting entrees.   It was a while ago but I remember enjoying the food and sitting and being able to see the view of the neighborhood as well.  Service was relatively quick and tentative.   Definitely recommend checking it out if your in the NODA zone.  Felt a little like Greenwich Village,  NY.

c_Zz4EzOycBbBXKHDvVbmQ.text: Can't wait to go back for the tacos. I'm sure they are all amazing. The only ones I tried were the bbq mahi and the grilled lemon chicken and shrimp tacos. Amazing. Just amazing. I will try more when i go back. The drinks were not consistent.  I had an amazing margarita (the original) and then my 2nd was bad, sent it back, returned less than great. Nothing like the first one that was made. And this was the same bartender. Oh well. Next time I'll get beer, that's always reliable. The guac was good but a little salty. The corn salsa that's on the table was hands down the best!!! I filled up mostly on that. So yummy. Prices overall were not bad so I will go back for the tacos. The rating is 100% on the tacos. Without the tacos and corn salsa, this place would get 2 stars...that's how good those 2 items are.

rdyqXqB5xvEfGYtMLPiMJA.text: This place started out as a 3-star for me and frankly I didn't understand why it was so damn popular.  The service was always really good, and they are on point with the refilling beverages and the chips and the checking up on you.  But the food was just average to me.  After my last experience there, I can now say that it was a "me problem!"  I just didn't order the right thing.   I finally tried the tacos rather than going the burrito or wrap route.  The tacos, my friends, are legit.  I got the tuna taco with the wasabi honey sauce and the tofu taco with Thai chili.  Boo yah!  They were both tasty, with an edge to the tuna.    Now I see why people wait an hour and a half on the weekend to eat here.  Just be prepared to experience that wait.  And when you finally get seated, order tacos!

ac3k-kGYpDsOhzuoje2__A.text: I don't get why this place comes so highly recommended. This is not authentic food. The pico was the worst I've had in ages. I had the carne asada burrito, which was okay, but lacked any True flavors. The "salsa" they serve on the table is absolutely disgusting... the shrimp tacos were probably the most decent thing we had, but again lacked flavor. They need to work on their side items. Rice was dry and crunchy. Pasta tastes like paste. Guacamole tastes like grocery store guac. Their beans were too mushy. Service was spotty, and she was not that friendly or helpful. And for all of that awful - it was suuuuuper over priced.   This place did not live up to its reputation and I will not be one of the crazies who recommend it.

Z8DT52gWdoYRalpFhrOSyw.text: We have been back multiple times since this occurred and have nothing but good things to say.   Always recommend it to friends and suggest the barbecue mahi tacos. He guacamole is fantastic too with bits of jalapeno on top.

-xeUFpB1KXHEaYar6aS9Og.text: Lemon Ahi Tuna Tacos!  That's all I'm saying!  Okay, I'll say more or they won't add the review. Everything we have had here is good. Hip area of Noda. Their chips and salsa could use a serious overhaul though.

hCS1XMWFb1QpsoyzuQxvNw.text: READ THIS FIRST! Review from one who disliked cabo fish taco.   Entires ordered:  - blackened chicken quesadilla;  - epic tuna burrito;  - blackened mahi mahi tacos;  - blackened grilled amberjack tacos (on special)  This is my second visit to this restaurant, previously I would haven given this -1/2 star.   Chips and salsa:  the other 3 in the party loved the salsa, it is a corn/tomato salsa. Personally, I am not a fan of this type of salsa, I like the traditional kind so I'm not able to provide an unbiased review. The chips have a stale texture, this is consistent from both visits, this may be just how the chips are supposed to be. Not a fan personally here either.   Entrees:  Blackened chicken quesadilla (mine) - not your standard quesadilla, not overloaded with cheese. Good balance of chicken-to-cheese ratio. The blackening is second to none, this was an pleasant surprise and delivered a very nice kick. Onions and peppers were good, not too much, just the right amount. I don't eat seafood, that's why I didn't get a "fish taco."   Epic tuna burrito- very good, comparable in quality/flavor of fresh California fish (according to the diner)  Blackened mahi tacos- delicious.   Blackened amberjack - the diner went on and on about these, refused to try anything else because she didn't want to "ruin her palate." (Tad dramatic if you ask me, but what do I know).   My review rating is based upon my entree and the opinions voiced by my cohorts. They truly loved everything (although they did share my feelings on the "stale chips").   My original experience was terrible, I don't remember what I had exactly but it was bad enough that I successfully boycotted this place 3 years. However, after the blackened chicken quesadilla, I will be willing to return.   Also, one had a Bloody Mary (on special) and said it was "delicious."   Note: parking is a real pain, just be prepared for that.

-DmoAkp39BkYeWUaHVjZRA.text: Good, but definitely not as good as it used to be.  Eleven dollars for two small tacos with hardly any fish or shrimp in either of them but way too much cilantro, plus a small side of beans of rice.  All of our flour taco shells were so chewy that we could barely eat them.  Give customers a choice because flour does NOT taste better, plus there's that whole gluten-free craze.  Draft beers were very pricey for a restaurant.  Not in much of a hurry to go back.  The food is fresh though,which is whey they barely earn three stars.

TV9ylmckCcGxXaObzly9DQ.text: Have to try the BBQ Mahi tacos! So good, love this place! Only problem is that it's extremely loud inside. The music playing is way too loud which causes everyone to talk loud and you can't hear anything inside that place. We always request a seat outside because of the noise inside.

WS_IZC0FSapA7n44z2iptA.text: One of my favorites for a lunch on a Saturday with the family in Charlotte.  We had the pleasure of Jeremy yesterday as our waiter and he went above and beyond and made our visit even more enjoyable.  We always have a great meal and great time here and the food is always amazing so it's hard to get 'any better' but Jeremy is a first class act when it comes to customer service and left us talking about how soon we will be back!!!  Cant wait to get my next 'fix' of all that Cabo Fish Taco has to offer!!!! YUMMMMY!

P1o9kbeSjKvgkfWXkGV-eQ.text: Can 14 years make a difference in the life of a restaurant?  At Cabo Fish Taco the answer is a resounding NO!  The last time before this week that I had a meal there was 2000.  At the end of my meal I remarked that the fish was overcooked, tasteless and served barely above room temperature.  The service was at best mediocre.  As we were in the area, a friend suggested we go there for lunch.  I hesitated for a moment, but then figured they had to get better after 14 years.  WRONG!  Someone please tell me how/why this place is still in business!  Whatever that corn stuff they bring to the table is was horrible.  None of the condiments at the table could make it much better.  Our waitress (in training) was pleasant enough.  She recommended a daily special - Curried Fish (trout I believe) Taco.  I had actually been in the mood for Indian food that day, so a Curried Fish Taco sounded like just the thing.  WRONG!  The curry flavor was so diluted that it tasted as though someone sprinkled just a dash of cheap curry powder on the fish while cooking.  Jenny's Cabo's Signature Taco (beer battered white fish) was dry, overcooked, and EXTRA crunchy.  I surely would not want my signature on that!  Perhaps I will wait another 14 years to see if they are able to earn that third star....

IvA5VZN2U993qU5ncTJDsw.text: I am not sure if we ordered the wrong things, but the food was just okay. I had ordered the salmon salad and the fish was raw inside...I told my server and she kindly brought me out another one, but by that time my appetite was non existent.

dJuYir6THaAjwrN3LERFSA.text: I moved to the Charlotte area about a year ago, and in that time frame, have eaten at Cabo Fish Taco approximately 5 times.  I originally wanted to eat here because of watching it on Triple D, and it has certainly proven to be worth the hype.  I am quite shocked at the number of mediocre to negative reviews on YELP for this restaurant (by my count it currently stands at 40% of reviews being 3 star or below).  This is, by far, one of the best restaurants I have ever been to in my life.  The BBQ Mahi and Tavura Tuna Tacos are incredible and delicious.  The Baha Shrimp dip appetizer is amazing as well.  As far as sides go, they are all good, but the Avocado Pasta Salad is the best.  I've also had the Steak-n-Cheese taco and one of the special fish tacos.  They were good also, but the real stars of this restaurant are the two tacos I mentioned above.  The wait can be bad on weekends but they use an app called NoWait that will allow you to track your wait status on your phone.  This is great compared to the normal method of buzzers because you can go wherever you want during the wait period and just track the updates on your phone.  You will get a text message when your table is ready.  Since NoDA is full of great restaurants and bars, you are able to go have a drink somewhere else while you wait for your table, then quickly walk back once you get the text that your table is ready.  The atmosphere is very chill with a Latin vibe, usually there is some reggae music in the background.  The ONLY thing this place is missing is live music, which I have not seen in my trips thus far.  I think that would really put this place into the upper echelen of chill/hang out places, but still, this is definitely a 5 star place to me.  Don't really get all the negative reviews but as they say "haters gonna hate."

1AO5_-4nDnNU6nGgDwbLUQ.text: Excellent food and ambience. I had the BBQ mahi tacos. The crab dip should be called crack dip as we couldn't stop eating it--it was so delicious! Great margaritas! Service was excellent.

3O_NhwdODtWUt4ifDHK_vA.text: They fit a lot of people into a small space, so it can be crowded and slow service sometimes...but the food always has great flavor!

8Xv64LUOnjAdtI1YxRegxg.text: I've only been once - but had to have the experience, everyone was ranting and raving about! Went during a football game, which worked out fairly well because they had many TV's and not a lot of people were at the restaurant to watch the game.

yVH9ZFQB7dkqS2w67jhr7A.text: I guess they're the best place in Charlotte called "Cabo Fish Taco."  Try the 15 dollar tuna and rice burrito that hits your stomach like a wad of clay.  Or any of the fish tacos which leave you parched and wondering "do they understand the importance of vegetation to compliment fish, rice, and beans?" The food gets a c- but the atmosphere gets an a-. Don't take my word for it though, Ive only lived in 5 major cities.

IvqIFETPNV8g1KrDuFJ12w.text: Cold chips they say they do not make them to order  This place is terrible where did they get the fish? Did not look like any fish that I have ever had. It was so bad I took two bites and left . First what is Cabo about it? and what is fish about it?It takes more than a few pieces of frozen fish on a tortilla shell. Lets see if Taco Bell can do better ?Guy you must have been drunk if you liked this place of course I have never seen him visit a place that he said he did not like?  No No No I should have contacted my credit card company and disputed the charge. What a waste...

0m8ZxYLNH4QMYXx3PpX3uA.text: Had dinner here, there was a slight wait but no to bad.  The salsa and chips were great, unlike your traditional chips and salsa. They have some of the best tacos that I've had.  Little pricy but they were great.  Definitely go back there again

Pf3I5bY1JfweDIr21TuTeg.text: Went here yesterday. After waiting to be seated for 15 mins, a couple that came in after us got seated before us. Once we were seated, it took 30 mins for someone to even take our order and 25 mins to have water brought to our table. Multiple servers and bussers came by our table to replenish the utensils, but they were not concerned that we hadnt ordered and we didnt even have a drink after such a long time. It felt like we were being treated unfairly and we thought about leaving multiple times. We shouldve honestly left because our server didnt seem to feel that bad about the wait. Would not recommend if you want to go somewhere that values your time.

3gvOf1KqN4n210mDdjZyrg.text: I've heard so many great things about this place, but never tried it to till this weekend. When I say I would definitely go back. The food was great everything was seasoned to perfection. I ordered the carne asada burrito which was the perfect blend of rice, beans, meat, avocados & cheese. I would definitely recommend it. My boyfriend had the quesadilla, he's never picky when we go out to eat but he completely loved how good his quesadilla tasted ! I will definitely be back !

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Quesadillas
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salsa
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carne Asada Wrap

wFbExnXmL08y9WGYUsgEIg.text: My last review wasn't until 2015, so I think it is time to update my review for Cabo Fish Taco.  Why the extra star? 4 words. Tavaru Tuna Fish Taco. I have fallen in love with this taco. It is just a perfection medley of flavors. The tuna is always cooked so well....seared with a nice pink inside. The wasabi sauce on it adds that nice bite and kick. Delish.   The avocado pasta salad is my favorite side still. Creamy and tasty with a little spice.  In terms of portions, my husband and I typically split a plate and add an extra a la carte taco. On this occasion, we split the tavaru tacos (2 tacos in the order) and added one BBQ Mahi, which in my opinion is the second best on the menu.   2013 since my original review and Cabo Fish Taco is still (6 years later) one of my favorite eats in Charlotte.

CrDpoTwjgW6WKe_FoLf70A.text: Cabo Fish Taco takes an unique spin on tacos and I love it! Came here on a Monday evening and was seated immediately. We ordered some margaritas which were delish for the price! The salsa is different with corn and tomatoes. I was skeptical but it was really was good! For the meal, I ordered the Lemon Shrimp Tacos. They were so tasty!! Highly recommend!! Next time I'm in Charlotte this will be a place to go!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lemon Shrimp Tacos

2qXLB8FnkMlScMT5dBk8lg.text: Excellent customer service, good vibes, and good drinks! I was pleasantly surprised with the grilled salmon tacos as the soy sesame glaze paired well with the taco ingredients. As a new comer, I would recommend this location to anybody looking for a good time and good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. El Cheapo
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grilled Salmon Tacos

Wknrqhlpfnp6SIe_HbV0hA.text: Never had a fish taco until I tried Cabo Fish Taco. "A Unique Fusion of Fresh Seafood and Original Baja Mexican Cuisine" (via their website). Whenever I get tacos, I'm usually hip to traditional Mexican style: carne asada, lengua, al pasto, or carnitas. Never do I reach for pescado. But tonight, that all changed. The BBQ Mahi tacos were awesome. Grilled mango BBQ Mahi-Mahi tacos stuffed with Cabo slaw, tomato, avocado, cheese & finished with cilantro white sauce. These tacos are pretty big in size and they come in pairs of two + a side. I could of eaten more, but it's a decent portion size for the average eater. The chunks of fish are humongous. Located in the heart of NoDa, this place does get busy, especially on weekends. Totally worth the wait, so if you commit, there's no decommiting. Please order the Baja shrimp and crab dip as an app to start - it's just as big time as the tacos. The dip is solid, but pay attention to the crispy pita chips. They will remind you of a soft, warm Taco Bell chalupa shell, but better. Both the dip + pita chips complement each other perfectly. Next visit, I'm going to try the honey soy glazed salmon tacos and a quesadilla.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ Mahi Tacos.

DCv3WiPtIR_vgFbmtbpozA.text: Tasty tacos! Flavorful sides and apps. Great service. Be prepared to pay for parking if you're in NODA at peak time and don't know the local area. We had to do a $5 pay lot almost behind the restaurant. My wife and I tried the white fish and tuna tacos. Both were great. The white Fish was beer battered, flaky and crispy! Great taco! My wife liked the tuna, but I wasn't a fan of the seasoning. Medium rare tuna doesn't need all that seasoning on the outside. Just the tuna is suffice for a great taco. The corn salsa app they bring to the table for free with chips had some serious kick! I liked that. My wife did not. Kudos on the refried beans side for having a few toppings to give it more taste and texture than most. And the avocado pasta salad had a great and unique creaminess to it. I highly recommend! We ate for $42 with 1 water, 1 tea, a $6 queso app and our two entrees. That's pricy for usual Mexican food for us. It was good, but with the $5 to park, too, it's not something we'd do again any time soon. Just too expensive. And good food, but not good enough for that cost.
