photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. fabulous fish tacos
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. veggie fajitas &amp; $2 tecate

TxHrIrK_Ie_E6_MxoPjvZA.text: Cabo Fish Taco is a pretty good place. Personally, I love the queso but the food has just never been flavorful enough for me. The flavors never really mesh together in a way that's like..."good GOD I HAVE to come back for this specific entree" Definitely a place to try out for yourself though! Although it may not be my cup of tea it may be yours!

UjFgADoSTxbYFt3SCb_nCA.text: We met a bunch of friends for dinner and drinks at Cabo before heading to the Evening Muse nearby for a show. We had a large party of 14 and management was able to seat us comfortably even though the place was full. Our server was fantastic and very attentive to our entire table. Everyone enjoyed their tacos. I had the tuna and lemon grilled shrimp, both were awesome. This place seems to be very well run as they all seem to help out to make sure you get your drinks and food quickly. I've been to so many poorly run places that I wanted to pass on kudos to this staff for getting it right.

_nw-j__7f3CbdbGEFbm7yw.text: Don't agree with all of the hype Great atmosphere and location. But the food is just bland sadly. Still the concept is great and its a appreciated part of Charlotte thus 3 stars.

aX3yWdFILQvX249Dq86_Xg.text: The BBQ Mahi Mahi Tacos are perfect. The fresh chunky salsa is delicious. The atmosphere is cool and relaxed. If you are in Charlotte this is the place you MUST try. I have not eaten anything from Cabo that wasn't delicious and the selection of local microbrews is awesome.

xwHHHTtjBHsf97Qx6hhkXA.text: LOVE their tofu tacos!!! I order the sweet chili thai tofu tacos without cheese and they are the best vegan tacos I have ever had. Service is usually good, but I've also had a couple of bad experiences, otherwise I'd give it a 5.

4nTFC-Ky0rSSXmfAFa-vGg.text: It's great!!! Try the Lemon Grilled Shrimp tacos!!! And they have skinny girl margaritas!!! It's a tad growded but it didn't bother us.  We waited only for 30 min.

OKNif-CaJ38OSWX64nmATQ.text: I had been waiting to try this place for YEARS since coming to town from Raleigh for a concert, but its always so packed when we're there. I finally discovered they do take out, so we by-passed the hour wait (at 8:30 on Friday night) and ordered food at the bar. We got chips and the amazing tomatillo salsa while we waited, and luckily, by the time the food came out (which wasn't long), two seats opened up at the bar and we got to eat there. And lemme tell you... It was well worth the wait. The beer battered tacos were out of this world. My husband had the mahi, which I liked on its own, but liked my taco more. The avocado pasta salad was the winning side- my black beans and rice were a little bland. But overall, it definitely lived up to the hype!

IBh0ULCJoKobChDdfxPIMA.text: Fish and shrimp tacos are great..LOVE the sauce!! The sides that come with the meal are awful tho. The parking sucks. Last time went on my lunch break..had to park almost 2 blocks away!! Did I say the sauce is really Gooooood?? Lol

hKpaGOg2TkeDCfPB-yEeUg.text: Great food but service was lacking.  I went with a group of friends months ago.  I asked for my food not spicy at all and a friend asked for it very spicy.  When it came out, they had got it mixed up.  Mine was extremely spicy and his was not spicy at all. No big deal, just send it back and have it remade.  It came out the second time, and same thing, the food was the same.  Mine was still extremely spicy and his had no spiciness at all.  We complained to the waitress again.  My friend and I decided to switch food so I had his and he had mine.  The bill came and they charged us for both.    While the food was amazing, the service was lacking.

IVpjW4Tm-fz9bmm7sDRmmg.text: Funky layout.....hipster staff.....always hoppin' in some manner, the Cabo is a NoDa anchor.  Fish Tacos are the draw for me and the GF....this time I was only hungry enough for the guac and cheese dip and a few beers.  The outdoor patio has really made this place even better and with temps this last weekend being in the 70s it was perfect.

5jZ3iOko52e9QhKkY34zgA.text: Second time at Cabo in Charlotte.  Food is pretty good; good selection of brews, not such a good selection of wines.  Most disappointing is that they did not have corn tortillas!  Not even the chips with the corn salsa were all corn.  One in our party is gluten sensitive and we were sure that choosing a mexican theme would be a sure bet for corn tortillas.  Guac was over smooth, but fairly tasty.

50MRNm7V7FuTTFwGsnMDUQ.text: Coming from San Diego, I'd have to give their tacos and A-OK. The vibe is great and the salsa definitely needs improvement. I would recommend this restaurant but I think they can go from good to great with some revamped salsa and perhaps a quick trip to SouthBeach restaurant in San Diego. Then, they can nail it.

Ia9gEo2_2F6JT5LW4k-DkA.text: We visited because of the DDD segment and the recommendation of our driver. It was definitely good and worth visiting, but I wouldn't quite give it a 100%. The original margarita was good but not great. The rice & beans lacked a distinctive flavor. Highlights: the service was very prompt and friendly, and the lemon shrimp taco and avocado pasta salad were exceptional. Well worth the visit.

7pOqSw1M0zTLQ3rIeAtECg.text: Great burritos, god awful service.  It seems like they do some kind of misguided communal attempt at serving here, and then none of the servers communicate with each other so we ended up with multiples of some things and none of others.  Worst of all the servers seemed annoyed with US when we corrected them.    Listen guys, theres a reason that 99% of restaurants have one waiter per table, BECAUSE IT WORKS.  On the brightside, the burrito I had was pretty damn good, so was my girlfriends, though I dont remember which ones they were, the fact that 2 different ones were good leads me to believe they have their burrito game on lock.    Unfortunately I dont think I can suffer through the awful service again, but if it ever gets fixed, I'll definetly go back more often, shame really.

RSsJQc-Eozcq-dGmq5-Hvw.text: I love the Noda feel of this place and the beer battered shrimp tacos are great but the service is always up in the air. If the service was good and the wait staff acted like they cared if you were even in the restaurant, I'd for sure rate it higher. I've eaten here a lot and the service has been consistently below average.

iVkS_okl16xc8n40PwRz3g.text: I've heard crazy good things about Cabo but it didn't really live up to its reputation.  The food was decent but I just wasn't blown away.  I love guac so I had to try it as an appetizer.  It was tasty but after you eat through the top layer of cilantro, peppers and other goodies, it is just meh.  I got the Epic Tuna Burrito for dinner.  It was yummy but I wouldn't especially go back for it.    My biggest peeve was that my margarita was waaaay too sweet.  Another person in my group felt the same way.  We decided to say something since there was obviously something wrong.  Instead of bringing us a new drink they tried to doctor it up.  The waitress said they poured out some of the drink and added more sour mix.  Needless to say, it was horrible.    Also, as a side note, I parked in the bank parking lot across the street and my car got towed.  Be careful and read all the signs :)

Xc43bCDf6MDiQPG8epOmiQ.text: There is nothing better than Blackened Mahi Mahi Tacos and a Silver Surfer Margarita and the only place you can find such a delicious meal is...........CABO FISH TACO!!!!!!  I have fallen in love with this place over four years ago and am so very thankful for the expansion and outdoor area.  They could extend the whole block and still have an hour wait on weekends.    I have tried many things on their menu, but I stick with my old faithful because it's crazy good.  I have never actually had bad service there, mostly the wait staff is attentive and very easy going with suggestions about the menu or specials.    Will continue to frequent!  Thank you for being awesome

pUcTaIae-eb3EHhnwhBxGQ.text: Ate here while visiting Charlotte for the week after seeing all the reviews. All I can say is, Amazing. I love how you can pick any two tacos and mix and match them. Salsa was on point, beer selection was great, service was excellent. Had no idea what to get since it was my first time there, but the waiter was more than helpful and gave me plenty of suggestions. It is kind of pricey, but the food is worth it. Also, they have plenty of tvs for any of your sports needs. I definitely will be a regular once moving.

hf_Y-yDmF8JGc2toF7hMbQ.text: This place was easy to find but the parking is the worst in this area. I ended up parking along the street near the Y. I can just imagine how it would be on the weekend. We arrived for dinner about 7:30 and were promptly seated and offered water and chips. I ordered a margarita (I think) which was pretty tasty but the chips ... come on guys. I love chips and dip and the chips..... well tasted stale. I remember reading a review before I went and somebody else mentioned the chips not being so great. We actually asked the guy about them b/c we thought they were stale and he let us know that's how they are supposed to be.... they had made a fresh batch about 2 hours ago. I tried the lemon grilled shrimp tacos with rice and black beans. They were pretty tasty although the beans were a bit spicy. Overall a nice atmosphere and nice area just be warned that you have to probably park in a neighborhood. I will be back to try more things on the menu.

75Cyb02gRFOBm_fnpvP62w.text: Okay folks, this is it. My final verdict, the end all be all of my Cabo reviews. I've had more than enough visits to add them up and divide them by pi. Cabo's perimeters were empty and the streets of Noda were barren. No gallery crawl, so lunch was to be served unadulterated and uninterrupted.   It all started on a sunny Sunday afternoon with amazing weather and a $2 can of Modelo. The service was friendly, the patio was ideal, and the food came out hot and fast.   Chips are no longer cold and instead of the regular fried White fish tacos, I decided to switch it up and opted for the special Tav-ah-roo tacos. The Tuna still wasn't anything special, but the wasabi sauce was pretty fabulous. Blackened tuna tacos were also so/so, along with the sides.   Cabo still hasn't made the upper echelon as far as my personal favorites, but still a very cool spot with decent food and a nice break from the norm.

9zdN2UAIGfK774TL6KeUPQ.text: Scrumptious food with a good atmosphere. Love the Mexican decorations and the friendly staff. Highly recommend the shrimp tacos!

KNxPWbW3V1m7ZzRTvXe_ow.text: My first time here I came with Pourina and I will say that it was quite bland.  The place was under construction and overall I was disappointed for my first time having fish tacos.  In the past two weeks I've frequented this place and I absolutely love it!  With the patio outside and this nice weather we've had lately it is such a cool place to chill.  The crowd seems kinda hip in the way Noda usually is and the service has been decent recently.  Again the patio is cool as hell, I don't know why I like it so much.  I want to go on a sunday, smoke my cigar, drink corona, eat some tacos, and play cards with friends out there.    Now the food, FAR better than my first time.  I've had a few things but I keep going back to the Tuna tacos with wasabi honey sauce. I forget the name of them but its the bottom of menu, its off the chizzzzzzzzzain!  Seriously, can't say much for the rest of the menu but those Tuna Tacos are the heat.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

SPYhdAZxrcNI-VaSwocv3A.text: If you haven't been to Cabo Fish taco, you need to go to cabo fish taco. The food is amazing and the tortillas on the tacos SO good! Be prepared to wait outside if you come on a weekend night, but this is the best place for dinner in Noda.

PBtkjeppkwgMX3hOhVXaPQ.text: So the amazing Jeff from Outsell is with us and KB the largest leprechaun went to this joint cause it's in the triple D tour and I'll tell you what.   Yes Jeff does eventually stop talking about sales.   And the tacos were da bomb.  That's it.  Great atmosphere nice folk and did I mention good tacos.     Here's a pic.  Just go.

r3GtrY2CNhEzrHXexjYjqQ.text: Right off the bat the corn salsa they give you is incredible and could be eaten as a side dish on its own. Food came out a little slow on a busy Friday night, but that just gave us more time to enjoy the salsa-our waitress was kind enough to bring another after we quickly demolished the first one. The fish tacos were excellent and the blackened shrimp and chicken burrito my girlfriend ordered was outstanding. I would highly recommend-my only caveat is that the environment inside is very loud.

BcBNkWgWfM9KfDrHE04b6Q.text: This was about my third visit to Cabo and just like the first few times I wasn't impressed by the food. I ordered the shrimp & chicken burrito, despite the contents it was pretty dry and lacked seasoning. The chips and pico dip were equally mediocre with what tasted like borderline stale chips. The only reason for three stars is the servers were especially nice and I did enjoy one of the tacos from a previous trip. If I want good tacos, this wouldn't be at the top of my list.

uPW8fa29vuFFWKV9vkFNkw.text: Definitely an awesome choice!!!!!!!!!! by far one of my favorite restaurants in Noda. Everyone needs to experience Cabo Fish taco sometime.

ENMtgsQAe9dbV-s6ZxmRvQ.text: Wish I could rate this 3.5, I realllllly like this place, I always have a good time here as well as good service, and yet when I initially clicked 4 stars it didn't feel right.  I have been here multiple times and have never gotten anything I didn't enjoy.  The tacos are great, the queso and salsa are really good as well, have had good burritos, have had good fish, but I think there is a tad of over-hyped-ness that comes with this place.  It's slightly expensive, but to be honest for well prepared, fresh fish you probably should expect a pricier meal. Most times I have been there is usually a wait BUT there is a bar to belly up to whilst you wait OR you are in NODA and there is plenty to see (shops, art, or ppl watch).  Continuing on the wait, the staff is always hustling and it does create an up-beat environment, and it is a fun place, service is great and waits never seem as long as they say.   My biggest gripe with the place might be the beer selection, I know it is a destination sort of place and you want to make sure you have your BMC's covered, but when you are literally one miles from two awesome breweries offer more than just one option from the two... And $5.50 pints ($5 was the "special") C'MON!!!  As a stickler for good beer, and being in this neighborhood, try a little harder!  Now my bashing is over back to positives, they mixed drink selection is pretty good, wife always gets margarita and still hasn't had a repeat flavor as the variety is big.  They don't seem to skimp on the booze and she always says they taste solid.   This and cowfish are also our two favorite places to take friends from out of town looking for something different.  Great place always a good time, enjoy the food, fun, but maybe just a tad over-rated for me.  Will be back, would always recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Arguably some of best fish tacos I have ever had.  BBQ mahi=AWESOME!

wJN8dmTJwdXSwq3uMNeFXA.text: Food here is absolutely delicious, aside from the corn salsa they give you. I tried the Thai shrimp wrap, it was slightly spicy, but still so good! They also have good drink specials on Sunday's which is the day I went. The only complaint is that the drinks are a little pricey. But overall delicious!

goxX2D6oR0P3mQlz9tMYMA.text: Stopped in while visiting Charlotte. I live near Tampa and I've never had fish tacos as good as the BBQ Mahi Tacos. Just insane. They give you the option of corn or flour tortillas, I had the flour. The tortillas were slightly grilled or fried - they were in between soft and crunchy and they were fantastic. 2 tacos for about $11, but trust me, they are huge and filling. I can't recommend these tacos enough, and Cabo Fish Taco is on my must visit list from now on when I'm in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ Mahi tacos w/side of black beans and rice

WQHBmi70wTGWv7XdWi1qhQ.text: This is one of the most talked-about restaurants in Charlotte and it definitely lives up to the hype! Food is super fresh, service is great and it's a fun atmosphere. I had the shark taco (on special) and it was incredible. The server suggested other items when I put in my order, which I appreciated because it was BOMB!

0QGwS89Wpf5gSohbyI0Nog.text: Can't get enough of this Charlotte staple. The lemon grilled tacos and beer battered shrimp tacos are amazing. The soft taco shells are actually my favorite, so much better than anywhere else! You also get a side with the tacos, jalepeno mashers or baja rice are my go to. They ahve a great selection of margs and beer, too! Because it's such a great spot, it can get pretty crowded making the wait long and it can get a little loud inside which is not ideal for deep conversations.

Fr68nucWtJ9FYcht26MNoA.text: Amazing!! Best fish tacos I've ever had! Shrimp taco was good too and I dream about the Avocado salad!

z5JMVPhRkhb9Qw_GNgwq9w.text: Place is usually busy at peak times but if you try 11:30am and 5:30pm to beat the crowds you can do it pretty easy. I've eaten here five times and every time has been about the same. Service is good, food is good and the corn salsa is really good. I've always eaten some type of taco. Usually mahi or tuna and the flavor combo's are spot on. The one thing I don't like is how greasy the taco shells are now. I didn't even eat the taco shells the past two times and used a fork to eat the inside portion. I think the next time I go I'll order something with out a shell.

IaGwvNZI9yb8plfJYoU-lA.text: Found this place in NoDa on a first time trip to Charlotte - the spicy avocado pasta salad and blackened mahi mahi fish tacos were beyond delicious! Would highly recommend!

hu8Zz3W4MJH-SPOezzHXIQ.text: Wow!! What a meal!! I had the carne asada burrito and it was BURSTING with flavor!! The black beans and rice were awesome as well. My steak was cooked so perfect it was juicy and tender. My fiance had the special trout tacos and he said they were super tasty and the fish was perfect. On top of that, our waitress was good too, she made sure my cup was always full and attendted to us the right amount of times. I am so impressed and will most definitely be back!!!

f-B6nztOWw5ZAM1jsCWldg.text: Yes, another four star review from me.  But the place was great. Excellent service, good food and nice selection of microbrews to match.  I ordered the salmon tacos. Fish was in chunks, lightly seasoned with cabbage, cheese, guacamole and queso sauce. Tortilla was chewy, but still good and didn't "dissolve" after one bite.  Also ordered the guacamole and chips. Homemade and very good, but a little too puree for me as well and would have liked a little more cilantro, but still good. Hard to screw up guacamole.  Ordered a couple of local beers and enjoyed each. Sat at the bar and again, find the best service at the bar.  Small place and packed on a Thursday night. Cool place to check out a "local" Charlotte hangout.

2j-yhAE35M2dKXxfO3pa_w.text: Fresh fish cooked to perfection.  Every dish at our table was bursting with flavor.  Really good beer selection and friendly service.  Especially liked the Tavarua tacos which were lemon rubbed grilled tuna with a honey wasabi.  Atmosphere was an urban funky vibe but still tame enough for our kids who were with us.  All walks of life dining side by side.  Would definitely come back again.

BE4VF2S3_VrAWxgrvhYrxQ.text: I love this place. The vibe is super chill and the food is always amazing. Sometimes there is a wait but that's  only because everyone knows it's  worth it!

E1M7Q1QVQKlEWp4hQKVk6A.text: Went here for a birthday dinner after getting tattoo's at Fu's across the street. Ate here once before and really liked the food so we decided to go again.  The food was really tasty, Blackened Mahi Taco's with Avocado pasta and Battered Shrimp Taco's with rice. We all had NODA Jam Session draft beer and that was really good as well. We arrived 20 minutes before closing and we're told as we walked in to order quickly and we felt rushed by the staff and especially the waiter. When he brought our beer he told us if we wanted another it was last call, so we asked for one and he told us we had to drink the first before he could bring another - apparently state law.  OK, so why tell us it was last call.  No attention. No care in our food or service.  We'll go back but not within 30 minutes of closing.  We felt rushed and ignored!

YL8rxHZoU4NQFkEzJNTk8g.text: Had an early dinner there last week and received excellent food (White fish taco, black beans, and rice) and great service. Sat at the bar, watched TV, drank a beer, talked with the bartender, and savored every bite. It's hard to beat Cabo for the food (delicious every time) and atmosphere (casual and very eclectic).   Can't go wrong with Cabo! (But come early to find parking in NoDa - only negative aspect to the whole deal).

47OvZHNiCWuRjho_mXQF2Q.text: Awesome. BBQ mahi tacos are a must try. Crab dip is awesome too. Have good specials daily. Always busy so plan accordingly. Good drink selection. Staff is friendly. Food comes out quick. Chips and salsa leave something to be desired. Chips are always stale.

kW0MT-JPXHmk3wRJxHTmoA.text: Food and service is amazing! Period! The fajitas -'d the crab and shrimp dip is off the charts!

GQ02u736EnIAQJF0S8ueNw.text: This place is awesome! It is always crowded so call ahead and make reservations or try to find a seat at the bar, the crab shrimp dip for an APP is great.  I always order the blackened MAHI tacos and they're always tasty, but I decided to try the beer battered shrimp tacos and HELLO... where have you been my entire life  i have been wanting this place every day since I went! Never a disappointment! And the pasta salad as a side is great! We asked them for the one with no jalapeno because it is pretty spicy!

f5PwGLP7GbXt3rx8jceYsQ.text: Cabo Fish Taco is located in NODA, which is the north end of davidson street.  Everytime we stop by NODA, my bf and I would always see a line out the door.  People were obviously waiting for seats to open up.  We were lucky enough to gone there early on a Wednesday night 6pm, right before my flight to grab an early dinner.  Once we walked in, there were plenty of seats and a reall cool looking booth that can fit up to 10 people.  Would love to sit there, if i were to come with a group of friends.    We were first served chips and salsa! I absolutely love their salsa! It had tomatoes, corn, and pieces of onion.  I guess i love anything that has corn in it!   We both ordered two tacos which comes with a side.  The tacos can mix and match so i got the Beer Battered Fish Taco and the Beer Battered Shrimp Taco with a side of Spicy avacado pasta.  I thought the shrimp taco was more delicious than the fried fish taco.  Reason is because the shrimp was still juicy and chewy even when fried.  I can tell they must of fried the shrimp on the spot, because both the fried fish and the fried shrimp came out pipping hot.  The taco shells were also fried, which was a change in all the tacos i ever had up north.  With every bite, there would a crunchy taste!  I would like to rave about the Spicy Avacado pasta salad! it was definitely delicious!   My bf got the Blackened Mahi Mahi Taco and the Steak taco  with a side of the baha salad?  The side came with black beans, chick peas , and corn i think.  And in our perspective, the side choice wasn't a good one.  However the Blackened Mahi Mahi taco was just okay, and the steak taco was chewy and was cooked to medium well.    Next time i think i would  try the fried shrimp tacos again, and another taco thats not from the fryer to balance out the chew factor taste.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened mahi mahi taco &amp; steak taco
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried battered fish &amp; fried battered shrimp tacos

9Hffnxtin685XFUMJoTXKg.text: Awesome Food!  Awesome Service!  Great Atmosphere!  If you leave this place hungry, it's your own fault.  Try the fish and shrimp tacos...they're great!

ccfSM9vyZI4bG2UJTPHAKA.text: Very reasonably priced and great portion sizes. The service was quick, my margarita was tasty, my tacos were fresh. It's lacking the extra kick that would take it to the next step, but that does not take away from the excellent job that they do. Get the avocado pasta salad as your side, you won't regret it.

ilyRJWnuUiKFq3B_9YyWtQ.text: Excellent beer battered shrimp taco and blackened mahi mahi taco. The avocado pasta was average but the tacos were well worth it

Zeh6KghbqrYhMbhOWGL8ww.text: This is our first time here. We are impressed and will be back! The service was great, the BBQ Mahi Fish Tacos delicious, and the patio dining very comfortable. Great place!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

qqT2jD3dnOLvukdFw5eDrg.text: Great place. Fish is fresh and seared medium well to perfection. They let you mix and match the two tacos. I think their specialty ones are the best ones.  Margaritas are worth it. Great for groups of friends.  Only 4 stars because service wasn't good. We waited nearly 20 minutes after we asked for our check.

paimpQS2dtuzJFGOLWm7aw.text: I'd heard friends talk about Cabo Fish Taco. I decided to try it. Really warm welcome and great service. It's a nice casual place but the service is really fantastic. I had a delicious Margarita and then a really filling burrito. Lots of choices and fun place to have dinner with friends.

ZRxCf7Df4lzYnKy0XGAyEA.text: The best!  I mean the best by far tacos made in a variety of ways for you to enjoy.  I must say that the Honey Soy Glazed Salmon Taco is the BEST!!!!  Well  my personal preference anyway!  You must come and enjoy for yourself!! The drinks are good,  the atmosphere is amazing, and Michelle's service we too notch!  She is the server that will offer you suggestions, give her your opinion and you make a decision, but trust me, her suggestions are on point.  You have a great lady working for your establishment and she's friendly to boot!  You don't get friendly everywhere, but ask for Michelle and she's got ya!!

PWoF05IkTRs231tfk8qy_A.text: Loved the place. Saw it on triple d plus I have a app that shows you restaurants that have been on triple d and man vs food so I always try to check at least one out in the city I'm in. Great tacos really friendly staff

EktUxZoHCGJaE-JK83naLw.text: This is our favorite date spot. We are here at least once every other week, and Cabo never disappoints!! Located in the cute NoDa district of Charlotte, Cabo Fish Taco has a laid-back, southern Cali vibe with 2 bars tucked inside and outdoor patio seating. There isn't a bad spot in the house. The patio is heated for colder weather.   The food is unreal. When you are seated your server will bring you their house-made salsa and chips. It is so fresh and tasty. I love to try their weekly specials, one of my all-time favorites being the Wahoo taco. Their season jalapeno mashed potatoes are so delicious! This is available in the colder months. We always start with the crab dip appetizer, no one can beat their crab dip.  Staff is friendly, and service is on point. They also have a great drink selection, and a great margarita menu. My favorite being the Azul margarita!

QE5aRNSVVvotjE0C2rsGGg.text: My first time here tonight. I'd heard the food was good but wanted to be the judge myself. My main dish was the BBQ Mahi and it didn't disappoint. The combination of the BBQ sauce and spices kept my taste buds working throughout the meal. Refried beans had adequate texture to compliment the Mahi. Service was prompt and attentive to my needs. The Buckshot local draft beer helped top off the meal. I will return to this establishment to get deeper into Cabo's menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious BBQ Mahi Taco with refried beans!

iSiupkMLbJxQLHIcX_jlIA.text: The food was absolutely amazing. We wanted to get seconds it was so good! I got the steak tacos and then eat was perfectly seasoned and cooked just right. The spicy avocado pasta salad was to die for. I'm saving this place for future reference because this was a great place!!

-_Psr_2gp8eoz1Yp4FCspQ.text: The food was good , I had the lemon grilled shrimp tacos. I would Honestly say the customer service was much more better than the food. I would definitely go back for the food and service !

Xn9W8JMQe7UWiG_6Q6tdLw.text: margs and shrimp tacos are all you need!

enp3vtCfpUXHnTH1MTxCgQ.text: Our first time here was very interesting. The salsa that they bring out to you is corn based and just a little spicy. The wait staff was a little slow, but it was a busy night. I ordered the Cabo roll as my meal and it was delicious, however it is super rich so it's self limiting. One of us got the lemon grilled shrimp tacos with refried beans and the other got the tuna burrito. The refried beans have a strange bright citrus taste to them in my opinion, but they were still decent. Also we got a margherrita but they don't offer them as frozen blended, but it was still good. Overall the food was good, there are a lot of choices, the prices are decent, the parking sucks, I would go back again for sure.

naVzkNSvGjZezB1QsVDzgw.text: Talented chef!  So much flavor!  The spicy avocado salad is so creamy and just the right amount of heat.  One of the best lunches I have ever had!

VVENB0Wh1j9lnrjwpMI7hw.text: I love their fish tacos!! The Cajun Jamaican style is my favorite !!! The service is always good but there is always a wait!! The location is good but the parking is bad

O12Hvq4-jEK2BYKmYqHL9w.text: I love this place. The tacos are amazing and I am trying to try them all. My first time there I went with what the server recommended (one shark with pinapple salsa, and the tuna) and was amazed. I didn't think I liked cooked fish until I took a bite of that tuna taco. It was pretty much a life changer. The next time I went with a friend and we halved all the tacos so we could try more. The service has been great, the only thing I don't like is the side dishes, I'd just stick to the fruit salad.

Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shark taco and a tuna taco

kE5UUb_jD-QnnsDHt5NS1A.text: Okay, I'm from San Diego. I love everything Mexican and Fish Tacos are a must. Unfortunately, I've found this place to be more trendy than good. When I received my fish tacos they looked like what I expected except for one thing. If the fish was breaded at the restaurant then why bother breading fish pieces. The fish itself was fine but I received pieces. Typically, if you cut the fish correctly you won't have pieces. The batter was okay but I've fish sticks for Gorton's that were better. The batter had absolutely no flavor. It just seemed that someone took the time to decorate but I felt that I was served leftovers. I'm going to look somewhere else for fish tacos in the future.  If you ever in San Diego then try Rubio's, which is a fast food fish taco place and they seem to know what to serve the customer and what not to serve the customer. Cabo's didn't feel that way. At I could have received the same dinner for half the price but with a lot more flavor.

7VaV2bKigRoeCJHcJErFrg.text: Been here a couple times. This place is very average. The first time I had something fried with the cilantro white sauce - I thought the sauce was way too much and the fried fish was flavorless - did not ever want to go back. Needless to say, I returned. The salsa is very bland, literally just a little bowl of corn and diced tomatoes? I tried 3 of the tacos on my recent trip - the lemon grilled shrimp easily the best but in the larger scheme of things just average, the bbq mahi tacos ok - a lot of flavor, seemingly none of it fish, and the beer battered shrimp tacos pretty Captain D's-esque. The pecan pie was nice and gooey, but the flavor was a tad too sugary. And the red velvet cake was tasty with a good middle layer, but a strange gelatinous top layer.

OSvDQLUAT1IGnHd4zSUGpQ.text: My family and I just went to Cabo Fish Taco two nights ago and I'm STILL thinking about it. I had the BBQ Mahi Taco and the Tavarua Wahoo Taco and it was absolutely delicious!!! The flavors burst in your mouth from beginning to end. I can honestly say they were the most flavorful tacos I've ever had...Now that's saying a lot.   On the other hand my wife and daughter had the shrimp and chicken bowl and although they were very tasty, the shrimp were on a skewer and there might have been 4 or 5 in total. I'm only saying this because the pictures seemed to be FULL of shrimp, where in actuality it was all the vegetables and rice surrounding them.  The chicken however was plentiful.

wIk4PNbR2SQ57EoSrKh6zw.text: Gotta love it when a "trendy, hipster" restaurant uses canned products. Canned corn, canned refried beans, canned jalepenos...not worth the money for these kinds of products... Stale chips, average tacos (we had blackened mahi mahi) and over priced beers. 5 bucks for a draught beer? Come on now!! My wife and I have eaten here several times and have tried various items on the menu. We always seem to be disappointed after eating here. And before we get reamed and told to stay in, we normally do The wait staff is awesome and attentive to the patrons...no problem here. Everyone is friendly and I think this is what brings us back for the most part....that and the fact we love the NoDa area. However the food is just average for us....

oOttdnkzxjA82mGeT7qU2Q.text: when other establishments (which will remain nameless) closed early, my charlotte tour-guides turned to Cabo for dinner.  The 4 of us all got different selections, and everything was pretty damn good. the tacos were well portioned, and the price was right.  i even had a bowl of black-bean soup and didn't poop myself on the way home, so it was a win-win situation all around!

yfWCIjYTbvo9cvxB9rmAhw.text: Friendly service legit tacos. trust me i was raised in California. Very busy is always a good sign.

AdSEh9TqpCsjZWEC4VvWng.text: Heard rave reviews about this place so when in the area with two friends who were familiar, we decided to eat there.  "Meh" is a good description.  Expensive for what you get.  Slow.  And simply nothing special about the food.  They enjoyed their lunches but I think I could have given them peanut butter and jelly on rye and they'd have enjoyed it just as much.  There's plenty better out there.

n9wbLZGF28vwi5Sck1vElg.text: Best fish tacos ever!!! Awesome service. The inside is very nice! I'd come here every time I'm in Charlotte!

2GZZWQQKwWD24pBV8nKihg.text: I've been here quite a few times.  I usually order the same thing, last time I branched out and tried a chicken and shrimp burrito.  It was ok but the real winner for me here is the mahi tacos, they're great!  It's disappointing though when you place a to go order and get no chips and salsa.  Thought that was a fluke the first time but they don't give them for to go orders.  Tacos are so good though it doesn't matter too much.

329g44xrda06pQaBB-Wl0A.text: Loved the monk fish tacos with spicy avacado pasta salad. Good service and a great lunch.

EBBc7VJyifj0scOzL2qT7w.text: I have been eating at Cabo for years now...before NoDa became the conglomerate that it is now.  The food is consistently good.  The flour tortillas that they use for their tacos are delicious all in their own.  I love the queso dip (the best I've had) and I've eaten at plenty mexican restaurants.  The Wraps are great and filling as are the entrees.  I will say that yes, at times, the chips are stale and the salsa isn't anything to write home about but who cares...it's an appetizer and it's free! I've never been impressed with their Margaritas so I usually stick w/Modelo or a Sweet Tea.   It is also a good place to take out-of-towners or maybe a first date.  It is usually VERY noisy so don't expect to have a super romantic time here unless you are a very laid back type of couple.

egwhcEipojyhpQDGK0H3fA.text: Corn and Shrimp chowder excellent taste, could have been a few degrees warmer. Shrimp and crab dip came with fried pita. Why fry pita? Waitress exchanged for fresh pita. Service was excellent.

IIvkcDrvIxwO0vTG8K1wVg.text: Never thought I would ever say this....but I have found fish tacos as good as the ones I grew up with in California. Cabo is a fun and cool hangout in an already cool and eclectic NoDa neighborhood. 4 stars because my wife was not a fan of their margaritas, but if you are in downtown Charlotte pop over to this place, it's worth the wait

wcD-5jg3jAnSIaSH3r5VGA.text: I've heard a lot about Cabo Fish Taco, from friends in Charlotte and from Food Network.  I decided it was time I found out what all the fuss is over.  I'm now left wondering just what, exactly, all the fuss IS over.  Cabo has generated a lot of hype, but does not have the substance to back it up.  Given that it was a Saturday night, I assumed there would be a bit of a wait.  We were told we'd have a table in 10 minutes, and the hostess was pretty accurate.  After initially getting our names on the wait list, though, she could have done without immediately telling us we were in her way (in those words, exactly).  We made it to our table, and the waitress promptly greeted us and took our drink orders.  We inquired about the specials on the chalk board, only to find out those were from yesterday and no one got around to updating the sign.  We placed our orders from the regular menu.  And waited.   And waited. And watched other tables, who were seated AFTER us, receive their orders BEFORE us.  Mind you, half the restaurant is still empty.  After 45 minutes of waiting and inattentive service from our waitress, she explained there was a mix up in the kitchen.  She was unable (unwilling?) to compensate us in any way for such poor service.  The food finally arrived and I was unimpressed.  It tasted good, but not Food Network, everyone's-talking-about-it good.  The tacos were more lettuce than fish and the slaw was rather bland.  When you add it all up, and factor in the fact that the place is so loud it's impossible to do more than look at the other people at your table, I felt like I had wasted my money and the better part of my evening on a miserable experience.  Needless to say, I won't be giving Cabo a second chance.

MFZatDPVp8rdP_O6E61FFg.text: Food was just ok. Guacamole tasted like crap. $7 !!!  For a tiny bowl of doo doo. Chips were stale and the tacos tasted old. Would not return.

52BcXfALhQ2m8v4Jpdontw.text: Love this place! Get the lime shrimp tacos...amazing!! Don't forget a house margarita. Casual fun atmosphere, friendly staff and great food!

jd2STxegxPEpIJIUsVkWnw.text: Food is always good. Great tacos. Ive never had fish tacos before this place and I was surprised how much I love them!

H4U4oY9OXJT1l5WwY6WBKA.text: so has anyone been to Cabo Fish Tacos. I went for the first time and it was so good the only thing was i had to wait for 20 mints for a drink because they couldn't find the bladder wow. but other then that the tacos are great and the salsa was not very good I'm not a fan of that  well i hope everyone will try this place it is very good

eIZvlCq8z7lrFpwI3yTUFg.text: If you've ever been to Mexico and experienced a real fish taco (which usually runs around 50) then you know Cabo is a giant poser.  They charge mucho dollars for crappy food. The seafood is ALWAYS overcooked. Seafood is delicate and should be flaky and light. Not fried hard as sh!t. I've been there thrice, all for lunch, and it's very inconsistent. Sometimes bland, sometimes very salty, sometimes seared, sometimes forgotten on the stove. The tacos are always drowning in some mystery grease, everything gets some kind of f%@king mayonnaise on it, and the complementary salsa is canned corn with NO FLAVOR.  The place is in a great location, with a great atmosphere, but the food is  just not that good.  Hey Cabo Fish Taco! Go to Mexico and do a work study...

C-uqWXSwI6BYB_NPSLvN8Q.text: Gotta go for the lemon grilled shrimp tacos! My all time fav, I love them so much I haven't even tried any other menu items! Great atmosphere, awesome food and drinks!

HllNSirsjVsl2JIwG5NJPQ.text: I've never been to Cabo, and I don't like fish tacos. I also don't like paying to park in dodgy gravel lots. However, I do like parking for free about a block down from NoDa's Cabo Fish Taco. There I might see a man in the yard adjacent to my meterless spot, expertly swinging chains with fiery balls attached to the ends. That he was performing for the group of firemen encircling him made it seem somehow normal.  You just never know what you are going to get in NoDa. You do, however, know what you are going to get at Cabo Fish Taco.  Usually, you'll get a waiting list. They've expanded into the space next door, where the hardwood planks are far less buoyant than those on the original side, and added covered outdoor seating. Their popularity has grown as well, so the extra room is proportionate to the demand. They don't take reservations, and at lunch and  even on weeknights there's sometimes a short wait, so it's best to plan accordingly.  You'll always get complimentary salsa. Not the liquefied tomato version of most Tex-Mex eateries, but Cabo Fish Taco's primarily corn, tomato and black bean brand that always has a few rebellious members who refuse to stay in the bowl or on a chip.  Fresh food is de rigueur at Cabo Fish Taco, along with special twists of white cilantro sauce and Napolito Salad. That's cactus, to the gringos. For those of us who don't care for fish, the menu also includes salads, burritos, tacos, quesadillas and my favorite, the Serrano Chicken Salad with a side of Mexi-Slaw, all sans fins.  Perhaps as a nod to the weird, or to the sense of community in NoDa, there are two toilets in the ladies room, but no stalls. I'd bet cash money that women with no previous interactions except simultaneously full bladders have used those potties in tandem based on their consumption of Purple Haze Margaritas.  Casual, and generally quick service is expected at Cabo Fish Taco, where the vibe is decidedly NoDa and what I expect of Cabo San Lucas: Anything goes, as long as it is good.

8l_If-DpZLHdyoHw0NEJ4g.text: Delicious!! The tuna tacos were yum and had a great kick to them. Loved the whole meal.

WWflorlHKOCefzm0x8lizg.text: Had the chicken and shrimp burrito with jalapeno and cheese mashers. The burrito was tasty even though I did not taste any shrimp. It was also filling, so I did good and only ate half.  Saved the other half for Monday's lunch.  The mashers were happily recommended by our server, yet they were lacking seasoning. Hats off to Cabo for my being able to tell they were homemade ( or in disguise)mashed potatoes.  Bf and I also tried Azula Rita margaritas. Margaritas range from $5 to $12 and are $1 off on Sundays. It consists of OJ, pineapple juice, Blue Curacao and Jose C. Pretty tasty and bf ordered a second. ;)  Service was just ok and there was a not big crowd. Will be back to try some of the other menu offerings.

GhVdguT9zQmC_3OHEX7WQg.text: Super long wait, but worth it. You don't have to sit in front of the place. They will text you when your table is ready, so go to the bar next door and have a drink. Everything we tried there has been good. It's one of my favorite places to eat in Charlotte. The whole NoDa area is nice. Well worth eating here.

m0B2EeODwqHXsKXM7yzKJg.text: Get it together cabo. No one should have to wait for their whole party to arrive to be sat. You're lazy. Take a reservation like a normal restaurant. Tacky.

cruzTA_hbgLFg9Is3T9Tzg.text: 3rd time in, it's a must stop every time we're in Charlotte.   The BBQ Mahi tacos are a must have.  A constantly changing specials menu, great craft beer selection with a few local brewerys on tap.

g6JNM6yLwI63QGlE0Cvd0A.text: Best fish taco's in charlotte. Even better than any taco joint I've eaten at when I lived in SoCal.

Qdn2jQ7Q78QGrVl2EGdCnw.text: Decent food! Good service considering how busy it is. Average drink selection. I like the location of this place but it can get a bit crowded and noisy depending on the night. I feel like a bigger space would allow for a better experience since it is a hot spot in NoDa and let's face it: there's just not enough room for everybody! Still give this place four stars though, because these are just minor setbacks. The salsa is fresh and super chunky! Probably one of the best food items.

c9tsa9JRbNPZZcL6sNvhlg.text: BBQ mahi mahi tacos, are life! The salsa is amazing and pretty much everything i have tried, is great!

ldYaDclbu-lG-Xfjp2Porg.text: They are flavor scientists... Adventurous ingredients on each unique taco. Great place for a local beer and refreshing meal. Only downfall... When the bill comes. Pricey.

p9SKlxi1s-BBzgIU2p08Cg.text: Had the fish and chicken burrito at lunch.  Great taste.  The chips and corn salsa was a welcome change vs regular tomato based salsa.

4VRGSMmsiw0Q4bx7i7peXw.text: Great service great atmosphere and good food!!!! The mahi tacos and jalapeno mashed potatoes are good. Will come back and try the tempura tuna tacos

sGoGq9fXoo40cUGj-6919A.text: Best tuna taco I've ever had. The avocado pasta salad is really unbelievable as well. Hint, sit at The bar for immediate seating

jYyFi9DrmOo2cYPS4XipiA.text: One of the best and most unique places in Charlotte. I love the honey wasabi tuna tacos. Packed with flavor and always a lively place to hang out. I have never been disappointed in what I ordered. The corn salsa is also really good.

2VTWWl8U5CExJWfRtaJVrQ.text: I am a Californian and have great Latin American/Mexican cuisine everywhere I go in the Los Angeles County and beyond.  The East Coast just can't compete.  This place is a great place to eat if you are craving Mexican and have no alternatives.  Otherwise, I'd suggest you skip it and enjoy classic Southern Soul food.

U4us5jY8irWzRY4zQyp2gw.text: Absolutely loved it!  Great local tap beers and wonderful shrimp tacos.  I would recommend the grilled shrimp over the fried, but that all comes down to preference.  I hear it can get pretty busy on a Friday/Saturday night so I would suggest going for lunch or on a week night.  If you don't mind a crowd then go anytime!

sKxQdeGr1i4Ct9OaukWmWg.text: The food was just excellent and the service was great.  If I had one thing negative... The food came out so fast I had just started on my first beer.  Local beer as well.  I will be back soon!

b0Vswl4n51nXts7YVycCmg.text: I hate to do this, but I can honestly say I'll never go back. I've had a lot of fish tacos in my time, and they've run the gamut, from stellar to absolutely forgettable. And even the forgettable ones are okay as repeats if I'm really in the mood for fish tacos. But the Cabo tacos are just in a whole nother level of bad. The mahi mahi was so overcooked and dried out I could barely press my fork though it. Eating it felt like chewing through paper. The coleslaw was totally boring. And the cilantro cream was "meh."   I also ordered the nopalito salad which was unexceptional (more like a chickpea salad). The chips were stale. The salsa was extremely bland.   Yes, I'm from California where you can find the absolute best tacos, so I have to admit that small bias. HOWEVER the carelessness and uninventiveness with which Cabo is approaching their staple meal is unacceptable.  I just read in another review that the Food Network came here. What?!

QMUZM8d6vVA2H9E2VBhu2g.text: Like pretty much everyone else who has rated this place I'd be stating the obvious when I say that the tacos here are amazing.  This is a restaurant that I take my friends when they come from out of town.  Staff has always been very nice and helpful.

VfVo3Wf9uFVc5J_9rz8Xrw.text: Excellent!!! A perfect balance btwn the meat & sides. Usually you get too much of one & not enough of the other... Here... they have a balance, along w/the match of seasonings. My wife agrees, but also she said that the Margarita is a perfect size & a True blend of alcohol. Will defntly frequent them more often!!!

qVQ_U60e35phIUle4xRZDw.text: Cabo was on point! It was so tasty and well worth the wait. So fair warning, there probably will be a wait, especially on the weekends. But like I said, worth it!   The atmosphere is a lot of fun, very high energy and loud but not too loud where you can't hear yourself or others talk. The food was really good as well. Wei t the crab dip as an appetizer...omg I could eat this everyday all day! The chips, the dip, everything about this was on point. Then we split the shrimp tacos with avacado pasta salad..FYI if you can't handle spice like me, they can take the spice out of the pasta salad. Pasta salad was great and the tacos were even better. Soooo much taste in one taco! I can't wait to return to try some more of the items on the menu!

Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Queso

_I2IWN9dEjzODEYpPSyf4A.text: Cabo is a home run - every. single. time.  Located in the funky NoDa neighborhood, there's almost always a wait, but it's definitely worth it.  Fortunately, you can put your name in with the host and they'll text you when your table is ready.  While waiting,  grab a drink at one of the nearby bars or browse in the stores across the street.  If there's only 2 of you, take a look at the bar - you may be able to get a seat there.  There's a second bar in the room to the right - don't forget to look there!  Once seated, you'll be greeted with a basket of chips and a bowl of corn salsa.  If you don't care for corn salsa (though, it's d-lish), you can ask for another type of salsa.  Their guacamole is fresh and very tasty.  You also won't be disappointed with shrimp and crab dip - creamy, cheesy, seafood goodness.   My absolute favorite item on the menu is the Tavarua tuna tacos.  You get large pieces of perfectly cooked (medium rare) tuna topped with an amazing honey wasabi sauce - think sweet and spicy.  I also really like the salmon guacamole salad - they will cook the salmon how you like - rare for me - and it's done to perfection!    Whenever we have guests in town, I love to come here. There's something for everyone, but it's still unique and memorable.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sweet blackened tuna salad
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tavarua tuna tacos with beans and rice

_TL3zLyCS0Bdt6yau_Uo9w.text: Hip place in Noda-lots if atmosphere surrounding it-fun people watching and shopping place.     Best fish tacos in the area. 0out table Had grilled shrimp tacos, white fish tacos and ahi tuna tacos-all great. Avocado pasta salad as a side-local beer on tap.   Parking in the street. Casual and family friendly.

iWw8mLTcZTGtEyTXeLDvVQ.text: It's been a while since my last visit here...so long that it was probably before my Yelp days so needless to say this is my first review of the place.  I remember it being so much better than my recent visit.  This visit was a disappointment. The best thing about the visit was the jalapeno margarita but I think you can find better ones of those elsewhere in Charlotte.  Like most mexican or tex/mex places we were given the complimentary chips and salsa. The chips were stale so I wasn't really interested in dipping them in the corn salsa.  I ordered the Tavarua Tuna tacos with a side of their mashed potatoes mixed with jalapenos. The tuna and sauce were good. The rest of it was meh. The tortilla shell was rubbery. The mashed potatoes were only partially cooked and I've had better mashed potatoes at a 24 hour diner. My friend ordered the chicken quesadilla in which she offered me a taste and I thought it was quite bland.  I remember Cabo being so much better than this. I guess the appearance on Triple D went to their heads or something like that.

lYZX8I0hgytWO6_87fa2qw.text: I had the chicken & shrimp burrito. It was very good, though a bit dry i had asked for extra sauce to go with mine. My sides were rice and beans which was very good. The seafood crab dip is excellent and you get a big plate of it on the appetizer menu.

RngYCoBOez9yVjsVE6rRVw.text: I really wanted to eat here after seeing it was on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives but I don't think it was that special. The food was fine but it wasn't anything amazing. The staff were very friendly though.

yBDXrzx8SRLAyMAjVida2w.text: Best Fish Taco spot EVER! If you ever visit the Charlotte area this spot is definitely a must have and a must stop. The food was awesome. Service was awesome. Some of the best margaritas I ever had in my life.

O77Hp-R-QTUg0CWB7VZ-5g.text: Food was good as usual but the wait for our food was exceptionally long. We will be back the next time we come through Charlotte.

S2XqtzAKQZV9AVYgFF1cdg.text: Love this place! Every time I've gone, the service has been incredible and prompt. I love their quesadillas!

Vd_RCKc8oxJqif1uLktpiQ.text: I love coming here. This is one of my favorite places to eat when I'm near NoDa. As anyone knows, parking can be a pain but I promise you it's totally worth it.

9TydLbzKknVWSDjC7AO_QA.text: In my opinion, if you are a specialty taco spot and don't offer Home mad tortillas, you aren't a real taco spot! This place has homemade tortillas and the best steak tacos I've ever had! I had 1 steak taco and 1 shrimp taco and I devoured them both! The flavors of each taco are soooo different yet sooo delicious. If you come to the Noda area, be sure to stop here and grab a taco or three!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carne Asada and Lemon Shrimp Tacos

nfwZlJ5L8EEWUmNG8dqD0A.text: First time in this place. Cool vibe. Definitely hipster. Got the queso dip which I would highly recommend. The cheese had great flavor. For lunch, I got a steak quesadilla which was huge. Steak had great flavor and I'd get it again. Overall, it was a good experience and I would go again.

buZfwL1rpbrEAkk1_KlRDw.text: We were visiting Charlotte from out of town and came to Cabo on Saturday night for dinner... they quoted us a 30-45 min wait, so we went across the street and grabbed a beer. And they called us right away to get seated! So our wait was really only 5 min... but we weren't ready to sacrifice our beers - Cabo was understanding and put us at the top of the list when we finished and came back. Inside is loud, and they were busy! There were big groups there, and mostly younger people/couples but also families.   Ok no beating around the bush: THE CRAB DIP! We all agreed that this hands down was the best dish we had all weekend. The warm semi-soft/semi-fried pita chips were so perfect and the dip was so tasty! We were still talking about this days later. The chips were so so good and come with a corn pico. I was honestly full before dinner. Margaritas were tasty, not all that strong though.   I think our server forgot about us or forgot to put our order in because we waited an uncomfortable amount of time before our food came out. My friend (Charlotte resident) said food is usually super quick to come out! So our service was a little disappointing.   I ordered the fried fish tacos Because the restaurant is called Cabo Fish Taco so how could I NOT order a fish taco! Crispy and HUGE! I had to take a whole taco and most of my side home. I had the avocado pasta salad, which was decent. I don't really think it's "spicy" as it's named. There were just large chunks of jalapenos that gave it a kick but 95% of it was just a regular pasta salad! People on Yelp seem to love it but it was pretty ordinary to me! My date and friend loved their steak tacos! Definitely a good value for the quality/quantity of food that you get!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

d44qQIoxmIk199s0Tja75A.text: There's a reason Cabo is always packed to the brim with people - this place is delicious. As a vegetarian, I'm pretty pleased with their veggie selection. Their teriyaki-kiwi tofu is AMAZING. I was really blown away. It's a very unique flavor that they pull off marvelously.   A waiter will immediately bring your table chips and salsa - but be aware it's corn salsa and it's messy to eat and not particularly flavorful. I wish their fajitas came with avocado/guacamole, but that may be a personal preference. I also had a "skinny" margarita and it was the perfect balance of alcohol and lime and whatever else they throw in there. I'll be back soon!

enivc9cgSEXx4UMkEMMOTg.text: Came here after seeing it on "triple D" with Guy Fieri and he hype settled down. This place certainly did not disappoint! We were fortunate to have only a short wait, and even got a parking space right in front!   Loved the vibe of the place, reminded me of my old town Berkeley. A hipster joint and friendly crowd! My spouse had the fish tacos and I had the beer battered white fish tacos. Both were superb. I paired my white fish tacos with a nice local serving of Triple C Brewing 3C IPA, given by our hostess' recommendation. Stupendous.  Menu is extensive. I can't wait to go back and try something new!

_da0YpJnCJ9LyY9-QlQivQ.text: This place is a decent spot to get food if you're on Davidson Street, but honestly there are much better tacos in Charlotte. I say this, and I really want to like this place, but honestly, most of their food is lackluster, bland (or way too spicy/overseasoned) or greasy. Maybe I just haven't had good meals here, but no one in our party was blown away by the food...except the seafood dip and guac, those were both on point!   I ordered the battered fish and shrimp tacos (one of each), with a side of rice and beans. My shell was so greasy that it was almost translucent and all the shrimp and veggies fell right out of it. I spent more time wiping my hands than I did enjoying the taco. The shrimp itself was delicious, but nearly impossible to eat in taco form. The fish, on the other hand, spent a little too long in the fryer, and honestly, just tasted like oil. I didn't even finish that taco. My rice in my rice and beans was still crunchy and other friends at the table had the same complaint. The avocado pasta salad, was spicy, but flavorful, so that was a bonus. Drink wise, stick to beer, as everyone at our table felt the margaritas were heavy on the sour mix, rather than a balanced margarita. Overall, I've given this place three chances since moving to Charlotte, and I think it's three strikes, you're out. Sorry Cabo, but I'll be taking my taco cravings elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and whitefish tacos with a side of rice and beans.

ihrG4O4dBzUTMvLABoTlGw.text: My favorite is the lemon shrimp tacos with the spicy avocado pasta salad! Great service and margarita's!  Just don't park at the YMCA down the road!  IT cost us $125 . And we only left the car there 5 minutes because we saw the sign when we left. And went back to move the car. They already had a boot on it. Also then the guy said if we pay cash it would only be $100. My husband said I'm not putting $100 in your pocket. .

NR2HQh_RfFU9sQsQSsBndQ.text: This was amazing. Delicious food, excellent flavor and huge portions. Giant kids meals. Best fish tacos I've had.

OhPVFvsAYujKk_1Azhuciw.text: The tacos were huge! A meal is typically around 12 bucks or so but they are worth it! I had the steak and fish tacos ! They both had plenty or protein in them.   The seasoning was also good and their complimentary salsa can be a bit in the spicy side but also very good

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

82swKw0xzgA3Ugjug0fUJQ.text: Cabo is one of my favorite local places for Mexican cuisine - it's a little more upscale than your authentic Mexican place, but the atmosphere screams fun, social drinking, and good food. Plus, it's in the great Noda neighborhood, where the whole street is filled with great restaurants and bars you can hop in and out of.  The menu is very varied, and offers a mix of Mexican cuisine as well, with their infamous fish tacos. Very eclectic menu and atmosphere overall and great for groups. Their bbq mahi mahi fish tacos are probably my favorite dish (I usually always order fish) and their salmon comes very well-flavored as well.   The salsa that comes with the chips is very good and addicting, with their pico de gallo/corn mixture. I always get seconds and thirds. They also have a lengthy margarita list, if you are a tequila lover, which I assume you are if you are contemplating Cabo. !  Great spot for groups, beer drinking, or margarita drinking

835lv9--7Ec3EnG7MENyyw.text: Had the soy honey tacos. Loved them. First time there after hearing folks rave about the place for years. Didn't love the corn salsa that they give you upon arrival. I didn't like the avocado pasta salad. I love avocados but maybe I expected something different. The Pomegranate margarita was solid.  I also thought the prices were fair. Seating felt a little awkward initially so we changed our minds and opting for outside seating. I will for sure be back. The salmon was super fresh and the flavors were popping. I just have to find a side that I like - something light.

LlZzypOCLrGYh6mtB0wizA.text: Cabo is one of my favorite places in Charlotte to get tacos. One thing that sets them apart from other places is the taco shell. It's like it's fried first or something. I could literally just sit there & eat taco shells all day lol. They customer service is a hit or miss. Last time I went the waitress had a weird demeanor & she just wasn't all that pleasant.

LyJ8PxgSw9bfoDvwTdAmRw.text: Cabo Fish Taco left our group of nine with mixed emotions. While the entrees were amazing the service and chips were less than great. The hostess did not speak to us but simply pointed at the table and the chips were stale.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bbq Mahi Tacos

_YFtfkTKa9N3UvRt6sqvlg.text: Came in to Cabo's from out of town on my trip to Charlotte. The food was so incredible and our server was amazing! The salmon  I definitely recommend this spot for lunch!

WinnO1tOxZinBR3py_eCng.text: In town to take care of some businessing and needed to kill some time and let traffic worsen up a little. Thad suggested stopping in here for a bite and since he's the boss... Found not-unreasonable parking around the corner and here I am in recognition of Uno de Mayo! Landed at the bar because it's just easier that way; fish tacos plus black beans, rice and an iced beverage for a happily diverse luncheon... Start with too many chips and dish of corned salsa to make my meal seem more substantial. Chips are standard fare but crunchy so close enough (because it's not Cabo Chips.) corn salsa has a little bit of "howdy!" and I like it okay even though it tends to fall off the chips. Fish tacos were delightful and well mannered alongside the beans and rices; a fine example of peaceful coexistence in troublesome times. Can't really complain about crispy breaded whitefish chunks and all that vegetative stuff with a decorative swoosh of sauceage: just fishy enough to know it used to was a fish not a chicken. Black beans are hard to wreck and pair nicely with the rice; I'd prefer a pinch of cajun spice in the beanery but when that's my biggest problem in life we're looking pretty sharp.

mQ0ypdU0sa8H7Dc-8nWoTQ.text: Cabo fish taco is ok , it has alot of different choices . I've only been here twice so maybe I'm not trying the right dish, but there's nothing exciting here , especially with Sabor next door .   I guess this spot is good for groups and caters to more social eating with drink specials. If you're looking for mouthwatering, authentic seasoning , jaw dropping tacos, PASS. The carne asada tacos were lack luster and the fajitas didn't come out sizzling , "where they do that at "???? My son's chicken quesadilla was too spicy for a 3 year old . The food never comes out hot , it's always room temp, and my corn tortillas have always been hard and greasy.   Even though I'm not a huge fan, many are so give it a try , maybe your two experiences will be above average. *shoulder shrug*

I ordered the beer battered shrimp and blackened mahi mahi tacos with avocado pasta salad. The shrimp was fries perfectly. The crema was also very good. The mahi mahi was also blackene well and was very flavorful. Pasta salad was soso. The service was extremely slow as well. Overall a very good restaurant with decent drink menu.

LfqlUEiNusBJ6uE4nmDSlw.text: Time to give a great place it's due. I bring everyone from out of town to Cabo for a reason, it delivers every time. It's the Charlotte foodie capital and it deserves to be. Just order the BBQ Mahi-Mahi or the Beer Battered shrimp tacos, simply awesome. I tried the new Soy Ginger shrimp tacos and it was one of the best things I have ordered in this city. Oozing with flavor, I was licking my hand not to waste a drop. Haha, questionable. So a tip of the cap to Cabo, cheers my friends. Shout out to waitress who was boasting six tables on the patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Soy Ginger Tacos, mercy!!!!! Order this!!!!

oWMVqg-fO_wVoMRuVfMbUA.text: The staff is very nice, the food is really not. Had the guacamole which was to be honest, kind of nasty. Not-so-fresh (brown), tasteless mashed avocado in one small dish with pickled relish (huh?) onion and tomato in two others. So 1/3rd avocado that tasted bad to begin with. Would have sent it back but we were lucky to get it since it was so busy, Our meal took over 30 minutes to arrive, it was busy but that is still too long. The bbq mahi tacos had good fish, but were very spicy, and the tortillas a bit greasy. The rice and beans were soggy. Shrimp tacos were OK. Our waiter gave us our check before asking, so if there is dessert at the restaurant, we have no idea. I know this place is popular, but we will go elsewhere for Mexican. The city has no shortage.

dqrhoVbkO-9vC1GY7TCv5Q.text: Did a visit to Cabo today after having some craving for it. It had been a minute. It was not crowded and we were taken to our seats right away, but the full party did not want to sit outside. In most situations the hostess ask if you would like to dine in or outside. We told her that we wanted a seat in the inside, the hostess said it would be 20 mins. We didn't wait that long. The lady came and brought us chips with corn salsa. I asked for verde and they stated it was a charge. She did say that the regular salsa was no charge. The chips seemed dry with no flavor and so did the sauces. I ended up ordering the crab and shrimp dip, which was amazing. Our waiter was great and knowledgeable about the menu. I ended up ordering the chicken and shrimp burrito, which was supposed to have a white cilantro sauce with the mexican slaw. I don't remember tasting a lot of cilantro. The meal left me feeling like it was ok, which was not my norm with Cabo.

YamYwcyEdmqRDGuDqVtqQA.text: Looking for a fun spot in NODA to have a taco?  Cabo is your spot.  They have a variety of menu options that are all really good!  As a warning sometimes the wait can be really long because this is a popular spot.   When you are seated chips and corn salsa is brought out to the table.  They are both really good.  I ordered the lemon tuna tacos based on the waitresses suggestion and they were incredible.  I didn't eat my side because I was full off of the delicious tacos.  As a warning the shells are fried but they are delicious.  My husband got the blackened mahi and chicken corn tacos, and really enjoyed them!

gkQ60byb8odeCz0x6qSuGg.text: Okay, For starters I'm a Tex-Mex spicy kid, throw on a lotta cheese . By the ocean - Mexican food changes significantly from the Midwest.   Our server pretty decent and the atmosphere pretty laid back. Gotta tell ya - They like tuna!  Mrs. had the Ahi Tuna grilled on a salad. It was good, fresh and a chef's touch.  No complaints whatsoever on the Silver Margs!! Awesome!!  I had the Chicken/Shrimp burrito. It was okay. Their corn based salsa was semi-spicy, but the mild was too sweet.   Fun place Yelpers!

Gw9bfwjAmKNRWVYGzt6MlQ.text: I can't say enough good things about this place. My dad has worked in NoDa since I was little, and I'm glad to say Cabo Fish Taco has stayed as popular as it has. Whenever I'm home from college or in the area to visit family, CFT is my go-to place for eating out. It was first on my list of restaurant bars to hit when I celebrated turning 21, so I immediately ordered one of the azularitas, made with Sauza extra-gold tequila, Curacao liquer, pineapple juice, and the house marg mix...SO good (and it's blue, so double the fun).  Without fail I order the grilled steak signature tacos. The cabbage is an excellent addition that Cabo adds to their tacos that not many other places do; it's extra crispy and refreshing with the steak and cheese, plus the Cabo tortillas are unlike any other I've had- they're crisp and golden, but don't fall apart when you pick up your food. The baja rice is the perfect pairing with the tacos, and it comes with a delicious addition of mango-esque sauce on the top that prefects the sweet-and salty flavor of the rice.  They've got great corn and tomato-based salsa I blow through in minutes and have to order refills of every time (good thing it's free), plus great Dia de los Muertos-inspired art in their outside seating area and unbeatable service. They're packed almost all the time, but the wait time is never long and there are great little shops all around the street to look in while you wait, and parking is easy to find all up and down the street or in cheap lots tucked away behind some of the other restaurants.  I've been here at least 15 times and have never experienced anything short of greatness here. Hands-down my favorite Tex-Mex joint in the Queen City area.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak tacos, baja rice, corn salsa with chips, and shrimp tacos!
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak tacos with baja rice! The mango sauce on top of the rice is amazing.

i-E94AvsZ82nFWYjsDXslQ.text: Just when you thought that the Charlotte experience could not get much better. These fish tacos are amazing. We had blackened Salmon, lemon grilled shrimp and Tavarua Tuna Tacos. All amazing but the tuna definitely the favorite.  Also The perfect wave margarita was great, if you like a little bit more orange, if not then the nectar of the gods margarita is for you!!! One thing that could have been better was the Baja Rice  it came out like warm and crunchy.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lemon Grilled Shrimp Tacos with Baja Rice

vQg08o_6SOJ_OUnly8F7ZA.text: Go! The tacos are amazing! Start with the crab dip, you won't be disappointed! The service is great and the vibes are good!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Get the Tuna Taco and a beer...you can thank me later

qetZNACku8Qu8KdmvxmL2g.text: It's my first time in Charlotte (i'm from Virginia) and i've been following this Charlotte foodie page on instagram for over 2 years, and that's how i found out about Cabo Fish Taco. As soon as you walk in, you'll see it may seem small but it's actually pretty spacious and has a great atmosphere. When i sat down, i was immediately given chips and corn salsa - YUM! the chips tasted fresh and the salsa was sweet and had a kick. I ordered the queso dip - which I normally don't order when i go to get mexican food, but this one was really good. I also ordered the blackened mahi tacos. OH..MY..GOD, the tacos...they were amazing. the fish was cooked perfectly, tender and flaky-not dry, and the seasoning was perfect! I ordered a side of the mexi-slaw which was surprising amazing too. And i couldn't go without ordering a pomegranate margarita, AMAZING! This will definitely be my go-to spot whenever I come to Charlotte!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened Mahi - mahi tacos, mexi slaw.  blue container (left)- queso dip blue container (right) - corn salsa

rTZv514LQkXUwlhLvdiFXg.text: Sooo yummy seared tuna taco!! And the spicy margarita is perfect. Not syrupy ! Fresh and clean!

38_QJvNhK_Mw2oaK4pIZFA.text: Why are there not 6 stars available?????? During my years on this earth never before have I eaten such blissful food served by a thoughtful waitress by the name of Stephanie. I came here for lunch on a Wednesday since I've been craving some fish tacos and I'm so glad I did. Even for lunch, Cabo Fish Taco was fairly crowded, I didn't expect that at all. I thought we'd be the only table there. We found 2 seats close to the bar quickly though, and didn't have to wait.   I'm fairly adventurous and asked our waitress Stephanie to order me something excellent that would make me want to return for more and wow did she deliver.Our order was taken promptly and we waited about 10 minutes to get our tacos. I was blessed with the combo tacos containing Blackened lemon rubbed tuna in a kiwi-pineapple fajita sauce, stuffed with lettuce, tomato, mixed cheeses, & topped with their honey wasabi sauce as the first taco I devoured nearly biting the end of my index finger off ensuring one drop would not hit the plate. As for my second taco I was equally impressed with the Grilled mango BBQ Mahi-Mahi tacos stuffed with Cabo slaw, tomato, avocado, mixed cheeses & finished with their cilantro white sauce. For the price, the tacos are gigantic!  The tacos were delicious and cooked to perfection, the flavors of the fish blended very well with the salsa and white sauce. The mahi was grilled just right, and the fish meat just flaked right off with each bite. The tuna taco was nothing short of amazing and am at a lost for words to describe articulately how your taste buds will feel after this delight.  Its not often I run into servers that take guests comfort and needs as serious and personal as our waitress Stephanie and is a real gem for this establishment. I happened to meet their General Manager Chris and again a real class act. Its apparent to me that this place has extremely high standards in both selecting employees and the food they offer to their patrons. I will most definitely be returning at my earliest opportunity.  The music may have been a tad on the loud side for casual conversation, but then again I'm getting a little older and this may just be me. (nothing that would prevent me from returning to this Charlotte jewel!)   HOORAY Cabo Fish Taco you have won my heart!!!!!!!  Note: they DO take credit cards.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Moderately priced deliciousness!

E_86lVKuHBly-QjOnk9sTQ.text: Great atmosphere and food. Had a Serrano chicken salad that was superb. The skinny margarita was marginal.  The rest of our dinner party raved about their tacos and burritos. Definitely will be back.

O15-3ggJ914s-jTG3CpUtw.text: Lunch stop with a large group. No problems with getting in or with our service. Food was excellent and hot when served. Blackened Mahi Mahi and Salmon were phenomenal. The only thing I didn't like was the jalapenos in the guacamole. No worries though, they gladly brought out another fish without so it was perfect. Definitely a go to spot for lunch. Deron (Bartender/server) was attentive and on the money!

4bg8qJPCsWE4ZSrsIGPd7A.text: The fish tacos are brilliant! My wife and I went here for exactly that and have Zero complaints. The dish in the tacos is cut into large chucks and cooked perfectly, something uncommon for fish tacos elsewhere.  The tortillas are lightly fried but with no greasiness, only crisp and fluffy.  Ambience was good, nothing special there. Beer list consisted of national staples and some local fav's.  I even took my father-in-law here who is a fish taco connoisseur from CA and he said they beer better that any fish taco he's had in CA, including Rubio's.

FS1n6L8azFgO8BNgSOjp4A.text: You literally can't go wrong with anything in this place. Portions are huge by the way. The wait is always worth it. Beer is local and fairly priced. They could definitely charge more for the food & they don't - it's good food, a good time, lots of energy, and the best items. Overall win.

9xnum-N5lCgKvAORutx-2Q.text: That BBQ Mahi Mahi should receive a Grammy!!!   Great service by waitress and mangers were nice, as well.  They checked on us a few times.  Great experience

pVtz0M3Q0MP7tEURBnffhA.text: There's nothing to critique. They've figured it out. The causal atmosphere, the show stopping drinks, and the menu... it's delicious! The bonus- it is located in NoDa. Cabo Fish Taco is winning all around. No wonder they're featured on tv shows and in magazines. The honey glazed salmon taco is my personal favorite.

tKs4b-_twWP4gylc8QG2Jw.text: Very well priced tacos with great flavors also the staff is very friendly. The ingredients tasted very fresh, we also got a free bowl of chips and corn salsa. Tacos a bit messy "wet" but I personally don't mind too much.

5oLfR6QetQ4HLmXVyYP5zQ.text: Omg just go!!!!! This place is amazing! My husband and I have been to several Triple D's but this one tastes the cake! We have friends that have been to 35 Triple D's (Diners, Drive Ins and Dives) and this is their fave and I know why! We started well I started with an Azure Margarita "Blue" and it's the best Rita I have ever had! So smooth that I ordered a second one but this time pomegranate. They bring chips and a corn salsa to the table which is really good and light! We both ordered the 2 taco combo plate and they let you mix and match. My husband ordered shrimp and the lemon tuna and I got the steak and white fish. We both agreed that the white fish was the best. It was beer battered with like a tempura batter. Omg it was amazing! The shrimp had the same type batter! The steak was just ok..a bit tough. The tuna was fresh and flavorful!!! It was just good food! The taco shells are fried but soft not crunchy! This place is amazing!!!!
