WoQcXXQCCVCpeJuEyrVgMw.text: Cabo has done so well because it is one of the few watering holes in a trendy area--NODA has a really, really long way to go, and I've never been quite sure what the appeal is, but if you want a see-be-seen spot or a place to catch a taco and stale chips (why are they always stale? always.) after a yoga class at the Y, this works. It's loud, it's a place to say you went. The shrimp tacos are pretty good, but it's hard to screw up fried food.

CJTHbSZA8NFOeC1MD38tuA.text: Some of the best Mexican food and drinks I've had in Charlotte thus far. Their tacos are amazing and full of flavor. I had their beer battered tofu tacos. They were absolutely amazing! I'm currently salivating just thinking of them. The side of black beans and rice were delicious!   Drinks were fantastic: strong but sweet. Service was great, and atmosphere was fun and casual. I can't wait to go back over and over and over!

QA7YOr-Lj2JfFRYhv_2tYA.text: I love the food here its good not to mention very unique. Located in the NODA area so its funky artsy and really chill. I would recommend anything on the menu its worth a try .

E4dE5_Y6uYOUw4MDqptq9Q.text: Best fish tacos I've had, blackened mahi mahi, just right amount of heat. Service was great, server was friendly and knowledgeable on the food and beer.  Will definitely be going back.

p_8d4_PZDu29W58i21Zngw.text: 1 star for many reasons: SO LOUD, sat us outside and there's no vent that actually keeps cool air in, the salad was horrible, and the waitress was the worst ever.  I (did) love cabo fish taco but last night was a really bad experience. My friend got there minutes before me (so a table for two) and they refused to sit her. It was a weeknight (a Wednesday) at 7pm.  I got there and she told the hostess that we were both there and she then told us we would have to wait. Mind you, there wasn't a wait when my friend got there. So, we had to wait even more. They got our name and phone number.  10-15min later, they texted us so we came to the door. The hostess ignored us as her and her coworker were telling a patron about seating options for a large party. She looked at my friend (who she has now seen 3-4 times) with the look of "what are you doing here?" I've never seen such  a horrible waitress before.  Also, the salads are horrible. I got the tuna one and it was gross. Not worth the $12. Just stick with a margarita and queso.

CX2HiK3WZ4zY9eN5lOpWZg.text: My first ever fish taco, and it blew my mind.   First walking in, I thought the atmosphere was meh (too loud) and the service was also meh (too slow). The salsa was pretty good but nothing unlike the salsas I've had before.   But then my BBQ Mahi Tuna Taco came and I almost died and went to heaven. I was expecting fish tasting taco but it was the least fish tasting tuna I've ever had. The fish was cut into chunky cubes but cooked so the meat practically melted into your mouth. The best part was the tortilla.  The tortilla was made out of some sort of God-Bread that was both flaky and bready at the same time. It was almost pastry like and I need to know how to make it!   But anyways. You get my drift. Awesome, awesome, awesome food.

HvHsHDx69maVCw0gcERdOg.text: One of my favorite places to go in NoDa! The food is amazing and the staff is super friendly and attentive. Have to try the BBQ Mahi tacos if you go! Wouldn't have been on Diners, Drive Ins and Dives if it wasn't good! Today's visit was no different. Labor Day weekend and still the best stop of my weekend!

9b1xFtd9qfha5vZyNVwTbA.text: Guac is soooo creamy coool ! Great experience and funky vibe. Loved the music and decor. Waiters were fun and totally seemed like surfer dudes, like totally dude. The food was delish and sooo good. The salsa was so flavorful, it honestly tasted like they just prepared it before they brought it to the table. The chips were perfectly salted and so crispie and crunchie! Sooo good.  My 2 year old nephew was with us this day and he loved the food and also the MUSIC! He was partying and jamming out to some reggae songs while we ate. Got some cute videos of him. Soooo...if your 2 year old nephew is smiling and jaming out and snacking on chips, salsa, fish tacos and the alike, this place has got to be good!  4 adults, 1 child, and bill was around 60 bucks or so. Not terrible. We were stuffed and by the time we went to leave -- the entire place was packed and there was a line at the door!  This is saying something for a Sunday at 12 noon !  Check this place out - you will be glad you did! Oh yummm dude!

-QYstWSghLWF18qeDLGtMw.text: When I first moved to CLT, Cabo was one of my favorite spots. Since then, I've noticed a huge downturn in consistency and quality. The last two times I went, my food was cold and the dishes I normally order weren't consistent. With all of the new "similar" places opening up around CLT, there are several other better choices. Did someone say 'Sabor'?

XBY52ZDlO9U-TE4hlXMahw.text: The service was quick and the server knew the menu so was able to give a few great recommendations.  Drinks came out immediately and the food soon after.  I had the perfect wave margarita and was to par. The atmosphere is very casual and laid back, there is noise but not overwhelming. But most important is the food was amazing. Best taco every.  I had the grilled lemon shrimp and the tavarua fish taco.  AMAZING.  Happy. And full.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. More yum!

mirQwOqvVxb50mmsGqKzUg.text: still my fav taco place but try their spicy avacado pasta salad!! you won't regret it!

vYyfZcGVv9PKPp_qvxk4pQ.text: I'm a fan of fish tacos, so this place definitely hits the spot.  When I visited, I tried the Jerk Flounder Burrito and the Shrimp/Crab Dip appetizer.  Both were pretty tasty, but probably not any more special than dishes I've had before.  And,  don't expect the food here to be of any authentic Mexican quality.  I do really like the ambiance.  It's a nice casual place to go with friends, although it does get kind of noisy.  I've also heard that weekends are pretty packed, but I went on a Thursday night, and it was fine.

-M4kSppjwtisWqbXnoaL9g.text: I have mixed feelings for this place.  I've been here 2 times.  I got the blackened mahi mahi fish tacos and they were very good.  The avocado pasta salad is also very good.  I got the refried beans before and they are a meh.  The cheese dip is very good.  We ordered the guacamole today and we were not fans of it.  My husband ordered the bbq mahi mahi tacos and loved them but he found a fish bone in it..and he also found something mysterious and hard in his refried beans (it looked like a fish bone but I don't know how it would have ended up in refried beans!).  Also tried the tomatillo salsa the first time we went and it was horrible..the whole table couldn't eat it.  The corn salsa they bring out with the chips is alright.  Basically a lot of hits and misses but the main attraction (the fish tacos) are very good.  I'm just a little turned off by the fish bone and more so the mysterious hard thing in my husbands refried beans. I think I may stick with the fish tacos at Phat Burrito. They put mango salsa on it and also have a fresh salsa bar with at least 6 or 7 different salsas on it.

qERaHDEfSGybiZFQ8Hn-Dw.text: I can not, for the life of me figure out how/why Food Network came to this hole. I live within walking distance, and you couldn't pay me to eat here again. Tortillas are cold and chewy, STALE chips, nasty wanna be "real" salsa.  Fish tacos have no taste, shrimp tacos came out ice cold. They make you wait forever, service is meh..... Overall, I can't figure out how this place has stayed in business for so long. Maybe because it has become a "hip spot" for those without taste buds.

Zgf07hTwNsJTBOw_54-HMg.text: great queso with the white cheese.  great fish tacos.

z1MWSq-4qO7UbLAmYvf6BQ.text: Okay-tacos are delicious and the staff are super friendly...I didn't care for the ambience since it was a bit loud to carry on any conversation and one ladies bathroom for a packed place is ridiculous.....  Frankly, the tacos are the BEST so it doesn't matter if there are no available bathroom, loud music, long wait.. It is worth it :-)

Us-ICo9MZOLDO-IyVHlMSQ.text: The last time I ate at Cabo Fish Taco was probably 2007 or 2008. There must have bene a major management shift because after eating there tonight, I would never return again. The server was way too laid back and paid no attention to us at all. The chips and salsa are bland - ordered some cheese dip to kick it up, and the cheese dip was just hard, melted velveeta. We ordered the steak and fish tacos. Both were mediocre, at best. I had the mexi slaw, which was nothing to write home about and my husband had the jalepeno-chedder mashed potatoes which were cold and just plain awful. Our beers were VERY over priced as well. Overall, I will never go back there again. It's a shame, because a few years ago, I remember it tasting much better. Perhaps being on a food network show got to their heads because the quality has gone WAY downhill. Ugh.

QDbcEe4Nm-CSqCvfAAfQTg.text: I have been a regular at Cabo Fish Taco for the past 3 years. I've told friends and family about how awesome it is and every one wants to eat there when they come into town to visit. However, my opinion about Cabo has changed in the last 5 months. The food has became greasy and tasteless. My once favorite shrimp tacos are made up of overcooked shrimp and a greasy a tortilla shell. I just wonder if management has changed or what has happened because it's really disheartening to see such a great restaurant go downhill. I continue going back hoping I've just had bad luck but each new visit doesn't leave me feeling more hopeful.

yYdcHIc2Ou1P09YqDFqEbA.text: BBQ Mahi tacos are the best (when served hot). Service is always great. I have visited Cabo a handful of times and about half of the time my food has come out luke-warm or cold. This usually occurred during their busiest hours. I got tacos to go late one night and they were the best I have had out of Cabo. I guess the secret is to go during off-peak hours.

LNjeUHf3nSsG2ZjIfb-ZtA.text: Was very leery of a fish-taco place... but I am sold!!! I am trying to talk my other half into giving it a go...and I am betting he will be converted too! Went with a friend who knows all the out of the way, non-chain places to eat. Had the corn salsa-yum! Liked the beer-batter fish. Very crowded, not big on the "ambience"...but it was soooo good!

9PL86lqyx7rmI6bz9c8hEw.text: I have had some good experiences and some bad. Customer service tends to be unimpressive, at best. The first time I went there I was with a friend who lived in the area. Minutes after sitting down, one of the hostesses literally threw a piece of folded paper at my friend. It asked if she was not on a date, would she like to go out with said hostess. Super unprofessional, especially at the beginning of a meal. The second time, I asked the server if the beans were prepared or merely tossed in a dish, he responded "well don't all beans come from a can?" and walked away. Service the rest of the night was slow despite it being low volume and the server continued to be rude when faced with questions or requests. Will not be returning. Poor quality food and awful service.

c5eQTAOveSVF2oW1A-vfUg.text: First off, be prepared to wait.  If you go on a weekend night, you will definitely wait, most likely at least an hour depending on what time you get there.  But even though some previous reviewers might disagree with me, I thought that service was reasonably fast once we were inside.    Food was average.  As a vegetarian, I can't have their signature item, so no tacos pour moi, but I still judge places on their veg items.  And what I had wasn't bad at all, it was sort of a grilled California burrito with queso (Burrito Verde).  It was big and I took home a good bit of it.  Had a side of Jalapeno and Cheese Mashers, which was fairly bland.  But prices were fine.  Small but decent selection of beers on tap (Dogfish, etc. when I was there).  Overall, I would probably give this place a 2.5.  Though the food isn't great, they don't forget about the vegetarian.  And the wait should be expected.  But its just so LOUD!!!  Have to deduct some points for that.  If I wait, and deal with noise, and then the food is amazing, then its worth the trouble.  But though good, the food here just doesn't justify dealing with waiting/atmosphere.

OhOFX6NLGVm52OaUH-3cQA.text: I live in NoDa but tend to avoid Cabo because I have never really had a great experience there.  And I actually wonder what I am missing when I read other peoples rave reviews.  But I was working from home on Fri and some former co-workers were heading there so I decided to suck it up and meet them.  It was packed at 12:15 and even though the 3 others were there they wouldn't seat them until I arrived.  Seemed odd for a place like that but okay.  When our waitress came by she was very abrupt with us and kind of slapped the menus on the table.  Someone else came by and threw the chips and salsa down.  My main complaint with this place is the chips suck, like seriously w/o fail everytime I go there they taste stale and cold.  Do they keep them in a fridge??  Not good.  We split the crab and shrimp dip appetizer, it was good and they pita crisps they give you tasted fresh.  I had the shrimp tacos w/no cilantro sauce because cilantro  makes me gag!  I was offered some honey wasabi sauce and I accepted but never received it.  Oh well, the tacos were actually pretty yummy on their own.  I got a side of the fruit but didn't eat it because it looks like it was really old and had a congealed look about it, no thanks.  Even though the food was good, I still just can't really get into this place, the service, the bad chips, in the past really bad margarita's.  I would much rather hit up Revolution or Solstice if I choose to eat out around home.

BfDnmw8Iyl19NXEIaHvTlA.text: I've not been crazy about my last few visits to Cabo Fish Taco. The food is still good, but the servers keep getting grouchier and grouchier. The last few times I was there, it wasn't very busy, but our server was inaccessible and grouchy. Boo.

EaFomK1VAprN7hSdSB90jQ.text: Cabo Fish Taco is one of the most hoppin' restaurants in Charlotte and for good reason:  tasty fresh Cali-Mex (or Baja) food, cool ambience, fresh salsa, and its proximity to all the hightlife joints in NoDa.  However, the place is somewhat "tainted" by their reputation.  I've never been when it wasn't packed and the servers weren't rushing us to order.  Dont' get me wrong-I still highly recommend that people try Cabo.  Just try it out for lunch or whenever the gallery crawls in NoDa are not taking place.  I've had the taco salad with chicken and on another occasion, carne asada tacos-both of which were slammin'!  The carne asada tacos uses chunks of well seasoned meat-with onion, cilantro, and romaine lettuce.  I was exceedingly full after eating just two of them.  The salad screamed freshness as well; chunks of real chicken, romaine lettuce, and other fresh veggies and cheeses.  Mmm mmm!    if you dare go on a weekend night, please be gracious to the wait staff.  They work pretty hard and brought our food in a timely fashion despite the crowds.  If I could offer any suggestions to Cabo, I would tell them hire more wait staff for the weekends.  The service doesn't quite match the quality of food.  Perhaps they could open up the upstairs for dining as well.  Overall, I'm pleased to have a restaurant like this in CLT.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. carne asada taco and fruit salad

b5vXwnRPS53WTB859kjzOw.text: My favorite place to go for tacos and beer. The service is always exceptional, and the food is amazing. Must try if you haven't!

Rv2v0lmToxLHtSFQdZcufQ.text: I had my first fish taco when I was 18. That's way too long to live without knowing how great of an idea that is. Beer-battered fish has been a part of my life since the fish fries I went to as a kid, and taco night was always a DIY-adventure. So the two together can be pretty awesome. Or, like many things in NoDa, they can be trendy (and a bit pricey). Cabo Fish Taco's namesake is pretty good. They're not anything to sell my possessions for a surfboard over, but because I can't surf in Charlotte, I wouldn't do that anyway. I like the salsa blanca and how delicate yet filling these tacos are. Their queso takes a good hint of chipotle and is an excellent appetizer choice. Above all else, try the Mexi-Slaw, a chopped vegetable side that I like more than the traditional cole slaw. Since the place is trendy, one of the hot spots in NoDa, the way is long. Very long. It's relieving to be finally seated, but the place is so bumping that it's hard to really get anyone's attention. Once a server comes over, they're more than happy to help though. The scene's one thing, the food of the sea is another, and that's why I like Cabo Fish Taco but don't always want to go.

pLXmEKOVLCb-X91fES0wLw.text: have been wanting to go to this place every time i go to the Johnston YMCA.. but only coz i dint wanna bury myself in guilt for eating out just after gyming id drive past! yest finally hubby n me decided to give this place a shot! the place has a nice upbeat feel....rustic furniture and good music with dim lights give it a nice atmosphere! we ordered the pita points with guacamole! that was nice and fresh. then got the bbq mahi taco! oh that was yumm...i was excite dto taste the mango bbq sauce and the white cilantro sauce! am ot too fond of the fish taste being very evident in dishes...this was just perfect! we also got their dessert special..a white choc craneberry cake! it was heavemly..i licked the plate clean!

N-NOy0JTioTDjzFrKn4mLA.text: We have been there several time since we relocated in Charlotte 18 month ago. We have never been disappointed with Cabo Fish Taco. That place is great, has good fresh food, a nice atmosphere and friendly staff. You may have to be patient to get a seat that place is packed early for dinner during weekend. You'd better come for lunch, or for dinner on a working day to avoid queueing to get a table.

gjg9EdNidTRmrIfriZ_qmA.text: Great fish tacos.  I always pick at least one grilled option.  If you do 2 fried fish options, then it can be too much.  Pasta salad side is really good too.

N6oHo-Vn82NFyDSSJ5Ujqw.text: Their fish tacos are the best in Charlotte! SO DELICIOUS! And they always have a great draught selection. I LOVE CABO!

JiMNwmBJY_bWgGOvH49ThQ.text: I ate at CFT for the first time this week with some coworkers. Delish!! I had the chicken quesadilla, and asked for light cheese...it was perfect. Looking forward to going back soon!!

7xuDvHm_0Gcj-Rg-CFr9JA.text: for the record... cabo fish taco has never been closed due to food poisoning!!!!! you are thinking cow fish in south park!!!

DXg1WYKnZSnGK5WVQk149w.text: I love everything about Cabo, their food is beyond amazing. I have been a frequent visitor of the location in Blacksburg, VA and upon moving to Charlotte I was super eager to give this one a try as well. They have a slightly different menu but for the most part it's the same. I tried their sweet chili tofu tacos which was something new to me and they were amazing. I am usually not a huge fan of tofu but these were delicious and the sauce was sweet with a hint of spice but nothing overwhelming. My bbq mahi tacos were actually a spicier than the tofu. I always like to get their margaritas as they are delicious and they have a wide selection. There is normally a wait but the restaurant is a decent size and you usually don't wait as long as they say. Plus, it's totally worth it.

7_SO6jAKT4BNpDvAnpSDnQ.text: BBQ Mahi Tacos are the way to go!!!!! I got mahi two ways- one BBQ, one blackened. The BBQ was incredible!!!!!! I didn't love the pasta salad side.

4gOwujnmOaHU4d2fy_Uncw.text: Good spot for a good cheap dinner. Although typically there's a long wait and it can be tough to have a conversation in there due to the loud noise, it's a good spot for dinner and drinks with friends. There are lots of combinations and choices of tacos, including very good fish tacos.

Atb-js-i1HCjNqB-gze3Hw.text: Had lunch here today. The tuna tacos were fantastic and the chips and salsa were some of the best I've ever had. Had the cabo toll appetizer and it was good but honestly not needed with the free chips and salsa.

hSLSjAeDhir3sMtaQmMtfA.text: The food, service and atmosphere are great here. As a visitor to Charlotte I am only sad that I cant eat here every weekend!  But when I do visit, its on my list of must do's!

08ehXBSLucaCe2SQIY9EQg.text: As advertised. Great tacos, service was prompt and friendly. Will be my go to place in the area.

redsw5pn1m3673ekccm9lQ.text: Was just down here on vacation, and I will be going back next time I am in Charlotte. This place is just simply amazing for food. I had some shrimp tacos that I loved. The app I had was average, and the beer selection was average as well. The waitress was just above average. If they just improve a few things, this is a 5 star place, but the food enough is reason to come back!

iq_M1vvCRXpB7JT3dxITkQ.text: Eat here at least once per month for lunch. Love the fresh salsa served with the drinks. Always order special fish taco of the day. Today was SeaBass with a mango salsa. Great as always.

yFMFl45DpjBOP1Yc_L5Amg.text: We've been to Cabo Fish Taco several times. It's usually ok. Not terrible food, but surely nothing spectacular either.   (disclaimer: my first fish tacos were eaten in Tulum, Quintana Roo, Mexico...most wonderful thing ever.)  We went with a group, 6 in all, on Saturday. We arrived about 2:20. Sat, ordered drinks and crab dip. Enjoyed drinks and crab dip, and ordered food, only 5 of us ordered food, all tacos.  then we waited...and waited  .......and waited  ....................still waited.  About an hour after we ordered the waitress said our food would be ready soon.  30 minutes later we asked her again.  It was ANOTHER FULL 30 MINUTES before food arrived, cold and awful.  They said that their computer system was broken, but somehow they were able to fill every other table's order. We saw others seated, fed, and gone.  And the food...cold, how do you cook something at the last minute, but deliver it cold? Our mashed potatoes wouldn't even melt the cheese. The tacos were just...just...there aren't words for how much it sucked.  We were in the restaurant until 5:00. Now, I'm all for leisurely eating...but not for this.  They did discount our food, but that wasn't the point really. We would have been more than happy to pay full price for a decent edible meal.

3GtYrA3vJCptdAZnl5AdOQ.text: Every time I go to Cabo, I am exponentially satisfied with my decision to have done so. Their food is exquisite, and I would gladly eat anything covered in their wasabi sauce. Never a disappointment.

r0tkChjI3kk257dDH_9VMA.text: Visited Cabo Sunday at 1:00 PM. Place was packed to the gills. Got seated (party of 7) in less than 7 minutes. Service was incredible, food was expertly prepared and beautifully presented and we were served faster than McDonalds. I was amazed at their organization which flowed gracefully our entire visit. Our waiter never let our glasses get low but didn't hover. He was very kind to our 2children and treated everyone with upmost respect. I would give Cano 7 of 5 stars if I could. This was many of our parties first visit but you can be sure we will return every chance we get. Their creative,relaxing, decor and attention to detail is a True gift to NoDa and great reason to visit this part of Charlotte. I can't wait to visit other businesses in this part of town. CUDOS

5SYvFF5K4whhK4tnloi1vg.text: Thanks to other yelp reviews,we knew to arrive early to score a seat at the bar (5:45 sat nt)   and we did! And not moments later the place was packed,like 1 hr 45 min  wait  packed.       Since we scored such golden seats we took our time ordering.  Red stripe for my friend,dos equis draft for me and queso dip to share.  I could have licked the bowl of queso clean it was so good. The free corn salsa was good too. Mild like alot of reviewers mentioned but its fresh made and FREE!   She ordered the tuna burrito and I got the tuvaroo(incorrect spelling) with jalapeno mash -  both were excellent. Prices are just right too. The honey wasabi was different and delightful :)    the bathroom(right behind our seats) was nicer than expected and matched the nice decor of the restaurant.  Oh and the host at the door was sooo nice,he made us feel right at home when we walked in.  reminded me of one of my fav  new orleans restaurants, Cabo fish taco is a gem!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Epic tuna burrito/corn salsa

xXgqIeTjm_LBURV4AlTwDA.text: I thought every thing was incredibly bland and pretty boring.  I had the blackened mahi mahi tuna tacos with rice. Not hot/spicy at all. The chips were good, as well as the guac but the corn "salsa" left something to be desired.

UFk_1adkzvnJJ-wnmQnelA.text: So yum!!  Good casual vibe; reggae music playing and an outdoor patio for people watching.  The Cabo Roll Appetizer was filling...should be shared for 3 or more.  I actually REALLY liked the corn salsa w/cilantro & diced tomatoes...it was refreshingly different & more sophisticated than a typical red salsa from a jar.  Beer Battered fish tacos were just ok...put your money on the tuna or the bbq mahi tacos.  LOVED Loved Loved the Tavarua Tuna Tacos...I came in thinking that the seared tuna thing has been cliched to death, but their tuna tacos had a really nice flavor, enhanced by their wasabi tuna & kiwi-pineapple fajita sauce.  I think I'm in love.

r6TV_1Gtqv_kGKUjdTB43Q.text: Really great! Casual atmosphere. Had the BBQ mahi tacos and honey wasabi mahi burrito. Excellent.

aKzEYfjnnf6xb5iyLAp4TA.text: Hmmm... I wanted to like Cabo so much! But sadly, my sister and I's visit on Friday night fell short from the get go, but wasn't a Pompei-esque meltdown either.  I believe the sour taste started as we waited about 2-3 minutes for anyone to notice us standing at the "wait to be seated" sign, despite the place being 3/4 empty.   When we got seated, it was obvious our poor waitress was having an off night for whatever reason, but she dropped some chips and "salsa?" with us, and took our orders in a decent time frame so all was well with me. Now the "salsa" is DUMB. Lacking in flavor, tomatoes and spice, this is basically a cup of corn with a few diced tomatoes and some parsley on top. At least that's what it tasted like. Seriously, bring me some damn salsa, none of this corny junk. Turns out though, if you want some salsa, cough up $3.95 and expect it to be green. :'( Not cool, IMO!  I got the BBQ Mahi Mahi tacos and it was moist and a good portion, but the white sauce everyone is commenting left me asking "where is it?". I mean, it was definitely on there but I couldn't taste a thing. Sad day. My sister chose the steak wrap and she didn't say a word from first bite to last and that says it all! :D  As sides, she got black beans and rice which she didn't eat much of, and I tried the jalepeno mashers which are basically chunky mashed potatoes with diced jalepenos and unmelted cheese on top. Weak attempt at a side, guys. Get with it.  For $20, it was ok but I won't be rushing back soon.

XHndp0dJoNcTUB8qnW5G6A.text: I was there on a Thursday.  at 7:30, there was a 20 minute wait for us (party of two).  I thought the nachos were a bit stale, but overall, it was a great night.

tY2ReOPe5qjxSMPuKPAQdg.text: Ordered a few different dips and appetizers.  The crab dip with pita chips were AMAZING but the guacamole was less than impressive.  It tasted like processed guac...nothing fresh about it.  I've had the fish tacos with a fruity drink in the past and they were delicious.  Great atmosphere and food overall!

M8aowdrOi5Mhk6zytsuheg.text: I seriously don't know what all the craze is about.  I tried the beer battered fish and the salmon (sauce made it better)... edible not fantastic.  Sides are bland. No pictures... wasn't worth my camera space.

ktzeVIvHZVCsjeWPPcsV2A.text: Favorite place to eat. We don't get there as often as I'd like, but this is a superb place to go. The vibe I have always gotten is very island themed...Bob Marley'ish. The food is awesome. The atmosphere is very open. Gets super crowded at peak times.

l4-hYMMKcKNpvek051sfMQ.text: By far the most famous restaurant in NoDa no thanks to some famous tv show I'm sure you already heard about. If you want to know if they play up to the hype then just look outside literally any night and you'll see groups of people waiting to grab a table.   Their taco game is on point here ... notice the name. You can't go wrong ordering them. Just two tacos with a side will probably fill you up! I've been branching out and trying new things recently like their burrito which was great!   Prices aren't bad and they have good beer specials too! Don't hesitate to ask your wait staff for suggestions!   Setting reservations for weekends is probably your best bet but during the week I wouldn't expect a huge wait if it's less than 4 people. They have a solid amount of indoor seating and probably about 8 tables on their street side patio. Perfect way to start a night in NoDa!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

vsJzL5qhpFEhcTZvDBd3OQ.text: Best tacos I have ever had! This was my first time here & the server really helped me navigate the menu. I was interested in the tacos since I hear they're famous for them :-) Best part about their tacos is you can mix & match any two, which is great for someone like me were its hard to decide between two!   I ended up getting one of the salmon tacos & one of the tuna. I can't stop raving about how great they were! From the taco shell to the seasoning to the delicious meat inside, everything was excellent. You can also choose one side & I got the spicy avocado pasta salad... I was curious with this one, but once again did not disappoint!   I highly recommend this place and its conveniently located next to other fun pastry shops & bars. For parking, you're looking at street parking or there is a lot in the far back that you can pay the meter.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. The salsa you get at the beginning, before your meal comes out
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tuna taco &amp; salmon taco, highly recommend both!

ZfUnbQLfP6FSx0heAF8N9Q.text: Waited for 15 minutes for someone to wait on us. The hostess brought us chips & corn salsa said there was a mix up with the wait sections. She then sat customers next to us who were waited on immediately. Not one of the waiters bothered to even look at us. We just left and went somewhere else. Great first impression.

Rke7-51xoiLrdPpEbnmVGw.text: Who doesn't love a good taco?! They have so many options, and they aren't just good for the tacos either. (The wraps are worth a try)  They deliver you chips with a house made salsa( corn as the base), complimentary.   Every-time I go I try to explore the menu and get something different, and My palate has yet ti be deceived!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened Swordfish.

xRmC6nS2aDYODmxd3wgwag.text: We tried Cabo for lunch on a busy Saturday, and it was awesome. I've heard many great things about Cabo, and the food and service exceeded my expectations. First off, the complimentary chips and salsa were very good. The chips were fresh and seasoned well. The fresh corn salsa/pico had a lot of corn and had a nice crunch to it; it's different from your typical tomato based salsa.   For my entree, I ordered the speciality ahi tuna and teriyaki salmon tacos with Mexican cole slaw. Both tacos were fantastic. The tortilla was lightly fried and was a little bit greasy, but hot and had a slight crunch. There was a very generous amount of fish chunks, and they tasted really fresh. The ahi tuna had a nice sear and was rare on the inside, which is a must. The light sauce and wasabi complimented the tuba very well and made it a great taco to eat. The teriyaki salmon was also super flavorful and a great Japanese taste to it. The tacos with the slaw and chips were filling and great to eat.   Overall, I would highly recommend Cabo as a great lunch spot because it's not as busy as dinner. The fish tacos were excellent and a must try. The fish tasted fresh and were served in huge chunks. I would definitely come back next time I'm in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Teriyaki salmon and ahi tuna
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lemon shrimp and BBQ mahi

bNlC8rdvLyIVpfesTYd5pg.text: This place is amazing. The corn salsa they bring at the start is addictive.  I have never had anything that I didn't like.  Some of the dishes, like the burritos and wraps are huge - definitely enough to share. I love the tacos - all of them.  Place gets really packed, especially on weekends so plan ahead.

JVeksNeW4NsrKlQU66W6Dg.text: I feel this review might be too generous but I always come back to this place. My concern is every time I have any type of fish from here it has a fishy smell. Meaning the fish most likely isn't fresh. I decided on the Carne Asada tacos and they weren't too bad. The atmosphere is the reason I come back. There is no dedicated parking.

xxqbbDAuX7wgsalzgcDZzw.text: I just got home and began having severe stomach cramps. Now I'm having so much diarrhea and have broken into a sweat over my entire body. I think the fish taco was old and spoiled. UPDATE: My mom also tasted some of my beer battered white fish taco. I asked her to bc it was bland and not at all crispy. She thought it tasted ok but not very good. This morning, she informed me that she TOO had diarrhea all-night long. I got little sleep as one does in these horrific situations. However, there is good news to this story I'm on a diet and want to lose 20 lbs. Because of all the bodily fluids lost , I weighed this morning and was DOWN 1.5 LBS !! THANK YOU CABO for helping me get closer to my target weight!! You guys are the best . Maybe I should come to Cabo every week. HERE'S WHAT I EXPERIENCED: food was subpar and not worth the price. This place is militant when it comes to the subject of straws. They do not and will not have plastic straws ever. On a chalkboard inside the restaurant there is a hashtag that literally says , #nostraws (I didn't see that until way after our encounter). If you ask for a straw- the server jumps on their soap box about plastic and its' evil ways. I'm an environmentalist and know it's an issue. However, the LAST THING I want to happen when I'm dining out at a very expensive restaurant with people who are close to me and others I want to impress is a waiter / waitress making me feel guilty and belittling me because I have a sensitivity to ice and need a straw. THE GROSS PART: I stood my ground and still asked for a straw. The server smirked at our table and handed us recycled plastic straws with no covering. I envisioned so many hands def. not all clean touching all parts of the straw before i sucked on it. I had no choice but to use it (sensitive teeth). I had to accept it. I'm 10000 percent sure that it's not sanitary . I don't think that would pass inspection either. Myself and my entire table (4 people total) were all so disappointed. I felt awful because I was the one who picked out Cabo due to the positive reviews. When we left at 6pm - the entire restaurant was full. I'm confused about the popularity. It's really strange. I want to forget the whole ordeal forever.

e4sAyzIP5cW6SWl9ubhMLA.text: The tacos are well worth the two hour drive! I'm literally writing this review because i need this place to stay open, So I can come back.

6a0hpEHCLXEKE67IYSuHTg.text: Always one of our favorite date places. Honey soy salmon and bbq mahimahi are on point! Seasonal jalapeno cheddar mashed potatoes were good, I would rather have fresh jalapenos over pickled, but still good.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Always delicious!

OtHimvNyb4YzciqlCWQ85w.text: The mahi mahi fish tacos were great. Definitely reminded me of the first time I ever had one when I was in San Diego some years back. Bar tender (can't remember her name) made a good pomegranate marg and gave me some recommendations for places to check out while I was in the neighborhood.

AOM8veYAQDp-UWUIRirbqw.text: Based on the reviews and info from Diners, Drive Ins, and Dives, we decided to head up to NoDa to try out Cabo. Stopped by on a Wed evening and it was still pretty happening. Laid back and trendy scene. Good menu overall. We tried the salmon, tuna, and carne asada tacos. All were good and the service was fast and friendly. There's a pay parking lot just to the NE of the restaurant across the street. $5 covers you until the weekend hours of the morning in case you decide to explore other bars in the area.

psWJHdMYMc34Ac1aHH5wnQ.text: Was really excited to try this place but was not impressed at all. Maybe the expectations were a little high but I probably wouldn't come back.

3F8wP7ayWd1w3B6050l8pg.text: We were really not impressed, especially for the price. The "cheap" margarita (for $6 - not cheap) was weak and tasted artificial. Lemon shrimp tacos were absolutely ok. If I had just gotten those for about $6-$8, I would've been content. Unfortunately side dishes were quite bad. Slaw was honestly the worst I've ever had, very bland, and boyfriend did not eat his rice & beans for similar reasons. Boyfriend brought the carne asada burrito home because he felt the steak was good but that the whole thing needed to be reseasoned.

bdnjIqUFTNxBTYG6rgPyyA.text: Cabo Fish Taco, not sure where to start.  It has been probably 10 years since my last visit and I remember thinking it was just ok, nothing great. And, after returning this year, I can clearly say I am not missing out on anything. Cabo Fish Taco is just okay...just don't get what all the hype is about. We arrived shortly after 7 on a Monday night and did not have a wait, which was great. We were seated in the new addition of the restaurant (which may not be so new, but since the last time I was there). It is definitely a great addition to the location, very open with a full bar and multiple tables. Monday nights they offer a Margaritaville Margarita for $5.00 so we started with those and were brought chips and salsa, which is corn and tomatoes.  This is the one thing I remember people love about Cabo, not me. It is okay, but no flavor. Needs a little salt. And the chips, they are chips. Not hot, don't seem fresh and need salt.  I ordered the Chicken Quesadillas with a side a refried beans. The quesadillas were good, grilled perfectly with melted cheese, chicken and peppers and onions. The peppers and onions definitely could have been cooked more. As for the beans, blah. Wouldn't bother with those again. My friend ordered the Tavarua Tacos and was not impressed. He also ordered the jalepeno mashed potatoes which sounded really good but said they were nothing great.  So, I remember why I hadn't rushed back and don't anticipate going back anytime soon. However, I thought our server was very sweet and definitely thought her service and the timing of drinks/food service deserved three stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Side of Refried Beans
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Quesadillas

szLKIbUKRCiYbJ0qzfQ-aw.text: Great lunch today. We were seated immediately. Clean atmosphere. The food took a long time to be served but it was worth the wait. We got a burrito and 4 different tacos, along with a side of guacamole. Everything was delicious. Our server was friendly and attentive. The restaurant is in a great location.  We will be back!

M6KC_XIRz9wdH2dJMB7jsg.text: This place is so good! I LOVE the Tavarua fish taco with the wasabi soy sauce. Yum!  The avocado pasta salad goes great with it.  The waitresses and bartenders are also very nice. This place was featured on "Diners, drive- ins and dives" TV show and for good reason!

wkBFCRUzShmZ_7SoyNuAhQ.text: One of my favorite places for tacos and margaritas. They seat you fast and it's great for a group. A lot of their food is on the sweet side which isn't my favorite but get the shrimp and ahi tuna tacos. THEY. ARE. SO. GOOD. Also 2 tacos is plenty, I usually can't finish the second one. The pomegranate marg and the one with blood orange  so yummy. Loving coming to this place

1iMmO9RiqBZiXyyvsKx5UQ.text: Wow..... just wow. The ginger soy salmon taco is amazingggggggg! I'm going to be craving this for months to come. I also tried the bbq mahi mahi which had amazing flavor but the mahi was a little tough. Not sure if they are but the tortillas taste homemade. The avocado pasta salad was also incredible. I sat at the bar and the bartender was really pleasant and helpful. They also give you chips with a spicy corn salsa as soon as you sit down-I will definitely come back the next time I'm in Charlotte!   Sorry for no pics...my phone shattered the day after I came here and they're all gone. :'(

3vaAdp7RA1tRIJjovJm_vw.text: It's not easy to feed a bunch of hungry pirate's, but Cabo did an excellent job. We had a large group and some arrived later than others, but the restaurant was very accommodating and stayed on top of things all through the night.   The food is wonderful. I love the complimentary salsa. Tons of flavor and love the sweetness of the corn. For my meal, I had the lemon shrimp tacos with rice and beans. The tacos were good. Plump shrimp and a really nice sauce with crisp veggies. The rice and beans were okay for me.   Service was great! I didn't catch our server's name, but he was wearing a red Star Wars t-shirt. He was very friendly and did a great job!   This is a very cool restaurant to visit when in NoDa.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lemon grilled shrimp tacos

y9FDsXOMiBIlyEmiBzR9JA.text: I was referred to this place by a few people and many people said that it's the best taco place in North Carolina if that is True me and my husband are very sad because even though it wasn't the worst food I've ever eaten it definitely is not the best. The beans and rice had absolutely no flavor I couldn't even eat them they were so bland the shrimp was pretty good and the taco but the chips they give you are stale the corn dip doesn't have much flavor either and my daughter wouldn't even eat the quesadilla. The beans and rice had absolutely no flavor I couldn't even eat them they were so bland the shrimp was pretty good and the taco but the chips they give you are stale the corn dip doesn't have much flavor either and my daughter wouldn't even eat the quesadilla

0ies0UZIpZ1pAARf5SPpdQ.text: I Love this Place! Good taco's, Good food and fresh, Great part of town, service is really good and friendly. I Would definitely recommend this place.  As recommendations if you live outside of uptown, do yourself a favor park near the light rail and take the train up and get off at 36th Street Station and walk a few blocks up, that way you do not have to worry about traffic, parking or anything else. When you finish walk down a few blocks to heist Brewery and sit and relax. ENJOY!

aVRhjbBLBeieQwoWZYK8Og.text: Meh, i came here 3 years ago and i remember having really great food.  This time around I was really disappointed.  The drinks were weak, my food was just okay ( even after i sent it back for being cold).  The service was really good, the kitchen and the bar failed us on this trip.  Unfortunately this will probably be my last time at CFT.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp fajitas.  Weak and poor presentation.  I wouldn&#39;t recommend at all.

RoEql4kL_Bmr1zxTDX4mDQ.text: It's been a hot minute since I've been to Cabo and last night reminded me why I need to go back anytime I can . The chips and corn salsa is always a crowd pleaser and I washed that down with a nice Dos Equis Amber! . . Then it was showtime and I ordered some beer battered Soy ginger shrimp tacos with jalapeno mash potatoes, and wow! As soon as I bit into these tacos the flavor just exploded and the shrimp was so perfectly cooked and tasted delicious.  . Cabo always delivers great service and is quick witj getting the food out, plenty of room and also a great view of the noda area! Go check them out!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp tacos with jalapeño potatoes
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chips and corn salsa
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Table area

4GJ-6gnDA6pM66K4KVd0gQ.text: I saw this place on a list of the best Mexican food in each state, this was it for North Carolina.  I also saw that they had been on DDD.  Once again, coming from San Diego, I am still looking for a really good Mexican restaurant in the Charlotte area.   We arrived for a late lunch.  It was busy but not super packed.  Service started on the slow side.  We waited a while for the chips and salsa and drinks.  They delivered their corn salsa and chips.  I like corn salsa.  This one was ok, not spicy and not enough flavor.  My husband asked for regular salsa.  That actually had more flavor and spices.  I preferred the regular salsa.  The chips were on the stale side.   I ordered 2 tacos, a bbq mahi and a soy ginger shrimp.  The mahi was ok, it had a weird flavor and maybe were cut too big for a taco.  The soy ginger shrimp was good.  It had good flavor and would have tasted good with some steamed rice.  The tortillas were on the dry side so I skipped those.  I ordered rice and black beans for my side.  The beans were good, but the rice was bland.  My husband had the ahi and the beer battered shrimp.  He liked both minus the hard tortillas.   Service was fine after the slow start.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beer Battered Shrimp and Lemon Grilled Wahoo
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Close up of the Soy Ginger Shrimp
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Close up of the Bbq Mahi Tacos

ynpJsvwv2bL7cGvKlfIYkg.text: I came in Solo Dolo on a Sunday to honestly see what the hype was about. I get it now lol. You can mix any two tacos. My favorite was the Honey glazed soy salmon. So fresh and savory!! I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Honey Glazed Soy Salmon and Beer Battered White Fish Tacos

XkEX0ohOE32vhVYOPW9IWw.text: Cabo Fish Taco is worth the hype. From their salads to their tacos - there's not a bad decision on the menu. Run don't walk, and get the jumbo margarita!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tavarua  Wahoo Tacos

9s2mmthyO478A9dCJxERmg.text: After hearing about this place for years from Charlotte locals, I finally had the opportunity to dine in today for lunch. The place is located on a busy street where parallel parking is a necessity if you want to dine. The ambiance had a "chill vibe" boasting Bob Marley music and service people in casual wear. The menu was overwhelming and everything looked delicious.   TBH, I am hesitant about fish and fish tacos, but my waitress encouraged me to try one. I ordered the honey soy glazed salmon taco with a carne asada taco. It was perfect! My friend ordered the BBQ mahi mahi tacos, which she always orders, and I tried it. Great choice.  Our sides were avocado pasta salad and jalapeno mashed potatoes. 10/10 would recommend.   You must order the delicious crab dip. It is hot, cheesy, delicious, and served with warm Parmesan crusted pita bread slices.   Lastly, I ordered the pomegranate margarita. Great, but unsure if worth $9.   Service was fantastic. Our waitress was honest, attentive, and personable.

Yhw_s0tQbvjBVPtXN8kPYA.text: Cabo Fish Taco never ceases to impress me. I have been going Cabo Fish Taco for over 9 years now and it's still one of my go-to spots.   Although I do think food/menu is better at the Blacksburg location, I also love the Noda Cabo. The menu is well priced and haven't had anything that I haven't enjoyed. I love the margs, they have a few good options to choose from.   The location is great with indoor and outdoor(covered seating). I would definitely recommend stopping in if you haven't tried it yet!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mango Taco (special)
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

5SlsrrBzCXOtYVNNXRBI_A.text: I went on a multi-state trip for a week and this was my favorite stop! These tacos are soooooo good. The free salsa they put on the table is yummy and starts you off wanting more. I shared two types of tacos with my friend and we were very full once we finished.  BBQ Mahi-Mahi Tacos- lots of flavor, was a bit nervous about BBQ fish but loved it Tavarua Tuna Tacos- super fresh and light  I would probably order the same thing again if I ever went back because it was such a good balance. All of it was delicious!  The only bad thing thing I will say is about the avocado pasta salad... that just should not exist. Please do not order it.

SqGJmIcJZ9yUCEA2_w1ggw.text: To put it simply... super good tacos. Highly recommend. The wait can be a little long sometimes, but it's worth it for sure.   The restaurant is in a really cool neighborhood with lots of shops to visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

-dARw0n1qjzuiMqFf-LGPw.text: Such excellent fish tacos.  I had the blackened salmon & ginger shrimp- both so yummy & filling.  The retried beans were just okay.  The blackberry margarita was the right amount of sweetness but I hoped it would be blackberry colored.  (Their mix made it red so I assumed there was other juice in there.)  Comfortable space in fun NoDa but a little loud for conversation.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp Taco, Salmon Taco, Retried Beans
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackberry Margarita

uiKjeDVoyzyKVb1ELZGdew.text: Just moved to Charlotte and love to check out the local places to eat! Someone recommended Cabo Fish Taco to me and I took the leap of faith! I'm in love. You have to try it! I had the Honey Soy Glazed Salmon Tacos and they were to die for!! The bartender, Mary Grace, is amazing. Fun, outgoing, and very helpful. Looking for a local Mexican place with awesome tacos and cool staff! Try Cabo Fish Taco!!

PvZWwKZQZUOAA_qaMqYBvw.text: Wow! I heard great things about this place from a friend and it met the expectations. Cool section of town and neat looking storefront. Relaxed and open setting inside and an amazing waitress kicked off a cool lunch.  Started with a delicious local beer even though their margaritas looked tasty.   I went for the mahi tacos blackened with a side of the jalapeno mashed potatoes. Waitress brought us some corn salsa with amazing homemade tortilla chips. Corn salsa isn't my thing but still tasty with a bite.  The tacos came out and were filled generously and seasoned amazingly (that's a lot of adverbs). Tacos were amazing and filling. Potatoes not bad but tasted like instant but I actually love instant potatoes.   We also got a guacamole app which was fair but I'd skip the next time.  The star was the tacos and therefore, so good they earn the 5 star rating. Don't miss this place.  This is a bit off the beat and path but easy trip from light rail or a quick Uber.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened mahi tacos
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Street view

CldlOzTZ7AhV19teQwkLfQ.text: Was visiting for vacation and we made a stop here for some lunch.   The food:  They start you off with free chips and a corn salsa, which was very good. We all ordered tacos and their selection was great. They had great options for vegans and vegetarians as well, so everyone was happy. The tacos were amazing, not one complaint, and they even let you mix and match different tacos.   Staff:  Very friendly, we sat down right away. Our waiter knew everything about the food and answered every question. He even told us the hot spots in town and gave us some ideas for bars and such.   Facility:  Cool restaurant inside, a lot to look at. The booth we sat at did have some crumbs on it still and the table was a little short compared to the seats. That would be the only reason it's not a 5 star.   Would definitely go again.

eOid4a_1w_-hqyo6BoQATA.text: This place was awesome. Came on a Saturday afternoon while in town for a concert. As a new lover of seafood, I was aching to give this place a try because it all looked so good. A friend and I were seated almost immediately, despite how busy the restaurant seemed. Got some beers and a pineapple margarita, which was so good I'm still trying to recreate months later. I got the BBQ mahi tacos and they were amazing. Just really flavorful and the fish was really fresh. My friend got two of the special tacos of the day and also loved what she had. There are so many options to choose from, including vegan friendly options. A bonus, free chips and salsa. Looking forward to coming back the next time I'm in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Free chips and salsa
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ Mahi

Q3ddCY8MdH9iJFuz5ukqBQ.text: Cabo Fish Taco is likely a favorite restaurant for many in the NoDa neighborhood.  The menu here is about fresh Mexican , 'Baja'-style food. While it may not be exactly like food served in Baja, the food is still good.   My long-time favorite menu item is the crab dip. It's hot, full of cream cheese, flavor and crab. It comes with pita points, and it is a large appetizer so there's no need to order more than one for your table .   Without ordering you get a really great fresh salsa , with plenty of corn and fresh tomatoes and herbs.   I've also ordered the beer-battered fish tacos, as well as shrimp tacos and enjoyed them .   My last visit I had an awesome grilled chicken salad. Yes , grilled chicken salad can be awesome. The chicken was grilled to perfection and had lots of seasoning. The dark green salad was enormous and had plenty of freshly chopped veggies including bell pepper ( one of my favorite vegetables).   Know there is patio seating, two bars indoors and a pretty large dining area. Also know that they do great margaritas too.

OKGNkXrehKqFjdzZFya1qw.text: I love Cabo! Have been going here for years now and don't remember ever having bad service or good. The corn salsa here is always nice and fresh and the tacos are great! Really love the soft shell that they have and the meat is always perfectly seasoned no matter what kind you get. My personal favs are the steak and shrimp (and of the shrimp flavors are great). The sides here are also really good, my go tos are the avocado pasta And the cheddar and jalapeno mashed potatoes. Located right in the heart of noda, this is definitely one that shouldn't be passed up!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ginger and soy shrimp tacos with cheddar and jalapeño mashed potatoes
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Corn salsa

PjzcA1e7iiaUJYHnSVhCLg.text: I went to Cabo in 2010 with my wife and it was just a bad night.  Neither of us liked it and we didn't return for two years.  That being said, I've missed out on two years where we could have enjoyed Cabo Fish Taco!  I went twice last week and both times it was fantastic!  Cheese dip was average, Guac was wonderful, BBQ Mahi and the Tavaroo tacos were phenomenal!  I'm excited to try some more new things soon!  *quick edit update:  they are using wahoo right now in replacement of the tuna due to oil apparently.   Had the Tavaroo tacos again and it is still wonderful.  Wahoo is a white fish and it was very fresh.  Still a safe order!  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Store front.
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wahoo Tavaroo Tacos
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Outdoor Patio

hoRLc3lC-qX-MMGZ_TGQEg.text: Food is awesome!  Beer options awesome. Wine selection SUCKS!  We live in the neighborhood and really enjoy coming here BUT I unfortunately can't drink beer for health reasons.  We would come a lot not often if they had a better wine selection. Hint Cabo owners start to lol at: Kim Crawford Sauvignon Blanchard, Matua Sauvignon Blanchard, J Lohr. Cab, Meoimi Pinot...you get the point. Anything that isn't your current rot gut wine menu.  By the way KW is an awesome server. Please get a better wine list and we will come every week!  Food is awesome!

vKt4YjSZFMpEfz6zNoBZYg.text: I'm surprised to see this many reviews. Cabo is ok at best. I had 2 tacos for lunch which were good but nothing to rave about. The steak and shrimp were my choices. Neither were overlooked or chewy, like I said decent. The corn salsa is not a can't miss. Overall, I won't be back and I can't see anytng special about this place. $12 for two tacos, no drink.

9I2GBXWH0fkBd42tFpFc3g.text: Not a huge fan of the food (I prefer more authentic and this seems more tex mex style) but it's the tightness of the tables that keeps me away. It's just too squished and I don't enjoy it. However...it's popular and you'll probably like it. So give it a try before you decide :)

JZQkHKzN--1semal3xArEA.text: After hearing everyone I run into rave about this place, I just had to check it out!  Parking is tough. After driving around in circles for a while, we finally made it inside. The atmosphere was great for a Saturday night...had to wait a little while for a table so we sat at the bar and had some cokctails - I had the 3 amigos which was pretty good.  Once we sat at our table (about 45 mins later) we started off with the guacamole - it could of used a little more salt, but hey, that's what salt shakers or for.  I then had the carne asada tacos - steak was cooked and seasoned perfectly! My girlfriend had the Mahi Tacos and those were delicious!  For side we black beans & rice as well as the avocado past salad, both very good.  I can't wait to go back try a bunch of other menu items that caught my eye!

t-a9faXtGY7jxMD0J7PnJg.text: I thought Cabo Fish Taco was excellent. It had a great atmosphere, the service was excellent- and above all the food was incredible. I got the fish tacos, which were very good. It came with huge chunks of fish, and all of the other ingredients were fresh and delicious. The corn salsa they put out for the table was great!    I had a couple of drinks. One was a specialty margarita, the other was a NoDa Jam session, which is some sort of local beer. Neither drink was very good, at least based on how the server described them. I would probably not drink here in the future, and leave that to one of the many local bars within walking distance.   Definitely recommend if you want something a little different. We went with a large party and everyone seemed very satisfied. I will definitely be back!

VOtrbPdfmTDjOY6fKyFi1Q.text: Great venue with a good vibe and music to match. Burritos on point, tacos on point, mashed potatoes amazing, beef and veggie soup fucking awesome. And their can of Tecate was immaculate. Their chips were stale, but I didn't come for chips.

MmBhN8Ph4zNojVTuHzVkNA.text: Awesome food! Flavors were terrific and the service was pretty good. It took a while for them to seat us even though we had reservations.

SCFY3S_8_t3c0KFiuVPsag.text: The tortillas for the tacos were by far the best part.  Delicious.  I am sure that the tacos were very authentic, but all of the dishes were a bit heavy on cilantro to me.  Next time around maybe I can ask that they hold cilantro.  I realize this next comment might sound crazy, but the Mahi was a bit too fishy to me.  In my experience, well-cooked Mahi isn't all that fishy. Check out the queso though, and enjoy the tortillas.

FgWTRlqNKBgYVYW1_O6xuA.text: This place is incredible - Love that they text you when your table is ready so you can get a drink at one of the many bars on North Davidson while you wait.  Fish tacos are probably the best I've ever had (never been to California so I may not be the best judge), any assortment is good but my personal favorite are the Salmon and BBQ Mahi.  To be honest though, if the fish tacos were mediocre I'd still come for the avocado pasta salad alone- unreal.  Moved away from NoDa in April and still trying to find an excuse to get back so that we can go to Cabo.

X6ZiJ9F6ayDrd7ppHM6M0g.text: Love this place! Best place to eat in NoDa. I tried the beer battered shrimp, beer battered tofu, blackened mahi-mahi, and grilled serrano chicken. My favorite was the mahi mahi.

k4fTzGeWO0FVn7tmkVDAvw.text: Went with two of my girlfriends on a Wed. Night. Seated immediately. Restaurant had a nice feel to it.  I ordered a traditional beer battered fish taco and a Wahoo Fish taco. The latter was simply amazing. The traditional (at least what I consider traditional) was just okay. Perhaps I had super high expectations because, oh I don't know, their name includes the words "Fish Taco". The corn salsa was fresh and very tasty. The guacamole was just okay but my expectations weren't that of the beer battered fish tacos seeing as how it's not "Cabo Guacamole Dip".  This was my first visit so I asked our "too cool for school" waiter his recommendation. He smugly responded, "I haven't had a bad taco in 4 years." Dude, I didn't ask how long you've been employed at the establishment, I asked what you recommended from the establishment.   All in all, food was good, nice environment, waiter was a douche.

Tn6W-2HM_OVZGzceRJ5jTw.text: Love the freshness of the food and friendly service. The chips and corn salsa are so great. I've been 4 times and never disappointed.

OAfI2YzRlP0AyXyD_MuqMQ.text: Great food and service. Tacos r on point. Place is outside the city but definitely worth the trip out.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fish tacos avocado pasta salad

NhUDeijGjbfGiMtBnytruA.text: I'm a fish taco junkie and this place is my Graceland! I haven't tried the majority of the menu because they always have multiple daily specials and it's hard to pass them up. I usually sit at the bar which has a great selection of brews and an always pleasant tender which adds to the laid back vibe!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sea bass tacos

ptYFxAYjO5ZZQCK86TlopA.text: I went to Cabo about a week ago and I still can't stop thinking about the shrimp tacos. I've never thought about a taco this much in my life. I fall asleep thinking about it every night. This is truly a piece of art located in the heart of the art district. I would recommend this restaurant to every person I meet. I would write poetry about the shrimp taco... If I was any good at poetry. Here, I'll give it a try here's a haiku:   Cabo's shrimp tacos, They changed my life forever, A perfect evening!

74DZC5GZniV_sUvEGOir7Q.text: By far my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. The fish always tastes fresh, the daily special tacos are always worth trying. The BBQ Mahi taco is a must try when you come here for the first time. Try to come for an early dinner or late lunch because this place gets packed real quick on weekends.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Left: Jamaican jerk shark taco (daily special). Right: BBQ Mahi taco

i34HUafpOECfpLnlftipvA.text: The restaurant decor was cool, our server was very friendly , food was just ok. This place has been built up and talked about so much in this area that we decided to stop on our way through town. My tofu tacos we ok, slightly bland, the refried beans were good. My boyfriend had the Serrano chicken tacos, he said the flavor was also kindof bland and the chicken was dry, his avocado pasta salad was awesome. Maybe because of all the hype surrounding this restaurant we had our hopes too high. We probably won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beer battered tofu tacos in the front, Serrano chicken tacos in the back..

N5w2mFlDvgl4ETqwUdWkeg.text: There were five of us and everyone loved their meal! Two had the Baja Bowls w/salmon that was amazing!!!  Some of us had the special grouper tacos and shrimp tacos and carne asada tacos. All of them were so tasty! We also had the guac with chips and was awesome!

y_TSY45sY9LYiygXjVx6hA.text: My sister and I heard this spot was featured on diners, drive Ins, and dives.  We shared the fish tacos, they were okay, the corn salsa was ok too.  But our server was pleasant.  The must interesting part of our visit was the double toilets in the ladies restroom.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

4FHqZYMeC-XWG555zzsChA.text: A must try for the No Da area! Eclectic and Artsy casual restaurant with good and great food! Depends on your mood and taste! For me, I have been going here for years and always enjoy what I get, go for Tacos! There is a reason Taco is in the name of the establishment!!!!

tQeMRpB39Zuo-ZEQ3zN85w.text: My wife and I decided to take a detour through Charlotte on our way home to Augusta from Wilson, NC. We wanted to eat somewhere in Charlotte and decided to pick Cabo Fish Taco because they were featured on Diners, Driveins, and dives. Overall the atmosphere was nice and friendly. For some reason the same dumb song played multiple times during our time there. Not sure what that was about. We were seated in a section that looks like they might open it up to the outside in warmer months. Someone was smoking just on the other side and it was coming in the restaurant.   We ordered cabo rolls and tuna tacos. The tacos and avocado pasta were amazing but the cabo rolls were too salty to eat. When we let our server know she immediately got us a menu to order something in place of the cabo rolls. We ordered the carne asada tacos and they were delicious! The chips weren't warm. I've never been to a good Mexican restaurant that doesn't serve warm chips. They did tasted good and the salsa was yummy and we will definitely return if we ever get to Charlotte again!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

hOgqO56oI-Bz1tqCSe5QDw.text: Great hang out place. There's a reason this place is always packed to the gills during mealtimes and weekends. Their food is good, their service is excellent, and it's just got an overall great vibe.  I recommend the queso dip if you want your willpower tested. I'm not usually a fan of queso dips (*gluuurg* calories), but there was something about this one that just.... crack, it had to have been crack. It was crack queso dip.  Cabo Fish Taco serves various forms of crack, skillfully folded into their food. My dining companion was quite taken with the honey wasabi sauce. It went into the Mahi Mahi fish taco she thoroughly enjoyed, and it went into the side of rice. She considered briefly drizzling it into her margarita before she finally resigned to just putting a small lid on the container (thoughtfully provided by our excellent server) and slipping it into her purse.   I had the lemon-grilled shrimp on a corn tortilla (because flour is the devil, or at least my devil), and some sort of chickpea, tomato, and black bean concoction on the side. While the shrimp was tasty and the overall taco was a good blend, he white cilantro sauce (sour cream, yogurt, and cilantro) could *really* have used more, you know, cilantro.. or crack. I'd take crack. I could be biased because I'm a cilantro fiend. Hey, they're good for your kidneys. The salad-ish thing on the side could  have used a lot of something, anything. It was really tasteless. I really like all three of those ingredients normally, but put them together with nothing delicious (or crack-like) to, you know, rule them, find them, and in the darkness bind them... er what? It was just lackluster.   Have I mentioned service was excellent? We came in on New Year's Day and was there ever a day where water was more needed? My glass was always refilled promptly, even as I was sucking down glass #3 or 5 or something.  Definitely worth your while. I'll be back some day, Fish Taco.

fuNJ9gjbET8Iv4h5Bn-6yA.text: Seriously guys, why is the fish SO DRY AND BLAND.   I really, really want to like this place. I mean, Cabo Fish Taco - I love Baja California and I LOVE LOVE fish tacos (favorite food, for real, look at my profile). And it's in my hood among other places I frequent. Part of me thinks I'm just being a fish taco snob, but several visits and outside sources have confirmed my original conclusion, this place has terrible fish tacos.  Please remedy this situation. I want to like you, so much, just learn how to grill fish.

9XUtgWN0nnIWPbZDHfpkNg.text: I am a huge Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives fan from the Food network channel which brings me to this place. I've never tried a fish taco until I came here and fell in love! I've tried almost ever taco combination on the menu and its like my 1st time, everythime. Great atmosphere, local art, local beer, and great vibes. I have yet to find a better fish taco anywhere else. Noda Charlotte, NC

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab dip starter is a must!!

LTpA8iCN3iuiSD04CA2PbA.text: By far the best tacos i've ever had! Everything is bursting with flavor and the service here is really great! There are so many options on the menu, all of which sound super good. Our server was super attentive and made sure we were all happy. The prices are also pretty good. A must come!

nK26CrtAVYGmMQ7QUDIJzA.text: I know a lot of people who are obsessed with this place, I personally don't understand why.  The tacos are basic and the guacamole comes out of a bag.  I complained about it because I am obsessed with guac and my waiter even admitted they buy it premade because "they don't have time to make it".  Half of the point in going ot a mexican restaurant is for the good guac, so that turned me off right away.  This place is not worth the extremely long wait times.  I would only go back for the environment, not the food.

T80Juzn-YNW4eeufB6nv_w.text: I really hate to be a debbie downer, I know A LOT of people love this place....but I have a standard, if i can make it at home just as good or better, then it's not worth eating there.  And I would have to say, this is one of those places where I can make it just as good, and probably better at home, and i have had far superior tacos other places that i would go back and pay for.  We got the beer battered shrimp tacos with Nopalito Salad.. The shrimp weren't bad, but not the best i've ever had.  The taste was acceptable, but, as my dad would say, "it's nothin' to write home to mom about."  and the Nopalito salad....ew.  My boyfriend had it there once before and said it was good, but this night he had to give it two thumbs down.  We also ordered BBQ MAHI TACOS, which based on the menu description, sounded like it would be really good!  ( Grilled mango BBQ Mahi-Mahi tacos stuffed with Cabo slaw, tomato, avocado, mixed cheeses & finished with our cilantro white sauce)  Yet when it got to the table, again the flavor was acceptable, but very mediocre.  I got it with the jalapeno mashers, which was apparently mashed potatoes with diced jar jalapenos and shredded cheese on top....and to be honest, i did not like the flavor of the mashed potatoes...there is a spice they put in it that just did not mix well with the flavor of potatoes....maybe cummin? or something like that...not sure, as i haven't really learned to tell completely the flavor of a spices.  But I really couldn't eat more than 2 bites and then thought to myself, its not worth wasting calories on something that doesn't taste good!  lol  The food was also room temperature, I would have expected it to be warmer when it got to the table.    for the money, I would say this place is not worth going back to.  If we would have paid $5  a plate, I wouldn't complain, but it was no were near worth about $10 a person for the quality of food we received.  If you're looking for good tacos, i'd say keep moving....in fact Taco Bell just may be more satisfying, cheaper, and give you hot food.  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ MAHI TACOS, up close and personal, sounds like, from the menu it would rock.....i only wish is would have.
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beer batter shrimp taco....looks good....tastes, average.
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ MAHI TACOS, with jalapeno cheese mashers on the side....Looks amazing....tastes...mediocre.

V175qllTYSit2HOfplGZMg.text: Check your tastebuds at the Door!   Cabo Fish Taco, you give Fish a real BAD name, you give Taco a Bad name, you even give Taco Bell a Bad name!  I've had better!  I've had better at Taco Bell and sadly, or maybe not, I've had better HERE at Cabo Fish Taco, so what is going on... It does not seem they are slipping it seems more like a Fall a dive in quality and flavor, not a swan dive, a NOSE Dive!  Fishy, Mahi Mahi should not NOT taste fishy especially when it has BBQ sauce to mask the flavor of the Fish, still fishy tasting!  The Menu said it was Mahi, so maybe it was a mistake, we made one too!  Glad to say neither of us became physically ill!  The Mashed Potatoes were so Cold as if they came out of the Refrigerator... Equally as disappointing as the worst parts of the meal!  What is cooler than cold, Tacos at Cabo Fish Taco!  Some food is like Revenge (better when served COLD)!  If they could make everything as good as their Corn Salsa I would be giving them closer to two or three yelp stars!  My Beer Battered Shrimp Taco (the Dish that used to be good here) was the best part of the meal and it was not very good!  The Wrap was COLD and the sauce had little flavor!  The other Dish I previously enjoyed here (years ago) was the Nopalito Salad I call it a Bean and Cactus Salsa! This time it was almost flavorless   The service was friendly and laid back, maybe a little too laid back since our food came out room temperature and since there were only two other tables (of two people each and they were already eating) it would be different if they were busy!  Here is how they approach the question they should have asked "How was your meal?"?  Instead they say : "Everything's good isn't it"?  They noticed we did not eat very much!  They knew we did not enjoy it!  One improvement is the Boys Bathroom!  Congrats!  This is a good upgrade from years ago!  If the food could have stayed good. I'd settle for going outside like before, (I was not the only one)!  I know you can get in trouble for that, so I'm glad they made that improvement!  The meal was so disappointing we went out to eat AFTER leaving this place!  After an experience this poor I want something good to make sure I still have Taste buds!  I did!!!  This place is probably still very popular and could be a cool place to hang out!  Sincerely I hope they were only having a Bad evening!  I hate writing 1 star reviews!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

hNXFRUUg0JZj5hZXeEQUuw.text: Great lunch at Cabo. Enjoyed the white fish and carna asada tacos. The flour tortillas are lightly fried and stuffed. The local craft beers are little pricy but food is excellent.  The waiter failed to mention that you can mix and max tacos.  Avocado pasta salad was creamy pasta salad with avocados.

G26-6rZOdRLTiDnZT4piMA.text: This place is AWESOME over in the NODA area. We have made the way over from South Charlotte on several occasions and have NEVER been disappointed. They have a standard menu of the typical taco choices, however they ALWAYS have a special two choices wrote on the ever so colorful chalk board along with the drink specials.. The staff is varies which is pretty cool, they include tatted up people, college students, Goth, Hippy, Happy, etc.. EVERYONE work well together and are all HAPPY to be there working and appear to LOVE their job. I must say the ladies room on the left side of the venue is pretty funny. The door has a lady on it and when you enter you enter to one sink and two toilets with no separation between the two commodes other than a small wicker basket with 3 drawers containing tissue. THIS IS PRETTY AWESOME to me ONLY because it has been several times that me and the ladies have gone out and we all have to go equally as bad and with this set up we can go at the same time.. NOT SURE I'D WANT TO only because that's awkward squatting next to your friend. What type of conversation happens when you are squatting next to your girlfriend LOL.. I LIKE it for taking my daughter to the restroom with me as we are able to go in at the same time and have an additional commode if she get the urge while waiting on me..  Enough about the LADIES ROOM.. Some of my many check-ins are below with what I was indulging in with the Mr. or with my daughter or with the Ladies:     Jerk Salmon & Grilled Mahi Tacos!  the chipotle lime salmon taco & beer battered shrimp taco is a winning combination ;-)  Blacken Seabass taco special is a must!!  The chips & in house fresh salsa is SPICY & AWESOME. Any of the various fish tacos are great I LOVE the grilled Mahi Mahi & Shrimp taco..  Salsa & Chips is very TASTY & a tad bit Spicy which I LOVE!!  Cons: There is a SERIOUS wait time on the weekends in the evening as the place is popular. Not sure if that's a CON because it's GREAT BUSINESS for a GREAT restaurant.

LHAulFcpZp_JUHtJoi76ZA.text: I had a fish taco craze last year and that was pretty much the only thing I ate for about a month. Still, I am not a self-proclaimed taco connoisseur and will not pretend to know everything there is to know about the dish.   I will tell you that in my short-lived taco-eating career, Cabo Fish Taco definitely tops the list of delicious tacos I've eaten. And I've tried all kinds. Korean bulgogi tacos to Vietnamese pork belly tacos to traditional carne asada tacos.   Seems to me that there are three main components  to the taco:   1) the protein  2) the case (wrap) 3) the garnish  While most of the tacos I've eaten have excelled in 1 and 3, few have been able to come up with an astounding 2 the way Cabo Fish Taco does. I would describe the "case" as a crisp soft shell. It's a light and fluffy, doughy bite with a crisp finish (literally). Reminds me of the Indian puri. Then you get this magnificent choice of beef, chicken, blackened mahi-mahi, lemon grilled shrimp...the list goes on of meat to flavor your taco up. Loved the shrimp in particular.
