AIIqf-fFu1INWotLEsmPvQ.text: So I saw this place on DDD so of course I had to check it out it was pretty good the tacos were very filling and you could taste the fresh ingredients the jalapeno mash potatoes left something to be desired but the tacos more than make up for it ...the atmosphere is Latin Kitch and it's in the art district so there are a lot of cool shops in the area if your up for it ..the best part about this place is the cilantro sauce That goes in the tacos I recommend this place simple fresh clean food !

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fish tacos !

H2pAC0HDFryihDOcvzH7Fw.text: My husband and I always have dinner here when we come to Charlotte. We LOVE this place! The shrimp and crab dip with the pita bread is to die for and the tacos are great! Upon our server's suggestion, my husband and I each opted for the Honey Wasabi Salmon Tacos. After one bite, we looked at each other and said "WOW - these are delicious!". I can't believe we hadn't tried these before! The best tacos we have ever had. Service was great. My husband is a craft beer snob, LOL, and he says that the craft beer selection is decent. Thanks for the recommendation - it is our new favorite item! We will have to come more often to Charlotte!

rZFmVvbY8qkiktkKMBuw_Q.text: Really enjoyed the Ahi Tuna Burrito, had some of the best flavor. Very fresh!  Wish it had come with something on the side, but overall definitely a redo.

vQVttrgZAPb1LUapw4X-qQ.text: Everyone gives this place 5 stars but my experience wasn't that great. The only seating they had was at the bar and the chairs were pretty uncomfortable. They didn't have a blender so they only serve on the rocks margaritas. I'm a blended marg girl...disappointing to say the least. Also the tacos weren't that great. BUT I AM from Texas so I'm pretty picky when it comes to tacos... I will give this place another shot though.

_R50YEgu3T878ZBMtS0bDg.text: I live in Noda so sometimes I come here out of convenience but I'm never greatly satisfied. Their tacos are good, but for the price you can get way better.  Their chips are always stale too.  Although the food is not anything special their service has always been good.

B02YWYbOijcoii2GlXcJhQ.text: I ordered the battered shrimp and grilled shimp taco. There wasn't much flavor. It was disappointing but my husband loved his tacos (swordfish and mahi). Service was fine. Chips and salsa eh. I'd rather go to Saber Latin Street for a quarter of the price.

NALr7A0ROUaeyqCo2s_whw.text: One of our favorite restaurants in Charlotte!  Excellent fish tacos and Margueritas!  The Perfect Wave is a must try. Delicious. Fun walking around the area and visiting the shops, too.

crO3WUXYXJRGQEzYdJSAuA.text: I have always gotten the tacos, which are great, until tonight. Tonight, I tried the steak quesadilla, and it was hands down the best quesadilla I have ever had. It was really just the best meal I have had in a while, with great service to boot. Lesson learned: there's more to Cabo than just fish tacos!

vR-XW7U-ar57ZLwrFN1vCw.text: 10 years ago I thought very highly of Cabo, but now I feel their food and service is average at best.  I've continued to try this place, always hoping that my experience will trump my previous visit and I've finally decided to give up.  The food is not great.  It's not bad, and it's a cool place to visit since it's a Charlotte staple.  Service here is also not a priority.  I'm learning to appreciate the places that train their staff to always be polite and professional.  This staff really doesn't care about your experience.  Common niceties are uncommon for many of the staff that just want to get you in and out and on to the next.  There are better fish tacos in Charlotte.

e03eB6d8FN23Krpzww6Fqg.text: The waiter was entertaining and very helpful with explaining the menu to my date. The food came out quickly and tasted great.

NjAhHfEUm9HNE-0MeN8jvw.text: Parking as always was a hassle, go in expecting that. Service was exceptional, food was fast and hot. The homemade flour tortillas were my favorite part; warm, flaky, and oh so yummy. I suggest sitting outside if available, inside was pretty loud.

oOPlNhxYIcU1MkHKjZMMNQ.text: I've been meaning to go to Cabo Fish Taco for many moons and never got around to it. NoDa, despite all it has to offer, is not a neighborhood I frequent. On this night a group of us were celebrating Becky's birthday and our original destination was actually Heist Brewery. The friendly staff at Heist told us that we had a two hour wait so we decided to skip Heist since we were all pretty hungry.  Cabo was packed, and originally we were told there was a 20 minute wait. Fortunately they told us the bar was open so we opted for that option. Ultimately we ended up eating at the bar since we didn't want to wait for a table.  The atmosphere is cool and hipster, not unlike anything else you'd expect in NoDa. The decor was great and the restaurant is ample. I especially loved the ceilings which had been untouched for quite some time and still had the original  The first thing they brought us was this corn-based pico de gallo-style salsa. I've never seen this style of salsa with so much corn but it was great. For my taste though, I could have done with 50% less corn and add maybe a little bit of cabbage instead. Chips were nice too, nothing special.  I ordered the wasabi tuna burrito which was excellent. No complaints at all. It would have never occurred to me to wrap those ingredients and wrap them in a flour tortilla to make them a burrito but it was one of the better dishes I've had lately. The wasabi was there... boom! Front and center in every bite. My tuna was perfectly cooked with a lot of pink in the middle and the avocado sent the whole thing to rock stardom.  Becky ordered the same but in taco form.  The beer selection was decent, as many other eateries in the area they seem to have dedicated a few tabs to local/regional breweries which is always nice to see (although lately it seems that our own loyalty to the local/regional breweries is limiting the availability of other small/medium breweries, oh well). I had one of Birdsong's Jalapeno Pale Ale (what else will you have with a wasabi tuna burrito?!).  Loved Cabo Fish Taco and want to go back to try more of their dishes!

eE1YIzODlYx8AKl52nJETw.text: This place is so good!    They don't just have fish tacos; they have all kinds of tacos and all are great.   Parking can be a pain in NoDa, but if you drive around a little, you can often find something.   The one downside to this place is that there is no reservations.   :(   So you will have to wait.   But they will take down your number and you can check the status of your wait while you enjoy some drinks at a neighboring bar.    The other downside is that it can get loud inside.   Therefore if it is nice outside, I recommend sitting on the patio where it is a little less loud.   Even with the down "downsides" though, it is definitely worth going to!

ypHwr9ILFL4tYfxA0Bz0KA.text: Terrible margaritas! We paid $11 for watery, salty drinks. Totally not worth the money. The food and service were excellent. Will definitely come back, but will order a beer next time.

upOemTuTOZf3qsJyixWLYg.text: I went on a Tuesday, because Taco Tuesday, right?  I ordered the Grilled Salmon tacos from the menu.....one was more than enough to stuff me, and I had the second for lunch the next day.  The tacos were $5 each on Tuesdays....great meal, and great service!

YVsbRiSFojAT4bno4_tFWQ.text: One of NODAs hot spots!  I have been to Cabo Fish Taco for the last few years.  This place is AWESOMELY delicious!  Let's start from the very beginning...when you sit down, you are greeted by some chips and salsa.  But not just any kind of salsa, corn salsa.  The salsa is a good mix of sweet and regular salsa-y.  The chips add a nice saltiness to it.  Then the margaritas are refreshing with a good balance of sweetness and tequila.  I always get the Mahi Mahi fish tacos with usually one of their taco specials.  I love how you can mix and match the different tacos.  The tortilla they are served on is hard to describe.  It is more flaky and light than your average flour tortilla.  The ingredients in the tacos are very fresh and flavorful.  Lastly, I am always craving the jalapeno mash potatoes, because they are THE best mash potatoes I have ever had.  However, they are only served as a seasonal side.  So I am disappointed when they are not an option and have to get my second favorite of the slaw.  This is a must try restaurant if you are in NODA!

X16I-vWa2JfXEju4PqH3TQ.text: Have been here 3 times and the food never disappoints.  I had the shrimp fajitas and will get fajitas from this day forward....SOOOOO GOOD! I would suggest a new salsa for the chips they start you off with...it's like a corn relish with no flavor. And the sweet tea wasn't very sweet. Every place has an off night especially as packed as it was. I would still come back, definitely! It's a great "hang out with your friends" kind of place.

ck4CCbitUgUclw8Nv9xD7A.text: Unique flavors in a funky location. Be sure to sit on the patio. The salsa and chips were okay. Salsa was more of a relish with corn, tomatoes, etc. It wasn't very juicy. We ordered the queso and it was a little thick for my liking. The tacos had great flavor. I was not a fan of the fried flour tortilla with them...I would prefer just a fresh tortilla. I was not impressed with my side (a rice with a mango salsa on top). My husband was also not too impressed with his garlic and jalapeno mashed potatoes. Definitely try the Wahoo Taco.  Great service. Would go back for the people and the atmosphere.   Check out the Women's Restroom....it had 2 toilets, side-by-side with no divider. It was a single room. Thought it was kinda odd!!!

OLdzarJufEx-Rl1ru0CMsA.text: The food was hyped up by hipster foodies so I came in with very high expectations. The food was good(ok), but the service was incredibly fast and the staff was super attentive. A fun and eclectic environment like most of Noda! It's definitely worth trying out for a tacos and beer kind of night.

a_idRoVKRB_Pnd3m4v36dQ.text: I cannot express to you how much I love this place. it is a bit noisy, crowded at times, however the menu is excellent, the service is incredible, the food is fresh and the presentation is perfect. One of my favorite spots in one of my favorite sides of town.

xZDacvvJprzFyrbvcYHJ-Q.text: Cabo fish taco is an excellent place to eat. Service is great. Beer selection decent. And food on point. Get the pasta salad.

4jxSR0mzAHIIZod25xNZxw.text: I always am blown away by the food here. Serrano chicken taco is amazing. Was glad to be served rice  that wasn't dry and stale like many other restaurants serve. Corn salsa and queso are great.  Only problem is staff. First time I went, server was awkward. Second time, our drinks and chip basket were rarely kept full. Food keeps me coming back!

0x17B2WDmbIhVwDlk0eMJA.text: Stopped in with my hubby at lunch time to check this place out. He had steak quesadilla and it was large and delicious. I had a 2 taco plate, 1 calamari & 1 crispy fish (you can mix & match!). Everything was brought out fresh and hot, quickly and with a smile. Our server paid us just the right amount of attention to make it a great experience. We will definitely be back to support this local gem :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mix &amp; match your tacos... 1 calamari &amp; 1 crispy fish with a side of rice and black beans. Amazing!!!

U3B2EsipInpySrSkuyFuiQ.text: What has happened to you Cabo Fish Taco?  I came in a few months ago and was very impressed.  Today I had out of town guests in town and ordered fish tacos to go.  I had raved about your food.  They had the lemon shrimp and the beer battered Fish tacos.  It was all horrible.  Just awful.  There was no Fish just soggy batter.  Shrimp tasted frozen Sysco style.  It was embarrassing to me to have raved about you and then get that food.  Not happy and won't go back.  Disappointed.

cneACp6h82VvMZ76jKv7WA.text: I've been here before.. several times in fact, and the food has always been.. Ok.  Don't misunderstand, I read the other yelp reviews, I've seen that people love Cabo Fish Taco and I WANTED to love this place, I just didn't think it was anything special, passable sure, maybe even "good" but certainly not worth the 30 minute drive, it was just nothing special.  Until today.  We had a rare lunch w/o kids so were up for something a lil different.  Decided to try Jack Beagles as I'd heard good things but had never been.  As we pulled up we saw Cabo just next door and thought.. Better the devil you know, right?  So Cabo was the answer.  Got talking to our waiter (also the bartender as our table was next to the bar) and I mentioned that as much as I'd wanted to love Cabo, so far I'd been greatly underwhelmed and I asked for suggestions.  Immediately he suggested the Tavarua Tuna tacos.. And I regretted asking lol.  See, I don't do meat/fish with fruit.  Of any kind, ever.  I greatly dislike sweet and sour food combos, I don't like sweet elements in a savory dish.  Tavarua Taco has all of these elements - blackened, lemon rubbed wahoo (blackened=strike 1 for me) in a kiwi-pineapple marinade (strike 2) with a honey-wasabi sauce (definite strike 3 for me).  Grudgingly I ordered a Tavarua Taco along with my Carne Asada taco figuring at least I knew the steak would be ok as I've had it in the past.  In a word, WOW.  I started with the Tavarua Tuna and honestly, I'm not sure I've ever eaten anything tastier.  WOW.  I now know fully why people RAVE about this place.. If you've been unimpressed, I promise you're ordering wrong!  The GM came past our table to ask how we were enjoying our meal and I told him how..bland our past experiences were (I've always had either the carne Asada tacos or the beer battered fish tacos - and he agreed with me that it is fairly easy to get a better beer battered fish taco elsewhere, but that's not what they're about and often people are disappointed thinking the fried fish taco is a "signature" dish, when the reality is the fresh grilled fish and all the clean flavors are the star of the show.  Genuinely, I could eat there everyday - the Tuna was SO good that the Carne Asada taco afterwards felt like punishment, and I ended up leaving it and the side (spicy avocado pasta salad - tasty!) in favor of ordering and having the room to eat a second Tavarua taco.  Unbelievable yum.  We will be back.  We will be back often.  I will be getting the Tavarua tacos, you can bet on it :)

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tavarua Tuna taco, YUM.

dCT7PeTr9E4WBMOtiPYUZQ.text: Kid friendly environment, noisy atmosphere & great service. Love that the salsa was fresh chunks of tomatoes & corn. The chips were a bit hard & thick. Avocado pasta salad was delicious- definitely order it again.  Tofu tacos were perfect. My 5yr old liked her shrimp kids meal. Beer batter white fish was heaven for your mouth....moist fish with oh so good batter.  Plenty of seats inside or outdoor patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tofu tacos &amp; avocado pasta salad

CMk31lR3HJ9kfrTszXxVyg.text: Awesome Baja style fish tacos, jalapeno mashed potatoes are a must and great tequila bar too. Great value and awesome atmosphere in the NoDa area of Charlotte. Must go if you're in the city.

bct6tXihuX5o8iSZqGVX2Q.text: Stopped at Cabo for lunch with the fam. Fantastic fish tacos. So many choices you could eat here a dozen times and not eat the same thing. Had the Tavarua taco--AMAZING flavor. Loved every bite. Had original Caborita to wash it down--very tasty. HIGHLY recommend and can't wait to go back.

3cI61bT0vQLVINRF2v9wXw.text: Came her on Father's Day with the family. Service was quick. Food was fast and fresh. Wonderful atmosphere. My family enjoyed it and will visit again when they return. The salmon was cooked perfect and not dry. The jerk chicken and shrimp was good and spicy. The 2 tacos were very filling and the shells were thicker than your traditional she'll.

L8_qscHLkJwCO0pRCwFncg.text: My Wife and I have only been to Cabo Fish Taco 3 times, and we can tell you that the food is amazing, the servers and friendly, your food is served quickly, and the prices are very fair.   They start you out with the standard Tortilla Chips, but the Corn Salsa is out of this world. We absolute love the Beer Battered Shrimp Tacos w/Cilantro Sauce, and the Grilled Salmon Tacos w/ a Honey, Soy, and Wasabi Sauce.   I would recommend Cabo Fish Taco to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cool Art at Cabo Fish Taco
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cool Art at Cabo Fish Taco

qwN2rdNmkTV9zI4qfAvTtA.text: Great place for fish tacos. Been coming here for years. Non better in the Charlotte area. They have specials all the time.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab dip

JQ57NFsC2OtmZlva-86HkA.text: Food is outstanding, but don't mix & match tacos thinking you'll pay the higher price of the two.  An additional few $ are added when you do that!  That's not how it used to be done!!!!

uBdPZkoHFovmwuBvvR6NZQ.text: I've heard so many great comments about Cabo so I had to try it. There was no wait on a Wednesday night (compared to the long waits I've heard about on the weekends). Our chips were a little stale, but I was excited to try their famous tacos.  I had one carne asada taco and a tofu taco. I liked the carne asada mix better, but I wouldn't say there was anything special about these specialty tacos. Tasty nonetheless. I'm glad I was able to try Cabo and I didn't wait 2+ hours for our food on a busy night.

wRFVal_C3gWmkon1vTFsMw.text: This restaurant can have a long wait and not overwhelmingly impressive for the wait it has. My favorite thing there is the steak fajitas which are my favorite. For all the Queso lovers out there unfortunately I would not put this towards my top queso list.

PymuO1voXoXfsNXacYfwQA.text: Steak taco...awesome. White fish taco...par. Chips and salsa...sub par. Price was ok for what we got so that was good. Very loud place and parking is kinda annoying over there.

6vnamLGCrXJtv6qkOgf-kA.text: My favorite place in Charlotte.  The taco shells are just special.  I tend to go with the shrimp tacos and whatever the seasonal side is (jalapeno mashed potatoes are awesome).  The taco salads are huge and the pasta dishes are also really delicious.  But really, get a taco...  The atmosphere is great too.  It's always packed but I never feel like I wait more than ten minutes (even if they say longer).    My only gripe at all about this place is that the chips always taste stale.  I love the salsa though.

pnQa7uDfagh0hE4TBpSLLw.text: Today was the first time I've been to Cabo Fish Tacos. This place has the best tacos ever. I had the Lemon Grilled Shrimp Tacos. They literally made me do a happy dance. The avocado pasta was delicious too. I will be back!

LTBkkPexv9-hfP73tFd4mA.text: The food was absolutely delicious. I would highly recommend the honey wasabi tuna steak burrito. I only was able to finish the whole thing, because it is all that I ate for the entire day; It's a hefty serving. My only little downer about the place was that staff did seem to be very short on enthusiasm.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Honey Wasabi Tuna Burrito
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tuna Steak bowl

yoAjQGObsLd7zUFWbI79dA.text: Heard about this place from almost everyone around Charlotte. The inside is super cute! Great atmosphere for a night out with a group of people. Chips and salsa weren't my favorite. It's more like pico then salsa.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cool wall art!

0mu1ksWtNzv63A_n4TZ3jw.text: Divey. (not in a great way)  Murals are odd-looking.  Taco's were burnt - but that's the way they do it.  Service - discombobulated.  Not just the new people.  More women than men after work.  LOUD!

97ZKRJ2bNWElfUn6_aMcfA.text: Amazing shrimp and blackened mahi tacos, delicious unique beers on tap, fantastic service; definitely worth the 15 min wait.

7zIml7MTVoZNhsj_r9w8oA.text: The white fish taco is so far the best. I've tried other things, but they are not as good. During busy times, this place is a headache. I ordered something to go on a late Saturday evening and went to Cabos to pick it up. There is nowhere really to stand and wait other than beside the bar, and some rude waitress yelled at me for being in her way. Other than having no designated area just for pickup, the food is good and I will be back.

ly7XjBxm_3JaJHwJBzAbtA.text: We didn't wait at all to be seated, and our host was very friendly and nice.  Our waiter however could have cared less about us.  Our food was luke warm. I the carne asada taco that left a bad taste in my mouth and the rice that came with black beans reminded bland Uncle Ben's rice.

hhvpywnewvRjlZUPQKh_2Q.text: Don't know what all the rave reviews are for. Had fish tacos today for lunch and they were bland - like having fish & chips on a tortilla, except the fish in real fish & chips is better. Also had soup - chicken & jalapeno; also boring, though better when we added some of the corn relish and some bottled hot sauce. Everything needed salt - and more flavor.  And what's up with no salsa on the table, just a corn & tomato relish? Which was mostly corn.  My fish tacos are way better! Can't believe Guy Fieri liked this place - he usually has better taste. Won't go there again.

pL6QznJBe-YM3g4d89KLrA.text: This place is amazing. The tacos are great and the sides can sometimes even be better! That avocado pasta salad!!!

4bJwbhKcOgYcI-r9zCh4lQ.text: Expect to wait for a seat at this spunky little fish joint. Very casual...don't expect to sit at the bar while you wait for your seat b/c it only seats about 9-10 people tops! The regular fish tacos are not the way to go....they're at the bottom of my pile- do something different- sword fish, etc.....they make a pretty darn good mojito as well. I recommend checking it out when you're in the area; plenty of things to do next door as well if you have to wait for your seat.

4HRLGpStWMaBIzgR4qjeUQ.text: Awesome!  A great place to hang.  Had the tuna tacos love'd em!

Xd61sbbrzGwyj9e9e8zIug.text: I was sooo excited to try this place after hearing all of the hype! Not what I thought it was going to be... Food is alright, nothing to write home about. I had the fried whitefish taco which was decent, but I've had much better. The margs were off though... Didn't even taste like a margarita to be honest and nobody at my table even finished half of theirs. I think there are much better Mexican places in the area.

iI3bUehMm4v3Fia2BIWXdw.text: Another great visit to Cabo!  Their special today was fried crawfish taco's that were awesome.  I could eat here every day.

zXg5JTD1570aqCI04nNtyA.text: Came here for lunch during a vacation from NYC. EXCELLENT fish tacos--do NOT miss out on this place if you are anywhere hear the area, it was awesome.

VWcKJ_tHFX9_R9qi0K_hPw.text: We have been here twice now and the first time was very good. We had the Mahi-Mahi Fish Tacos and we loved them. We wasn't all that impressed with the service either time with exception to the guy who seated us the second time with the dreads. He was very, very nice and helpful. The food the second time just wasn't near as good as the first. We will have to try it again some time soon.

07ifajI2A4C0nQ7GbYYILQ.text: everyone loves this place except me. seriously, have you seen all these reviews? people rave about this place but i think it blows.   we went there later one night after thinking about getting some fish tacos and we were basically ignored by our waiter all night, which in retrospect was probably a good thing because he looked like he was about to set the place on fire anyway and we didnt want him to start with us.  i got blackened mahi fish tacos and they were pretty bland, i didn't finish it and then we waited around to get our check for a while longer wondering if we were about to get our faces burned off by our unhappy server or our check so we could get the hell out of there. when we finally did leave (faces intact) i asked some friends if they had been to cabo fish taco and they said they loved that place.   moral of the story: i hate this place but you will probably love it forever.

jdzpe8KQV1HGENis-V3xRg.text: Ok, so I travel to CLT every month and have been doing so for the past 3 years. My weekend spot is always Cabo to reconnect with area friends. My experience last was horrible, not the food but the service. I chopped it up to maybe that waitress had a bad day but I was still going to tell her manager. This past weekend, I connected with a friend there who really wanted to try it out and I put our name down for a table. They text you when your table is available. I realized I received a text msg 2 minutes earlier. We go in and the hostess is talking to someone with a red bull can in her hand about what I don't know but we waited for about 35 seconds (yes, I timed it) to finish talking.  I finally after about 10 more seconds, said "Hey, we have a text, I think our table is available?"The hostess looked at us, KEPT talking and turned back around. I say "excuse me" She says, "Yes, I heard you but I'm talking to someone else" AND SHE TURNS BACK AROUND. It was by the grace of God I didn't slap curse her out. I was about to leave however, my friend wanted to stay and someone immediately walked us to a table. All she could've done was acknowledge us if that convo was that important. I immediately called the manager, I think his name was Walter, who was very apologetic. Get this, he was already kind of aware of the situation and offered us a free appetizer. I declined it but my friend asked for queso but rest assured, I will NEVER go to that restaurant again. They just lost a faithful customer of 3 years who travels down to have a good time at that restaurant.

v5VgLy5brBiFTe6pIj9Tzg.text: I use to really love this place.  The tacos, the beer, the atmosphere... that said it is still OK but not what it once was.  The food has been kind of bland the last few times I have visited and the service has been iffy.  Hopefully, they will wake up and get back to there roots.  I miss the way it use to be.

0dCf9kQiJKhdtm7a9hGvRA.text: Great food and portions! BUT be prepared to wait for a table if you come too late. Worth it for anything on the menu.

x7pZGIHrNq4DE8aDXvMRzQ.text: This small dive is overall good! They have what their name states, Fish Taco's!  It is very good, but a bit pricy! You get a little less then you would expect portion wise, but the taste for the food is good! The atmosphere is really great! Very fun place to go for a quick meal!

vv2BOUBsal1Jtz-zUPl2_A.text: Love the fish tacos and great Noda atmosphere.

4ozwUAIh0M8SGsmtqnfQQQ.text: Overall, a great place to hang out.  The chips were a little stale but the corn salsa had large chunks of tomato which made it extra special.  The Tavarua Wahoo Tacos were very tasty and had just the right amount of heat.  We sat on the veranda since it was a nice evening.  The service was great - constantly checking on us.  The noise level inside was on the higher side.  The Nectar of the Gods margarita went down very fast.  My only disappointment was that they don't serve any Johnny Walker!!!

vuZQ90bvHKA1LksKM8LJZA.text: Paying $5 to the sketchy dude for parking in a dark lot didn't even phase me. I'd had tacos from this place before and they were amazing.    My friend and I both ordered beers from the menu, they didn't have either.  Fine, no big deal.  We then ordered the pimento cheese rolls... SORRY,  I meant the "CABO ROLLS" that were filled with nothing but cheese and mayonnaise.  This set a bad tone for the rest of the experience.    I ordered the blackened Mahi tacos.   All of their signature tacos are "finished with white cilantro sauce" which did nothing to enhance the flavor and just made the whole thing soggy.  There was a low amount of cilantro accompanied with a low amount of flavor.    Under-seasoned and soggy are the only words to describe the tacos I had there.    I feel I am expressing very "first world problems" writing this review.  But for $60+ this meal sucked ass, so here is the review.

0wgT9PWO6uRTuQCOeKWU6Q.text: I never ask to speak to a manager but I almost did. The service was a fail. Not a "sorry" for messing up two orders and dropping ( wasn't rang in) one, but a simple "oh". Refills was like a DMV experience. Food is great but at some point it's not worth it. I hate broda and don't frequent the neighborhood because I don't enjoy the people that live and frequent these haunts. Cabo was the exception. Was. Two stars just because the food is good. As someone that makes his living as a server it erks me when I'm treated this way. Apathy has no place when it comes to service.

MUW9feDi0w21_x4T8vbCoQ.text: Cabo Fish Taco, in general, is a decent establishment. Although I have conflicting opinions on various food choices offered, the restaurant atmosphere usually makes up for any setback.   First off, the fish tacos... very well crafted. If you're a fan of fish tacos, you really can't go wrong with these. I've been out to this place about three times now and have come to realize it's a safe bet. My favorite (although I really haven't tried any others) is the Wasabi Fish Taco, which as you may have figured, has that perfect combination of sweet and spicy flavor. In my opinion, it is still on the mild side.  Now contrary to the fish tacos, are their burritos. Fail. These are basically meals you could easily put together yourself- wrap, a can of re-fried beans, mixed with some other ingredients that just don't make up for the overpowering sense of eating at a Taco Bell. Not that there is anything wrong with Taco Bell, but simply put, you are basically paying Cabo $10.29 for a near synonymous $.99 bean burrito from Taco Bell. And burrito size? Probably less than half of what you'd expect an authentic Mexican restaurant to serve you.   Lastly, atmosphere. The restaurant has a great layout and usually has a great crowd. Well decorated. The ambient noise can be a little much at times with the acoustics set up as such- a lot of hard wood, metal, etc.  Overall, I would REALLY rate a 3.5 if could. Ideally, if all your looking for is a place to go to have a few drinks with friends, get some food (knowing you want a fish taco, of course), this place is definitely worthy of your time.

JvvDkNYkKteVzC5JR0Lmdg.text: Place is fantastic.  Yes its busy, so you may have to wait on a weekend night.   Food is the best and that's why you have to wait.  You can tell everything is made with care and not from a can.  Love the lemon shrimp tacos!

b_rIK7lnb_YZ3MT6kxEFaA.text: If I didn't know where I was, I'd expect to walk out the doors to a beach when I was done eating. Got the tacos before I could even finish one beer. The chips they give you with salsa could be better though.

E2v07gF0ehQcpkEk_HzMmw.text: People must like fishy fish tacos, because this place gets great reviews and a cool hangout, but every time I order fish tacos, they are very fishy. The plates and utensils are usually dirty, maybe is it part of NoDa style. I didn't enjoy myself. Sorry.

zcIaIefsIMC9eJ_9Dj9S1w.text: Excellent!!! Queso was outstanding. High grade tuna on the tacos. Tons of spice, tons of flavor! Lives up to reviews!

2woQjVWQuaSw_AxGwHbr1A.text: Great Atmosphere.  Food is outstanding.  The tacos and the corn salsa can't be beat.

IeSqVjxGxTP_dF3MyddoAQ.text: The tuna tacos were awesome. They almost always have a wait, but if you are not in a hurry it is well worth it. The wait staff was friendly and knowledgeable. The only thing that kept them out of 5 starts is the fact that they didn't accept call aheads. They have a large selection of local beers that are found in every bar in NoDa. I would go there again if I'm in town.

neUC3Ne54-XGWXt5q_Zsqg.text: When I first came here I really enjoyed it but my last 2 visits were really underwhelming. The salsa is pretty average, nothing to write home about. I have only had their burritos and fish tacos but the ingredients and flavors don't WOW me. It's just another Ok taco spot.

dyRLuIKSxn5o6HPwLlsMeQ.text: I know cabin has been getting mixed reviews lately... but I'm still a fan! I've been going for a couple years. It used to be so popular that the wait was ridiculous. Glad they expanded and have more seating now.  Everything I've had here has been great! Just thinking about the fish tacos while writing this review make me want to go eat.

RmaYH7NolLeTi1PIqsgVrA.text: Quite possibly the best fish tacos I have ever tasted....2nd only to Torchy's Tacos in TX.  The flavor was outstanding (I had one salmon taco and one tuna) and the fish was grilled to perfection.  My only complaint was that when we got our food it was lukewarm...not hot at all.  Also, I ordered the coleslaw and it was slightly flavorless.

2iy7KQch7awxqct1SW-VuQ.text: Sadly, we had a really bad experience. Our guacamole had a really strange texture and unpleasant taste and the tacos were hardly even mediocre. The fish tacos had no cabbage, cilantro, or lime, they were pretty lacking in general and were served with wilted green leaf lettuce. The black beans and rice had no flavor. The party at the table next to us had to send their meal back for being uncooked. It was just not a meal I would ever come back for.

zhKTG_oYCYt6kvk2wp2QBA.text: I have rode by this place many times in NODA and I finally got the opportunity to eat here on Thursday for lunch. Me and my sister had a FAB time!  The corn salsa and chips they bring out while you wait for your food are great. I had the Lemon Grilled Tuna Tacos with Baja Rice. The tacos were filling and the rice was cooked well. The sauce that goes on top of the rice was really sweet as well. My sister got the Lemon Grilled Shrimp Tacos with black beans and rice. I'm not a fan of black beans, but I got myself a little bite of my sister's shrimp tacos and they were good.   I believe the next time we go, I'm definitely going to try the Beer Battered Shrimp Tacos! This is one place I will return to again and again.

SfVQ7Npu2j8uRSzq2fRE0g.text: I'm not quite sure how it gets such good reviews. Every time I come I get bad service and bad food. I gave up but a friend wanted to go just for a margarita and queso. The queso was cold and chips were stale. Service also sucked. We got the check (finally) and left without eating to go somewhere else. No one who works here even smiles at you!  We also sat without touching our chips, queso, and guac and no one checked on us at the bar.

QXtTMjLkVpLdx9DLWuTs2A.text: I had the "special" which was a grilled scallop taco with pineapple salsa and the jalapeno/cheddar mashers.  It was tasty but it didn't blow my mind.  However the crab/shrimp dip with deep fried pita triangles was ON POINT.  I could eat that all day, everyday!  Service was very attentive even on a busy Friday night!

ja5jrms92iu3tbZ4Uy2xAg.text: Awesome food and the service was great.  Getty he ta-va-rue taco you won't be disappointed

oe3cvymg5thulbD5bjSIvw.text: My favorite place!!  Pros:  Corn Salsa, Text message table alert, cilantro drizzle, El Cheapo Margarita (a good buy) and patio .  Cons:  Always a wait....even at 2:30 in the afternoon on a Saturday.   Definitely would try if you have not but plan to wait.

Y4XuYLjcZrpQgChaDS8hQA.text: The food was decent. I had the BBQ Mahi Taco which I felt were too saucy. The chips were stale.

PP1z4ckU3mXPqQeie-RW8g.text: I love this place!  I always order the mahi mahi tacos. The queso is awesome too.  I think the last time I went there was a shrimp taco with thai chili sauce but I substituted for mahi and it was no big deal.  Tequila shots are a must here. Great atmosphere.  On busy nights there is always a wait but try and get the patio of it's nice out.

LgCJdwsu0zKb-aZL6jYB1g.text: One of my favorite places to eat in CLT!  Not big fan of the complimentary salsa and chips (It's not a traditional salsa (has corn in it)).  My favorite dish on the menu is the Tavaruna (Tuna Tacos) the honey wasabi sauce (it is not hot) but the flavor is incredible) (one of best dishes.

y-xHuduQX_4--Cin7mhHAw.text: What started out to be a great day ended in my going back to bed at 3:30PM.   After having such a wonderful experience at Shine with Mark, I decided to head over to NODA to check it out and to try something new, Cabo Fish Taco  So the place was packed, as expected from what I've read per previous reviews. I asked if there was a place at the bar since I was solo.   Headed to the bar and was ignored. Finally the grumpy and "I'm too busy checking my iPhone" bartender dude came over. He offered me a drink menu and I asked for the full food menu as well. He asked if I wanted chips and "salsa" .  As  I was looking over the drink menu, nothing really stood out, so I had the Souza something or other.. blah... boring, bland... stupid... why bother to order kind of drink - as it turned out. And not to mention it was served by a not so friendly bartender.   The chips were fine, but the corn-tomato salsa was DRY... it looks like they must pre-serve the bowls and let them sit until they are grabbed to be distributed. Salsa should be fresh, not dry.   Ok, then another person, brought over my lunch, I had ordered the lemon grilled shrimp taco with a steak taco and a side of re-fried beans as I, personally, dislike black beans. Strange I know, but I despise black beans.   The tortillas were warm, but the proteins cold. The cheddar cheese used on the steak tacos didn't even warm (and why would you put cheddar cheese on a steak taco?) The proteins were of good quality, but SERIOUSLY lacked any kind of flavor. I agree with Tanya R. -- white sauce, what white sauce? I asked if they had any other salsa's -- the dude looked at me like I was crazy. I said, you know hot sauces. He brought over Tapatio and Chula... ARE YOU KIDDING ME???? I said, "No like salsa verde or rojo? Something else made in-house" still he stood there blank and annoyed. I said something made in house... he went on to saying something with wasabe... What? WTH in a mex joint... I said forget it, please just bring out some more white sauce (which he charged me for). I put tapatio in in to help enhance it and to add heat.   The food was a big let down. The proteins were of good quality, lacked serious seasoning and were served cold. The re-fried beans were really weird tasting... sour almost, so I quit eating them in case there were bad.   I asked the to busy bartender after he finished checking his iPhone if the owners were from So Cal... he said I don't know... I just started here. REALLY you don't know shit about the restaurant you work in... WOW  And what put my experience over the top was they allow their wait staff to wear daisy dukes... one girl bent over and you could see up to a land you didn't want to observe...  The staff all seemed overwhelmed and too busy to care. Argh I hate grumpy staff. The "good" thing out of my experience there was this nice patron sitting next to me at the bar who complemented my shirt...   I doubt I'd ever return. I can't believe this next part is even going to come out of my mouth, but I so wish a Rubio's would come to Charlotte, I would so welcome this chain and their taco Tuesday's... The places I avoided back home is what I'd rather eat here. Sad, shaking my head I even typed that, but at this point, I'd die for one of their fish tacos with white sauce and their salsa verde...

of2-Jaebfe9xdJbwYZNnQg.text: Got tacos to go! World class tuna taco! Avocado pasta salad as a side was heavenly. We definitely be a return customer.

tg8bivTu2r_3JWZssp0Tnw.text: Decided to go out to this place haven't been since I finished college in 2014 and the food is still amazing. Just wish the wait was not over a hour long . Enjoy my tocos and drinks

MyvLRTNoOXYokAKXRKqhyg.text: If you are looking for Americanized Mexican food this is the place. I would not suggest a burrito or salad. Most people go here for the tacos, I unfortunately is not realize that the tacos where going to be the best thing here so I did not get them. As I looked around and saw everyone eating tacos those looked good! I had the salmon salad. Really not much flavor there. The salsa is not really made with tomatoes it's made with corn. The chips where ok. I've had better.

ugBuOVfFGZXvGIg4eEac3A.text: Me and my friends went last night my food was great. I had the the honey glazed salmon tacos and they were amazing . The down sides were where we sat was very cold and there was a wait.

gYjLd3llK4odwyhOpRqUrg.text: First time here.  Enjoying myself with friends who are like family. The shrimp and crab chip is THE BEST.

OZ-wLl6S485zc3s82qZQIw.text: This place is a must go to in Charlotte! We went on a friday around 12pm so the wait time wasn't too bad. I ordered tofu tacos was obsessed! These tacos were like something I've never had before! I added a little hot sauce to spice them up but other than that they were perfect. The restaurant and the waiters have a really chill, happy vibe making the experience even better!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

RExuyAG0Egsf9lN4E3t9sg.text: OMG! Went here fo lunch and got the blackened mahi taco. It was amazing! Everything was fresh and delicious. The staff was so nice and attentive and the atmosphere was great. I highly recommend!

LGQzpIajVGjpVWYgDe_lPg.text: TRY THE BBQ MAHI MAHI TACOS!! This place was on point. Busy as hell and the service was amazing. The food came out fast, hot, and delicious. Chicken Tacos, Diablo Salad, you cannot make a wrong choice....and their Sangaritas are to die for.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

wuK4x7ey33Etru4BbOchZg.text: The tacos here were VERY good! The food is fresh and has a very unique taste. I will definitely come again next time in Noda.

v_aFreRhHac5KnKp2zsBig.text: I've always been leery about fish tacos and have yet to find a good one. Cabo's Fish Tacos are one word, "AMAZING"! I ordered there Honey Soy Glazed Salmon Tacos and they had the perfect seasoning and very tender. I also had the Carne Asada Tacos. If you are a beef eater you can't go wrong with these tacos. Again, seasoned perfectly and although the beef was cut in chunks they were still tender juicy pieces. And the spicy guacamole pasta as a side was probably one of the best pasta salads I've ever had. This restaurant gets a perfect score from me. I will definitely be returning here.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Absolutely delicious! Carne asada taco, honey soy glazed salmon taco and spicy guacamole pasta salad.

1MG8gVRxsZrP9Ov__heiCw.text: I love this place. Best tacos in Charlotte. I always get the salmon tacos. Delish!  The restaurant is the best location, and is jam packed no matter what time of the day !

MqiF1FoIHv2QSYBlbeE76w.text: This is one of my go to restaurants in charlotte. When people come into town to visit this is usually one of the first places I recommend due to its uniqueness and killer food. This is far from a chain which is exactly what I look for in a restaurant.   As you'd expect from the name, their fish tacos are nothing short of incredible. I've had nearly all of the tacos on the menu including many of their specials. My favorites continue to be the Tavaroo Wahoo and the lemon grilled shrimp. You really can't go wrong though.   A solid choice for anyone looking for something out if the ordinary.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Always a solid choice. Great food!

o7Nnb73zD2koyOnEYJ_clg.text: I couldn't have asked for a better first meal in Charlotte! First of all the NODA area of Charlotte is simply amazing! Such a huge melting pot of cultures there, and great shops! Front and center I found Cabo Fish Taco and decided to eat there. Taco's are my favorite food ever!   I tried the salmon taco and the lemon pepper shrimp I couldn't tell you which was better because they were both AMAZING! I also had a pineapple hard cider which blew my mind.   Definitely check this spot out!

fQQdlDQL8PzQ75sQ5A_LOA.text: Great spot for tasty food and people watching. Gets loud and crowded but that's part of the fun. Every fish taco option is excellent and their sides are great too. Good margarita selection for the tequila fan and fun artistic decor. You have to go at least once! Just don't be in a rush if it's a weekend night.

-UxMsqX68sehSUORz7I-2w.text: Love their tacos and margaritas. Never disappointed when it comes to the food. Wait times can be kinda long since it's super popular but the staff is always friendly and I've never had an order come out incorrect.

1BzobhnIrXxSU-W7XwsvRA.text: I ate here for the first time today. I've been trying to get there for 2 years and finally made it. One of the downfalls is the parking. If you can get past that your in for a good time. I had the BBQ Mahi tacos and I must say it was very tasty and the portion size was good. I also lucked up and had a great server so it was a good day.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ Mahi Taco with Black beans and rice

xNQdrDN2Rr5NLL_WdvZCpA.text: I may have had high hopes from reading the previous reviews. My expectations were not met there was too much corn in everything and the salsa that they give had a hint of like cinnamon which was really weird. The food came and I had the fish burrito and it was massive but mainly filled w beans. If you want authentic Mexican food go up the street on North Tryon to El Taco Veloz.

AkNgaXv49NPmG8Rdr0A7wA.text: What can I say about Cabo Fish Taco that hasn't already been said.... It's a gem in NoDa! With good and fast service, the place always has a line... and it's not small.  Chips and salsa are always fresh! My favorite dish there is the Blackened Mahi, it feels like you just stepped onto Baja California and took a bite! I wouldn't normally be full with two tacos, but they fill them to the brim, and most people need a fork to scoop up all the goodness after the shell is gone.   I'm always game is anyone of my friends wants to go here...

eHJcdfHode-V_ZRly1-agA.text: Saw this place on "DDD" had to try!! The Tacos were excellent.  Our service was great.  My margarita was perfect.  So even if your not hungry the drinks are amazing!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ fish Tacos &amp; Carne Asada Tacos!!

fAwHwHsemNB7DT5U7n9qcw.text: I love seafood and Mexican food...naturally, Cabo Fish Taco was a delightful treat last night! This may have been my first time there but it definitely won't be my last. I wasn't surprised to find that Cabo was packed around 7:45p last night. They won't seat you unless your entire party is there so make sure to be on time if you are meeting someone.   We were seated right away and given this amazing corn salsa to start. I wasn't a fan of the chips, they were a little stale for my taste, but the corn salsa was crisp and refreshing. Definitely a step up from the tomato salsa you get at chain restaurants. I took V's recommendation and ordered the epic tuna burrito rare with a side of avocado pasta salad. I was tempted to order the beer battered salmon tacos but I'll save that for another Thursday. The bf got a beer battered shrimp taco and a chicken taco. I didn't mind the wait, we had corn salsa to keep us company.   Food came out, those tacos looked huge! I seriously have not seen tacos that stuffed, I definitely will be returning for those tacos now. The shrimp was tender on the inside and crunchy on the outside, as it should be. The epic tuna burrito is rightfully named with generous chunks of fresh tuna. I love sushi so I enjoyed the rare tuna. For all of you who don't normally eat seafood, its not fishy at all. The shrimp and fish were seasoned so well. That pasta salad, yum, soooo creamy. I am going to have to opt for this option for every meal at Cabo.   We are for sure coming back. I'll have to try a margarita next time. Cheers!

wl68TkjTGUveIYZtvGPd-Q.text: Not sure you can be a taco lover in Charlotte without trying this place. I have been coming here for years and they never disappoint. I must admit I have not ventured too much away from tacos on the menu, but that's a good thing. They do tacos so well, I've tried them all and love them. The Mahi and tuna are my favorite. It can be a little costly, however I have never left here still hungry. Keep in mind this place can get packed so on a weekend night you'll probably have a wait. However, they use the service that can let you see where you are at in line and alert you when your table is ready. We like to use that time and have drinks or an appetizer next door at sabor.

SCgUa-novx60Ro0Fo_QMpA.text: This place is more so simply another chain not too authentic if you ask me. I prefer authentic Mexican food when I actually take the time to sit down or else I could've just went to chipotle or moe's. I remembered I hadn't been here in a while when in the area and now I remember why that is. I ordered a shrimp quesadilla which was extremely bland and I maybe took two bites before i stopped trying to force myself. It looked amazing but the taste did not match that all if anything all i tasted was cheese. Of course the table came with chips and corn salsa, but the corn salsa was absolutely disgusting(there was really nothing salsa about it). Our server was sweet which really helped out with our experience but I honestly don't see myself returning anytime soon maybe in another 5 years

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

yNnfY2x45ih4Aace-9oReg.text: Definately a must, especially if you are visiting Charlotte! The shrimp and crab dip is the BOMB! It can easily be shared with 2-4 people as an appetizer (or for 1 person it can be a meal). The shrimp and chicken burrito is my go-to order with the avocado pasta (which has some spice to it). Non-seafood options and veggie options are available and are also very good! The portion sizes of everything is reasonable/a lot for the prices. I always have to get a box to take home food. Beware of parking and be prepared to search, walk a little bit, and/or pay for parking in a lot a few blocks away. The staff are very friendly and helpful if you have questions about the menu. If you are able to find a spot at the bar to eat, take it! The restaurant is always full and busy, so be ready to put your name in and wait when you go, especially during meal times.

p-t2glnBFxQLezv1gR9F2A.text: If you're any kind of taco lover, don't miss Cabo Fish Taco in No Da!   Amazing fish tacos - had both mahi mahi and ahi tuna.   Great service, too!

5LV7tTMMgEx0hm1VfSVHQQ.text: Cabo Fish Taco 3201 N Davidson St Charlotte, NC 28205 Saturday June 24, 2017 9:30pm  Let's just say some people love it and some people hate it and I'm right there in the middle. I'm not really sure what the hype is about this place. I think it might just be the hipster place to eat in NoDa.   This not being my first time here but not coming in a long time (5 plus years since my last visit) these are the reasons I like Cabo Fish Taco: 1 - Consistently good food and drinks. These are the reasons I DON'T like Cabo Fish Taco: 1- Consistently a 30 minute wait 2- it's soooo loud.   On this visit I ordered the shrimp and chicken burrito and the spicy avocado pasta salad. I really enjoyed both items and thought they were worth the price. I also had the Azulita Rita with sugar rim and thought it was a great drink choice. Since I'm not a fan of fish  and think that tacos are overpriced unless they are a $1 special I quickly overlooked the taco options. However the only reason I was here this visit was because an out of town friend is in love with the BBQ Mahi taco. I tasted the fish and it was good but not anything to write home about.   I probably won't be back unless someone else just has to go. And if I want the meal I had again I will probably just order togo!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Azulita rita
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ mahi tacos with rice
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken salad

3IBd-WknDoC_VBzQjXObEQ.text: Who doesn't love this place! Every time I come here, I'm met with really great service and the food is always good. The margaritas are delicious and pair well with the food for sure. My favorite time to go is when the weather breaks and they open up the side area. I love sitting outside with a good margarita and some chips! The two taco meals are super misleading. You might not think 2 tacos are enough but trust me they are! I have a hard time finishing both of them!

234NW2mRWY3J1BaAofIQ3g.text: Loved coming to Cabo but I can tell there's new management and new staff, my friend used to work there so we decided to get margaritas because we actually like the food, the service was average nothing special and we tipped the waitress $6.00 on a $44 tab and tipped her 2 dollars on top, I tip no matter what, after leaving my friend received a message from the group chat she used to be in, due to her working at Cabo fish taco, the message  stated that the waitress only received 2.00 on 44$ tab when in reality we tipped her 8.00, just the fact of the waitress lying on my friend  and not being thankful on the tip we tipped her is displeasing, I payed for the meal and for someone to make a mockery of my friend when In actuality we tipped her is disappointing, Idk if the receipt fell of the table or what but we tipped her. Gina the manager didn't calm the situation she told me to leave without hearing both sides of the story in a instant, I'm experienced in management and have managed multiple restaurants in the past and hearing the customers part of the story is always important to me, GINA needs training on how to calm situations with a displeased customer and hearing both sides of the story before intervening , I won't be back to this poorly managed establishment.  We don't know the waitress's name but here initials are K.S

pdgBZQvrSgNcK_rQzcCpHQ.text: Tried this place last night and the food was pretty good! I got the chicken tacos, which tasted great. Service was good, but our waiter did forget our appetizer. But he looked really busy and it was packed. The margarita was awesome and I loved the jalapeno cheddar mashed potatoes! I definitely want to come back and try some other dishes they have.

5HAOjDl8KqyQNUH_kv0gmA.text: I got here as the restaurant opened but the dining room was about 2/3 full in 30 minutes. I ate here a couple of years ago and today this place seems like a hipster haven. It reminds me of Williamsburg. I don't recall that vibe last visit. The food is still really good. Service was fast and friendly.  The tacos are fresh and the crab dip is definitely worth the trip. I like being able to mix and match taco choices because I can't pick just one. Today I had blackened Mahi and lemon shrimp.  The corn salsa is really good also. I'm not a fan of the rice and beans because it's on the dry side and the rice was kinda hard. It gets loud as the place fills up. This place is a solid 4 stars. I may pop in again for drinks before I leave town.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fresh corn salsa
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened Mahi and Lemon Shrimp tacos

N5vwAgAYZUvlH2xDunAK6g.text: Cabo Fish Taco?  No, Cabo Fish Taco HEAVEN. This place will ROCK your mind as you take each bite with total confusion of how good a taco can taste. There aren't enough words to describe the amazing freshness and quality of the food that play a part in the spectacular creation of the flavor profile in each taco. From the complimentary corn salsa and chips to the last bite of food on your plate will leave you speechless. A giant smile  on your face says it all as you regretfully will have to leave and move on with your life. But remember one thing, you experienced the wonderful hospitality of the wait staff and the amazing food.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. L-R Scallop Taco, Flank Steak Taco, Mahi-mahi Taco with Cabo Rice

jNdSN3nLixer-TKRlvevpw.text: it's ahhhh-mazing!!!!!! The service was  out of this world. We went in only to order out, but, the hostess made us want to dine in. It was the best experience, I've had in a very long time!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Queen City Margarita!!
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

h90iPizQ6_6oge3gCOfREA.text: Love the food.  I especially like the shrimp tacos! That's what I always order.  You can go very casual or some people dress up.

Bl-fq58EvvIdnVumbmQHfg.text: Cabo Fish Taco was a wonderful experience. The food was very good and flavorful. I had the Soy Ginger Shrimp Tacos and it exceeded my expectation. My guest had the Carne Asada Tacos and they stated that their tacos were amazing as well. I requested slaw as my side but I wasn't a huge fan because I prefer vinegar based slaw and their slaw is more on the sweet side in my opinion. I paired my food with a pomegranate margarita and it was very good. The staff was very nice and attentive to our needs. Overall, my experience at this establishment was very pleasant and they have a nice atmosphere. The only downside to this restaurant is the parking. Due to it being in the NoDa area, free parking is very limited however they have a paid parking lot near available. I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Soy Ginger Shrimp Tacos.
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carne Asada Tacos and slaw.
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Soy Ginger Shrimp Tacos.

M1lkpS5aqeylfMsWXgD3Og.text: This is our second attempt to get in to this bustling restaurant and as usual the waitress said a wait time of 30 to 45 mins. After an excruciating wait we got to our tables. Our waiter was okay but never acknowledged the fact we waited a whole 45 minutes to get to our table. Once you order there is an another delay which might take some waiting before you could dig in. The tacos were okay tasting and not very flavorful. The quantity of food was mediocre. Be warned all that waiting would make you really hungry. Overall if i look back, I could only remember the waiting and nothing about the food. The restaurant is at a great place and Tacos with sea food is definitely inviting, but considering all the toil, I rather see someplace else.

Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Tacos

96ZkI_7xFEidez-ckrm2Wg.text: I absolutely love this place! Every time I go I get something different and Cabo never disappoints. The salsa is chunky and amazing, and the queso is always gone within 5 minutes of touching the table. Portions are large!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZdETwKPfE7mo6zO9tHx5-Q.text: I suggest the Maui Maui tacos! This place is so cute. The food is great. Awesome service, the people who work there are so nice. It is very popular though so you might have a wait but it's so worth it!

vKflXU7J6dgYKhhb4DSjLg.text: Delicious food. Great atmosphere. Awesome service. Plenty of AC with a nice breeze throughout. You kind of get that traditional island feeling walking in. Music is not too loud and just an overall nice place for family and friends.The corn salsa with chips that they start you off with is super fresh and tasty. I ordered the Honest Wasabi Tuna Burrito. Packed with so much flavor and full of flavor. I mean every single bite had tuna flavored in a aioli sauce with rice. It's a nice portion for a great price. One of the big things that earn a high grade to be in any restaurant is quality of water. Great water here. Can't wait to return.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

EQFTOgDyOnBL0f_KJ2sAXA.text: One of our favorite restaurants! We love the beer battered fish tacos, but we usually try something off their seasonal/ rotating menu. The flavors are so fresh and unique, definitely worth the try. Hands down, best queso I've ever had. You will gain a lot of weight your first time here because you'll want to drink that deviously delicious white cream sauce. I mean, this review should just say: Queso. Honestly the whole menu is amazing and fun to go to with a group so you can try a bit of everything. The free salsa they give you is unique and sweet!! The interior is unique and the service is usually very good. 5/5 on all areas!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

zNDq4AMdIMNpQvDzo6d6eQ.text: Came in after a road trip and had a great meal. Carne asada taco was good but the tuna taco was amazing. Thick cut tuna fish with wasabi paste sauce! Sounds weird but amazing. Note, very limited parking. Expect to drive around a bit and fight for street parking or a small fee for a parking lot. Free chips and spicy corn salsa was nice but chips are hard. Good find overall.

WniQDHSPeusQ9L3EZk_rpg.text: So I have been here before and I do like this place but the wait is so long. It isn't there fault as this is one of the best restaurants in NODA. What is cool is that it is in the heart of NODA so you can grab a drink some where else while waiting or walk around and get a look of the colorful artwork.   I am trying out vegan now so I was shocked at the options I did have for that lifestyle . . People who love guacamole! You found your new place to love guacamole!!  Now for non vegan people you need to try the fish tacos! Delicious!   The atmosphere is cool but a little small on the inside as this adds to the wait . It has a good word of mouth and some people go insane over this place and I understand why too. I have eaten at a lot places and I still recommend here all the time. Just be prepared to wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegan option burrito with tofu

ZmDDiDbZItstmJapyK0m2Q.text: Our server Jeremy was great, the food was great but the wait was whew, highly recommend calling ahead if it's possible it's very busy on Friday nights.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and Shrimp &amp; Chicken Burrito

vuLY7JsaHt8vObloUjiDsA.text: Born and raised near the Border of Baja, I had some pretty high expectations. The food was pretty good, though my Serrano taco was cold, it had a great flavor and my husband enjoyed the fish taco. The chips were stale (confirming other reviewers). Our service was very good.   The 3 stars is for the dangerous noise level in this place. 30 minutes at this level can cause damage to hearing. The workers in this place should wear protective ear coverings or the owner should take responsibility and protect their workers and patrons from the excessive noise.   The picture is from our decibel reading.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

jOAMf4dH1a35IisMqpQJEg.text: Cabo Fish Taco...you have been talked about and talked about from FoodNetwork to all-over-Charlotte.  I don't tend to veer towards baja-Mexican cuisine, but was with a group so Cabo it was...and I was excited to try because, well, simply said, I'm a tequila girl. I was ready to get my hands on a nice blanco on the rocks...until I didn't. Why? Because I couldn't.  I asked if they had cazadores? Nope. I looked quickly at the margarita menu since there wasn't a tequila menu (still scratching my head about this), and ended up with El Jimador, which I took approximately 2 1/2 sips out of because I couldn't do it. No no, I wasn't going to let this ruin my tequila.  The girls' tacos looked fabulous but I went with a salad for two reasons: 1. I don't love soft shells 2. gluten and corn-free. The options for dietary restrictions aren't terribly limited here, but they aren't great. Nothing on the menu is labeled, so you definitely need to mention to your server specifications. You very rarely hear me complain about cost in reviews, I'm fine with spending on quality, but I thought $7 upcharge to add chicken was VERY high so considering my salad was over $16.00 but their other salad that happens to have chicken on it costs $12.50 and the salmon salad was $13.95. Again, scratching my head.

5R8LPsnfNPRkTIZIRaXpgQ.text: Pros: Good salsa Good location  Cons: Insane wait for not that great of food  Bad chips, always stale  Bad service Not that great of a venue No parking Bad service Margarita is overpriced and weak  For as much as everyone talks this place up, I was very disappointed. Long story short.. I'll pass.

EcDilAC__9DER3L4A9j8lw.text: This taco place is phenomenal. Tacos are moderately priced. Service was prompt and fast. I enjoyed my meal and will certainly be back. This place is packed on the weekend nights so go in advance if you want to get a table without a long wait time!

ozUrPuRzsNPDiBRDVx8g7Q.text: A good friend of mine was at Cabo fish taco with a group of our friends. This friend was more intoxicated then the rest of us and accidentally left without paying for his meal. He came back about 5 minutes later and told the waitress he accidentally walked out so he came back by himself to pay. They added $40 to his tab when he had 2 tacos and one beer- his tab was over $70. They also told him he isn't allowed to eat there anymore. What assholes! Next time, he's gonna walk out without paying and not even come back to be decent and let you know that he's sorry it was an accident and he's back to pay. Worst waitresses in all of CLT.

uqtzmwE7BB-8cI3VjFpQkw.text: Barely waited for a table at about 2pm on a Friday. The chips and corn salsa were great, and the salsa definitely has a kick to it. I chose the bbq mahi and lemon grilled shrimp tacos, and both were great. A little spicy, but nothing that a little alcohol can't help. On Friday's, they have a "bartender's choice", which happened to be a peach margarita--pretty strong and very good. Overall great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. The BBQ mahi and lemon grilled shrimp tacos, served with baja rice.

-Mg7j9JEa1SqBvLZfBeZew.text: This place has four stars, and that nails it on the head. It's not worse, and it's not better. The location is excellent, I LOVE Noda. The service was nice as well.  I am not a fish taco type of person, so that is somewhat important to my review. But, I am a food person, and flavors are a big part of what makes me decide if I LOVE something. I had two tacos, a steak taco, and a salmon taco. The salmon taco had a sauce that used horseradish as the main flavor, likely a good match for seafood. This taste, however, turns me off in general, making the taco get overpowered. The steak tacos was good, the steak a bit chewier than I would like, especially after the Carne Asada Fries from Sabor next door.  I'm sure that if I loved fish tacos, this would be my place!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Good tacos, a good meal
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nice starter to a nice meal

eTT7SH6M-8CvT6_B1py-Sw.text: Salmon tacos. Omg!!!! I've been wanting salmon tacos for a while now and I got that and more with a side of Baja rice. Nice amount of salmon, dough was sooo good and soft and this sauce!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon Tacos with Baja Rice

FFJywYfkQ3HgR0_seusSHw.text: I stopped in Cabo fish taco for the second time ever and was again really impressed by the food. Cabo has a very unassuming environment. This place is casual, with a nice outdoor seating area, open via a garage door. The menu is full of margaritas, burritos, tacos, and drink specials. They have regular specials on Tecate and PBR, as well as food specials.  As far as the food goes, the standard salsa they bring is a corn and tomato based salsa that I really enjoyed. Unfortunately, the chips were slightly stale, but the salsa itself was solid. I ordered the grilled shrimp tacos and loved them. They have a nice aioli and the tortilla is buttery.   Given this place's spot on triple d, I was worried about commercialism the first time I visited, but I've been overall impressed by the food both times. Not a bad spot for casual drinks and good food.

zNU3y_Zr5iGFmGmWmrqiGA.text: I love tacos! That being said, this place was so so so good. I highly recommend the shrimp dip to start but you also get chips and a really yummy corn salsa! I had a lemon grilled shrimp taco and a blackened mahi mahi taco with the Baja rice as my side. I don't think you can go wrong with any of the tacos! They all sounded so good! Our waitress was super cool and kept the margs coming which were also great! Can't wait to go back here!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

gIbfJtELGFObPjk2lrvFvw.text: 1. The food was amazing  2. The food was amazing 3. The food was amazing  4. Chips and water off the bat 5. The food was amazing  6. Just go and be as happy as me right now writing this review

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Amazing
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Amazing

959aup-JZcdAsSMCZtxQYg.text: Stopped in to place a to-go order on a Sunday night. Sat up at the bar, and the bartender was extremely kind. I follow a vegan diet so she helped me find the best menu option, and was very patient with the rest of my north as they ordered. Gave us chips and salsa while we waited. Food came out very quickly and was SO delicious. Will be returning when I visit Charlotte again

f8N7sBJ8N_kdmdxfedsj5g.text: The taco were superb, I had the beef tenderloin and my wife the salmon wasabi taco. I'll vouch for it, however that's as far as it goes. The service was mediocre and the server was not sincere. She had a demeaning attitude and sort of was speaking down to us as we ordered. This place has a grungy vibe to it. I felt like everyone needed to pause and wash their hands. The waitresses were in street clothes and some of them had semi workout attire on.  This place has a mellenial appeaI to it as most of its patron were below 40.  Outside of the tacos the food was low quality. The chip were super stale and came out cold. The guacamole was unusually solid (not good). The ambiance was just confusing to me. This isn't my scene, I probably won't be back.

ce-1Da_eRjcg6EdtqcDWzg.text: Rastapasta is the only dish worthwhile. This place is a shadow of what it used to be, and many of the dishes just aren't very good. I can't tell if it is this version of the chain, or if they have adjusted recipes and ingredients, or if they have poor training that makes every meal here, well, just suck.  Either way, a money trap with mediocre food. Hard pass every single time.

LhE9v3pn6KlL2v8pBhu2Qw.text: One of my favorite spots to eat here in the QC! Cabo Fish Taco is one of the best spots when you want tacos with a twist. All the flavors are fresh and Work so well together. I got the chicken Serrano taco and the blackened salmon taco. I could of eaten 5 of them because they were so good. I decided to get the rice and beans as my side and my taste buds were dancing in my mouth. I also ordered the Pomegranate margarita and it was the perfect addition to this meal. Prior to the meal, they give you their own rendition of a salsa and it's amazing and fresh. I was surprised there wasn't a wait bc it was mother's day. I also am so happy they've expanded. I'll be back soon

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

w3LhUOM8-uUflj2z5gljlw.text: I wish Yelp had half stars because this place was a 3.5/5 for me. We went on a Sunday morning and there was no wait but like any part of downtown, the parking situation sucks. We got free chips and corn salsa to start and that was pretty good and a nice change from the regular tomato salsa. Our waiter also hooked us up with queso which tasted great. I got two tacos and they all come with a side (carne asada and tavarua tuna) and I decided on  their special jalapeno mashed potatoes that our waiter recommended as my side. The carne asada was a bit spicy but it was nothing special, there was too much going on. The tuna one was delicious and cooked perfectly. The mashed potatoes were weird, I was not impressed because it was just mashed potatoes with jalapeno pieces on top. Overall I think it is definitely overhyped. The tacos are good but not the best I've had, the combinations are cool and more of a go for the atmosphere place.

reLx2DAMyfn3mayvEWmXXw.text: Great food, good margaritas but don't go for intimate conversations unless you want to have them at the top of your lungs.

g8LyZFfTY9YsHmTlyLGJ5Q.text: 100% my favorite spot in Charlotte.   The food is great, I've had so many of the menu items--and I've never complained about anything. My number one favorite is the Tav-a-Roo tacos, but again, you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Mix and match the tacos to try different flavors, I also recommend the baja rice for a side.   They have great drink specials and a full margarita list to choose from. When you sit down, they'll serve you chips and corn salsa...you're going to want more!   The servers are always great, the atmosphere is fun and laid-back. Absolutely recommend it!

CtBvM-tFy5LBEBQqgXaOqg.text: I like going to Cabo when I'm in the Charlotte area.. the food has always been great. I decided to go today, taking a friend who had never been there and the food was horrible! I was very surprised & disappointed. Food had no taste, the salsa tasted like it came straight out of a jar. I sent my side back, refried beans; and my friend did not eats hers, the black beans & rice. Both were tasteless! Adding a whole lot of hot sauce didn't make a difference in taste. Tacos were just ok. Basic tacos - nothing to brag about. I don't know what happened but I won't be going back.

YXUiYDnY-c8eWZ8C0Lc_YA.text: The tacos are really good.  The menu regulars and special tacos a like.  My favorites are the tuna tavarua and the honey soy salmon.  They have a corn based salsa with their chips that isn't my favorite.  The guacamole is way below the bar, especially for a taco place, one of the worst in the city.  The mexi-slaw is decent but I only get that side because the rest aren't very good either.  They make up for everything else with the tacos which is why everyone goes there.         The restaurant itself is pretty large and has a porch like outdoor seating area in the front.  They can open up the large clear walls on nice days too.  I would plan on putting your name in and  grabbing a drink in the neighborhood while you wait for your table.  There is almost always a long wait but I live so close I usually get takeout which is super easy.        ***  I live in the middle of NODA and have been everywhere in the neighborhood many times over the past years. These reviews are a culmination of lots of visits so it's more of a consistency rating than anything.  If you are going out in NODA I've got reviews up of all the places in the neighborhood if you're looking to compare.  ***

5B-FrlnVkwHWfpJNIVg2fQ.text: Although the name implies delicious fish options, my sister and I got chicken tacos and carne Asada tacos. Both were lacking flavor, the chicken was worse than the carne Asada. Refried beans were bland, the avocado pasta salad was warm and weird, also not much flavor. The queso was delicious, but the chips were thick, yellow, and cold. Just not my favorite style of chips. The corn salsa they serve with their chips was also very bland. I won't be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chips and corn salsa. Kinda lame.
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken tacos with refried beans. Not impressed.

QLtQjrW7PJuLba8l6UQmeA.text: Relaxed unpretentious place. Nice energy as usual in noda We went because of the DDD tv visit and the good Yelp reviews.   Not too long of a wait and I like that they just text you instead of one of those vibrating things. The chips and salsa were good and free is always nice. You can get fresh guacamole too if you want. Started with the crab dip. We loved cheesy with warm pita.a winner for sure I had the tuna tacos and it was perfectly med rare withe spicy wasabi sauce. Big chunks . I ordered two but could only eat one.  My friend got the lemon shrimp tacos and she said the shrimp were sweet , tender and not over cooked. Again a winner The avocado pasta salad make you think your in a modern era and not in granny's kitchen. The parking can be tough because it's on the street but we figured we just had to walk off all that food This is a good place to bring out of town guests and or big groups.

uI1mHjbVY0LydvrwLcAskw.text: Best fish tacos I've had so far! Stopped by because of the place being featured on DDD. They get you in and out quick. Food isn't a long wait at all.   Got a silver surfer margarita and they have some other specialty margaritas. Husband got a lonerider shotgun Betty and really liked it.   Ordered the BBQ mahi mahi fish tacos which was featured in DDD. I've never had BBQ on fish tacos but it goes so well. The sauce is homemade and the soft tortilla is too! It was the first thing we noticed when the tacos arrived. I wish every taco place had these homemade soft tortillas. I could just smack on those alone.  Husband ordered the blackened mahi mahi and he enjoyed that as well. You get two tacos so we swapped one. He got the spicy avocado pasta salad as a side and it was delicious. It's really not spicy at all.   If we lived in Charlotte we would definitely be coming back. There's no parking lot so you'll have to find street parking. You will not be disappointed with the fish tacos. Almost everyone in the restaurant was ordering them. Also featured on the show was the tuna wasabi burrito. I saw someone order that and it looked yummy as well. Another unique part is the corn salsa they give you to snack on. It's got a slight kick and it's just tomatos and corn with chips.   I just wanna go back and try everything off the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lonerider shotgun Betty beer
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Signature BBQ mahi mahi tacos with black beans and rice
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened mahi tacos with avocado pasta salad

8n3-1OFcqtsPvt7zhx_62A.text: Our service was Great. But Cabo is slipping. 3 baskets of stale chips later, and our dishes were microwaved from frozen. Just awful awful food... gross to the point we couldn't eat it. We said nothing to our super sweet attentive waitress - but the food was so bad - we went and vomited later.  So bad. Pre made and reheated disgusting piles of pure shit.  Please- please redeem yourselves Cabo. You were so much better than this.
