Today was one of the worst dining experiences based on Food alone I've ever had.

D2tzcab0kBg1kWtst1UQ8A.text: I was in Charlotte for business and asking around for places to eat in Uptown, when a friend recommended I try somewhere in the Noda area while I was here.  I was not disappointed.    Cabo Fish Taco was great for the large group I had. Decent, attentive service and overall the food was really good.  I ordered the tuna taco, carne asada taco, and the avocado pasta salad.  The tuna was a bit too salty, and my tortillas were pretty greasy, but overall I really enjoyed all of the big flavors (and huge portions). I definitely recommend checking this place out if you want a cheaper meal that doesn't skimp on the food or the taste.  And the house margaritas are pretty good, too!

15vruAp9plzxmSe8a63G-A.text: Have been wanting to come for a long time. 5 stars for atmosphere. 3 stars for food. 1 Star for parking. Had fish tacos, shrimp tacos, beef burrito, Ava pasta salad..... everything very bland and under seasoned. All fine but very very underwhelming. Will not be venturing back. Parking is terrible so just not worth the trip. We are from Huntersville and Verde has hands down superior food.

dANnDstkotg8rxLV8flB8A.text: New resident in NoDa so checking out the local spots. Cabo is very alluring I mean who doesn't love fish & taco then add them together and it's heaven in a taco  .  Ordered the Jerk Grouper taco with a mango & misc salsa (there was other stuff in the salsa but mango was the king) which was freaking amazing. You get 2 huge soft tacos with a side which I got the avocado salad which is a pasta also freaking amazing . Cabo gives a very laid back vibe and the atmosphere has a Caribbean feel and tons of unique art which includes Bob Marley (4/20 ). The rice and beans as a side were also tasty so I recommend those as well.  Our waitress was very attentive and thank goodness cause that jerk snuck up on me and slapped me like 3 times lol but it was worth it.   The only thing missing from Cabo is a live band, group of friends and some libations lol.

5ZI6IR-hJ5fmG9vvU55w0A.text: This place was highly recommended by a good friend of ours. We tried it for dinner tonight and it just wasn't for us. Im sure plenty of people would appreciate the strong margaritas and people who like flavorful salty food would love it. I probably woulda really liked it in my early 20s. The waitress was super nice and we had absolutely no issues with the service. The inside is loud but if you do outdoor seating, it's not so loud. It does take a while to be seated but they text you when your table is ready so you can go for a walk or something.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened mahimahi tacos
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken salad
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Guac

nDiOPFCSTzHOBYSQaAC-dw.text: I love this place. It's in NODA. It's not a large restaurant but the salmon tacos are amazing. The size of the place is the only downside. The pricing is decent and the atmosphere is very chill. NODA is an art district so when the weather is fair I encourage you to walk around and explore the different shops in the area. I have been to Cabo Fish Taco about 4 times in the past year. Each time I go I get the same exact thing. The salmon taco is just so note worthy that I can't pass it up. It's so good that I have even ordered me a second meal to go. There is a pay parking lot directly beside the restaurant but parking is usually available on the street for free, you would just have to walk a short distance to get to the restaurant. The staff here are very friendly and helpful as well. If you are in the NODA district I encourage you to drop in to Cabo Fish Taco and check out what they have to offer.

E89sClAcXHSCQuEJDGm3OQ.text: Overall AMAZING! Ask to sit in Marissa's section. All of her recommendations were super tasty! My sister ordered the Rasta pasta, which is chicken and shrimp pasta with a pineapple cream sauce! It was different yet good because the pineapple isn't too over powering and it's something different to try. I definitely recommend the salmon taco! It was sooo good. As an appetizer we got the shrimp and crab dip. It came with pita triangles that were soft and seasoned to perfection. The food alone is a reason to go and the service matched. Marissa was super sweet and was very attentive.

qB1qKZROes6TnZ49AyovKw.text: One of my absolute favorite places in Charlotte, best quesadillas and their tacos are amazing, I get the lemon grilled shrimp and the blackened mahi! The sides are also delicious, the avocado pasta salad is to die for and the seasonal mashed potatoes are fantastic! Don't take reservations so make sure you get there early. They are very fast but is always crowded.

wCG_ld6dE2WlLNs_rHuCNQ.text: Fun place with good food and a friendly atmosphere. I tried the Tuna Tacos with the wasabi honey sauce. Didn't like them personally, but that was due to me not the way they were served. The tuna was cooked beautifully. I kindly asked for something else and told them I was still happy to pay for that dish. The manger came out without me asking and said that he wouldn't let me pay for something I didn't enjoy. Some of the best customer service I have ever had. Tried another dish and loved it. Wish I lived closer so I could go to this restaurant more.

3SxAcNEYU-520zSP-IzEBw.text: The drinks are moderately price...which is nice, but it's pretty much down hill from there. The best thing to eat is the salsa, very fresh and heavy on the corn. I got the epic tuna burrito, it wasn't epic at all. There was no seasoning on it. Same goes for the avocado pasta salsa. No seasoning. The food could use some traditional Mexican season or even some Lawry's. Sabor Latin Street Grill is 10 times better.

f78B9YKxz0x-b6yiJ0HK7w.text: Best Fish Tacos in NC hands down! I've made it a point to try the fish tacos wherever I go and I don't think I've found one to beat Cabo yet.

3oLfYhKy3kdcP8ozSYoUrg.text: Such a funky fun place. Firstly love Noda, love the outside/inside seating feels like Asheville. The food is gorgeous, it is art. Margaritas have their own menu. I don't give 5 stars for this reason, I just wish there was a Taco that was just not so spicy. When they say it's not spicy, it still hurt me- (BBQ mahi taco, fantastic) but I have to disclose I have an incredibly low spice tolerance. Even though it was spicy (for me, and I stress that) I could taste such amazing blends of flavors, and the quantity of meat and fun in the taco is more the size of a burrito, so don't shy from the price. Too it all off with friendly, likable, helpful staff. Love you Cabo Fish Taco, please give me one.. "sweet" fish taco, you know what I mean.. maybe a sweetish slaw, advocado cilantro something.. any space with so much attention to detail could give me one not too spicy dish.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ mahi taco.. this is a monster size !!! Amazing flavors :)

cJjgxLvNT75TO_Zcw_fpIw.text: One of my favorite places to eat with friends. Great light meal where everything is just right.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Honey Soy Salmon Tacos! Delicious

sMGpp7eb0Fxi6DBoapl2Sg.text: This place has gone down hill so badly in the past few years. Several of my friends have even been sick- one had food poisoning.  What happened? It used to actually be good. Food is awful.  The salsa and chips is even bad. Better off getting some from the grocery store

CuJ-kBd8obL07W2FdU8Ahg.text: Totally love the tacos....the best that I have ever had ...great atmosphere...my wife and I tell everyone it is a must place to experience...very friendly staff and service is always good

bUvjFXZp-ORDAGaGpTIfjQ.text: The food is great! Service fast and efficient- Hearty portion of Food! One of the best fish taco places I've been to.    Highly Recommend the Honey Soy glazed Salmon   Ryan was a great server he had awesome menu knowledge!

mvA58Hf_q09waNc3R0fGBw.text: Love the food. The Epic Burrito is awesome. Great selection of beers. I always order Birdsong Jalapeno Pale Ale to go with my meal. Kate, our waitress, spoils us. We always enjoy coming here.

EjeJyDaQMAS0FkBxGg5puw.text: We went here based on good reviews , but never got a chance to try the food. It was our anniversary and we just wanted a quiet place to sit. The snotty girl who seated us tried to sit my 6 foot 4 husband and I in a super small table which hangs halfway into a door jam. We asked if we could sit somewhere else and she put us up at the front where there was heavy traffic . We just asked if we could possibly sit somewhere a little more quieter and she offered us to sit outside when it was about to start raining !!!Really??? The whole other side of the restaurant was darker and quieter and she would not budge so we left... Sorry so here is a bad review for you because of your not so nice employee !

fUvHh0UBBf_cq6oWgRFL-A.text: Great food. Not impressed with the Salsa, but who cares it was free on the table. I had the shrimp taco. Excellent. My semi-picky kids loved it as well.  Great atmosphere. We got there at a perfect time. Sometimes  the line can be long. The Banana Cheese Cake was perfect.  Over all I will go back to try more of the menu.

--zmqc2-B748BJ23QukKYw.text: Always AWESOME Food, great staff, and now they can text you when you table is ready which is perfect.

-1g-s6zoHu2bQGoBI6NfcA.text: Very impressed with the lemon grilled shrimp tacos. My companion's beer batter fish tacos were not as flavorful. Can be very loud when restaurant is full of people.

iphGbEtTqXamdX4oRURKIQ.text: Stopped by for a bite to eat before a show at the Neighborhood Theater. I'm from out of town and was really hungry so went for the tofu tacos. All in all, very good taco but I would've preferred smaller pieces of tofu if it's going to be on a taco. Cool vibes, dope art work, and love the outdoor seating. Very cool area too. Props to Noda!

O-J3aO8NziAr0W6VYK3QxQ.text: Great location Mediocre food. Limited menu, the bar isn't too appealing look to it and the bar tenders were rude seeing as though I'm 22 and probably assumed I wouldn't tip accordingly. Haven't been back.

NudPtpcRgmpkBSun7XcK1w.text: As an establishment it has turned into a novelty.  Everything I ate lacked real flavor and instead was coveted in jalapenos. I doubt I'll be back.

RJVlRaeS_E8Q7rXwWcv3Bg.text: THE BEST FISH TACOS I'VE EVER HAD!   So last Saturday I tried this place for the first time after hearing all these great things about it from friends, and it definitely lived up to my expectations. IT WAS ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS!!!   I've had the lemon grilled tuna and grilled salmon tacos, they were both great, but the salmon one was to die for! The cilantro white sauce really perfects the dish! You also get a side with the order as well; I chose fruit cup to be a little on the healthy side. I thought 2 tacos wasn't going to be enough for me because I have such a big appetite, but it was very filling. Good portion size!   This is definitely a place to check out. I want to go there again very very soon!

pJo8hdSJrEW3qC6TNzMYYA.text: Love there appetizers the crab dip AWESOME!!! Been here twice salmon taco and bbq mahi is amazing..but the reason they received only three stars is the service slow and they continuously forgot to come by our table and there sides are not good at all..I think taco bells rice taste better and I haven't eaten there in over 5 years . But the main food is great and app. Try for yourself

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon and bbq mahi
Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab dip..so good!!

0pphjcUWCk1jytuLmHnEYw.text: BOMB dot com. Don't ask questions. Don't read reviews. Just go. Have fun. Stay thirsty my friends.

MzE8GNCGuJi76iQMjq5ljg.text: Overrated. I think the hype is bc they've been on TV. Foods otherwise is flavorless. Was trying to give them a chance to coming here a few times afterwards but Everytime I felt like I needed more salt or something in all the meals. Their fish tacos (which is what they're famous for) in my POV weren't up to all the hype.  Pretty much something you can get at another restaurant.

HHEYOFH0A2tZFzSwAxSMZQ.text: EDIT: I have to drop this to 3 stars.  A restaurant just has to be consistent and CFT is anything but that.  I went today and my food was just so-so (everything we ordered) and it's not the first time.   This place is awesome.  A lot of creative choices other than just fish tacos too - my favorite being the Carne Asada tacos.  The price's are reasonable and the atmosphere is pretty chill and down to earth - but nothing special.  I don't think it matters - if you're like me you come here for the food and to have a few brews while hanging out in the NODA area.    So what's holding me back from giving 5 stars?  I'm not factoring in atmosphere, meal presentation, etc because this isn't that kind of place.  And the price's reflect that.  So purely based on food - the sides are very average. The chips and salsa are OK (although complimentary as in most mex-american joints).  And while the main entrees are definetely tasty, they're not "out of this world" good.  Still, I'm always up for some Cabo Fish Taco and they get a solid 4 stars.

UOpeVFHtUb2l-DuEtXklSA.text: Got a take out order which was prepared promptly.  I chose fried shrimp tacos which I were good but only had 4 smaller shrimp in them each.  I picked my side as pasta salad and while I typically love hot food this side was too spicy for me.   I might give it another shot for mahi mahi, I'd also like to see option of mixing up selections and buying more than just 2.

7bopuPudWs7v45Wie6GOsQ.text: Laid back vibe, good food and portions.  I mostly wanted to write this overdue review because of Rafaela, our awesome waitress.  She seemed to have a bunch of tables going at once, but was very attentive to us, and provided great service!

qSLEa7_u2jdIn7la97M-Qg.text: I came by for a visit based on recommendations from fellow YELPers.  The place was packed for dinner, so I sat at the bar.  They have two bars, one in front, one in the other side of the restaurant.  The place was very busy, and pretty loud.  That's fine, it's just that kind of place.  The sidewalk patio seating looked GREAT but, it was full so, I couldn't enjoy the people watching.  I ordered the special, based on recommendation from the bar tender, the Tuna Wrap.  It was basically a tuna sandwich in a tortilla....sounds lame  but, it wasn't.  the Tuna salad was very nicely spiced and the wrap was quite good.  Very generous portion but, I was hungry!!! what could I do?  I ate the whole darn thing (oink oink)  The beer selection was nice, with a variety of local brews, as well as commercial taps and specialty beers.  Service at the bar was good.  The bartender was VERY experienced and knew what he was doing.  Friendly, good at small talk but, not annoying and bothering too much.  The ambiance....meh.  Take it or leave it.  Too "themed" for my own tastes but, that's just the kind of place it is.  I would definitely come here again, especially with friends for dinner before night on the town  Hint:  Plan on waiting if you come at peak times...the place was very busy during dinner, as well as lunch when I strolled by earlier in the day.  Not sure if they take reservations....worth a call to find out.

gKV4obGvcZp9MHjOvASADg.text: Two and a half stars, Ok but not so great.  Another Sunday fighting the crowds at Ikea - I recently bought two complete kitchens from them what a Pita!! - from there to the nearest home depot. I'm rarely at that end of town so I ask the young man behind the counter what's a good place for brunch in NODA and he says .... Cabo Fish taco.  Great idea!   We get there about 2:30, the place is busy but not unmanageable. Mexico and Marley theme joint, my partner asked if it was a part of a chain. Told her, no but it wants to be. We get a table immediately, the waitress is very friendly and attentive, although the bar was slow getting the drinks out.   - Salsa and chips. Boooring, the corn heavy but too light on onions and spice mixture is no salsa and chips are cardboardy - I'd be surprised if they're not packaged.   -The skinny Margarita got two thumbs down but I was cozy with my Negra modelo.   - Mahi taco .. with tangy bbq sauce? The sauce was tasty but out of place, it overpowered the whole dish. Mahi, which in Fla we usually call dolphin is a strong tasting fish that can even be served blackened and it's flavor will still come through. Here it was so bland it could have been a chicken. It wasn't bad but the mahi taco tasted like bbq chicken taco so I'd call that a fail. My companion said she would have liked it if it hadn't been for the sauce , not me.  - Honey wasabi Tuna wrap, hu menu says burrito. Exact same result, wasabi/honey is the only flavor that came through and the wasabi tasted more like sharp yellow mustard than like wasabi.  And I'm a wasabi eater, at home I even use it on cold chicken or cold roast beef.  Tuna, unlike mahi is easy to overpower but still that was another honey/mustard chicken wrap not a fish burrito.  The refried beans and the mashed potatoes with jalapenos were the best thing of the whole meal. Price was reasonable. Would I go back? No, it wasn't bad but the food was Charlotte-grade boring.

gcMuSy8QE_p9nCoueHKPiQ.text: I really want to love this place but I really think it's overrated. I've been a number of times over the years and the food is rarely better than ok. The service has always been awesome though.

XHBcVVtbARvAKy9xPS7m6A.text: There is always an hour + wait but its delicious. Don't order the tuna taco unless you're a big fan of wasabi (cream sauce served over top). I recommend putting your name on the list and going across the street for a beer at Growlers.

juL-nbJh4KlxF4VdXdN8lQ.text: Carne asata wrap and a small pasta salad waiter was awesome and the food rocked!!!! Def would come back!!!

GbTV7v9i3mlIkNl23zpmVQ.text: I'm really not sure what all the hype is about.  The crab and shrimp dip is amazing and next time, that will be my entree.  My hubby got the tuvaroo (however that is spelled) wahoo tacos and they were really good, but too spicy for me.  I got the beer battered white fish tacos.  They were tasty but stone cold.  Like, the fresh from the cooler.  The place is super loud, unless you are lucky enough to be seated outside, and our table was literally in the doorway between the bar and the dining room.  I might get take out next time, if there is a next time.

aFrN8yf8Pai7K_5uLAqT0A.text: After being repeat customers we had the worst experience with customer service. Since that time we have not been back and will not return.

S9bbA7HxXnWs5f9wkHUE3g.text: Excellent tacos, very interesting flavors, and good service.  Cool and cozy atmosphere, and great margaritas.

AYE-oHavt_-ejhq-R3np_w.text: We eat here regularly and have been working our way through the menu. All of the shrimp and grilled tacos are excellent and the namesake Cabo Fish Taco is decent. They changed their menu around recently and the newly added carne asada taco is great--tender, juicy steak with nice chunks of jalapeno for some kick. The side dishes are inconsistent, but at their worst are pretty good. The only negative is that sometimes dishes can be a little sweet and... cinnamon-y? Especially the corn salsa and refried beans.  The service is laid-back and can occasionally be sloppy. At times, it seems like the staff can't handle big crowds, which is inexcusable for a restaurant that's consistently packed-with-waiting-list on Friday and Saturday nights.

e2OlClJWV-8iNkHkvi9RYQ.text: Stale chips, okay salsa mostly corn, fish and shrimp tacos not very hot, mashed potatoes tasted like instant with jalapenos on top.

C6_ligv84SqsHP_pg64N1A.text: Went again because their tacos are amazing! Chips were so much better this time and got the lemon shrimp tacos, no complaints! Going to chalk up the bad chips to a busy night! Amazing food

snDcr9C5uqRdgF5Hx_sFRg.text: Good fish tacos. Mahi Mahi and fried shrip are my favorite! Combine it with $2 Tecate with lime and you are on your way to complete satisfaction!   Service can be slow at times. When we sat inside it was slower but when we sat at the Patio it was faster. IMO

Lgrbk7CPhYqspF3S0aYnog.text: GREAT place... service was 5 stars, sangria was spectacular... great menu and food.. but the crab dip was CRAZY good, do NOT skip it!! The pita chips with it were AMAZING!!!

B2WyQBlG0uGlw-UNVl_q5A.text: I love Cabo - the food is great! I have never had a bad fish taco here.  Love the beer.  Love hanging out with my friends here and meeting new ones.  This is a MUST visit place in Charlotte and I feel that it anchors the NoDa area.

D8Z8VZO76nyzowgY-KuS_Q.text: Cabo Fish Taco is one of my personal favs in Charlotte (and I'm  a former restaurant co-owner and native Charlottean).  Been going for years and it's hard for me not to get the same thing every time...Cabo's signature tacos with beer battered white fish:  two flour tortillas stuffed with cabbage, tomato, avocado, mixed cheeses, & finished with their white cilantro sauce.  And I'm not even much of a seafood eater.  Back in the day the thought of eating a fish taco would have grossed me out.  But going to Cabo in Noda is a different experience that everyone in Charlotte should try at least once, seafood lover or not....

h46dZcLzUexEn6MBGWnzCw.text: I have visited Cabo Fish Taco several times and it is hard to find a bad thing to say. The food is awesome , the service is fun and great and the atmosphere is very chill. I suppose the only negative is that the place is always packed.. You are better off to get there at 5pm and eat early then to attempt to go later.

3mFbrJEJDnDsxdVtVLGfyQ.text: Great food! Very popular resturaunt with a long wait, but worth it!

E4oskjipghH6jH0C3Fwa4g.text: Have been here twice - only had tacos (figured they had to be good, hence their name) I've tried the beer battered white fish & the BBQ Mahi Mahi tacos - both were very good. (although the rice and beans are pretty dry, nothing to rave about) I love the homemade tortillas. Also - you can't go wrong with chips & queso (their salsa w/ corn in it is pretty tasty as well) Both times I came here on a Saturday for lunch & ended up sitting at the bar because the place was packed. The atmosphere is very hipster but nice, with very cool paintings adorning the walls. (LOVE the huge Samurai painting) If I want a good fish taco I'll come here. Not sure if I want / need to try anything else here, I'll stick to tacos.

IVnrpBzRLmPwmUzcqABcDQ.text: I feel guilty that I have never reviewed Cabo Fish Taco before because it is my favorite place! I love this place and I always take people here when they come to visit. My favorites are the BBQ mahi tacos, lemon grilled shrimp tacos and the mahi maui burrito but you really can't go wrong here. My fiance loves the rasta pasta. The guacamole is also delicious. The only thing that is sometimes a downside to this place is that it can get really loud in the restaurant which makes it hard to talk at dinner. Also, since it is so tasty, sometimes you have to wait awhile for a table. But it is SO worth it!

a35bQV_7Q6FnPQE0tqwh4w.text: 3.5 stars.   I ordered the shrimp tacos with rice & beans. I'd give the tacos 4 stars, everything else 3...   Taco orders come with 2 sizable tacos & one side. Mine came with lightly battered & fried shrimp, tomatoes, guacamole, shredded cheese, shredded cabbage (coleslaw style, minus the dressing), and a delicious white sauce on a house-made, slightly crispy white flour tortilla.   The rice was slightly overcooked and the beans slightly under, without much flavor. Also, they serve chips with a mixture of corn, tomato, cilantro & lime juice which is particularly hard to eat. Salsa would've been nice...  Go for the tacos - they got the name right.

P0tQwxfVa-tOU_h--VYANQ.text: Awesome atmosphere. Great food. Great service/people. The only downside is that this place is always busy!

w5-fO8oGUcbst4urzMdpSw.text: I had read the great reviews of this restaurant and, because I have a condo in Baja and love their fish tacos, I traveled cross town to it.  The location is great as it is in a great urban neighborhood called NoDa.  However I was greatly disappointed in the tacos.  Everyone raved about the tavaroo ones but pineapple on it just did not work for me  I also had the blackened mahi, which was better but the cilantro crema was too mild.  The salsa served with drinks was bland and dry with corn and tomatoes.  Garbanzos in the side dish??  I believe in creative cuisine but the food just was so far off from its Baja theme and was too bland for my taste.  Margarita menu interesting and varied with a great selection of tequilas.  Service was excellent.

PsSoY4G39zOuEQtpxDWz_Q.text: Worth the visit!  Go for  the  BBQ  Mahi Tacos.  Mine where loaded so it made the price for two wort it.  Had to finish with a fork it was so loaded.  It rivals Fish tacos from the west coast.  Vickie was a great host serving at the bar making great local Tap recommendations.  Next time I am in town I will definitely be eating there again.  It only gets loader as more guest come  in so go around 5:30 before the rush and you will be fine.

WkRfkKZto84SezjoAbpNiQ.text: What happened?   I have always loved CFT and willing to suffer the long waits.   Last night...no wait!   This should have been a red flag.    Did they change chefs?   My halibut fish taco was just "OK".   Where was the signature sauce?  The slaw on the taco tasted like a premade packaged slaw.   The cheese was cold.  The waitress was super nice and the food came out quickly.   But it didn't make up for the so-so tacos.    My daughter had the fajitas which had way too much soy sauce, very salty.  So sad.   I will think twice about going back and am now looking for another source for my fish tacos.

FCpx-rYUTR9RJNiAmSFXww.text: I wouldn't stray from the tacos.  This place is good but there are other cheaper alternatives (Crazy Fish) that are on par for cheaper.

E8JhSjzEpdGYWEhvR2UWPA.text: Very good!  Tacos are huge but insanely tasty. Each order comes with two. However, two are plenty. The salsa n chips are also great.  On Thursdays all NC drafts are half off which is a plus.  I don't usually get surprised by taco spots but this place is solid!

KgbIQgZrUrr_aW23sGGaMQ.text: I am a huge fan of the Cabo at Virginia Tech so I had to give this place a try when I came down to Charlotte. The ambiance in this place is almost identical, even down to the hipster-ish people working here who are always very kind. The salsa here wasn't as great as the one back at school but everything else was pretty much on par to the other location. We sat at the bar at this place was packed for a late lunch on Sunday. I enjoyed the chicken tacos which were spilling over of toppings but what I really come here for is the guacamole pasta salad. This place is always great!

kmAepxsfbRzLIgM24m3JHg.text: Came here while visiting Charlotte from a recommendation I got at another restaurant. So glad I came! Service was great, it was my waitress' first night on the job and she did wonderful!  I tried the bbq mahi taco and a blackened mahi taco. The Bbq mahi was better by far, not sweet, but a little tangy, it was amazing. After the bbq mahi my blackened mahi taco seemed a little plain jane. Also the flour tortillas were so unique , they were fluffy and reminded me slightly of Indian fry bread. They were so good and made it much easier to hold/eat the hearty tacos!  I also tried a skimny margarita in the rocks, which was yummy and paired great with the tacos.   I would definitely go back, I was told after I ordered that the calamari tacos are delicious as well, so that's what I want to try next!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bbq mahi taco, blackened mahi taco, black beans and rice, can&#39;t wait!

zHIAuGzj1INqL8fI2nlvfQ.text: I wanted to love this place, but I don't know what I was thinking; after crappy Mexican food the night before, I thought I could get good tacos in the south?  Either we were there on a REALLLY off day, or the people who eat here have not had good tacos/Mexican food.  I will say, however, the service was excellent and the iced tea was tasty and my glass kept filled.  I was tempted to go an extra star for the service, but I just can't.  The food.  Meh...  First, the chips and salsa.  Actually, the corn and tomato salsa was probably the best thing I had here - very interesting, but the chips were awful  Completely stale.  Oh, I ate them... I was hungry, but STALE.  I ordered the lemon grilled shrimp taco (sounds amazing, right?) but asked them to make it with the standard accompaniments (cabbage versus mixed greens).  The husband had fajitas.  My taco was fine.  I thought it was weird that it had cheese on it... I mean, it's shrimp so cheese is weird, but I picked most of it off.  The shrimp was good, the tortilla was meh, that cabbage was not crisp.  It came with beans and rice.  I don't eat beans so gave those to the husband.  He who loves the beans left them there without touching them after tasting his own beans.  That was a first.  The rice had something weird in it for a Mexican rice - I'm pretty sure it was Thyme.  Never heard of Thyme rice with tacos.  Cilantro?  Yeah.  Thyme?  Not so much.  After eating my tacos, I said, "well, what was I thinking trying a second time for Mexican food?"  The husband replied, "yours wasn't good either?"  So there's that.  I've NEVER heard him say he didn't like ANY Mexican food.  He's like a vacuum, especially for the Mexican food.... NOT picky.  I feel bad dinging this place, but it was such a huge disappointment.  What surprises me is how much people love this place and even more that a Cali boy like Guy Fieri put this place on his show and raved about it.  Again, maybe it was an off day while we were there, but I just don't get it.  I cannot recommend this place.  Wait until you get to Cali or heck, even New Mexico before going for tacos.

VljZ8dW85HfG0YZSkPznGw.text: I have now been here twice in the month I've lived in Charlotte. Both times I have gone with family. The first time my aunt and I shared so we could try two things.  I got the chicken and shrimp burrito which was more than filling and she got the bbq mahi tacos which were so full of fish, you could hardly pick them up! The second time I returned and got the BBQ Mahi tacos because I liked them so much. Ended up bringing enough food home from our table that I had two other meals (brought home two tacos). This week I was there on Thursday night and we had just beat the crowd. They had 1/2 off NC Draft beers which was awesome! I will definitely return again soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. On the left is half of the chicken and shrimp burrito then rice and black beans and in the back is the BBQ mahi taco.

ZR3nxhLKB9XwNphp4yWPLQ.text: Good and fun location.  The environment is upbeat and lively. Servers are friendly.   The food is amazing. Fresh and flavorful. The salsa alone is to die for.  The beer is good and the daily deal affordable. The lemon shrimp tacos are so good and the avocado pasta is unique and tasty.  Try this you won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

zgnY3pPFNtp3INVzdk-Ogw.text: Awesome, hot, fresh, delicious!    Went to try this place win my wife for lunch.  I was blown away with how great the service was.  We were seated quickly, the waiter was great, and the food was decadent!    Can't wait for my next visit!!!

JmfDUJZtuoMBY6r7cAInDg.text: Tried Cabo for the first time a few years back, and wasn't very impressed. I gave them the benefit of the doubt because it was a Sunday, and it was slammed. Finally went back on a Tuesday night and the food was great, server was knowledgeable about the menu, and food was quick. Would make the 25 min drive again from huntersville to get the carne asada tacos.

Iy4xZQ0nPpFkgTt-1JbkFg.text: The best fish tacos I've ever had!!!! So fresh and not fishy at all. So glad we stopped in while visiting Charlotte! All of the food was amazing, except the guacamole was a bit of a let down and the chips were stale, but did not distract from the amazing tacos. Please open a location in NJ!!!!

9VjtbLtKfTbKK8cmhD-01g.text: I had high hopes for this place after reading all the reviews. Unfortunately I left with more to be desired. The shrimp tacos I had looked good. I mean the presentation was on point! However it really lacked flavor. My wife's shrimp Baja bowl was sodium crazy! I guess the lid came off when they were putting the salt in. The salsa they give you is not the best and the chips were stale. Also maybe our server was having a bad day but we literally only saw her twice, once when we first sat down to after our food was brought out. If you're visiting Charlotte and trying to find a place to eat skip Cabo Taco you'll thank me later.

zAIZzySYDDlugVJMEDBcPQ.text: Good food, good vibe. Visiting from PA and I have to say, next time I'm here I'm definitely coming here

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States

FZ3veGNTCmU6KxmjpeaGbw.text: Best restaurant in NoDa. Good vibe, friendly service. I unfortunately found a sizeable bone in my blackened mahi mahi taco. It happens and I get that, but was still an off-putting part of an otherwise delicious meal. I thoroughly enjoyed their avocado pasta salad. Chips and corn salsa are good, but I would advise against the queso... everyone at the table agreed it tasted like melted CheezIts

Jw_V2jd-FDZivRjPwWRPCA.text: I had been wanting to try this place really badly - as a DDD restaurant and the fact that there is almost always a line out the door, it seemed like a solid choice.   My boyfriend and I went at about 1:45p on a Saturday afternoon and it was only a 10min wait. Not too shabby!  We loved the lemon grilled tuna tacos, original margarita, and queso that we split. The queso almost tasted like a beer cheese, just had a more savory flavor than I'm used to I guess. The margarita was really interesting, you'd get the typical citrus/sour mix flavors at first then it had a really sweet after taste - I'm pretty sure I couldn't drink more than two without getting a massive hangover. And the tacos were out of this world - definitely the star of the show - and there were a handful of other types we want to try in the future that I'm confident are equally as good.   My only qualms are: (1) the chips and salsa they serve the table are a unique twist. Instead of making a standard tomato based salsa they serve the tortillas with a corn salsa. This is just a personal preference, but I don't want corn salsa (with close to nothing else but corn in it) with corn chips. Hence the queso move... (2) our server missed part of our order. Granted it was loud, I mumble, and one order of tacos plus a side plus queso was enough to fill us up. But still, he wrote down the first and third things I ordered. Confused on what happened there in the middle.   BUT, we will definitely be back!

cLtJAp46KbXHeU1xeLFeIg.text: Was in town for business, staying downtown and heard NoDa was a good area to grab dinner. There was a 20 minute wait around 7pm but I was by myself so I was able to eat at the bar right away. I had the beer battered shrimp tacos and they were very good. The flour tortillas were crispy yet soft at the same time and everything tasted fresh.  Very affordable, quick and tasty.

5Wp4hy-6V0wvqFx7OaJrAA.text: I'm probably going to make some enemies in Charlotte by not eating this place higher but despite its devoted following, Cabo Fish Taco is overrated and overpriced. I've also noticed that the quality has been steadily declining over a he years. I used to really like it but now it's squarely in 'just ok' territory with me.   Some of the tacos are good but some are of iffy quality. The crane asada tacos used to be my go to but last time I had then, the meat was incredibly tough. They're seasoned well but that doesn't matter much when the meat is the consistency of a shoe. The tuna isn't fresh tasting so I'd avoid that too. The fried fish tacos and the Mahi tacos are decent.  One of my biggest complaints about this place is the unreasonable prices. Not only are the tacos way overpriced but they also charge five bucks for the tomatillo salsa then don't give refills! The house salsa is free but it's disgusting. I love the tomatillo salsa but I use a lot of salsa and I don't expect to pay ten dollars for salsa alone!  The atmosphere of this place is really fun but the food quality just doesn't measure up to the price tag or the ridiculously long waits. I guess in Noda, you can get away with skewed price to quality ratios since the twenty year old hipsters will flock to you regardless!

fqKBdpFwOm3ZRIysL3BGRg.text: Definitely an awesome choice! We had the crab and shrimp dip with fried pita and it was heavenly! Portions were great too. I had the Mahi Mahi tacos and they were delicious. It came with two very full tacos and a side of black beans and rice.  They had the doors open to the patio and our group of 5 arrived right before the lunch rush. Once the place started to fill up, it started to get loud. Honestly though, what place wouldn't get loud when it fills up? The noise level wouldn't deter me from coming back - the food was TOO GOOD.

9cxljuwKE1mLt5GrviOIYg.text: You should have two types of chips,  one with salt, and one without .  High blood pressure is a major issue and salt, is the major demon. Give people the option.  I'm a regular customer and love your food but it really pisses me off when you bring me a of  bucket full of salted chips. Next time I come there I have been promised  by a shift manager to cook a basket of salt free chips. Thank you. Dont be like Bojangles salt infused!!!!! Their's salt on the table!!!!!!!!!  We love the tofu here. We're vegetarians. They are a few choices you offer. Thank you!!!!!  But this salt that the cook puts on these chips after they come out of the grease is under unnecessary!! Enough is enough!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!   You would have 5 stars with out this issue.....

7KaXJ66NHdUxWN5BvFsOmg.text: We love Cabo fish taco! We especially love their crab dip for appetizer and their tuna taco is to die for!!!! I love their avocado pasta salad too!

eN_Pko4fsNUMmQMjHb977w.text: Finally made it here over the weekend for lunch. My mom and I were both very impressed. The salsa you get when you sit down is great and the chips are good though I wish they were served hot. The queso dip was on point. I love that they use the white queso. We also got the grilled shrimp tacos and the fried white fish tacos. The white fish tacos were amazing. The shrimp ones were good. They could put a little more sauce on the tacos. The tortilla shells themselves were GREAT! Freshly fried and perfectly crispy. The refried beans had rice in them which I didn't see on the menu. The spicy pasta salad was okay.   4.5 stars but rounded down for the waiter. Our server was kind of rude when my mom asked what the spicy pasta salad was. His response: exactly what it says it is...spicy pasta salad. He clearly had an attitude and did not smirk or smile when he said it. And then when my mom  (taken aback) said oh ok... so its pasta and spices? The guy then rattles of a laundry list of ingredients including pasta cheese jalapenos etc etc. Clearly it wasn't "exactly what it said it was". He could have been friendlier overall. Rest of staff was great!

XxQdNqOloMbgrRtU8Vbwjw.text: Had an early dinner with the family.  The portions were large and we will have left overs.  Our waitress made a great bear recommendation.  Great place to eat in NoDa

ZkkQXa3fHTpJP009BuwZLA.text: Outstanding food, and they serve up free chips and salsa...how can you go wrong?  Cheap drink specials and very interesting decor.  It is a bit crowded inside, and loud...normally stuffed with hipsters too, but if you can see past al that...this place is a treasure chest.

J41mwkNplptf0n5-dnbs0Q.text: I quickly became a fan of Cabo Fish Taco when I found out just how fresh their tacos were. This review doesn't need to be long because all I really need to tell you is go and try this food because you will simply see for yourself what I'm talking about.  But the real winner of this place is by far the lightly fried taco shells. I truly have never tasted anything like them before. They're not crunchy tacos and they're not soft tacos, they are something completely new. It's what keeps coming back for more each week.  And please do try their crab dip, the fried pitas it served with will also make you want more.

VdvgEvNcq1IEVoWYtjaExQ.text: Gave this place a second try.. And now I can officially say that I do not like this place at all. You can get MUCH better food and service at an endless number of places in Charlotte. I spent $75 on the worst dinner ever, and am sad I can't get my money back for such a waste.   The waiter we had, Matt, was the absolute worst. I manage a restaurant, and I've been a server... He should not be serving.  And the most important part - my food was SO bland and weird - (carrots and zucchini and other veggies in a fried taco bowl?) so I said I didn't like the food, but that im willing to pay for it and just take it home, and that I can order something else.. Matt didn't apologize, or even care to ask how he can make it better. I ordered another meal, which was my third entree (including my boyfriends) and ended up paying the $75.   It was my boyfriends birthday... The only thing he enjoyed was the $2.75 buckshots.  All around - Horrible horrible horrible horrible, and even more horrible.

Cmy6rzsLuo38HtNdN8wd8A.text: I'd give my first (and likely only) experience at Cabo Fish taco 2.5 stars. I want to give it more based on the location, vibe, and service, but the food simply isn't very good.  First off, the chips, salsa, and queso. The chips were stale, the corn salsa was nothing more than underripe tomato chunks and corn (no seasoning whatsoever), and the queso was quite clearly microwaved velveeta. Not a good start.   For entrees, we split the specialty tuna and bbq mahi tacos. Both were one-note and heavy-handed on the sauces. Requested tuna medium rare, but received overcooked tuna. Way too much wasabi on the tuna--not too spicy, it just overpowered every other flavor. Bbq sauce was incredibly sweet and drowned out the flavor of fresh, well prepared mahi. Rice and beans on the side were flavorless.   Maybe this is what constitutes a good restaurant in Charlotte. I certainly hope not.

jKFNH7mJE0fHuwfYmBOzsQ.text: I am SO happy we have Cabo Fish Taco here!  I'm a regular! My favorite is the signature 'Cabo FIsh Taco', which come 2 per entree.  Also, my side of choice is the 'jalapeno mashers' or when in season, the fresh fruit. I've also had the Tavarua Tuna Tacos & the BBQ Mahi Tacos & the grilled shrimp tacos. These are equally delicious! The chips & corn salsa are yummy too; however, sometimes the chips are soggy, so be careful of that, Margaritas, even the "el cheapo' are very refreshing...& like the name says, "cheap"! :D

Duyn1cijfzBok_5cPQaOHA.text: Came here with my cousin who was visiting from Fort Bragg because I had heard solid reviews from others. He got the Mahi Mahi tacos which he said were average. The fish was bland and not particularly anything to write home about.  I had the chicken tacos which were so watery that the tortilla they came on was soggy, damp and crumbling apart before it even reached my table. That should've been my first sign.  There must have been an entire handful of chives in the tacos. I ended up having to spend five minutes picking enough out so I could actually taste the meat.  Anyway, I ate a good portion of the tacos and began feeling sick about 45 minutes later. Spent the next two days in bed feeling miserable.  I will never go back here.

ROL-l7VJUwzuXzgfo-FSFg.text: It wasn't the worst but I gotta say the chips they have for appetizers are very stale and cold. The food was cold and not fresh..it tasted as if it got microwaved from a freezer or something..but they did have one taco which was pretty good but once again..it wasn't fresh..a little below average for the price..I've been to much cheaper Mexican places where it was absolutely delicious and worth it for the low price..I wouldn't pay as much as I did again for a place like this..but employees were friendly

l_raEJJI_NuZsWdyPK5J3g.text: By far my favorite taco spot.  Not the place to go for authentic Mexican but, it hits the spot of you're craving a taste of California.

XaocCm8bNtZfapFaITuULA.text: Great atmosphere and very friendly staff! Was not impressed with the chips (tasted stale), salsa and guacamole....this is a must at a Mexican restaurant. However, the burrito and tacos were very delicious!!

zxVyTxeOE5A1A1p_xKDiDQ.text: After seeing this on The Food Network, I was super excited to try it. It was not great!  I had the Mahi Mahi tacos both BBQ and blackened. Too much seasoning and salty. The crab and shrimp dip appetizers were ok, they tasted like a sour cream and onion potato chip.   Service was awesome! But I will not be back:(

D-HjAEYwIhqildKPc-9xdA.text: The crab & shrimp dip is excellent! The tacos are too. Just be careful. This food is spicy! It's delicious but spicy!  The waitress was excellent. I also love that they give you free chips & salsa. I absolutely can not wait to go back there!

iLY3C1fPlLq-tfNHJ-AtRA.text: I am a fan of hanging out in NoDa and I have loads of friends who LOVE this place. I however just didn't find it to be anything extraordinary.  There's nothing really to say oh this was awful, or this was unacceptable. It just came across so bland. The decor has got a NoDa feel which is good but again nothing to make it stand out. The wait for this place is outrageous which really leads me to a conclusion that it's very overrated. I will have to go back and give it another shot but for now I will stick with 3 stars. I hate that I can't really give a better review but the whole experience just left me underwhelmed and was not very memorable.

VLp-kxGz59ZE1pKz3VTtCQ.text: Great fresh food! I had the salmon and batter fried cad tacos, both where great. The area is crowded and parking is poor but the atmosphere and food are great.

uvNdyVqZXm-zgr0noqBNrQ.text: You know, as much as Cabo lives in infamy for so many, I can't really see it through the same lens of "amazement" or "culinary nirvana," but I can land on it being a solid choice...if the wait isn't too long. I've been coming here for years and even used to frequent the other location in Blacksburg, VA. Where's Cabo's menu isn't s strong point for my taste, it's a great spot for a few margs, decent fish tacos, and perfect for street-side seating in the summertime.   *Sigh*...the menu. Some of the items here just don't really push past the point of being worth the dollars. Believe me, the blackened tuna or mahi tacos are great. Love the slaw, the tortillas work well, they are piled high with goodies, and the flavors abound...but the rest of the plate? No thanks, brosef. The sides are ever-so lackluster. Jalapeno mashers? Ick. They never end up coming out right. Also, every time I've ordered a side of beans, I regret it. Also, for the veggie-lover, DON'T order the veggie burrito. The addition of zucchini and yellow squash inside the tortilla is an atrocity. But hey, if the sides are the worst part of their game, I think they are doing just fine for a NoDa staple.   Also, be prepared to wait on a Friday or Saturday night. The addition they have on the patio is awesome in the spring or summer. If you have a large group, you might end up with at least an hour wait on a busy night. I'm privy to heading here for lunch. Much more accessible.   Cabo, you are welcome in my book. I'm not a huge fan of your side items, but your space is killer and I'm a sucker for fish tacos. Cheers!

3Xqh7NHyZKjHF5ge07VPLg.text: My favorite taco joint in Charlotte.  Great beer, great atmosphere, and amazing food.  I have not had anything from Cabo that has not been spectacular.  I have had all of the tacos, and every single one is amazing.  My personal favorite is the carne asada.  So yummy. The jalepeno mash potatoes are amazing as well. Not to mention the corn salsa may be the best salsa I have ever had.  You are most likely going to wait for a table here, but that should be a given with it's popularity. Patience is a virtue and with Cabo, it pays off big time.

5L3IH4HRe3VKxXFCReusFQ.text: So yummy! We love eating at Cabo fish taco. The service was amazing. I had the pomegranate margarita which was perfect and not too sweet. I also had the rasta pasta which is so tasty! It's sweet, with a little spice. Overall everything was wonderful and we will be back again.

LqFka1pix8GzdNlOQjZXJQ.text: The Baja Shrimp and Crab Dip is delicious and a meal by itself. The BBQ Mahi tacos are jammin! Bring your appetite. The tacos are huge!

of0NwN19QN8UVBzsMKY_hg.text: Great neighborhood spot on the weekdays. The weekends can get a little hectic with long waits. The lemon grilled shrimp tacos are my favorite entree!

photos.caption: Photo of Cabo Fish Taco - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lemon grilled shrimp tacos

u79OSw9wRSBYpwUO-51uzg.text: Every time I travel to Charlotte, I make it a point to eat at Cabo Fish Taco. It is my favorite place to eat in Charlotte.

vqSmXejAQlhoFoRkkBgnRQ.text: Great food and excellent service. The restaurant was crowded on a Good Friday but we only had to wait about 15 minutes. The service was attentive but not overbearing. The food was served quickly. The portions were generous. The Epic Tuna burrito was tasty and the Salmon taco Salad was delicious. a wonderful evening!

0sO7s66nqRvgj0fvju080w.text: Casual and excellent food.  Great beer selection.

a9AdwqUawLo1VNWiG9QMaA.text: Great food, casual atomosphere and cool location.

aHJHXi44f1xvklLtaAMRLw.text: My first time trying fish tacos. The BBQ mahi tacos from Cabo are delicious! Service was great too. I'll be coming here every time I come to Charlotte!

93Cw0Bdc8y0OINeTtcB3Bw.text: I don't know, maybe Cabo has just outgrown itself?  It's ok, but not spectacular.  The first time we went (2010), it was fantastic.  It was a Saturday night, it was packed, it was delicious.  We then talked often about how we couldn't wait to go back when we were in Charlotte again.  We went last week while in town for a concert and it just wasn't the same.  This time, we went on a weekday afternoon around lunchtime.  The corn salad stuff they brought out kinda looked like it had been sitting around for a while and the chips tasted stale.   I ordered the battered fish tacos and hubs ordered the carne asada.  The tortillas had the texture you get when you nuke them for too long - rubbery - and rubbery tortillas sincerely bum me out, man.  The carne and the fish were good, though, I could've eaten those elements all day.  I had rice and beans on the side, which was terrible, but hubs had pasta salad, which was really good.  It has its ups and downs now, I suppose.  Good service and cool atmosphere, though.

rXf_pC9Cto2ugsgYOKMpzQ.text: I have to say that this was one of the biggest disappointments I've had in a restaurant. I had seen Cabo on Diners, Drive-ins and Dives and couldn't wait to try it. I do not live in Charlotte any longer but was in town to visit relatives for the holidays so this was kind of a destination. The NoDa section is very much out of the way but it is a neat area with what they have done with it. There were 3 of us eating so we had a chance to taste a few different things. First of all they were jam packed which was a good sign but resulted in terrible service. We sat for about 5 minutes before anyone said hello and finally Pete showed up. He was friendly enough and took our drink orders. I had an IPA on tap and another one of us had the Original Cabo Margarita. The beer was great but the margarita was the worst margarita ever served. We asked for the margarita to be served "up" (no ice) and what showed up was a glass full of tequila and triple sec, no mixer what so ever. We asked Pete about this and he said he told the bartender that it was supposed to be served straight up and he guessed the bartender took that to mean just the liquor. Anyway Pete took it back and had them add the mixer and it really wasn't any better. As far as lunch was concerned, I ordered a bowl of seafood chowder and the blackened Mahi Mahi tacos with a side of black beans and rice. My wife ordered the battered white fish tacos with a fruit side and my brother ordered the battered white fish tacos with a side of mashers (mashed potatoes). A few minutes later our lunch was served. They forgot to bring my seafood chowder and instead of bringing me black beans and rice they served me mashers ( I didn't bother to say anything). My tacos were okay. The tortillas that they were served on were very good, the accouterments served on the taco were bland and virtually tasteless and the mashers were okay. I told them to just forget the seafood chowder. I also had one of the battered white fish tacos and they were tasteless as well. The fruit side was good. Our billed was $47.80 + gratuity which would have been fine if the food had been decent. Overall I would not recommend this restaurant and I definitely will not return. Charlotte has way too many good places to eat without wasting time and money here.

q_AkBIXWCaZ_iLt5QhsuUg.text: I live within walking distance of CFT and used to go here all the time. I used to line their food. Now, it's all gone down hill. I don't know what happened. Every time I've eaten there recently it's terrible. Cold sides, stale chips, fish not fresh... Recently I got the veggie fajitas. I'm still gagging thinking about it. Tastes like old Chinese food (yeah,not Mexican) that had been sitting in a styrofoam box in the fridge for a week then heated up in the microwave. It was so gross. I didn't finish it. So last week I went there (why? Not sure) and I got a simple vegetable wrap with some ranch sauce and a side of fruit. The fruit tasted fine, not freshly cut but maybe like pre cut my Harris teeter or something. Anyway I started feeling an upset stomach after the first part of the wrap. I boxed the other half and took it home. I tried to finish it at home and within 30 minutes I was projectile vomiting. It lasted the entire day. I threw up around 25 times that day. I have never felt so sick. That food was the first and only thing I ate that day and I never ever throw up usually. I couldn't keep anything down the entire day, not even water or medicine, I felt like dying and that wrap poisoned me! Definitely my last experience at cabo will be connected with some brutal food poisoning memories. Ew

I8_E0M9_0TI7gGobH6Mp-A.text: Best fish tacos I have ever had. Can't wait to go back! Only draw back would be the wait and the small bar area. Yummmm..

E8z8LXmdqxJBIm1AHWH-Yg.text: Food is good. Drinks are good. Expanded restaurant means that the waits are much shorter than they used to be. Seems cliche but the fish tacos are the way to go here. House margaritas are delicious and inexpensive (they also have an El Cheapo Marg that I think is only $3), but the house is way better and still a bargain at $5. Enjoy!

fOGv7EAZsg_oegDiINMF5w.text: Cute decor but looks can be deceiving. The mahi-mahi & tuna in the tacos smelled and tasted "fishy"- not a good sign. Over seasoned, dry rice & beans...I sent my meal back (the wife had paprika halibut which was very good) but found I was still being charged for it when the bill was presented. I was put in the position of telling my pleasant but clueless waiter that I shouldn't have to pay for a meal returned to the kitchen and asked for the manager, who came to the table to tell me that my dish had been "comped" after having tried to charge for it. Hello!? 1 star for food. minus 2 stars for customer service.

PLKpgZpxLEQdl8dYFOJAvw.text: My friends and I arrived at 6:00pm on a Friday and the place was nearly filled, but luckily we were seated after arrival. The waitstaff checked up on the table frequently and brought more chips and corn salsa once we were out. Chips were salted and the ingredients in the corn salsa were fresh, however,  the salsa was spiceless. We ordered guacamole for the table and it was good, also not spicy. I expected my tuna burrito to be pretty bland judging from the corn salsa and the guacamole, but the cilantro sauce added the spiciness I was after. The tuna was delicious! I also had the Cheapo margarita and that was very smooth.

DmMLmam1M8TvFP5pBpiFzA.text: Let me say first of all  that I'm writing this review with a heavy heart, but I feel the need to be honest.  I have eaten at Cabo Fish Taco a few times before and I have usually really enjoyed the Baja fish tacos and margaritas.  This time, however, was not the same.  The corn salsa was bland and room temperature. The Baja fish tacos were just not good...that's all I can say.  The typically long, crunchy strips of cabbage were replaced with mealy mush that I guess was supposed to pass for some kind of coleslaw and the usually large buttery avocado chunks on top gave way to a sad little spoonful of browning guac at the bottom.  The fish was super fishy and not in a good way.  I always get the nopalitos salad because I'm obsessed with pickled cactus, but this time I found one slice of cactus amongst an entire bowl of bland black beans and chickpeas.  My boyfriend's Rasta Pasta came without shrimp because they were out (wtf??? no shrimp in a seafood restaurant??) and the sauce/chicken had way too much jerk seasoning that overwhelmed the other flavors like peppers and pineapple.  Our waitress was crazy busy and overlooked our empty drinks more than once, then let us sit for 15 minutes while she attempted to settle our tab.  The margaritas, I will say, were strong and tasty...just like I like 'em.  All in all, I was exceedingly underwhelmed and disappointed that the food has gone so far downhill.  Perhaps the biggest kicker of them all....it was my birthday.  Booooooooo.

DXodAYDkKtiiYRAIZlKLBQ.text: I absolutely love the fresh baja flavors of this place!! I recently moved to Charlotte from Chicago, and the number one thing I miss most about my previous city is the food. Everything here seems to be so heavy, so when I found light refreshing Mexican with a flair I was thrilled!! Plus Noda is such an interesting neighborhood to visit! By far my favorite Mexican spot in the city. And the margarita's aren't too shabby either.

YT2ALbdAJHdMM1nSix3sqA.text: Cabo fish taco has consistently good food and great atmosphere.  Unique flavors and good margaritas make this a good buy.  Local area has great bars and art galleries to travel to after your meal.

M3SPnpjQKQgMDRu2pVuFXw.text: I went on a Thursday night at about 7 so I expect to wait a little. The problem with that is, there is NO place to wait. the doorway was so crowded the hostest couldn't get to the people that had been waiting. Also people that were waiting in the bar overflowed into the tables of people eating. Once I sat down, we were in a an overflowed table. It was weird to eat with people's rears in your face.  The salsa was great. All the ingredients were fresh and delicious. I wish the chips were hot, like they are at other tex-mex restaurants. The meal I ordered was a burrito Verde (I don't eat fish). It was not really that good, the veggies didn't really go together. It tasted like they just took every veggie in the kitchen and threw it in there. I would not order this again.  The service was also not so great. I went in with three other girls and when we asked for our check to be separate we got some attitude. My water glass was empty about half the time.  Overall if I went on an off night (which from the other reviews doesn't seem like there is one and ordered something different it would be OK.

zFv703v6yO6kEIpN5gQiLw.text: Fish tacos, queso dip and the corn salsa, and cans of tecate... can hardly think of a better meal.  Friends of mine have tried more of the menu but I stick to the regular fish tacos... comfort food at its best, and cheap

AfJ8Q3ZSz0rYvqouE3c9xw.text: the best part of this meal was the salsa and chips.  Service sucked we waited a good ten minutes before anyone came to our table after being seated, and it wasn't busy. Guacamole was missing something just didn't taste like guac- it was missing something, but not sure what.  My salad was not very good, The veggies were cut to thick, and obviously cut way earlier in the day as they were starting to wilt. Any of the seeds that the wrote about on the menu were obviously plated first as they weren't seen until the end. Chicken was suppose to be spicy- it was bland although cooked decently.  The fish taco that my wife had was disappointing and lack luster.  It was very uninspired, the blackened mahi mahi was well not blacked the cheese was just kinda there the only redeeming part of it was a white cilantro sauce.   Overall food would be a 2 but service is a 1.  that combo wont be bring me back.

yiAZPzlnAcAk_x15GxyY3Q.text: Had lunch here with some team members today, after seeing the Diners, Drive-ins and Dives episode.  It is in the art district of North Charlotte, also called No Da for North Davidson.  The seating area was pretty large and we did not have to wait to be seated.  The service was good as well.  They brought out some chips with a corn-based salsa which was pretty good, with a slight bite to it but the chips were pretty sad, like they had been laying around for a while...definitely not crisp.  We all ordered the fish tacos, with several of us choosing the blackened Mahi Mahi. Our plates arrived within about 15 minutes, which did not seem too long and the tacos were really good.  I had a side of jalapeno mashed potatoes and they were not very warm but they tasted good.  Overall, we all thought the lunch experience was great and the tacos were great also.  We will be returning to Cabo Fish Taco again for sure.
